original: dge ba'i sems sam lung du ma bstan pa'i sems su rig nas zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi bsam pa rtogs nas byed pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i sems sam lung du ma bstan pa'i sems su rig nas zhes bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi bsam pa rtogs nas byed pa'o //
translated: “Having understood that the mind is virtuous or neutral” means that one acts after realizing one’s own intention.

original: 'dzem bzhin du zhes bya ba ni thabs gzhan med de phongs chos su byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzem bzhin du zhes bya ba ni thabs gzhan med de phongs chos su byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “With reluctance” means that one does it out of necessity, because there is no other way.

original: phyi ma la snying brtse ba'i sems kho nas zhes bya ba ni de dag la phyi ma la phan pa'i bsam pa kho na bskyed na las de lta bu byed du zin kyang nyes pa med de /
analyzed: phyi ma la snying brtse ba'i sems kho nas zhes bya ba ni de dag la phyi ma la phan pa'i bsam pa kho na bskyed na las de lta bu byed du zin kyang nyes pa med de /
translated: “With a compassionate mind for the future” means that if one generates only the intention to benefit them in the future, then even if one does such an action, there is no fault.

original: yang dag pa'i don gyi byang chub sems dpa' ni bya ba la nan tan byed pa yin pa'i phyir zhes ston to //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i don gyi byang chub sems dpa' ni bya ba la nan tan byed pa yin pa'i phyir zhes ston to //
translated: This shows that a true bodhisattva is one who practices what he preaches.

original: rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa la ni byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa rnams kho na 'jug par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyi kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa la ni byang chub sems dpa' khyim pa rnams kho na 'jug par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that the household bodhisattva engages in actions that are naturally unwholesome.

original: mdo las de dag kho na'i yin par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mdo las de dag kho na'i yin par mthong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is seen in the sūtras that they are only for householders.

original: ma byin par len pa'i skabs su rgyal srid kyang 'phrogs pa ni sems can mang po la nor mang po sbyin pa'i bsam pa yod pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir smos so //
analyzed: ma byin par len pa'i skabs su rgyal srid kyang 'phrogs pa ni sems can mang po la nor mang po sbyin pa'i bsam pa yod pa yin par bstan pa'i phyir smos so //
translated: In the context of taking what is not given, it is said that he even seizes kingdoms in order to demonstrate that he has the intention to give much wealth to many beings.

original: gcig tu nges par pha rol la gnod pa byed pa la zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa la gnod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: gcig tu nges par pha rol la gnod pa byed pa la zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni srog la sogs pa la gnod pa byed pa'o //
translated: He engages in conduct that is certain to harm others means that he engages in conduct that harms life, and so on.🔽That wealth is harmful for a long time because of the harm that is related to it.

original: nor de la longs spyad pas yun ring por gnod pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir nor de @170a * //🔽slar 'phrogs te /
analyzed: nor de la longs spyad pas yun ring por gnod pa dang rjes su 'brel pa'i phyir nor de @170a * // slar 'phrogs te /
translated: Therefore, he seizes that wealth

original: gnas ji lta ba bzhin du 'bul bar byed na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gnas ji lta ba bzhin du 'bul bar byed na nyes pa med do //
translated: and returns it to its rightful owner. There is no offense if he does so.🔽He engages in sexual misconduct means that he engages in sexual intercourse with those who are protected by their mothers,🔽and so on, up to those who are protected by the tradition.

original: mi tshangs par spyod pas gzir ba zhes bya ba ni ma phrad na 'chi bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: mi tshangs par spyod pas gzir ba zhes bya ba ni ma phrad na 'chi bar 'gyur la /
translated: He engages in sexual misconduct means that he engages in sexual intercourse with those who are protected by their mothers,

original: byang chub sems dpa' la yang khon gyi bsam pa 'dzin pas sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro snyam du de ltar rig nas byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' la yang khon gyi bsam pa 'dzin pas sems can dmyal ba rnams su skye bar 'gyur ro snyam du de ltar rig nas byed do //
translated: and so on, up to those who are protected by the tradition.

original: mgo gtsang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la sogs pa g-yem pa'i nyes pa spangs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: mgo gtsang zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa la sogs pa g-yem pa'i nyes pa spangs pa'i phyir te /
translated: The term pure head means that one should avoid the fault of sexual misconduct.

original: de ltar bud med dbang du gyur na ci dga' mgur dge ba'i rtsa ba la yang sbyar du yod la mi dge ba yang spang du gzhug tu rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar bud med dbang du gyur na ci dga' mgur dge ba'i rtsa ba la yang sbyar du yod la mi dge ba yang spang du gzhug tu rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Thus, if one has brought a woman under one's control, one can engage her in the roots of virtue as one wishes, and one can cause her to abandon evil.

original: de lta bu'i las mang po sems can la phan pa dag mthong na bdag la mi lta zhing sems can gyi don la bltas te byed na nyes pa med do //🔽mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i gnas skabs la bab pa'i tshe thabs gzhan med pa'i phra mas mdza' po'i dbyen byas nas bstan pa la 'dzud par byed na yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de lta bu'i las mang po sems can la phan pa dag mthong na bdag la mi lta zhing sems can gyi don la bltas te byed na nyes pa med do // mi dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su zin pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i gnas skabs la bab pa'i tshe thabs gzhan med pa'i phra mas mdza' po'i dbyen byas nas bstan pa la 'dzud par byed na yang nyes pa med do //
translated: If one sees that many such actions are beneficial to sentient beings, there is no fault if one acts without regard to oneself and with regard only to the welfare of sentient beings. 🔽If one has no other means to bring those who are dominated by nonvirtuous friends to maturity, there is no fault if one causes a schism among friends through harsh words, and then causes them to enter the teaching.

original: tshig rtsub po drag po'i sbyor ba drag pos mi dge pa'i gnas nas bslang ste /
analyzed: tshig rtsub po drag po'i sbyor ba drag pos mi dge pa'i gnas nas bslang ste /
translated: If one causes someone to rise from a nonvirtuous to a virtuous state through harsh words and a harsh manner, there is no fault.

original: dge ba'i gnas su dgod pa'i phyir sma 'bebs par byed na tshig rtsub mo smras kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dge ba'i gnas su dgod pa'i phyir sma 'bebs par byed na tshig rtsub mo smras kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: If one insults in order to establish in virtue, there is no fault even in harsh speech.

original: tshig 'khyal pas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams de'i sgo nas 'dul ba la yang nyes pa med par bstan to //
analyzed: tshig 'khyal pas 'dul ba'i sems can rnams de'i sgo nas 'dul ba la yang nyes pa med par bstan to //
translated: And there is no fault in speaking frivolously to those who are to be disciplined by that.

original: nyan thos kyang log par 'tsho ba'i sbyor bas nyes pa dang bcas par 'gyur la /
analyzed: nyan thos kyang log par 'tsho ba'i sbyor bas nyes pa dang bcas par 'gyur la /
translated: Even the disciples are at fault if they engage in wrong livelihood.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni log par 'tsho ba'i sems skyes ma thag tu nyes par yongs su ma shes na nyes par 'gyur bar ston to //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni log par 'tsho ba'i sems skyes ma thag tu nyes par yongs su ma shes na nyes par 'gyur bar ston to //
translated: But it is taught that the bodhisattvas are at fault if they merely generate the intention of wrong livelihood, even if they do not understand it to be wrong.

original: rgod pas yongs su zin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyis bskyed pa'i rnam par ma zhi ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rgod pas yongs su zin pa zhes bya ba ni 'dod chags kyis bskyed pa'i rnam par ma zhi ba dang ldan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: “Possessed by excitement” means that it is produced by attachment and is associated with a lack of tranquility.

original: rnam par ma zhi ba zhes smos pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par ma zhi ba zhes smos pa yin no //
translated: It is a lack of tranquility that is mentioned.

original: rta gad du dgod pa zhes bya ba ni skad cher dgod pa'o //
analyzed: rta gad du dgod pa zhes bya ba ni skad cher dgod pa'o //
translated: “Laughing loudly” means laughing out loud.

original: kun du rtse zhes bya ba ni lus kyi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: kun du rtse zhes bya ba ni lus kyi sbyor ba'o //
translated: “Playing” means physical activity.

original: kun du ca co 'don zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gi sgo nas so //
analyzed: kun du ca co 'don zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gi sgo nas so //
translated: The phrase they all cried out means that they did so with their bodies and speech.

original: dga' ba'i bzhin gyis ni nang gi bsam pa dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dga' ba'i bzhin gyis ni nang gi bsam pa dag par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase with happy countenances indicates the purity of their inner thoughts.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don ngas rtogs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs pa'i don ngas rtogs te /
translated: The phrase I understand the meaning of what the Lord has said indicates that the bodhisattvas are not attached to nirvana.🔽The Lord has taught that the bodhisattvas should remain in cyclic existence, and the bodhisattvas are delighted to do so.🔽The Lord has taught that the bodhisattvas should remain in cyclic existence, and the bodhisattvas are delighted to do so.🔽The Lord has taught that the bodhisattvas should remain in cyclic existence, and the bodhisattvas are delighted to do so.🔽The Lord has taught that the bodhisattvas should remain in cyclic existence, and the bodhisattvas are delighted to do so.🔽The Lord has taught that the bodhisattvas should remain in cyclic existence, and the bodhisattvas are delighted to do so.🔽The Lord has taught that the bodhisattvas should remain in cyclic existence, and the bodhisattvas are delighted to do so.🔽The Lord has taught that the bodhisattvas should remain in cyclic existence, and the bodhisattvas are delighted to do so.🔽The Lord has taught that the bodhisattvas should remain in cyclic existence, and the bodhisattvas are delighted to do so.🔽The Lord has taught that the bodhisattvas should remain in cyclic existence, and the bodhisattvas are delighted to do so.🔽The Lord has taught that the bodhisattvas should remain in cyclic existence, and the bodhisattvas are delighted to do so.🔽The Lord has taught that the bodhisattvas should remain in cyclic existence, and the bodhisattvas are delighted to do so.🔽The Lord has taught that the bodhisattvas should remain in cyclic existence, and the bodhisattvas are delighted to do so.🔽The Lord has taught that the bodhisattvas should remain in cyclic existence, and the bodhisattvas are delighted to do so.🔽The Lord has taught that the bodhisattvas should remain in cyclic existence, and the bodhisattvas are delighted to do so.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'khor ba nyid du gnas par bya ba yin no zhes mdo las byung ba kho na bzhin di byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'khor pa la mngon par dga' @170b bar gnas na yang nyes par 'gyur par bstan te /🔽nyan thos shes rab rtul pos kyang 'khor ba'i nye sa dmigs can gyi nyon mongs pa yongs su shes pa yang mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dga' zhing 'khor ba la skyo bar bya dgos na byang chub sems dpa' la ha cang yang bya dgos par
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni 'khor ba nyid du gnas par bya ba yin no zhes mdo las byung ba kho na bzhin di byang chub sems dpa' rnams 'khor pa la mngon par dga' @170b bar gnas na yang nyes par 'gyur par bstan te /🔽nyan thos shes rab rtul pos kyang 'khor ba'i nye sa dmigs can gyi nyon mongs pa yongs su shes pa yang mya ngan las 'das pa la mngon par dga' zhing 'khor ba la skyo bar bya dgos na byang chub sems dpa' la ha cang yang bya dgos par
translated: The Lord has taught that the bodhisattvas should remain in cyclic existence, and the bodhisattvas are delighted to do so.🔽The Lord has taught that the bodhis

original: ston to // de las khyad par du 'phags pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang ldan pa ni byang chub sems dpa' yin te /
analyzed: ston to // de las khyad par du 'phags pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa dang ldan pa ni byang chub sems dpa' yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva is endowed with the absence of defilement, which is superior to that,

original: ye shes chen po dang mthu chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ye shes chen po dang mthu chen po dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is endowed with great intuition and great power.

original: dge slong dgra bcom pa ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dgra bcom pa ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: The arhat bhikṣu is not like that.

original: snyan pa dang mi snyan pa shin tu rtogs pa de nyid ni dri ngas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
analyzed: snyan pa dang mi snyan pa shin tu rtogs pa de nyid ni dri ngas zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
translated: That very understanding of the pleasant and unpleasant is explained by the words “he is not offended, etc.”

original: mi srung zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi spong ba ste /
analyzed: mi srung zhes bya ba ni yongs su mi spong ba ste /
translated: “He does not protect” means he does not avoid.

original: mi bden pas mi mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: mi bden pas mi mi byed ces bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: He does not do what is not true, i.e., he does not avoid.

original: bden pa'i dngos po dang / bden pa'i dngos po ma yin pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: bden pa'i dngos po dang / bden pa'i dngos po ma yin pa dang go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The words “true thing” and “not a true thing” are to be applied respectively.

original: mu stegs can ni shin tu mngon par zhen te dga' bar bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mu stegs can ni shin tu mngon par zhen te dga' bar bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The tīrthikas are not able to be delighted by him, because they are attached to the extreme views.

original: byis pa rnams kyis kha na ma tho ba ma yin pa'i sgo nas gzhag pa'i dri ngas la dri ngas ma yin pa'i 'du shes kyis yongs su spong bar mi byed na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: byis pa rnams kyis kha na ma tho ba ma yin pa'i sgo nas gzhag pa'i dri ngas la dri ngas ma yin pa'i 'du shes kyis yongs su spong bar mi byed na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if a child does not avoid a question that is not improper out of the notion that it is improper.

original: thabs drag po zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gi spyod pa mi sdug pas chad pas 'dul ba rnams la bya ba'o //
analyzed: thabs drag po zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gi spyod pa mi sdug pas chad pas 'dul ba rnams la bya ba'o //
translated: “Harsh means” refers to the punishment of those who should be punished by means of unpleasant physical and verbal conduct.

original: yid mi dga' bar 'gyur ba bsrung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sems kyi sdug bsngal ba yongs su spang ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yid mi dga' bar 'gyur ba bsrung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni bdag gi sems kyi sdug bsngal ba yongs su spang ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “In order to protect against mental unhappiness” means in order to avoid mental suffering.

original: gzhan dag gi don chung du la bdag nyid kyi tshegs chen por 'gyur na ma byas kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi don chung du la bdag nyid kyi tshegs chen por 'gyur na ma byas kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: If the benefit to others is small and the effort for oneself is great, there is no offense if one does not act.

original: dge sbyong gi chos bzhi dang bral ba'i nyes pa bstan te /🔽gshe ba ni khros nas spyo ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dge sbyong gi chos bzhi dang bral ba'i nyes pa bstan te / gshe ba ni khros nas spyo ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The disadvantages of being devoid of the four qualities of a spiritual practitioner have been explained.🔽“Anger” means to be enraged and to scold.

original: khro ba ni khror gzhug pa'i bsam pa can gyi ngag gi spyod pa mi sdug pa'o //
analyzed: khro ba ni khror gzhug pa'i bsam pa can gyi ngag gi spyod pa mi sdug pa'o //
translated: “Rage” means to speak harshly with a mind that is filled with anger.

original: rdeg pa ni sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i bsam pas snun par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdeg pa ni sdug bsngal bskyed pa'i bsam pas snun par byed pa'o //
translated: Striking is to beat with the intention of causing pain.

original: mtshang 'dru ba ni gcig la gcig nyes pa gleng ba'o //
analyzed: mtshang 'dru ba ni gcig la gcig nyes pa gleng ba'o //
translated: Finding fault is to accuse one another of faults.

original: nyes pa byas pa byas pa shad kyis byang bar mi byed pa'i nyes pa bstan te /
analyzed: nyes pa byas pa byas pa shad kyis byang bar mi byed pa'i nyes pa bstan te /
translated: The fault of not readily acknowledging a fault that has been committed is shown.

original: nyes pa byas sam ma byas par yang brgya la na byas su dogs pa ni de lta de ltar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyes pa byas sam ma byas par yang brgya la na byas su dogs pa ni de lta de ltar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Whether or not a fault has been committed, if there is doubt about it, then it is just as if it were committed because of the way in which it is held.

original: kun nas mnar sems zhes bya ba ni phrag dog gi shas che ba'i phyir ro /
analyzed: kun nas mnar sems zhes bya ba ni phrag dog gi shas che ba'i phyir ro /
translated: The term malice is used because of the predominance of jealousy.

original: nga rgyal gyis non pa zhes bya ba ni dman pa'i tshul gyis ngo tsha ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nga rgyal gyis non pa zhes bya ba ni dman pa'i tshul gyis ngo tsha ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Overcome by pride means that one is ashamed because of a low status.

original: nyes pa byas na yang shad kyis byang par mi byed pa dang / dgos pa la yal bar @171a * //
analyzed: nyes pa byas na yang shad kyis byang par mi byed pa dang / dgos pa la yal bar @171a * //
translated: Even when a fault has been committed, one does not readily acknowledge it, and one neglects what needs to be done.

original: 'dor ba'o // 'thab krol can zhes bya ba ni shad kyis byang bar byas na yang 'khrug par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'dor ba'o // 'thab krol can zhes bya ba ni shad kyis byang bar byas na yang 'khrug par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Quarrelsome means that one argues even when one has readily acknowledged a fault.

original: rtsod par byed pa ni de'i sgo nas rtsod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsod par byed pa ni de'i sgo nas rtsod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One disputes because one argues on that basis.

original: bzod pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba ni 'gyur ba med par shes pa ste /
analyzed: bzod pa'i ngang tshul can zhes bya ba ni 'gyur ba med par shes pa ste /
translated: One who is patient is one who is aware of the unchanging.

original: shad kyis byang bar byas kyang rung de'i sems 'gyur ba med par rig pa'am /
analyzed: shad kyis byang bar byas kyang rung de'i sems 'gyur ba med par rig pa'am /
translated: Even if one is being cut to pieces, his mind is aware of the unchanging.

original: shad kyis byang bar byed mi 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: shad kyis byang bar byed mi 'dod pa'am /
translated: Or, he does not want to be cut to pieces.

original: ngo tsha bar byed de mi mthun par 'du shes par rig na shad kyis ma sbyangs kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: ngo tsha bar byed de mi mthun par 'du shes par rig na shad kyis ma sbyangs kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: Or, he is ashamed of it. If he is aware of the idea of non-concordance, then there is no fault in not being cut to pieces.

original: rtsod pa gang la gzhan nyes pa byung ba dag ces bya ba ni rtsod pa byung ba rnams dang rtsod pa la zhugs pa rnams la shad kyis byang bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: rtsod pa gang la gzhan nyes pa byung ba dag ces bya ba ni rtsod pa byung ba rnams dang rtsod pa la zhugs pa rnams la shad kyis byang bar byed pa'o //
translated: In a dispute, if the other person has a fault, he should be cut to pieces.

original: mi nyan zhes bya ba ni sems mi dga' ba'am /
analyzed: mi nyan zhes bya ba ni sems mi dga' ba'am /
translated: He does not listen means that he is not pleased in mind.

original: mi bzod pa'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi bzod pa'i ngang tshul can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or, he is not patient by nature.

original: chos bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa'o //
analyzed: chos bzhin ma yin pa zhes bya ba ni mi rigs pa'o //
translated: Not in accordance with the Dharma means unrighteously.

original: khro ba'i bsam pa zhes bya ba ni khro ba'i sems te /
analyzed: khro ba'i bsam pa zhes bya ba ni khro ba'i sems te /
translated: The idea of anger is the mind of anger.

original: de rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: de rgyun mi 'chad par 'byung ba'o //
translated: It arises uninterruptedly.

original: 'dzin pa ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: 'dzin pa ni rnam grangs so //
translated: Holding is a synonym.

original: tshogs sdud pa'i dbang du byas te smras pa ni rim gro bya ba dang bsnyen bkur bya ba kho na'i dbang du byas nas de kho na'i phyir zang zing med pa'i sems dang ldan pas rim gro bya ba dang bsnyen bkur bya ba bdag gir byed na nyes
analyzed: tshogs sdud pa'i dbang du byas te smras pa ni rim gro bya ba dang bsnyen bkur bya ba kho na'i dbang du byas nas de kho na'i phyir zang zing med pa'i sems dang ldan pas rim gro bya ba dang bsnyen bkur bya ba bdag gir byed na nyes
translated: The verse declares that the bodhisattva is not to accept service and honor from others, but this is said only with reference to the bodhisattva who is gathering a following.

original: pa med de sbyor ba yod du zin kyang bsam pa dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa med de sbyor ba yod du zin kyang bsam pa dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no offense if the bodhisattva accepts service and honor from others with a mind free from worldly desires, because the intention is pure, even though the action may be the same.

original: 'du 'dzi'i gtam la kun du chags pa'i sems ni bre mo'i gtam la 'dus pa'i nang du rgyal po dang chom rkun la sogs pa'i gtam ngan pa la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'du 'dzi'i gtam la kun du chags pa'i sems ni bre mo'i gtam la 'dus pa'i nang du rgyal po dang chom rkun la sogs pa'i gtam ngan pa la 'jug pa'o //
translated: A mind attached to idle chatter is one that engages in talk about kings, thieves, and so on, in the midst of an assembly that is gathered for idle chatter.

original: brjed pa zhes bya ba ni sems rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
analyzed: brjed pa zhes bya ba ni sems rnam par g-yeng ba'o //
translated: Forgetfulness is a distracted mind.

original: dran pa la gnas kyang pha rol gyi ngor nyan pa dang / ya mtshan du 'dzin te 'dri ba tsam dang dris pa'i lan 'debs pa tsam la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: dran pa la gnas kyang pha rol gyi ngor nyan pa dang / ya mtshan du 'dzin te 'dri ba tsam dang dris pa'i lan 'debs pa tsam la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the bodhisattva listens to others with a mind of loving kindness, or if he or she is merely asking questions or answering questions, even if he or she is not mindful.

original: slob pa la brtson pa dang / 'og nas 'byung ba la ni de yang nyes pa'i gnas yin no //🔽sems gnas pa nyid ni sems mnyam par 'jog par 'dod ces bya bas ston to //🔽bsam gtan la brtson pa kho na'i sgrib pa'i dbang du byas nas byung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //🔽ting nge 'dzin thob na yang bsam gtan tsam gyis chog par 'dzin pa nyes par 'gyur ba ni yon tan du blta zhes bya bas ston to //

The phrase “he views it as a virtue” teaches this.🔽🔽

original: de nyid la bye brag tu brtson par bya ba ni /
analyzed: de nyid la bye brag tu brtson par bya ba ni /
translated: One should make a special effort in just that.

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: It is taught by thus... and so on.

original: gcig tu nges par de la brtson pa'i 'dun pa bzlog pa'i phyir na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gcig tu nges par de la brtson pa'i 'dun pa bzlog pa'i phyir na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in reversing the aspiration to make a special effort in just that, because of the certainty of one.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs phal po che'i lam ston par byed pa yin pas na de nyid la bye brag tu bslab par bya dgos te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs phal po che'i lam ston par byed pa yin pas na de nyid la bye brag tu bslab par bya dgos te /
translated: Since the Bodhisattva Canon teaches the path of the great collection of merit and knowledge, one must train in just that.

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod ces bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says the Bodhisattva Canon... and so on.

original: yun thung dus kyang dran par nus pa dang / sems rno zhing shes rab gsal bas don sems pa dang rtogs par byed nus pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab kyis sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab rtogs par nus te /
analyzed: yun thung dus kyang dran par nus pa dang / sems rno zhing shes rab gsal bas don sems pa dang rtogs par byed nus pa dang / lhan cig skyes pa'i shes rab kyis sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab rtogs par nus te /
translated: One is able to remember even a short time, and one is able to contemplate and understand the meaning with sharp mind and clear wisdom, and one is able to understand the Buddha's teachings with innate wisdom.

original: rtogs pa'i shas che ba la ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: rtogs pa'i shas che ba la ni nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault in the predominance of understanding.

original: de las nyis 'gyur du zhes bya ba ni myur ba kho nar rgyun du chud pa dang / gus par brtson zhing goms par byed de /
analyzed: de las nyis 'gyur du zhes bya ba ni myur ba kho nar rgyun du chud pa dang / gus par brtson zhing goms par byed de /
translated: and who is devoted and makes effort.

original: rang gi gzhung la brtson du zin kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: rang gi gzhung la brtson du zin kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: Even if one is engaged in one's own scriptures, there is no fault.

original: de lta bu'i tshul dang yang mi 'gal bar zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab la brtson par byas su zin kyang de la gnas pa'i lta ba can gyi mu stegs can gyi bstan bcos la sbyor ba ma gnang ste /
analyzed: de lta bu'i tshul dang yang mi 'gal bar zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi gsung rab la brtson par byas su zin kyang de la gnas pa'i lta ba can gyi mu stegs can gyi bstan bcos la sbyor ba ma gnang ste /
translated: Not contradicting such a method, even if one is engaged in the scriptures of the Buddha, one is not permitted to apply oneself to the treatises of the tīrthikas who adhere to the views of those who abide in that.

original: dper na dgos pa'i dbang gis sman tsha ba la brten pa de bzhin du mu stegs can gyi bstan bcos la yang de dang 'dra bar bya'o //
analyzed: dper na dgos pa'i dbang gis sman tsha ba la brten pa de bzhin du mu stegs can gyi bstan bcos la yang de dang 'dra bar bya'o //
translated: For example, just as one relies on hot medicine due to the power of necessity, so it is with the treatises of the tīrthikas.

original: mchog tu zab pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i blo las 'das pa'i phyir de kho na'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mchog tu zab pa ni nyan thos la sogs pa'i blo las 'das pa'i phyir de kho na'i don zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Supreme profundity is stated by the meaning of thatness, and so on, because it transcends the minds of śrāvakas and so on.

original: don dang ldan pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni don dang 'brel pa ma yin zhing shes rab kyi khyad par gyi rten ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dang ldan pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni don dang 'brel pa ma yin zhing shes rab kyi khyad par gyi rten ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not meaningful because it is not connected with the meaning and is not the basis for the excellence of wisdom.

original: chos dang ldan pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi khyad par gyi rten ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos dang ldan pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi khyad par gyi rten ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not Dharma because it is not the basis for the excellence of merit.

original: gcig tu na don bzang po yang ma yin la tshig 'bru bzang po yang ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: gcig tu na don bzang po yang ma yin la tshig 'bru bzang po yang ma yin pa ste /
translated: It is neither well-spoken in meaning nor well-spoken in phrasing.

original: go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du sbyar ro //
translated: The terms should be connected in the same order.

original: de'i phyir phan pa dang / bde bar 'gyur ba ma yin zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir phan pa dang / bde bar 'gyur ba ma yin zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be neither beneficial nor pleasant.

original: skur pa 'debs pa dang ldan pa ni bdag nyid kyi tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed @172a * //
analyzed: skur pa 'debs pa dang ldan pa ni bdag nyid kyi tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed @172a * //
translated: It is associated with denigration, because of one's own improper mental attention,

original: pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: and so on.

original: rang gi stobs sam rgyu'i stobs sam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi stobs sam rgyu'i stobs sam zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is either one's own power or the power of a cause, that is, the power of a friend.

original: gzhan gyi rjes su zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi stobs dang sbyor ba'i stobs so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rjes su zhugs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi stobs dang sbyor ba'i stobs so //
translated: It is associated with the influence of others, because of the power of others and the power of application.

original: gal te zab mo la sems mi 'jug par 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te zab mo la sems mi 'jug par 'gyur na /
translated: If the mind does not enter into the profound,

original: de la sgrub pa ni ;
analyzed: de la sgrub pa ni ;
translated: the remedy is this:

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' dad pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' dad pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: This is taught by the passage beginning, “In that case, the bodhisattva should have faith, etc.”

original: long ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i mig med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: long ba zhes bya ba ni zag pa med pa'i mig med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Blind” means lacking the uncontaminated eye.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan gyis zhes bya ba ni yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad mas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyan gyis zhes bya ba ni yid ches pa'i lung gi tshad mas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “With the eye of the Tathagata” means with the valid cognition of trustworthy scripture.

original: dgongs te gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni don gzhan la ldem por dgongs pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dgongs te gsungs pa zhes bya ba ni don gzhan la ldem por dgongs pa'i tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Intentional” means that the words are indirect, intending another meaning.

original: mos pa'i dbang kho nas spong bar mi byed na ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: mos pa'i dbang kho nas spong bar mi byed na ni nyes pa med do //
translated: If one does not reject it merely out of faith, there is no fault.

original: la las ni mos pa med du zin kyang zhes brjod de /
analyzed: la las ni mos pa med du zin kyang zhes brjod de /
translated: But some say that even if one has no faith,

original: de dang sbyar na ni ma mos su zin kyang spong bar mi byed na nyes pa med ces bya'o //
analyzed: de dang sbyar na ni ma mos su zin kyang spong bar mi byed na nyes pa med ces bya'o //
translated: if one does not reject it, there is no fault.

original: sngar ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la brkam pa'i dbang du byas nas bdag la bstod pa pham pa lta bu'i gnas su bstan to //
analyzed: sngar ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la brkam pa'i dbang du byas nas bdag la bstod pa pham pa lta bu'i gnas su bstan to //
translated: Previously, it was shown that praising oneself out of greed for gain and honor is a basis for defeat.

original: 'dir ni bdag la gces par 'dzin pa'i sems kyis bdag la stod par byed pa'i nyes pa'i gnas gzhan bstan te /
analyzed: 'dir ni bdag la gces par 'dzin pa'i sems kyis bdag la stod par byed pa'i nyes pa'i gnas gzhan bstan te /
translated: Here, another basis for the fault of praising oneself out of self-cherishing is taught.

original: de'i phyir zang zing dang bcas pa'i sems zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zang zing dang bcas pa'i sems zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the mind is accompanied by material things.

original: bstan pa'i dgra yin par bstan pa'i phyir mu stegs can la dmod par byed pa la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bstan pa'i dgra yin par bstan pa'i phyir mu stegs can la dmod par byed pa la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: In order to show that it is an enemy of the teaching, there is no fault in cursing non-Buddhists.

original: mu stegs can rnams zil gyis gnon pa'i dgos pa ni bstan pa gnas par bya ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: mu stegs can rnams zil gyis gnon pa'i dgos pa ni bstan pa gnas par bya ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: The purpose of overpowering non-Buddhists is shown by for the sake of establishing the teaching and so on.

original: bdag nyid gces par bya ba bskyed pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir bdag la bstod pa la ni nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bdag nyid gces par bya ba bskyed pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi dad pa bskyed pa'i phyir bdag la bstod pa la ni nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in praising oneself in order to generate faith in others by generating self-cherishing.

original: ma tshor na zhes bya ba ni chos sgrogs pa yod par mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: ma tshor na zhes bya ba ni chos sgrogs pa yod par mi shes pa'o //
translated: If one does not know means not knowing that the Dharma preacher exists.

original: gal te der 'gro na chos smra ba mi dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / lan mang du thos pa dang sngon shes zin pa'i don gyi gtam yin par shes na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: gal te der 'gro na chos smra ba mi dga' bar 'gyur ba dang / lan mang du thos pa dang sngon shes zin pa'i don gyi gtam yin par shes na nyes pa med do //
translated: If he goes there, but the Dharma teacher is not pleased, and if he knows that the talk is on a subject that has been heard many times and is already known, there is no fault.

original: thos pa mthar phyin pa ni mang du thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: thos pa mthar phyin pa ni mang du thos pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: The completion of learning is taught by the verse beginning “The learned one, having heard much…”

original: rgyun mi 'chad par bsam gtan la brtson pa ni rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad par bsam gtan la brtson pa ni rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: The uninterrupted effort in meditation is taught by the verse beginning “Always delighting in meditation…”

original: shes rab rtul ba dang lung nod pa la sogs pa bslab pa la brtson pa la yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: shes rab rtul ba dang lung nod pa la sogs pa bslab pa la brtson pa la yang nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no fault in being diligent in the training of recitation and so on, even if one is of dull faculties.

original: khyad du gsod ces bya ba ni snying @172b nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi 'du shes dang / ston pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes mi bskyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyad du gsod ces bya ba ni snying @172b nas dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyi 'du shes dang / ston pa la sogs pa'i 'du shes mi bskyed ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Disrespect” means not generating the perception of the spiritual friend as a teacher and so on.

original: bkur sti mi byed ces bya ba ni lus kyi spyod pa'o //
analyzed: bkur sti mi byed ces bya ba ni lus kyi spyod pa'o //
translated: “Not serving” means not serving with physical actions.

original: 'phya ba zhes bya ba ni sma 'bebs pa dang ldan pa'i tshig go //
analyzed: 'phya ba zhes bya ba ni sma 'bebs pa dang ldan pa'i tshig go //
translated: “Contempt” means words accompanied by a disparaging attitude.

original: bsting bar byed ces bya ba ni tshig blang po ste /
analyzed: bsting bar byed ces bya ba ni tshig blang po ste /
translated: The phrase to belittle means to disparage.

original: de lta bu ni chos smra ba la ma gus pa dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu ni chos smra ba la ma gus pa dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: Such is the lack of respect for the Dharma teacher.

original: chos la ma gus pa'i dbang du byas nas tshig 'bru la rton gyi zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: chos la ma gus pa'i dbang du byas nas tshig 'bru la rton gyi zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: With regard to lack of respect for the Dharma, he says he relies on the letter.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba la mi brtson pa'i nyes pa ni sems can gyi bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba la mi brtson pa'i nyes pa ni sems can gyi bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: The fault of not striving to help sentient beings is taught by the phrase beginning with the activities of sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims bstan pa las byung ba'i sems can gyi bya ba rnam par dbye ba las brtsams te grogs bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims bstan pa las byung ba'i sems can gyi bya ba rnam par dbye ba las brtsams te grogs bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The activities of sentient beings should be understood as the activities of helping sentient beings, which arise from the teaching of morality.

original: rten yod pa ni byed pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: rten yod pa ni byed pa yod pa'o //
translated: The basis exists means that the activity exists.

original: chos ma yin pa'i bya ba dag la nyes pa med pa ni gnod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'i bya ba dag la nyes pa med pa ni gnod pa dang ldan pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: The absence of fault in the activities that are not Dharma is taught by the phrase he is not one who is harmful.

original: gzhan la bcol ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan byed du gzhug pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la bcol ba zhes bya ba ni gzhan byed du gzhug pa'o //
translated: He is not one who is lazy means that he is not one who is indolent.

original: de bas chos khyad par du 'phags par dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa dang / rang bzhin gyis shes rab med pa dang / bslab pa la brtson pa dang / sems can ches mang po dag gi sems srung ba dang / dge 'dun gyis bcas pa srung ba la yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de bas chos khyad par du 'phags par dge ba'i phyogs la brtson pa dang / rang bzhin gyis shes rab med pa dang / bslab pa la brtson pa dang / sems can ches mang po dag gi sems srung ba dang / dge 'dun gyis bcas pa srung ba la yang nyes pa med do //
translated: Therefore, there is no offense if one is especially devoted to virtue, if one is naturally lacking in wisdom, if one is devoted to training, if one is protecting the minds of many sentient beings, or if one is protecting the rules of the Sangha.

original: mgon yod pa nyid kyi phyir na nus pa'o //
analyzed: mgon yod pa nyid kyi phyir na nus pa'o //
translated: “One is able” means that one is capable because one has a protector.

original: de'i phyir yang rten yod pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir yang rten yod pa ste /
translated: “One has a basis” means that one has a support.

original: rnam pa gzhan du yang 'tshol nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan du yang 'tshol nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “One is able to seek in another way” means that one is able to seek in another way.

original: yang na bdag nyid kyis nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang na bdag nyid kyis nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “One is able by oneself” means that one is able by oneself.

original: nad rgyun rings ni yun ring du na ba la yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: nad rgyun rings ni yun ring du na ba la yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “One is sick” means that one is sick for a long time.

original: bsam gtan dang kha ton la brtson pa ni snga ma kho na bzhin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang kha ton la brtson pa ni snga ma kho na bzhin no //
translated: “One is devoted to meditation and recitation” means that one is devoted to meditation and recitation as before.

original: rigs pa'i gdams ngag mi ston pa'i nyes pa bstan te /
analyzed: rigs pa'i gdams ngag mi ston pa'i nyes pa bstan te /
translated: The fault of not giving proper instruction is taught.

original: rigs pa zhes bya ba ni skyon med pa'o //
analyzed: rigs pa zhes bya ba ni skyon med pa'o //
translated: “Proper” means without fault.

original: mi shes zhes bya ba ni tshul ston mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: mi shes zhes bya ba ni tshul ston mi shes pa'o //
translated: “One does not know” means one does not know how to teach the method.

original: de nyid mkhas sam ston pa gzhan yod pa dang / gal te mi dga' bas nyan par mi 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de nyid mkhas sam ston pa gzhan yod pa dang / gal te mi dga' bas nyan par mi 'gyur ba'am /
translated: There is no offense if the teacher is skilled in the methods for taming others, or if there is another teacher who is skilled.🔽There is no offense if the student is uncooperative, such as when he or she is in a bad mood and unwilling to listen, or has a hostile attitude and is holding a grudge, or is difficult to train because he or she is disrespectful and lacks faith.

original: bka' blo mi bde bas log par 'dzin pa dang / dga' zhing gus pa med pas gdul dka' ba'i phyir dmu rgod kyi rang bzhin can dang / lan du phan 'dogs pa la brtson par byas kyang mi 'dod na ma byas kyang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bka' blo mi bde bas log par 'dzin pa dang / dga' zhing gus pa med pas gdul dka' ba'i phyir dmu rgod kyi rang bzhin can dang / lan du phan 'dogs pa la brtson par byas kyang mi 'dod na ma byas kyang nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the student is naturally wild and unruly, and even though the teacher has tried to help him or her, the student is uncooperative.

original: yang dag par slong ba zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang ldan pa'i slong ba po ste /
analyzed: yang dag par slong ba zhes bya ba ni rigs pa dang ldan pa'i slong ba po ste /
translated: A “proper request” is a request that is reasonable.

original: sdug bsngal bar gyur pa la sogs pas @173a * //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bar gyur pa la sogs pas @173a * //
translated: It is reasonable if the student is suffering, and so forth.

original: bsdus so // rung ba ma yin pa'i bsam pas ma yin pa dang / mi 'phrod pa slong ba dang / rgyal po la gnod par sems shing rgyal po la glo ba ring ba la rgyal po'i sems srung na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: bsdus so // rung ba ma yin pa'i bsam pas ma yin pa dang / mi 'phrod pa slong ba dang / rgyal po la gnod par sems shing rgyal po la glo ba ring ba la rgyal po'i sems srung na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if the teacher does not comply with the request because the student’s motivation is improper, or if the teacher is not able to help the student, or if the teacher is protecting the student from something that would be harmful, or if the teacher is protecting the mind of the king, who is hostile to the student and would be displeased.

original: 'khor bsdus la zhes bya ba ni yongs su gzung ba bdag nyid grags shing bsod nams che ba'i phyir gos la sogs pa rnyed pa'am /
analyzed: 'khor bsdus la zhes bya ba ni yongs su gzung ba bdag nyid grags shing bsod nams che ba'i phyir gos la sogs pa rnyed pa'am /
translated: The phrase those who gather a retinue refers to those who are well known and have great merit because they have acquired robes and so on.

original: yang na bdag nyid tshol nus kyang rung ste de ma byin pa'o //
analyzed: yang na bdag nyid tshol nus kyang rung ste de ma byin pa'o //
translated: Or, they are those who are able to seek out robes and so on for themselves, but they do not receive them.

original: mi rigs pa la zhugs pa'i phyir 'dul ba'i skal ba med pa ste /
analyzed: mi rigs pa la zhugs pa'i phyir 'dul ba'i skal ba med pa ste /
translated: The phrase those who are not fit vessels for the teachings refers to those who are not fit vessels for the teachings because they have engaged in improper conduct.

original: de la ma byin na yang nyes pa med do //
analyzed: de la ma byin na yang nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one does not praise them.

original: mu stegs can ni bstan pa'i dgra yin pa'i phyir tshar gcad par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mu stegs can ni bstan pa'i dgra yin pa'i phyir tshar gcad par bya ba yin no //
translated: The phrase those who are tīrthikas refers to those who are to be refuted because they are enemies of the teaching.

original: yon tan brjod pa nyid ni bsngags pa yin par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan brjod pa nyid ni bsngags pa yin par shes par bya'o //
translated: The phrase those who are worthy of praise should be understood to mean those who are worthy of being extolled.

original: 'dod pa chung ba ni bdag nyid kyi yon tan rnams gzhan yang brjod du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa chung ba ni bdag nyid kyi yon tan rnams gzhan yang brjod du mi 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase those who have few desires refers to those who do not allow others to proclaim their good qualities.

original: yon tan gleng ba'i rgyus gang zag de nyid kyi rgyags pa la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba mthong na nyes pa med do //
analyzed: yon tan gleng ba'i rgyus gang zag de nyid kyi rgyags pa la sogs pa kun nas nyon mongs par 'gyur ba mthong na nyes pa med do //
translated: There is no offense if one sees that the afflicted state of mind of pride, etc., would arise in that person as a consequence of being praised.

original: bskrad pa ni gtan du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bskrad pa ni gtan du ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The phrase those who are expelled refers to those who are expelled temporarily, not permanently.

original: bcos su mi rung ba'i skabs nyid ni bka' blo mi bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
analyzed: bcos su mi rung ba'i skabs nyid ni bka' blo mi bde ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad do //
translated: The time when it is not suitable to correct is explained by unhappy with the advice, and so on.

original: dus la sdod ces bya ba ni dus gzhan la sdod pa dang 'thab pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa la lta ba'o //
analyzed: dus la sdod ces bya ba ni dus gzhan la sdod pa dang 'thab pa la sogs pa'i 'jigs pa la lta ba'o //
translated: The phrase waiting for the time means waiting for another time, and looking at the danger of fighting, and so on.

original: dge 'dun 'khrug cing dbye ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun khrag 'khrug tu gyur pa'am thad kar dbye bar 'gyur ba dang / de nyid g-yo med pa dang / shas cher ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang ldan pas sgrub ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun 'khrug cing dbye ba zhes bya ba ni dge 'dun khrag 'khrug tu gyur pa'am thad kar dbye bar 'gyur ba dang / de nyid g-yo med pa dang / shas cher ngo tsha shes pa dang khrel yod pa dang ldan pas sgrub ste /
translated: The phrase the Saṅgha is divided and in dispute means that the Saṅgha is in a state of dispute or is about to be divided, and that one should accomplish it by being without deceit and having a great deal of shame and abashment.

original: nyes pa 'chags par byed pa la ni nyes pa med do //🔽bstan pa la zhes 'gras pa rnams kyi dad pas byin pa'i longs spyod kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: nyes pa 'chags par byed pa la ni nyes pa med do // bstan pa la zhes 'gras pa rnams kyi dad pas byin pa'i longs spyod kha na ma tho ba dang bcas par 'gyur bas na /
translated: There is no offense if one confesses one's faults.🔽The phrase in order to stop the schism means that the schism will be stopped by the gift of fearlessness, because the schismatic will think, I will not be killed or imprisoned.

original: spong du gzhug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: spong du gzhug pa'i phyir zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The phrase in order to stop the schism means that the schism will be stopped by the gift of fearlessness, because the schismatic will think, I will not be killed or imprisoned.

original: mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni sngags sam sman nam cho 'phrul byed pa yin gyi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis ni ma yin no zhes sgrogs pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa zhes bya ba ni sngags sam sman nam cho 'phrul byed pa yin gyi rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis ni ma yin no zhes sgrogs pa'o //
translated: The term manifestly attached means that one is attached to mantras, medicines, or magical powers, but not through the power of spiritual abilities.

original: gnas thams cad la yang nyes pa med pa ni sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bas nyen pa la lhag par yang nyes pa med de /
analyzed: gnas thams cad la yang nyes pa med pa ni sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bas nyen pa la lhag par yang nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no offense if one is insane or in extreme pain.

original: tshor bas nyen pa ni tshor ba drag pos brgyal bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: tshor bas nyen pa ni tshor ba drag pos brgyal bar gyur pa'o //
translated: One who is in extreme pain is one who has fainted due to intense pain.

original: sdom pa ma mnos pa ni sdom pa ma bzung ba'o //
analyzed: sdom pa ma mnos pa ni sdom pa ma bzung ba'o //
translated: One who has not taken the vow means one who has not taken the vow of individual liberation.

original: dngos su byung ba sha stag ste zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du byas pa ste //🔽@173b de dag der dngos su bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: dngos su byung ba sha stag ste zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du byas pa ste // @173b de dag der dngos su bstan pa rnams so //
translated: The term only those that are actually mentioned refers to the three types of morality.🔽 Those that are actually mentioned means those that are actually taught in the scriptures.

original: thor bu zhes bya ba ni 'thor ba rnams so //
analyzed: thor bu zhes bya ba ni 'thor ba rnams so //
translated: Scattered means those that are taught here and there.

original: tshang bar zhes bya ba ni lhan cig tu bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: tshang bar zhes bya ba ni lhan cig tu bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: Complete means those that are taught together in one place.

original: slob par 'dod ba'i bsam pas zhes bya ba ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims la'o //
analyzed: slob par 'dod ba'i bsam pas zhes bya ba ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims la'o //
translated: With the intention of training refers to the morality of restraint.

original: byang chub 'dod pa'i bsam pas zhes bya ba ni dge ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims la'o ;
analyzed: byang chub 'dod pa'i bsam pas zhes bya ba ni dge ba sdud pa'i tshul khrims la'o ;
translated: With the intention of desiring enlightenment refers to the morality of collecting virtue.

original: / sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam pas zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims la'o //
analyzed: / sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam pas zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims la'o //
translated: With the intention of working for the benefit of sentient beings refers to the morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings.

original: nyes byas su bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyes pa ni tha dad pa med de /
analyzed: nyes byas su bsdus pa zhes bya ba ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyes pa ni tha dad pa med de /
translated: The term included in the misdeeds refers to the fact that there is no difference between the misdeeds of the bodhisattvas and the defeats of the disciples.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba las 'gal ba'i phyir nyes pa kho nar zad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba las 'gal ba'i phyir nyes pa kho nar zad do //
translated: Because they are in conflict with the activities of the bodhisattvas, they are simply misdeeds.

original: gang su yang rung ste khong du chud pa la zhes bya bas ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyes pa ni skal ba med pa ma yin par ston te /
analyzed: gang su yang rung ste khong du chud pa la zhes bya bas ni byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi nyes pa ni skal ba med pa ma yin par ston te /
translated: Whoever understands refers to the fact that the misdeeds of the bodhisattvas are not due to lack of good fortune.

original: nyan thos la sogs pa thams cad las 'das pa'i sdom pa'i khyad par la gnas pa ni dge ba'i phyogs kyi sbyor bal skal ba med par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyan thos la sogs pa thams cad las 'das pa'i sdom pa'i khyad par la gnas pa ni dge ba'i phyogs kyi sbyor bal skal ba med par 'gyur ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no lack of good fortune in the application to virtue, since they abide in the special vow that transcends all the disciples and so on.

original: pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i nyes pa 'bring ni tshogs sam /
analyzed: pham pa'i gnas lta bu'i nyes pa 'bring ni tshogs sam /
translated: The middling misdeed that resembles a grave offense is either in the assembly or in the presence of the Buddha.

original: yang na dge 'dun la bshags par bya'o zhes ston te /
analyzed: yang na dge 'dun la bshags par bya'o zhes ston te /
translated: Or else, one should confess to the community.

original: de yang gnas kyis lci ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang gnas kyis lci ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that is heavy because of the basis.

original: thog mar dngos po brjod de zhes bya ba ni tshe dang ldan pa bdag la ni dngos po che ge mo zhig las nyes byas kyi nongs pa byung ste zhes bshags pa'i rim pa ston to //
analyzed: thog mar dngos po brjod de zhes bya ba ni tshe dang ldan pa bdag la ni dngos po che ge mo zhig las nyes byas kyi nongs pa byung ste zhes bshags pa'i rim pa ston to //
translated: The sequence of confession is taught: First, the thing is stated, meaning, Venerable, I have incurred the fault of a wrongdoing in regard to such and such a thing.

original: lhag ma zhes bya pa ni nyes byas kyi nongs pa byung ba de dag bshags so zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: lhag ma zhes bya pa ni nyes byas kyi nongs pa byung ba de dag bshags so zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The remainder is I confess those wrongdoings that I have incurred.

original: len pa pos kyang nyes pa de dag mthong ngam zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: len pa pos kyang nyes pa de dag mthong ngam zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The receiver also should say, Do you see that fault?

original: des kyang mthong ngo zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: des kyang mthong ngo zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: The other should say, I see it.

original: phyin chad sdom par byed dam /
analyzed: phyin chad sdom par byed dam /
translated: Do you restrain yourself from now on?

original: legs par sdom par bgyid do zhes de ltar lan gsum gyi bar du bya'o //
analyzed: legs par sdom par bgyid do zhes de ltar lan gsum gyi bar du bya'o //
translated: The other should say, I restrain myself well. This is done up to three times.

original: len pa po med na byin gyis brlabs pa'i sgo nas kyang nyes pa bshags par bstan to //
analyzed: len pa po med na byin gyis brlabs pa'i sgo nas kyang nyes pa bshags par bstan to //
translated: If there is no receiver, it is taught that one should confess faults by means of consecration.

original: sdom pa blang pa'i chog gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yang dag par blang ba de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: sdom pa blang pa'i chog gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa yang dag par blang ba de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: The other ritual for taking the vow is taught by “And also that perfect taking of the bodhisattva vow. ”

original: 'dod chags ni 'dir sems can la rjes su chags pa yin par bstan te /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni 'dir sems can la rjes su chags pa yin par bstan te /
translated: Here, attachment is taught to be affection for sentient beings.

original: sems can la byams pa de'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpa' gang ci spyod kyang rung de dag thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: sems can la byams pa de'i sgo nas byang chub sems dpa' gang ci spyod kyang rung de dag thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba nyid yin te /
translated: Whatever a bodhisattva practices, it is all the activity of a bodhisattva, through that affection for sentient beings.

original: sems can gyi don du gtogs pa'i phyir byas na yang nyes byas su ni mi 'gyur gyi /🔽cir @174a * //
analyzed: sems can gyi don du gtogs pa'i phyir byas na yang nyes byas su ni mi 'gyur gyi / cir @174a * //
translated: If it is done for the sake of sentient beings, it is not a misdeed.

original: 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: 'gyur zhe na /
translated: What does it become?

original: legs par byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: legs par byas pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: It becomes a good deed.

original: de bas na 'dod chags las 'byung ba ni nyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na 'dod chags las 'byung ba ni nyes pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, arising from attachment is not a fault.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can la sdang ba ni bdag dang gzhan la phan par spyod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can la sdang ba ni bdag dang gzhan la phan par spyod pa ma yin te /
translated: A bodhisattva who is hostile to sentient beings does not practice for the benefit of self and other.

original: bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par yang mi 'gyur la ;
analyzed: bdag gi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par yang mi 'gyur la ;
translated: His own buddha qualities will not come to maturity.

original: sems can yongs su smin par yang mi 'gyur bas de yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par yang mi 'gyur bas de yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Since they would not even bring about the evolutionary development of sentient beings, this is not the task of the bodhisattvas.

original: bya ba ma yin pa byed pa ni nyes byas kyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa byed pa ni nyes byas kyi nyes par 'gyur ro //
translated: To engage in what is not the task is a misdeed, a fault.

original: de bas na zhe sdang las byung ba'i nyes pa'i gnas la phal cher kun nas mnar sems kyi sems zhes 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bas na zhe sdang las byung ba'i nyes pa'i gnas la phal cher kun nas mnar sems kyi sems zhes 'byung ngo //
translated: Therefore, in the case of the basis of a misdeed that arises from hostility, the term “a hostile mind” is used most frequently.

original: 'di lta ste gzhi bsdu ba las 'byung ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni rgyu rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste gzhi bsdu ba las 'byung ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni rgyu rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: “For example, as in the Compendium of Bases” means that there are five causes,

original: chung du dang chen po la sogs pa sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: chung du dang chen po la sogs pa sngar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: as previously indicated, such as the small and great.

original: tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas nyan thos rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa dang / nyams pa bzhi bzhir rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas nyan thos rnams kyi phun sum tshogs pa dang / nyams pa bzhi bzhir rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: In terms of morality, the perfection of the disciples is established in four ways:

original: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang ; lta ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims phun sum tshogs pa dang ; lta ba phun sum tshogs pa dang / cho ga phun sum tshogs pa dang / 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: perfection of morality, perfection of view, perfection of conduct, and perfection of livelihood.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni gtan gyi sdom pa yin pa'i phyir tshul khrims nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni gtan gyi sdom pa yin pa'i phyir tshul khrims nyams pa med do //
translated: For the bodhisattvas, there is no degeneration of morality, because it is a permanent vow.

original: de bas na rnam pa gzhan du phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum bstan pa'i phyir ;
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa gzhan du phun sum tshogs pa rnam pa gsum bstan pa'i phyir ;
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate the three kinds of excellence in another way, he says:

original: rang gi 'dul ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang gi 'dul ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The excellence of one's own nature refers to the excellence of the morality of restraint.🔽The excellence of the basis refers to the excellence of the morality of acquiring good.🔽The excellence of the support refers to the excellence of the morality of assisting beings.

original: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi kun du spyod pa yongs su dag pa la brten pa ni phun sum tshogs pa dang po'o //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi kun du spyod pa yongs su dag pa la brten pa ni phun sum tshogs pa dang po'o //
translated: The excellence of one's own nature is the first excellence.

original: yang dag par rab tu byung ba'i sgrub pa'i bsam pas legs par brjod pa'i gnas pa la brten pa ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu byung ba'i sgrub pa'i bsam pas legs par brjod pa'i gnas pa la brten pa ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The excellence of the basis is the second.

original: 'tsho ba'i yo byad rnams kyis phongs pa med pa'i mchog la brten pa ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i yo byad rnams kyis phongs pa med pa'i mchog la brten pa ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The excellence of the support is the third.

original: 'dral bar mi byed pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi las 'gal bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dral bar mi byed pa ni bslab pa'i gzhi las 'gal bar mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One does not violate it, because one does not transgress the rules of training.

original: bslab par rtogs pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kun du spyod pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa'i kun du spyod pa yongs su dag pa' //
analyzed: bslab par rtogs pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kun du spyod pa'i phyir lus la sogs pa'i kun du spyod pa yongs su dag pa' //
translated: Because he practices the actions of body, speech, and mind that are understood as the trainings, he has pure practice of body, etc.

original: bslab pa dag la gus pa dang bag yod par shas cher gnas pas na nyen pa rgyun du mi byed do //
analyzed: bslab pa dag la gus pa dang bag yod par shas cher gnas pas na nyen pa rgyun du mi byed do //
translated: Because he is devoted to the trainings and is very much engaged in heedfulness, he does not constantly commit transgressions.

original: brgya la nyes pa zhig byas na yang ma thol bas sdig pa 'chags par byed do //
analyzed: brgya la nyes pa zhig byas na yang ma thol bas sdig pa 'chags par byed do //
translated: And even if he should happen to commit a transgression, he immediately confesses it.

original: rnam pa gsum po 'di dag gis thog ma dang bar ma dang / tha ma rnams su sbyor ba phun sum tshogs @174b pa bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa gsum po 'di dag gis thog ma dang bar ma dang / tha ma rnams su sbyor ba phun sum tshogs @174b pa bstan to //
translated: By these three aspects, he is shown to be perfectly endowed with application in the beginning, middle, and end.

original: yang dag par rab tu byung bar sbyong ba ni chos kyi bsam pas rab tu byung ba yin no //
analyzed: yang dag par rab tu byung bar sbyong ba ni chos kyi bsam pas rab tu byung ba yin no //
translated: He is perfectly gone forth, because he has gone forth with the intention of attaining the Dharma.

original: nyan thos rnams ni bdag gdul bar bya ba la sogs pa'i don du rab tu byung ba'i phyir legs par rab tu byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos rnams ni bdag gdul bar bya ba la sogs pa'i don du rab tu byung ba'i phyir legs par rab tu byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The Sravakas are said to be well gone forth, because they have gone forth for the sake of disciplining themselves, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du rab tu byung ba'i phyir legs par rab tu byung ba yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bdag nyid kyi sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba'i don du rab tu byung ba'i phyir legs par rab tu byung ba yin te /
translated: The bodhisattva is well gone forth, because he has gone forth for the sake of ripening the qualities of a buddha in himself.

original: de'i phyir / byang chub chen po don du gnyer ba zhes smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir / byang chub chen po don du gnyer ba zhes smos so //
translated: Therefore, he is called one who strives for great enlightenment.

original: don du mi gnyer ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni de gcig pur nges par bstan pa ste /
analyzed: don du mi gnyer ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni de gcig pur nges par bstan pa ste /
translated: He is not one who does not strive, which indicates that he is certain in that alone.

original: de'i don kho nar rab tu byung ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de'i don kho nar rab tu byung ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He has gone forth for that alone.

original: dge sbyong gi tshul don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i sbyor ba dang 'bras bu bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dge sbyong gi tshul don du gnyer ba zhes bya ba ni sgrub pa'i sbyor ba dang 'bras bu bstan pa ste /
translated: He is one who strives for the religious life, which indicates the practice of the means of attainment and the result.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge sbyong gi tshul ni sa bcu po dag la bslab pa gsum gyi sbyor bar gtogs pa'i lam mo //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge sbyong gi tshul ni sa bcu po dag la bslab pa gsum gyi sbyor bar gtogs pa'i lam mo //
translated: The bodhisattva’s religious life is the path included in the practice of the three educations on the ten stages.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni theg pa chen po'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni theg pa chen po'i yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ste /
translated: Nirvana is the transcendence of suffering of the universal vehicle.

original: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi gnas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as the nirvana that is not a resting place.

original: de ltar 'jug pa'i bsam pa'i dbang gis bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med par bstan te /
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa'i bsam pa'i dbang gis bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa kun nas nyon mongs pa med par bstan te /
translated: Thus, by the power of the intention to enter, the perfection of intention is taught as being without defilement.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa'i phyir bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ni le lo med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med par gnas pa'i phyir bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ni le lo med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: The perfection of intention is taught by the absence of laziness, etc.

original: le lo med pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba rnams la brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: le lo med pa zhes bya ba ni dge ba rnams la brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absence of laziness is due to the practice of effort in regard to the wholesome.

original: ma 'dres pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnam par spyod pa dang bar chad med par kun du mi spyod pa ste /
analyzed: ma 'dres pa ni sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnam par spyod pa dang bar chad med par kun du mi spyod pa ste /
translated: The absence of confusion is due to the avoidance of the practice of sin and the avoidance of the practice of the unwholesome.

original: de la sdig pa ni dmad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sdig pa ni dmad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Sin is to be avoided because it is reprehensible.

original: mi dge ba rnams ni dge ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi dge ba rnams ni dge ba dang mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The unwholesome is to be avoided because it is contrary to the wholesome.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni tshe 'di nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa phyir zhing 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa ni tshe 'di nyid la kun nas nyon mongs pa phyir zhing 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Defilement is to be avoided because it is the cause of the production of further defilement in this very life.

original: yang 'byung ba ni tshe phyi ma la yang 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang 'byung ba ni tshe phyi ma la yang 'byung ba'i sdug bsngal 'grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it is a source of future suffering because it establishes suffering in a future life.

original: rims nad ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rims nad ni kun nas nyon mongs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is a disease because it is a universal affliction.

original: rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba ni yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba ni yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is a painful result because it is a source of future suffering.

original: de'i nyes dmigs ni tshe 'di la nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pas lus dang sems yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ba dang / tshe phyi ma la ngan 'gror 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i nyes dmigs ni tshe 'di la nyon mongs pa kun du spyod pas lus dang sems yongs su gdung bar 'gyur ba dang / tshe phyi ma la ngan 'gror 'grub par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Its disadvantage is that it torments the body and mind through the experience of affliction in this life and it establishes the lower realms in a future life.

original: yang 'byung ba rnams yod pas @175a * //
analyzed: yang 'byung ba rnams yod pas @175a * //
translated: Since it is a source of future suffering,

original: na tshe phyi ma la skye ba dang rga shir 'gyur ba de ni nyes dmigs yin te /
analyzed: na tshe phyi ma la skye ba dang rga shir 'gyur ba de ni nyes dmigs yin te /
translated: birth and aging-death occur in a future life. That is its disadvantage,

original: yun ring por skye ba dang rga shi 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring por skye ba dang rga shi 'dren pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it leads to birth and aging-death for a long time.

original: bsod nams byas pa ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po kun tu bsten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams byas pa ni sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po kun tu bsten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is meritorious because it is the basis of meritorious action that arises from giving.

original: dge ba byas pa ni longs spyod chen po'i bar du gcod pa yongs su spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba byas pa ni longs spyod chen po'i bar du gcod pa yongs su spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Virtue is the relinquishment of the obstacles to great enjoyment.

original: gzhan yang bsod nams ni bsod nams kyi don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan yang bsod nams ni bsod nams kyi don gyi phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, merit is for the sake of the goal of merit.

original: dge ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i don gyi phyir ro //
translated: Virtue is for the sake of the goal of non-remorse.

original: phongs par mi gyur zhes bya ba ni mi ldan pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: phongs par mi gyur zhes bya ba ni mi ldan pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: One does not come to be in want means one does not come to be without.

original: de dag thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag thob ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It means one comes to possess them.

original: phun sum tshogs pa dang pos nyin mtshan du dga' zhing mchog tu dga' ba'i shas che ba'i phyir bde ba la reg par gnas so //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa dang pos nyin mtshan du dga' zhing mchog tu dga' ba'i shas che ba'i phyir bde ba la reg par gnas so //
translated: By the first perfection, one abides in bliss because one has great joy and delight day and night.

original: gnyis pa ste kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par gnas pa'i phyir yang bde ba la reg par gnas so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ste kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par gnas pa'i phyir yang bde ba la reg par gnas so //
translated: By the second, one abides in bliss because one abides without defilement.

original: gsum pa ste phong pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir yang bde ba la reg par gnas so //
analyzed: gsum pa ste phong pa rnam par spangs pa'i phyir yang bde ba la reg par gnas so //
translated: By the third, one abides in bliss because one abandons want.

original: bsdus pa dang rgyas pa zhes bya ba la mdor bsdus pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bsdus pa dang rgyas pa zhes bya ba la mdor bsdus pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The summary and the extensive explanation. The summary is twofold:🔽The summary is twofold: the summary of the essence and the summary of the categories.

original: khyim pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs su gtogs pa'o //
translated: The morality of the householder and the morality of the renunciate.

original: yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: It is threefold:

original: sdom pa yang dag par len pa dang dge ba sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: sdom pa yang dag par len pa dang dge ba sdud pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims so //
translated: the morality of taking up what is wholesome, the morality of gathering sentient beings, and the morality of benefiting sentient beings.

original: rgyas par bshad pa ni ji skad bstan pa'i rab tu dbye ba bzhin no //
analyzed: rgyas par bshad pa ni ji skad bstan pa'i rab tu dbye ba bzhin no //
translated: The extensive explanation is according to the above classification.

original: de las gzhan pa 'di'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims thams cad pa nyid kyi phyogs gcig ste /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa 'di'i rab tu dbye ba zhes bya ba ni tshul khrims thams cad pa nyid kyi phyogs gcig ste /
translated: The other classifications of morality are the aspects of the morality of the bodhisattva.

original: dka' ba'i tshul khrims nas rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bar ro //🔽de ltar bstan pas ni tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid bstan te /
analyzed: dka' ba'i tshul khrims nas rnam par dag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bar ro // de ltar bstan pas ni tshul khrims kyi ngo bo nyid bstan te /
translated: They are the morality of difficulty, etc. up to the morality of purification.

original: bshad pas ni tshul khrims thams cad bstan to //
analyzed: bshad pas ni tshul khrims thams cad bstan to //
translated: By teaching the essence of morality, the author teaches the essence of all morality.🔽By teaching the extensive explanation, he teaches the morality of the householder, etc.

original: bshad pa'i rab tu dbye bas ni dka' ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa bstan to //
analyzed: bshad pa'i rab tu dbye bas ni dka' ba'i tshul khrims la sogs pa bstan to //
translated: By teaching the classification, he teaches the morality of difficulty, etc.

original: dka' ba'i tshul khrims ni rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: dka' ba'i tshul khrims ni rnam pa gsum gyis rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The morality of difficulty is established in three ways:

original: gtang dka' ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong bas na tshul khrims len pas na yang dag par len pa dka' ba la brten ta //🔽blangs nas nyam thag par gyur kyang yongs su mi gtong bas na rjes su bsrung ba dka' ba la brten to //
analyzed: gtang dka' ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong bas na tshul khrims len pas na yang dag par len pa dka' ba la brten ta // blangs nas nyam thag par gyur kyang yongs su mi gtong bas na rjes su bsrung ba dka' ba la brten to //
translated: It is difficult to give up what is hard to give up.🔽It is difficult to protect what has been taken up, because even when one is exhausted, one does not give it up.

original: rgyu ba dang gnas pa dag la shin tu dran pa nye bar gnas @175b pas yongs su dag pa dka' ba la brten pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu ba dang gnas pa dag la shin tu dran pa nye bar gnas @175b pas yongs su dag pa dka' ba la brten pa'o //
translated: It is difficult to purify what has been protected, because mindfulness is well established in all activities and resting.

original: gzhan dag ni gzhan du yang 'chad de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni gzhan du yang 'chad de /
translated: Others explain these four in a different way.

original: len pa dang srung ba'i sgo nas dka' bar bstan to //
analyzed: len pa dang srung ba'i sgo nas dka' bar bstan to //
translated: They show that it is difficult to take up and to protect.

original: de la srung ba ni nyams la bab par gyur kyang shin tu yongs su skyong ba dang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la srung ba ni nyams la bab par gyur kyang shin tu yongs su skyong ba dang shin tu rnam par dag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Protection is the thorough protection of the morality that has been taken up, even when it is threatened, and its thorough purification.

original: longs spyod che ba ni rnam pa bzhi dang lngas rigs par bya ste /
analyzed: longs spyod che ba ni rnam pa bzhi dang lngas rigs par bya ste /
translated: Great enjoyment is to be understood in four or five ways.

original: bzhi zhes bya ba ni gang gis longs spyad par bya ba'i lus kyis te /
analyzed: bzhi zhes bya ba ni gang gis longs spyad par bya ba'i lus kyis te /
translated: The four are the body by which one enjoys,

original: lus kyi 'byor pas gyur pas na longs spyod che ba'o //🔽gang dag dang lhan cig pa ste /
analyzed: lus kyi 'byor pas gyur pas na longs spyod che ba'o // gang dag dang lhan cig pa ste /
translated: He has great wealth because he has a great body.🔽He has a great retinue because he has a great family.🔽His family is great because it is well known and has many members.

original: gnyen 'dab pa dang rtsa lag sdug cing byams pa nas yid du 'ong ba'i bar dag dang ngo //
analyzed: gnyen 'dab pa dang rtsa lag sdug cing byams pa nas yid du 'ong ba'i bar dag dang ngo //
translated: He has great friends and relatives because he has many friends and relatives.

original: de dag kyang mang ba dang che ba'i phyir na che ba'o //🔽gang dag gis bsgrubs pa ni bran la sogs pa rnams kyis te /
analyzed: de dag kyang mang ba dang che ba'i phyir na che ba'o // gang dag gis bsgrubs pa ni bran la sogs pa rnams kyis te /
translated: He has great servants because he has many servants.

original: de dag kyang mang ba dang che ba'i phyir che ba'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang mang ba dang che ba'i phyir che ba'o //
translated: He has great wealth because he has much wealth.
