original: gang longs spyod pa ni zas dang skom la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang longs spyod pa ni zas dang skom la sogs pa ste /
translated: He has great enjoyments because he has great food and drink.

original: de ltar na lus phun sum tshogs pa dang phyogs chen po dang / 'khor chen po dang / nor dang yo byad phal po cher gyur pa'i phyir longs spyod che bar bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na lus phun sum tshogs pa dang phyogs chen po dang / 'khor chen po dang / nor dang yo byad phal po cher gyur pa'i phyir longs spyod che bar bstan to //
translated: Thus, he is said to have great wealth because he has a great body, a great family, a great retinue, great friends and relatives, great servants, and great enjoyments.

original: rnam pa lngas ji ltar zhe na /🔽lus dang ngag gis ci'i phyir longs spyod pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa lngas ji ltar zhe na / lus dang ngag gis ci'i phyir longs spyod pa yin te /
translated: How is he great in five ways?

original: 'tsho ba'i phyir yin la de gnyis kyang che ba'i phyir che ba'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba'i phyir yin la de gnyis kyang che ba'i phyir che ba'o //
translated: He has great enjoyments because he has great food and drink.🔽He has great wealth because he has great enjoyments.🔽He has a great retinue because he has great wealth.🔽He has a great family because he has a great retinue.🔽He has a great body because he has a great family.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma dang 'dra'o //
translated: The rest is as before.

original: nor dang 'bru dang mdzod dang bang ba'i tshogs phal po che spangs pa'i phyir dka' ba'o //
analyzed: nor dang 'bru dang mdzod dang bang ba'i tshogs phal po che spangs pa'i phyir dka' ba'o //
translated: It is difficult to give up a great accumulation of wealth, grain, treasuries, and storehouses.

original: nor dang 'bru mang bas na longs spyod chen po'i dka' btsan pas de dag la ci dga' mgur dbang byed pa'i tshul gyis dbang phyug chen po la dbang byed pa ste /
analyzed: nor dang 'bru mang bas na longs spyod chen po'i dka' btsan pas de dag la ci dga' mgur dbang byed pa'i tshul gyis dbang phyug chen po la dbang byed pa ste /
translated: Because of the great wealth and grain, there is great wealth. Because of the difficulty of giving that up, there is great power, since one has power over them as one wishes.

original: gsum po'i 'di dag ni gtang bar mi nus pa yin la /
analyzed: gsum po'i 'di dag ni gtang bar mi nus pa yin la /
translated: These three are impossible to give up.

original: de btang dgos pas na tshul khrims yang dag par len pa dka' ba yin te /🔽mdog gzhan las kyang 'di skad du 'khor log sgyur ba'i rgyal po gling bzhi'i dbang phyug la dbang byed par gyur pa de lta bu yang 'dod na skad cig gcig kho nas btsun mo dang longs spyod thams cad spangs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab
analyzed: de btang dgos pas na tshul khrims yang dag par len pa dka' ba yin te / mdog gzhan las kyang 'di skad du 'khor log sgyur ba'i rgyal po gling bzhi'i dbang phyug la dbang byed par gyur pa de lta bu yang 'dod na skad cig gcig kho nas btsun mo dang longs spyod thams cad spangs nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la rab
translated: But one must give them up, and so it is difficult to take up morality.🔽The Mṛṣāvāda-sūtra also says,

original: tu 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: tu 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: “Even if a universal monarch, lord over the four continents, should desire this, in a single instant he would give up his queens, his wealth, and all his enjoyments and go forth into the doctrine of the Tathāgata.”

original: nyams pa la bab par gyur pa ni srog la thug kyang zhes bya bas bstan te /
analyzed: nyams pa la bab par gyur pa ni srog la thug kyang zhes bya bas bstan te /
translated: The verse shows that the bodhisattva does not transgress the precepts even at the cost of his life.

original: 'chi bas thug pa'i sdug bsngal gyis thebs na yang gtong bas srog gi @176a * //
analyzed: 'chi bas thug pa'i sdug bsngal gyis thebs na yang gtong bas srog gi @176a * //
translated: Even when he is overwhelmed by the suffering of death, he does not give up.

original: phyir yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyir yang zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning of even at the cost of his life.

original: rgyu ba dang gnas pa dang yid la byed pa thams cad la zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba la sogs ba la dran pa dang shes bzhin mchog dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i bag yod pa la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ba dang gnas pa dang yid la byed pa thams cad la zhes bya ba ni 'gro ba la sogs ba la dran pa dang shes bzhin mchog dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / yan lag lnga dang ldan pa'i bag yod pa la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In all his activities, in all his postures, and in all his thoughts, means that he is endowed with the highest mindfulness and vigilance in going and so forth, and that he is established in heedfulness endowed with the five limbs.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsam pa dang sbyor ba dag pas na brgya lam na gnas skabs 'ga' tsam la yang yang dag par blangs pa'i skad cig phyin chad nas ma shi'i bar du yang sdig pa mi byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bsam pa dang sbyor ba dag pas na brgya lam na gnas skabs 'ga' tsam la yang yang dag par blangs pa'i skad cig phyin chad nas ma shi'i bar du yang sdig pa mi byed do //
translated: The bodhisattva, with his pure will and application, does not commit evil even for a moment after he has taken up the precepts, even for a single instant, until his death, even in an emergency.

original: de ltar na rjes su srung ba'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas te dka' ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rjes su srung ba'i tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas te dka' ba nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the morality of restraint is difficult to practice.

original: rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i tshul khrims ni thams cad kyi sgo'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i tshul khrims ni thams cad kyi sgo'o //
translated: The morality of the four practices is the door to all.

original: sbyor ba'i khyad par gyis bsgrubs pas na yang dag par blang bar byas pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i khyad par gyis bsgrubs pas na yang dag par blang bar byas pa'o //
translated: It is undertaken by the special application of the perfections.

original: sems pa dang mngon par 'du byed pa dang smon pa la mi ltos pas na rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims so //
analyzed: sems pa dang mngon par 'du byed pa dang smon pa la mi ltos pas na rang bzhin gyi tshul khrims so //
translated: It is natural morality, since it is not dependent on volition, on the formative forces, or on aspiration.

original: yun ring po dang rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dus nas zhugs pa na goms pa'o //
analyzed: yun ring po dang rgyun mi 'chad pa'i dus nas zhugs pa na goms pa'o //
translated: It is habitual, since it is practiced for a long time and without interruption.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos pos yongs su zin pas na thabs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos pos yongs su zin pas na thabs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with means, since it is accompanied by the means of conversion.

original: rigs la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i rtags kun du spyod pa'i gnas skabs kyi'o //
analyzed: rigs la gnas pa zhes bya ba ni sbyin pa la sogs pa pha rol tu phyin pa'i rtags kun du spyod pa'i gnas skabs kyi'o //
translated: The morality of one who is established in the spiritual lineage refers to the stage of the bodhisattva who practices the signs of the perfections such as generosity.

original: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las te /
analyzed: kha na ma tho ba med pa ni lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las te /
translated: It is irreproachable, since it is the activity of body, speech and mind.

original: de yang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu yin pas na pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba 'thob po //
analyzed: de yang tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i rgyu yin pas na pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba 'thob po //
translated: Moreover, since it is the cause of the perfection of morality, it is described as a perfection.

original: goms pa'i khyad par gyi sbyor bas gong ma bas kyang ches gong ma dang / gya nom pa bas kyang ches gya nom par tshul khrims la goms par 'gyur te /
analyzed: goms pa'i khyad par gyi sbyor bas gong ma bas kyang ches gong ma dang / gya nom pa bas kyang ches gya nom par tshul khrims la goms par 'gyur te /
translated: Through the distinctive practice of cultivation, one cultivates morality more and more, to a higher and higher degree, and to a more and more excellent degree.

original: de bas na sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de bas na sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, in other former lives, etc.

original: de'i phyir dper na /
analyzed: de'i phyir dper na /
translated: Therefore, just as, for example,

original: rang bzhin gyis gtsang zhing khrus byas la lus byugs pa ni mi gtsang ba dang mi mthun zhing mi 'dod pa de bzhin du rang bzhin gyis sdig pa rnams la zhe sdang la de'i gnyen por dge ba rnams la dga' zhing dge ba 'dod do //🔽bslab pa la brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i lus la sogs pa'i las ni thabs dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gtsang zhing khrus byas la lus byugs pa ni mi gtsang ba dang mi mthun zhing mi 'dod pa de bzhin du rang bzhin gyis sdig pa rnams la zhe sdang la de'i gnyen por dge ba rnams la dga' zhing dge ba 'dod do // bslab pa la brtson pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i lus la sogs pa'i las ni thabs dang ldan pa'i tshul khrims te /
translated: a naturally clean and washed body anointed with perfumes is incompatible with and does not desire filth, in the same way, one who naturally detests evil is incompatible with and does not desire evil.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi ni thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi ni thabs kyis yongs su zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The morality of the bodhisattva who is diligent in the training and who has entered through generosity, etc., is the morality that is endowed with means, because it is embraced by the four means of conversion.

original: bdag dang gzhan la mi gnod par @176b sgrub pa'i phyir skyes bu dam pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la mi gnod par @176b sgrub pa'i phyir skyes bu dam pa yin te /
translated: He is a holy man because he practices without harming himself or others.

original: sgrub pa de yang bdag nyid dang gzhan dag la phan 'dogs pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kun du spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgrub pa de yang bdag nyid dang gzhan dag la phan 'dogs pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kun du spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And that practice is the performance of bodily, verbal, and mental actions that benefit both himself and others.

original: skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims rnam par gzhag pa ni bdag nyid kyang yang dag par len pa dang / yongs su bsrung ba'i yan lag phun sum tshogs pas thog ma dang tha mas skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims su gyur pa'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims rnam par gzhag pa ni bdag nyid kyang yang dag par len pa dang / yongs su bsrung ba'i yan lag phun sum tshogs pas thog ma dang tha mas skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims su gyur pa'o //
translated: The morality of the holy man is established as the morality of the holy man by the perfection of the limbs of right taking up and right protection, and by the beginning and end.

original: gzhan ni tha mal pa dang / zhe 'gras pa dang / yang dag par zhugs pa'i bye brag gis tshul khrims rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni tha mal pa dang / zhe 'gras pa dang / yang dag par zhugs pa'i bye brag gis tshul khrims rnam pa gsum gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The other three kinds of morality are considered in terms of the three kinds of persons: the ordinary person, the hostile, and the rightly engaged.

original: de la snga ma rnams ni yang dag par len du 'jug go //
analyzed: de la snga ma rnams ni yang dag par len du 'jug go //
translated: Among them, the former are induced to take up the precepts.

original: zhe 'gras pa rnams la na bsngags pa brjod do //
analyzed: zhe 'gras pa rnams la na bsngags pa brjod do //
translated: The hostile are praised.

original: de dag gis bsngags pa dang phan yon thos na kun nas mnar sems kyi sems rtse zhil  bar 'gyur du re ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis bsngags pa dang phan yon thos na kun nas mnar sems kyi sems rtse zhil  bar 'gyur du re ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they hope that their hostile thoughts will be pacified when they hear the praise and the benefits of the bodhisattvas.

original: yang dag par zhugs pa rnams mthong na ni yid dga' bar 'gyur la 'gran par yang mi byed de /
analyzed: yang dag par zhugs pa rnams mthong na ni yid dga' bar 'gyur la 'gran par yang mi byed de /
translated: But when they see the bodhisattvas who are correctly engaged, they are delighted and do not compete with them.

original: de ltar na tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas gzhan dag la lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims nyid du bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na tshul khrims kyi dbang du byas nas gzhan dag la lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi khyad par dang ldan pa'i skyes bu dam pa'i tshul khrims nyid du bstan to //
translated: Thus, in terms of morality, the bodhisattvas’ morality is shown to be the morality of holy beings, which is endowed with the special activities of body, speech, and mind in relation to others.

original: rnam grangs gcig gis rnam pa drug yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas na rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: rnam grangs gcig gis rnam pa drug yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas na rnam pa drug go //
translated: It is sixfold because it is completed in six aspects by one enumeration.

original: rnam grangs cig shos kyis ni rnam pa bdun yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas na rnam pa bdun no //
analyzed: rnam grangs cig shos kyis ni rnam pa bdun yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas na rnam pa bdun no //
translated: It is sevenfold because it is completed in seven aspects by another enumeration.

original: gnyis ka bsdoms pas rnam pa bcu gsum yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas na rnam pa bcu gsum mo //
analyzed: gnyis ka bsdoms pas rnam pa bcu gsum yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur bas na rnam pa bcu gsum mo //
translated: It is thirteenfold because it is completed in thirteen aspects by combining the two enumerations.

original: byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa'i phyir 'bras bu dang phan yon che ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub chen por yongs su bsngos pa'i phyir 'bras bu dang phan yon che ba ste /
translated: It is of great result and benefit, because it is dedicated to great enlightenment.

original: de bas na 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pas yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs pas yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is perfect in result, because it is fully developed.

original: rgya chen po ni bslab pa'i gzhi rgyas par blangs pa'i phyir gnas yongs su rdzogs pas yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgya chen po ni bslab pa'i gzhi rgyas par blangs pa'i phyir gnas yongs su rdzogs pas yongs su rdzogs pa'o //
translated: It is perfect in the development of the bases of training, because it is taken up in an extensive manner.

original: rgya che ba ni rgya cher brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgya che ba ni rgya cher brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: It is extensive, because it is to be expressed extensively.

original: 'dod pa'i bsod nyams kyi mtha' rnam par spangs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi bde ba dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i bsod nyams kyi mtha' rnam par spangs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa can gyi bde ba dang bral ba yin te /
translated: It is free from defiled pleasure, because it is free from the extremes of indulgence in sensual pleasures.

original: de bas na kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na kha na ma tho ba med pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is irreproachable.

original: bdag nyid dub par byed pa'i mtha' rnam par spangs pa'i phyir dang don med pa'i sdug bsngal rnam par spangs te /
analyzed: bdag nyid dub par byed pa'i mtha' rnam par spangs pa'i phyir dang don med pa'i sdug bsngal rnam par spangs te /
translated: It is a fit vessel for the joy of the noble ones, because it is free from the extremes of self-mortification and the suffering of uselessness.

original: de bas na rab tu dga' ba'i gnas dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na rab tu dga' ba'i gnas dang mthun pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is a fit vessel for the joy of the noble ones.

original: bar du gcod pa yongs @177a * //
analyzed: bar du gcod pa yongs @177a * //
translated: It is free from obstacles, because it is free from the extremes of distraction and torpor.

original: su btang bas ji srid 'tsho'i bar gyi bslab pa dang ldan pas na rgyun du chud pa'o //
analyzed: su btang bas ji srid 'tsho'i bar gyi bslab pa dang ldan pas na rgyun du chud pa'o //
translated: It is continuous because it is endowed with the training for as long as one lives.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi brten te de'i sgo nas nyams par mi byed pas de'i phyir zil gyis mi non pa'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la mi brten te de'i sgo nas nyams par mi byed pas de'i phyir zil gyis mi non pa'o //
translated: It is not overcome because it is not overcome by the door of gain and honor.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bcas pa'i tshul khrims phul nas mu stegs can gyi gnas rnams su sdom pa yang dag par len pa'i phyir phas kyi rgol ba la sogs pas zil gyis gnon par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bcas pa'i tshul khrims phul nas mu stegs can gyi gnas rnams su sdom pa yang dag par len pa'i phyir phas kyi rgol ba la sogs pas zil gyis gnon par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not overcome by opponents, etc. because it is the foremost of the moral precepts established by the Tathāgata, and because one does not take up the vows in the abodes of the heterodox.

original: de med pas na de dag gis zil gyis gnon par gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de med pas na de dag gis zil gyis gnon par gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: Since it does not exist, it is not overcome by them.

original: dge sbyong sar pa sar pa rnams ni dge sbyong gi gnod pa rnams kyis gtses so zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa de lta bus bslab pa phul nas nyams shing ldog pa'i phyir dang / bslab pa 'dral bas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis zil gyis non par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dge sbyong sar pa sar pa rnams ni dge sbyong gi gnod pa rnams kyis gtses so zhes mdo las gsungs pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa'i kun nas dkris pa de lta bus bslab pa phul nas nyams shing ldog pa'i phyir dang / bslab pa 'dral bas nye ba'i nyon mongs pa rnams kyis zil gyis non par 'gyur la /
translated: Because one gives up the training and regresses due to such entanglements of affliction, and because one is overcome by secondary afflictions due to breaking the training,

original: rnam pa de rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa de rnams kyis mi 'phrogs pa'i phyir bstan pa'o //
translated: it is taught that one is not carried away by those aspects.

original: rgyan dang ldan pa yin pas na rgyan dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: rgyan dang ldan pa yin pas na rgyan dang bcas pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with ornaments, thus it is endowed with ornaments.🔽It is like this in the Sravakabhumi.

original: 'di lta ste nyan thos kyi sa las zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang ldan pa dang / g-yo med pa dang / nad nyung ba dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid dang / shes rab can dang 'dod pa chung ba la sogs pa nas sbyangs pa'i yon tan la thug pa rnams ni tshul khrims kyi rgyan yin no zhes de las bstan to //
analyzed: 'di lta ste nyan thos kyi sa las zhes bya ba ni dad pa dang ldan pa dang / g-yo med pa dang / nad nyung ba dang / brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid dang / shes rab can dang 'dod pa chung ba la sogs pa nas sbyangs pa'i yon tan la thug pa rnams ni tshul khrims kyi rgyan yin no zhes de las bstan to //
translated: Faith, honesty, few illnesses, the practice of striving, wisdom, few desires, and so on up to the qualities of purification are the ornaments of morality.

original: tshul khrims ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: tshul khrims ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Morality is twofold in brief:

original: gtan mi bya ba kho nas nyes par spyod pa spong ba yang dag par len pa'i phyir ldog pa'i tshul khrims dang / gcig tu nges par bya ba kho nas bslab pa ste 'jug pa'i tshul khrims dang / de gnyis rtag tu bag yod par bsrung ba'i phyir kun nas bsrung ba'i tshul khrims te /
analyzed: gtan mi bya ba kho nas nyes par spyod pa spong ba yang dag par len pa'i phyir ldog pa'i tshul khrims dang / gcig tu nges par bya ba kho nas bslab pa ste 'jug pa'i tshul khrims dang / de gnyis rtag tu bag yod par bsrung ba'i phyir kun nas bsrung ba'i tshul khrims te /
translated: morality of restraint, because one vows to abandon evil through never committing it; morality of engagement, because one definitely engages in training; and morality of full acceptance, because one always protects those two with heedfulness.🔽Thus, there are three types.

original: de ltar rnam pa gsum dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bus rab tu phye bas na rnam par smin par byed pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar rnam pa gsum dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bus rab tu phye bas na rnam par smin par byed pa ste /
translated: Morality is distinguished by its fruitions.

original: de yang sa re re la ji ltar 'tsham pa'i mtshan 'grub par byed pa'i phyir dang de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin 'grub par byed pa'i phyir dang / lha dang mi'i 'gro ba 'grub par byed pa'i phyir dang / sems can gyi don mang po'i 'bras bu 'grub par byed pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de yang sa re re la ji ltar 'tsham pa'i mtshan 'grub par byed pa'i phyir dang de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin 'grub par byed pa'i phyir dang / lha dang mi'i 'gro ba 'grub par byed pa'i phyir dang / sems can gyi don mang po'i 'bras bu 'grub par byed pa'i phyir rnam pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be known as fourfold: because it establishes the name that is appropriate to each stage; because it establishes the bodhisattvas meditative concentration; because it establishes the destinies of gods and humans; and because it establishes the results of many benefits for sentient beings.🔽Thus, it is sevenfold.

original: de ltar na rnam pa @177b bdun du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa @177b bdun du 'gyur ro //
translated: Morality of renouncing what is evil is fourfold: morality of renouncing what is evil by nature; morality of renouncing what is evil by roots; morality of renouncing what is evil by vows; and morality of renouncing what is evil by acceptance.🔽Morality of collecting good is fourfold: morality of collecting ones own good; morality of collecting the good of others; morality of collecting both goods; and morality of collecting the result of both goods.🔽Morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings is fourfold: morality of establishing sentient beings in virtue; morality of establishing them in the three vehicles; morality of establishing them in the three refuges; and morality of establishing them in the ten virtues.🔽Morality of renouncing what is evil is fourfold: morality of renouncing what is evil by nature; morality of renouncing what is evil by roots; morality of renouncing what is evil by vows; and morality of renouncing what is evil by acceptance.

original: bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i phyir 'dod pa nyid dang / phongs pa nyid la lta zhing so sor brtags nas blangs pa ni phongs shing 'dod pa'i tshul khrims so //🔽de yang sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad kyi gnyen po'i phyir rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan mnyam pa nyid thob pa'i phyir 'dod pa nyid dang / phongs pa nyid la lta zhing so sor brtags nas blangs pa ni phongs shing 'dod pa'i tshul khrims so //🔽de yang sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad kyi gnyen po'i phyir rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: Morality of collecting good is fourfold: morality of collecting ones own good; morality of collecting the good of others; morality of collecting both goods; and morality of collecting the result of both goods.🔽Morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings is fourfold: morality of establishing sentient beings in virtue; morality of establishing them in the three vehicles; morality of establishing them in the three refuges; and morality of establishing them in the ten virtues.🔽Morality of renouncing what is evil is fourfold: morality of renouncing what is evil by nature; morality of renouncing what is evil by roots; morality of renouncing what is evil by vows; and morality of renouncing what is evil by acceptance.🔽Morality of collecting good is fourfold: morality of collecting ones own good; morality of collecting the good of others; morality of collecting both goods; and morality of collecting the result of both goods.🔽Morality of acting for the benefit of sentient beings is fourfold: morality of establishing sentient beings in virtue; morality of establishing them in the three vehicles; morality of establishing them in the three refuges; and morality of establishing them in the ten virtues.🔽Morality of renouncing what

original: sems can thams cad ni 'tsho ba 'dod kyi 'chi ba mi 'dod pa'i phyir 'tsho ba dang srog 'dod pa rnams dang / longs spyod 'dod pa rnams dang / kha mi phyin pa'i chung ma 'dod pa rnams dang / mi blu ba 'dod pa rnams dang /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni 'tsho ba 'dod kyi 'chi ba mi 'dod pa'i phyir 'tsho ba dang srog 'dod pa rnams dang / longs spyod 'dod pa rnams dang / kha mi phyin pa'i chung ma 'dod pa rnams dang / mi blu ba 'dod pa rnams dang /
translated: Because all sentient beings desire life and do not desire death, they desire life and livelihood, they desire wealth, they desire a wife who is not unfaithful, they desire not to be deceived,

original: mi phyed pa'i g-yog 'khor 'dod pa rnams dang / sgra snyan pa thos pa rnams dang / don dang ldan pa'i 'brel pa'i gtam 'dod pa rnams dang / sdug pa'i 'dus te reg pa 'dod pa rnams so //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i g-yog 'khor 'dod pa rnams dang / sgra snyan pa thos pa rnams dang / don dang ldan pa'i 'brel pa'i gtam 'dod pa rnams dang / sdug pa'i 'dus te reg pa 'dod pa rnams so //
translated: they desire an undivided retinue, they desire to hear pleasant sounds, they desire meaningful and related speech, and they desire pleasant contact.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.

original: de las bzlog pa ni sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad de /🔽phongs par byed pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / yid du mi 'ong ba de las bzlog pa'i sgo nas phongs shing 'dod pa'i tshul khrims rnam par gzhag go ;
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad de /🔽phongs par byed pa dang / mi sdug pa dang / yid du mi 'ong ba de las bzlog pa'i sgo nas phongs shing 'dod pa'i tshul khrims rnam par gzhag go ;
translated: The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.🔽The opposite of that is the eight types of suffering.

original: / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la 'jug pa bkag pa'i sgo nas 'di dang phyi ma la bdag dang gzhan rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pas na 'gog pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: / sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la 'jug pa bkag pa'i sgo nas 'di dang phyi ma la bdag dang gzhan rnams la phan 'dogs par byed pa yin pas na 'gog pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: It is morality of restraint, because it restrains one from engaging in the causes of suffering and thus benefits oneself and others in this life and the next.

original: 'di dang phyi ma la bde ba ste bde ba'i rgyu la 'jug pa gnang bas na gnang ba'i tshul khrims so //🔽de bzhin du gnyi gar phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir de gnyis la yang dag par zhugs pa'i sems can sdud pas na sdud pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: 'di dang phyi ma la bde ba ste bde ba'i rgyu la 'jug pa gnang bas na gnang ba'i tshul khrims so // de bzhin du gnyi gar phan 'dogs par byed pa'i phyir de gnyis la yang dag par zhugs pa'i sems can sdud pas na sdud pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: It is morality of permission, because it permits one to engage in the causes of happiness and thus brings happiness in this life and the next.

original: gzhan dag gi 'di dang phyi ma'i bde ba la log par zhugs pa'i sems can tshar gcod par byed pas na tshar gcod pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi 'di dang phyi ma'i bde ba la log par zhugs pa'i sems can tshar gcod par byed pas na tshar gcod pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: Similarly, it is morality of attraction, because it attracts beings who are engaged in both of these, and it is morality of subjugation, because it subjugates beings who are wrongly engaged in the happiness of this life and the next.

original: sbyin pa dang ldan pa kho nas phyi ma la longs spyod chen po'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i phyir dang bzod pa dang ldan pas ni 'di dang phyi ma la bdag dang gzhan gyi bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / phyi ma la bdag nyid g-yog 'khor dang ldan pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di dang phyi ma la bde ba dang brtson 'grus dang ldan pa ni tshe 'di nyid la brtson 'grus brtsams pas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang mi 'dre ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir
analyzed: sbyin pa dang ldan pa kho nas phyi ma la longs spyod chen po'i 'bras bur gyur pa'i phyir dang bzod pa dang ldan pas ni 'di dang phyi ma la bdag dang gzhan gyi bde ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / phyi ma la bdag nyid g-yog 'khor dang ldan pa'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di dang phyi ma la bde ba dang brtson 'grus dang ldan pa ni tshe 'di nyid la brtson 'grus brtsams pas sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang mi 'dre ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir
translated: Generosity alone is the cause of the result of great resources in future lives. Patience is the cause of the happiness of self and others in this and other lives.🔽Diligence is the cause of happiness in this and future lives because it is the cause of not mixing with sinful nonvirtuous dharmas through the practice of diligence in this life and it is the cause of great happiness in future lives.

original: dang / phyi ma la bde ba chen po'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di dang phyi ma la bde ba dang / bsam gtan dang ldan pa'i tshe 'di nyid la bde ba la reg pa'i @178a * //
analyzed: dang / phyi ma la bde ba chen po'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir 'di dang phyi ma la bde ba dang / bsam gtan dang ldan pa'i tshe 'di nyid la bde ba la reg pa'i @178a * //
translated: Concentration is the cause of happiness in this and future lives because it is the cause of the experience of bliss in this life and it is the cause of great happiness in future lives.

original: rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / phyi ma la rnam par dag pa'i lhar skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyi gar bde ba dang / shes rab dang ldan pa ni tshe 'di nyid la de dang de dag la mkhas pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / phyi ma la shes rab kyi khyad par gyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir gnyi gar bde ba ste //
analyzed: rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / phyi ma la rnam par dag pa'i lhar skye ba'i rgyur 'gyur ba'i phyir gnyi gar bde ba dang / shes rab dang ldan pa ni tshe 'di nyid la de dang de dag la mkhas pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / phyi ma la shes rab kyi khyad par gyi rgyur gyur pa'i phyir gnyi gar bde ba ste //
translated: Because it produces skill in this and that, and because it is the cause of the special insight of the next life.

original: de ltar na tshul khrims rnam pa bzhi ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsdus te ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de ltar na tshul khrims rnam pa bzhi ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis bsdus te ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: Thus, the four kinds of morality are included in the six perfections, as appropriate.

original: bdag dang pha rol rnam pa gnyi gar phan 'dogs pas na 'di dang phyi ma la bde ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang pha rol rnam pa gnyi gar phan 'dogs pas na 'di dang phyi ma la bde ba'o //
translated: It is happiness in this life and the next, because it benefits both oneself and others.

original: nyes pa rnam pa bcu'i gnyen por gyur pas na rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: nyes pa rnam pa bcu'i gnyen por gyur pas na rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: It is pure, because it is the antidote to the ten faults.

original: rnam pa bcu ni nyes pa rnam pa bcu'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu ni nyes pa rnam pa bcu'o //
translated: The ten faults are:

original: bsam pa nyams pas na yang dag par len pa nyams pa'i nyes pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa nyams pas na yang dag par len pa nyams pa'i nyes pa'o //
translated: The fault of the degeneration of correct practice, because of the degeneration of intention.

original: de'i gnyen por dge sbyong gi tshul 'dod pa nas tha ma rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa la thug pa rnams smos so //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por dge sbyong gi tshul 'dod pa nas tha ma rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'dod pa la thug pa rnams smos so //
translated: The antidotes to these are mentioned from the desire for the way of virtuous endeavor up to the desire for complete enlightenment.

original: bslab pa la mi sbyor ba'i nyes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas bslab pa'i gzhi bcas pa rnams la gus par mi byed pas na de'i phyir ha cang zhum pa ma yin pa zhes smos te /
analyzed: bslab pa la mi sbyor ba'i nyes pa ni de bzhin gshegs pas bslab pa'i gzhi bcas pa rnams la gus par mi byed pas na de'i phyir ha cang zhum pa ma yin pa zhes smos te /
translated: The fault of not applying oneself to the training is mentioned by the words not excessively lax, because one does not respect the bases of training as they have been laid down by the Tathagata.

original: de nyid ni 'gal bar byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel to //
analyzed: de nyid ni 'gal bar byas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel to //
translated: This is explained by the words and so on for contradiction.

original: bslab pa'i gzhi ma bcas pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i nyes pa yin pas na ha cang thal ba nyid do //
analyzed: bslab pa'i gzhi ma bcas pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i nyes pa yin pas na ha cang thal ba nyid do //
translated: The fault of following what has not been laid down as a basis of training is mentioned by the words not excessively strict.

original: nyes pa de gnyi ga'i gnyen por ji ltar bcas pa rnams la yang dag par bslab pas na rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa de gnyi ga'i gnyen por ji ltar bcas pa rnams la yang dag par bslab pas na rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The antidote to both of these faults is mentioned by the words pure, because one trains correctly in the bases of training as they have been laid down.

original: le lo'i nyes pa nyams par gyur pa'i gnyen por le lo med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: le lo'i nyes pa nyams par gyur pa'i gnyen por le lo med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The antidote to the fault of laziness is mentioned by the words not lazy and so on.

original: le lo dang bral ba ni nyin mtshan du dge ba'i phyogs la mngon par brtson pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
analyzed: le lo dang bral ba ni nyin mtshan du dge ba'i phyogs la mngon par brtson pa zhes bya bas bstan to //
translated: Being free from laziness is taught by day and night one is dedicated to virtue.

original: bag med pa'i nyes pa'i gnyen por ni bag yod pas yongs su zin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: bag med pa'i nyes pa'i gnyen por ni bag yod pas yongs su zin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To remedy the fault of heedlessness, it says he is fully engaged in heedfulness.

original: rten ngan pa'i nyes pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang skye ba'i khyad par la brten pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rten ngan pa'i nyes pa ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti dang skye ba'i khyad par la brten pa'i phyir te /
translated: The fault of a bad basis is that one relies on the distinctions of gain, honor and birth.

original: de'i gnyen por smon lam legs par btab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por smon lam legs par btab pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To remedy that, it says he makes good aspirations.

original: gzhan dag 'dun par mi byed pa'i nyes pa de'i gnyen por ni cho ga phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gzhan dag 'dun par mi byed pa'i nyes pa de'i gnyen por ni cho ga phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To remedy the fault of not inspiring others, it says he is endowed with perfect conduct.

original: log par 'tsho ba'i nyes pa de'i gnyen por ni 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: log par 'tsho ba'i nyes pa de'i gnyen por ni 'tsho ba phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: To remedy the fault of wrong livelihood, it says he is endowed with perfect livelihood.

original: mtha' gnyis su @178b lhung ba'i nyes pa de'i gnyen por ni mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mtha' gnyis su @178b lhung ba'i nyes pa de'i gnyen por ni mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The antidote to the fault of falling into the two extremes is stated in the line, “Abandoning the two extremes.

original: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i nyes pa de'i gnyen por ni nges par 'byin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mchog tu 'dzin pa'i nyes pa de'i gnyen por ni nges par 'byin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The antidote to the fault of grasping at the highest is stated in the line, “The one that leads to definite release.

original: nyams par byed pa'i gnyen por ni bslab pa las 'gal bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: nyams par byed pa'i gnyen por ni bslab pa las 'gal bar byed pa ste /
translated: The antidote to the fault of degeneration is stated in the line, “The one that does not conflict with the training.

original: de'i gnyen por ni ma nyams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por ni ma nyams pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The antidote to the fault of being incomplete is stated in the line, “The one that is not incomplete.

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po chen po ni yangs shing rgya che la bsod nams che ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po chen po ni yangs shing rgya che la bsod nams che ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The great aggregate of discipline is vast and extensive and has great merit.

original: byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu bskyed pa ni 'bras bu che ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: byang chub chen po'i 'bras bu bskyed pa ni 'bras bu che ba'i phyir te /
translated: It produces the result of great awakening, because it has a great result.

original: de gnyis ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel te /
analyzed: de gnyis ni tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas rnam par 'grel te /
translated: These two are explained in the lines beginning, “The perfection of discipline.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims la slob pa ni phan yon nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin par bstan te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sdom pa'i tshul khrims la slob pa ni phan yon nyan thos la sogs pa dang thun mong ma yin par bstan te /
translated: The benefits of training in the morality of the bodhisattva vow are taught to be not shared in common with the sravakas and so on.

original: de la slob pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dgongs par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de la slob pa ni sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis dgongs par 'gyur gyi /
translated: One who trains in that is considered by the buddhas and bodhisattvas,

original: nyan thos kyi sdom pa la slob pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sdom pa la slob pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not one who trains in the vow of the sravakas.

original: 'chi ba'i tshe 'di nas shi 'phos nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang phrad pa yid la byed pas 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa las 'das pa'i phyir mchog tu dga' ba chen po 'thob bo //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i tshe 'di nas shi 'phos nas sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang phrad pa yid la byed pas 'chi ba'i 'jigs pa las 'das pa'i phyir mchog tu dga' ba chen po 'thob bo //
translated: At the time of death, after death and transmigration, one obtains the supreme great joy because one has transcended the fear of death by means of attention to meeting with the buddhas and bodhisattvas.

original: phyi ma la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa'i phan yon gsum pa'o //
analyzed: phyi ma la sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i bshes gnyen dang phrad pa'i phan yon gsum pa'o //
translated: The third benefit is meeting with the spiritual friend, the buddhas and bodhisattvas, in the next life.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa bsdus pa'i bsod nams yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa bsdus pa'i bsod nams yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the benefit of holding the merit that subsumes the perfections.

original: gtan du ba'i tshul khrims yin pas chos nyid kyi tshul khrims thob pa'i phyir lnga pa'o //
analyzed: gtan du ba'i tshul khrims yin pas chos nyid kyi tshul khrims thob pa'i phyir lnga pa'o //
translated: It is the fifth because it is the morality of the Dharma element, since it is the morality of the Dharma element that is attained.

original: rnam pa re re la yang tshul khrims rnam pa gsum gsum du bsdus pa ni de thams cad ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
analyzed: rnam pa re re la yang tshul khrims rnam pa gsum gsum du bsdus pa ni de thams cad ni sdom pa'i tshul khrims dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan to //
translated: Each of the three moralities is included in each of the three moralities, as is shown by the passage beginning with “All of them are included in the morality of restraint.🔽” Why are the three moralities of the bodhisattvas neither less nor more?

original: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims rnam pa gsum las mi nyung mi mang zhes rgol pa'i lan gyi sgo nas tshul khrims rnam pa gsum du gzhag par bstan pa'i phyir gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ci'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi tshul khrims rnam pa gsum las mi nyung mi mang zhes rgol pa'i lan gyi sgo nas tshul khrims rnam pa gsum du gzhag par bstan pa'i phyir gsum zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The three moralities are established as three in response to the question.

original: sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyis ni sems gnas pa ste /
analyzed: sdom pa'i tshul khrims kyis ni sems gnas pa ste /
translated: By the morality of restraint, the mind is stabilized,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos kyi bde ba la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'i chos kyi bde ba la gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one abides in the bliss of the Dharma, which is free from defilement.

original: lus dang sems kyi mngon par 'dus bya ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi mngon par 'dus bya ba yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same applies to the activity of body and mind.

original: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis ni sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa'i sgo nas bdag la phan pa sgrub pa'o //🔽sems @179a * //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos sdud pa'i tshul khrims kyis ni sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin pa'i sgo nas bdag la phan pa sgrub pa'o // sems @179a * //
translated: By the morality of amassing the wholesome, one benefits oneself by maturing the qualities of a Buddha.

original: can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims kyi sgo ste sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i sgo nas ni gzhan la phan bsgrub po //
analyzed: can gyi don bya ba'i tshul khrims kyi sgo ste sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'i sgo nas ni gzhan la phan bsgrub po //
translated: By the morality of working for the benefit of sentient beings, one benefits others by maturing sentient beings.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba ni 'di dag tu zad do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba ni 'di dag tu zad do //
translated: These are the activities of the bodhisattva.

original: 'di lta ste bdag nyid snod du gyur par bya ba dang / gnyi ga la phan pa sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta ste bdag nyid snod du gyur par bya ba dang / gnyi ga la phan pa sgrub pa'o //
translated: They are: making oneself a vessel and accomplishing the benefit of both.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi le'u ste bcu pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i tshul khrims kyi le'u ste bcu pa'i rgya cher 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the tenth chapter, having the morality of the bodhisattva as its content, is finished.

original: // / pha rol tu phyin pa drug car yang rnam pa dgu nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya'o zhes bya bas kun la yang sdom gyi tshig gcig nyid kyis bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: // / pha rol tu phyin pa drug car yang rnam pa dgu nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya'o zhes bya bas kun la yang sdom gyi tshig gcig nyid kyis bstan pa yin no //
translated: The six perfections should be arranged in nine aspects. This is the summary verse.

original: rnam pa bzhir bzod pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bzhir bzod pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The nature of patience should be arranged in four aspects.

original: rten gyi khyad par nyid dang / gzhi'i khyad par nyid dang / dmigs pa'i khyad par nyid dang / rgyu'i khyad par nyid do //
analyzed: rten gyi khyad par nyid dang / gzhi'i khyad par nyid dang / dmigs pa'i khyad par nyid dang / rgyu'i khyad par nyid do //
translated: The distinctive features of the basis, the distinctive feature of the objective, and the distinctive feature of the cause.

original: de la rten ni mos pas spyod pa'i gnas skabs kyi ni so sor rtog pa'i stobs yin te /
analyzed: de la rten ni mos pas spyod pa'i gnas skabs kyi ni so sor rtog pa'i stobs yin te /
translated: The basis is the power of discernment in the state of the stage of action out of faith.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: For it is said:

original: so sor brtags pa'i stobs la brten //🔽zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: so sor brtags pa'i stobs la brten // zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Relying on the power of discernment.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: The power is called power because it is not overcome by its resistant tendency.

original: sa la zhugs pa rnams kyi ni bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis te /
analyzed: sa la zhugs pa rnams kyi ni bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis te /
translated: The basis is the power of cultivation for those who have entered the stages.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: For it is said:

original: rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Naturally.

original: sa la zhugs pa rnams kyis bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis rab tu rtogs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i bzod pa la rab tu zhugs pas zhes bya bas rang bzhin gyis bzod pa'o //
analyzed: sa la zhugs pa rnams kyis bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis rab tu rtogs pas 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa'i bzod pa la rab tu zhugs pas zhes bya bas rang bzhin gyis bzod pa'o //
translated: The power is called natural because those who have entered the stages have attained the tolerance of the noncreation of things, having realized the two kinds of nonself and having entered the tolerance of the complete purity of the three sectors.

original: gzhi ni gnod pa byed pa'i sems can thams cad de /
analyzed: gzhi ni gnod pa byed pa'i sems can thams cad de /
translated: The objective is all sentient beings who do harm.

original: de dag dbye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag dbye ba med pa'o //
translated: They are not differentiated.

original: des na smras pa /🔽ji mi snyam pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: des na smras pa / ji mi snyam pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽“He is indifferent to all.”

original: dmigs pa ni gnod pa byas pa thams cad la dbye ba med pa'o //🔽gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: dmigs pa ni gnod pa byas pa thams cad la dbye ba med pa'o // gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: The objective reference is all the injuries, without differentiation.🔽For what reason is he indifferent?

original: thams cad la ji mi snyam pa ste zhes bya ba la /🔽rnam pa gnyis kyis ji mi snyam pas nus pa dang ldan yang rung /
analyzed: thams cad la ji mi snyam pa ste zhes bya ba la / rnam pa gnyis kyis ji mi snyam pas nus pa dang ldan yang rung /
translated: It is said: “To all.”

original: nus pa dang mi ldan yang rung /
analyzed: nus pa dang mi ldan yang rung /
translated: By means of two kinds of indifference, he is indifferent to all, whether they are able to injure or unable to injure.

original: go rims bzhin du lan du gnod pa mi byed pa dang / sems mi khro ba'o /
analyzed: go rims bzhin du lan du gnod pa mi byed pa dang / sems mi khro ba'o /
translated: In due order, he does not injure in return and his mind does not become angry.

original: zang zing med pa'i sems ni mthong ba'i chos la lan du phan 'dogs pa la re ba med pa'i phyir dang / phyi ma la yang 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa'i 'gro ba la mngon par 'dod pa dang / bag tsha ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zang zing med pa'i sems ni mthong ba'i chos la lan du phan 'dogs pa la re ba med pa'i phyir dang / phyi ma la yang 'dod pa dang / mi 'dod pa'i 'gro ba la mngon par 'dod pa dang / bag tsha ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mind without material possessions is without hope for a return of the favor in this life, and in the future life, it is without desire for a desirable migratory state and without fear of an undesirable migratory state.

original: rgyu'i khyad par nyid ni gang gi phyir smras pa snying rje 'ba' zhig gis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par nyid ni gang gi phyir smras pa snying rje 'ba' zhig gis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The special cause is stated: “Only through compassion.”

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang bzod pa'i @179b ngo bo rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang bzod pa'i @179b ngo bo rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: There is another way of classifying patience.

original: gnyen po'i khyad par dang so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang / bsgoms pa'i stobs dang / rgyu'i khyad par te /
analyzed: gnyen po'i khyad par dang so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang / bsgoms pa'i stobs dang / rgyu'i khyad par te /
translated: The specific antidote, the power of discernment, the power of cultivation, and the specific cause.

original: gnod pa byed pa'i sems can dang / byas pa'i gnod pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa'i sems can dang / byas pa'i gnod pa'o //
translated: The specific object is the sentient beings who harm you and the harm they do.

original: rgyu'i khyad par ni zang zing med pa'i sems dang / snying rje 'ba' zhig pa'o//
analyzed: rgyu'i khyad par ni zang zing med pa'i sems dang / snying rje 'ba' zhig pa'o//
translated: The specific cause is the mind that is free of material things and the compassion that is its sole concern.🔽All patience is summarized as two types:🔽patience that is a virtue and patience that is a gateway to freedom.

original: bzod pa thams cad mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: bzod pa thams cad mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su gzhag par bya ste /
translated: Patience that is a virtue is of two types:

original: phyogs nyid dang / dbye ba nyid do //
analyzed: phyogs nyid dang / dbye ba nyid do //
translated: patience that is a virtue in its own nature and patience that is a virtue by its association.🔽Patience that is a virtue in its own nature is of two types:🔽patience that is a virtue in its own nature in the sense of being a virtue in its own right and patience that is a virtue in its own nature in the sense of being a gateway to freedom.🔽Patience that is a virtue in its own right is of two types:🔽patience that is a virtue in its own right in the sense of being a virtue in its own right and patience that is a virtue in its own right in the sense of being a gateway to freedom.🔽Patience that is a virtue in its own right in the sense of being a virtue in its own right is of two types:🔽patience that is a virtue in its own right in the sense of being a virtue in its own right in relation to the human condition and patience that is a virtue in its own right in the sense of being a virtue in its own right in relation to the divine condition.

original: mi'i 'gro ba nyid la bzod pa'o //🔽mi bzod pa mang du 'byung bar 'gyur zhing de nyid la mnar sems kyi dngos po 'byung bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: mi'i 'gro ba nyid la bzod pa'o // mi bzod pa mang du 'byung bar 'gyur zhing de nyid la mnar sems kyi dngos po 'byung bar 'gyur la /
translated: Patience that is a virtue in its own right in the sense of being a virtue in its own right in relation to the human condition is of two types:

original: mnar sems kyi dngos po rnams spong bar byed pa'i gnyen po kun du spyod par byed pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: mnar sems kyi dngos po rnams spong bar byed pa'i gnyen po kun du spyod par byed pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: patience that is a virtue in its own right in the sense of being a virtue in its own right in relation to the human condition in the desire realm and patience that is a virtue in its own right in the sense of being a virtue in its own right in relation to the human condition in the form and formless realms.🔽Patience that is a virtue in its own right in the sense of being a virtue in its own right in relation to the human condition in the desire realm is of two types:🔽patience that is a virtue in its own right in the sense of being a virtue in its own right in relation to the human condition in the desire realm that is difficult to carry out and patience that is a virtue in its own right in the sense of being a virtue in its own right in relation to the human

original: khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la brtan pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khyim pa'i phyogs la brten pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs la brtan pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is based on the side of the householder and based on the side of the renunciate.

original: 'di'i phyir yang /
analyzed: 'di'i phyir yang /
translated: For this reason,

original: de ltar bskyed pa'i bzod pa de ni bsngags par 'os pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de ltar bskyed pa'i bzod pa de ni bsngags par 'os pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: it is said that the patience thus generated is worthy of praise.

original: khyim pa rnams las kyang longs spyod kyi 'byor pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis lan du gnod pa bya bar nus la /
analyzed: khyim pa rnams las kyang longs spyod kyi 'byor pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis lan du gnod pa bya bar nus la /
translated: Even householders who possess the wealth of resources are able to retaliate with harm.

original: rab tu byung ba rnams kyang sems kyi 'byor ba dang ldan pas lan du gnod pa byed nus so //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba rnams kyang sems kyi 'byor ba dang ldan pas lan du gnod pa byed nus so //
translated: Even renunciates who possess the wealth of mind are able to retaliate with harm.

original: de ltar byed nus na yang lus la sogs pas bzod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar byed nus na yang lus la sogs pas bzod par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Even if they are able to do so, one should be patient with body, etc.

original: khyim par gyur kyang rung /
analyzed: khyim par gyur kyang rung /
translated: Whether one is a householder

original: rab tu byung bas kyang rung bzod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rab tu byung bas kyang rung bzod par bya'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: or a renunciate, one should be patient. This is the meaning.

original: dbye ba nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dbye ba nyid ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The classification is threefold:

original: ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa ni gnod pa byed par yid la mi byed pa dang / mnar sems kyi gnyen po yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji mi snyam pa'i bzod pa ni gnod pa byed par yid la mi byed pa dang / mnar sems kyi gnyen po yid la byed pa'o //
translated: The forbearance of not taking to mind is the antidote to the anger of taking to mind the harm done by others.

original: de dag ni zhe sdang med pa dang / khong khro ba med pa'i rang bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni zhe sdang med pa dang / khong khro ba med pa'i rang bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: These two should be understood as having the nature of non-hatred and non-aversion.

original: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa ni lus kyi brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i stobs la brten nas skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa'i sdug bsngal ba rnags par nus pa nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa ni lus kyi brtson 'grus kyi stobs dang / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa'i stobs la brten nas skyes pa dang / ma skyes pa'i sdug bsngal ba rnags par nus pa nyid do //
translated: The forbearance of accepting suffering is the ability to endure the suffering that has arisen and that has not yet arisen, based on the power of physical effort and the power of proper mental attention.

original: chos la so sor rtog pa'i bzod pa ni chos rnams kyi phyin ci ma log pa nyid chen por bzod pa ste /
analyzed: chos la so sor rtog pa'i bzod pa ni chos rnams kyi phyin ci ma log pa nyid chen por bzod pa ste /
translated: The forbearance of discernment of dharmas is the great forbearance of the non-erroneous nature of dharmas.

original: yang de ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: yang de ni shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: Moreover, it has the nature of wisdom.

original: bzod pa dang / 'dod pa dang / shes rab ces bya ba 'di ni rnam grangs so //
analyzed: bzod pa dang / 'dod pa dang / shes rab ces bya ba 'di ni rnam grangs so //
translated: Forbearance, desire, and wisdom are synonyms.

original: de ltar na rdzas su ni ngo bo gnyis bzod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na rdzas su ni ngo bo gnyis bzod par rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, in substance, forbearance should be understood as having two natures.

original: zhe sdang med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: zhe sdang med pa'i ngo bo nyid dang / shes rab kyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: the nature of non-hatred, and the nature of wisdom.

original: @180a * // ji ltar na gzhan gnod par byed pa la ji mi snyam par bzod par byed ce na zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: @180a * // ji ltar na gzhan gnod par byed pa la ji mi snyam par bzod par byed ce na zhes bya ba ni /
translated: How does one practice patience when others do harm?

original: so sor rtog pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan te so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis yin gyi /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i rab tu dbye ba bstan te so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis yin gyi /
translated: This shows the classification of discernment. It is by the power of discernment,

original: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis ni ma yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: not by the power of meditation.

original: ji mi snyam par zhes bya ba ni lan du gnod par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji mi snyam par zhes bya ba ni lan du gnod par byed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One does not mind because one does not retaliate.

original: bzod par byed ces bya ba ni sems rab tu mi 'khrugs pa nyid do //
analyzed: bzod par byed ces bya ba ni sems rab tu mi 'khrugs pa nyid do //
translated: One practices patience because one's mind is not disturbed.

original: yang na tshig gzhan gyis bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na tshig gzhan gyis bshad pa yin no //
translated: Or, this is explained in other words.

original: drag pa ni brnags par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: drag pa ni brnags par mi nus pa'o //
translated: It is intense because it is not easily overcome.

original: rgyun mi 'chad pa ni par mtshams med pa'o //
analyzed: rgyun mi 'chad pa ni par mtshams med pa'o //
translated: It is continuous because it is uninterrupted.

original: sna tshogs pa ni sgo sna tshogs nas 'byung ba'o //
analyzed: sna tshogs pa ni sgo sna tshogs nas 'byung ba'o //
translated: It is varied because it arises in various ways.

original: yun ring ba ni dus yun ring po dag tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yun ring ba ni dus yun ring po dag tu 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is long-lasting because it lasts for a long time.

original: 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste zhes bya ba ni brtag pa bzhis brtags la bzod par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang dag par slob ste zhes bya ba ni brtag pa bzhis brtags la bzod par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Thus, one should train in reality means that one should investigate with the four investigations and develop patience.

original: rnam grangs dang po bstan pa'i phyir brtag pa bzhi ni bdag nyid kyi sngon gyi las kyi dbang gis 'byung bar brtag pa ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs dang po bstan pa'i phyir brtag pa bzhi ni bdag nyid kyi sngon gyi las kyi dbang gis 'byung bar brtag pa ste /
translated: For the sake of teaching the first category, the four investigations are: the investigation of the power of one's own past karma,🔽the investigation of the power of the present condition, the investigation of the power of the present karma, and the investigation of the power of the present karma and the power of the present condition.🔽The investigation of the power of one's own past karma is as follows:🔽This body of mine, which is material form derived from the four great elements and possesses resistance, has come into being due to the power of my own past karma.

original: bdag gi lus 'byung ba bzhi las gyur pa'i gzugs thogs pa dang bcas pa 'di lta bu gang la bdag gnas na mi 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi reg pa myong zhing /
analyzed: bdag gi lus 'byung ba bzhi las gyur pa'i gzugs thogs pa dang bcas pa 'di lta bu gang la bdag gnas na mi 'dod pa'i sdug bsngal gyi reg pa myong zhing /
translated: Since I am dwelling in this body, I experience painful contact that is not desired and hear words that are not desired.

original: mi 'dod pa tshig gi lam yang thos par 'gyur gyi zhes rang gi las kyi dbang kho nas 'di ltar gyur to zhes lta zhing /
analyzed: mi 'dod pa tshig gi lam yang thos par 'gyur gyi zhes rang gi las kyi dbang kho nas 'di ltar gyur to zhes lta zhing /
translated: One should view this as having come about due to the power of one's own karma alone and not give rise to a mind that is spiteful toward others

original: gzhan dag la mnar sems sam /🔽lan du gnod pa bya ba'i sems bskyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag la mnar sems sam /🔽lan du gnod pa bya ba'i sems bskyed par mi byed do //
translated: or that wishes to harm them in return.🔽The investigation of the power of the present condition is as follows: This body of mine, which is material form derived from the four great elements and possesses resistance, has come into being due to the power of the present condition.

original: yang na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba 'di lta bu nyams su myong ba na bdag gis mi dge ba'i las byas pa'i rnam par smin pa kho na yin no zhes yid la bsams nas snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: yang na sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba 'di lta bu nyams su myong ba na bdag gis mi dge ba'i las byas pa'i rnam par smin pa kho na yin no zhes yid la bsams nas snga ma bzhin no //
translated: Or else, when he experiences a feeling of pain like this, he thinks: “It is only the ripening of my own unwholesome action.”🔽The second investigation: “Impatience is the cause of suffering in my own continuum in the future.”

original: brtag pa gnyis pa ni mi bzod pa ni phyi ma la rang gi rgyud kyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa nyid du so sor brtags nas sdug bsngal ni mi 'dod la /
analyzed: brtag pa gnyis pa ni mi bzod pa ni phyi ma la rang gi rgyud kyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa nyid du so sor brtags nas sdug bsngal ni mi 'dod la /
translated: He investigates this and thinks: “I do not want suffering,🔽but I want happiness.”

original: bde ba ni 'dod pa nyid yin pas bzod par byed de //
analyzed: bde ba ni 'dod pa nyid yin pas bzod par byed de //
translated: Therefore, he practices patience.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: bdag ni sdug bsngal mi 'dod de //
analyzed: bdag ni sdug bsngal mi 'dod de //
translated: I do not want suffering,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: bdag dang gzhan dag rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal pa'i gnas skabs la so sor brtag pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dag rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal pa'i gnas skabs la so sor brtag pa nyid du'o //
translated: He investigates the situation of himself and others who are naturally in a state of suffering.

original: gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: gang yang smras pa /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: ngo bo nyid kyis kyang sdug bsngal ba'i rang bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal bar gyur ba'i sems can rnams la mi shes pa'i sems can gzhan @180b dag ni sdug bsngal skyed par 'dod kyi /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis kyang sdug bsngal ba'i rang bzhin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal bar gyur ba'i sems can rnams la mi shes pa'i sems can gzhan @180b dag ni sdug bsngal skyed par 'dod kyi /
translated: Sentient beings are miserable by their very nature, and other sentient beings who do not know this want to cause them more suffering.

original: bdag gis 'di ni shes bzhin du de dag la ji ltar sdug bsngal skyed par byed par rigs te /
analyzed: bdag gis 'di ni shes bzhin du de dag la ji ltar sdug bsngal skyed par byed par rigs te /
translated: But how can I, who know this, cause them more suffering?🔽It is like pouring salt on a wound.

original: rma'i nang du tsha ldugs pa dang 'dra'o snyam du brtags nas snga ma bzhin du bzod par byed do //
analyzed: rma'i nang du tsha ldugs pa dang 'dra'o snyam du brtags nas snga ma bzhin du bzod par byed do //
translated: Having reflected in this way, one should cultivate patience as before.

original: bzhi pa ni bdag nyid kyi sgrub pa'i gnas skabs la brtags nas gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni bdag nyid kyi sgrub pa'i gnas skabs la brtags nas gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bsal ba'i phyir zhugs pa yin no //
translated: The fourth reflection is on the occasion of one’s own practice, when one has undertaken to remove the suffering of others.🔽It is not at all becoming for me to harm them.

original: bdag nyid kyis de dag la gnod pa byed pa ni shin du mdzes pa ma yin no zhes brtags nas snga ma bzhin du bzod par byed do //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis de dag la gnod pa byed pa ni shin du mdzes pa ma yin no zhes brtags nas snga ma bzhin du bzod par byed do //
translated: Having reflected in this way, one should cultivate patience as before.

original: rnam grangs gnyis pa ni brten nas so sor brtags pa'i dbye ba nges par ston pa ste /
analyzed: rnam grangs gnyis pa ni brten nas so sor brtags pa'i dbye ba nges par ston pa ste /
translated: The second alternative is the teaching of the ascertainment of the classification of the individual through dependence.

original: 'du shes rnam pa lnga bsgom zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar bstan pa'i thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'grel par byed do //
analyzed: 'du shes rnam pa lnga bsgom zhing zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni sngar bstan pa'i thams cad kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'grel par byed do //
translated: The phrase “cultivating the five kinds of perception” and so on is a commentary on the phrase “all that has been taught previously” and so on.

original: 'di dag gis ni rgyu'i khyad par khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni rgyu'i khyad par khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Through these, one should understand the special cause.

original: byang chub sems dpa' las gzhan dag ni shes pa rnams mi mthun pa byed pa la bzod par zad do//
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' las gzhan dag ni shes pa rnams mi mthun pa byed pa la bzod par zad do//
translated: Those who are other than bodhisattvas are only able to tolerate the cognition of those who are hostile.

original: dgra'i phyogs kyang ma yin pa'i bar ma rnams la ni btang snyoms su byed do //
analyzed: dgra'i phyogs kyang ma yin pa'i bar ma rnams la ni btang snyoms su byed do //
translated: They are indifferent to those who are neutral, not even on the side of the enemy.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni snying rje ba'i dbang gis de lta bu'i rang bzhin can no //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni snying rje ba'i dbang gis de lta bu'i rang bzhin can no //
translated: Moreover, bodhisattvas are of that nature through the power of compassion.

original: gzhan dag ni dman pa rnams la nga rgyal dang / mtshungs pa rnams la 'gran pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa rnams la phrag dog byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag ni dman pa rnams la nga rgyal dang / mtshungs pa rnams la 'gran pa dang / khyad par du 'phags pa rnams la phrag dog byed do //
translated: Others are proud toward those who are inferior, competitive with those who are equal, and jealous of those who are superior.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni snying rje'i dbang gis de lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni snying rje'i dbang gis de lta bu ma yin no //
translated: But the bodhisattvas are not like that, because of their compassion.

original: yang gzhan dag ni skyid pa rnams la ni gnod pa byed par nus kyang 'dod pa'i dbang gis ster du re ba'i blos bzod par byed do //
analyzed: yang gzhan dag ni skyid pa rnams la ni gnod pa byed par nus kyang 'dod pa'i dbang gis ster du re ba'i blos bzod par byed do //
translated: Moreover, others endure harm out of desire for happiness, with a mind that hopes for a return favor.

original: sdug pa rnams la ni phyi ma'i rnam par smin pa 'dod pa'i dbang gis so //
analyzed: sdug pa rnams la ni phyi ma'i rnam par smin pa 'dod pa'i dbang gis so //
translated: They endure the loss of the loved ones out of desire for the future evolutionary development.

original: yon tan dang ldan pa dang / skyon dang ldan pa rnams la ni 'di nyid la mi 'dod pa'i bya ba 'byung du dogs pas bzod par byed do //
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa dang / skyon dang ldan pa rnams la ni 'di nyid la mi 'dod pa'i bya ba 'byung du dogs pas bzod par byed do //
translated: They endure the loved ones out of fear that they will do something undesirable in this life.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni snying rje kho nas so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni snying rje kho nas so //
translated: But the bodhisattvas endure everything out of compassion alone.

original: gnod pa thams cad bzod par byed do zhes bya ba ni mi khro ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnod pa thams cad bzod par byed do zhes bya ba ni mi khro ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They endure all harms, because they are engaged in nonanger, etc.

original: 'du shes lnga ni tha snyad dang / dam pa'i don dag gi mtshan nyid de /
analyzed: 'du shes lnga ni tha snyad dang / dam pa'i don dag gi mtshan nyid de /
translated: The five perceptions are the characteristics of the conventional and ultimate.

original: tha snyad dang dam pa'i don du nye par mtshon pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag pa ni dang po dang tha ma dang / bar ma'i tshig la go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: tha snyad dang dam pa'i don du nye par mtshon pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag pa ni dang po dang tha ma dang / bar ma'i tshig la go rims bzhin no //
translated: The first and last are established in terms of the conventional and the ultimate, respectively, while the middle one is in terms of the words of the verse.

original: gnod pa byed pa rnams la @181a * //
analyzed: gnod pa byed pa rnams la @181a * //
translated: With regard to those who harm you,

original: 'das pa'i dus nye bar bzung nas ji ltar 'os shing gsha' bar gnyen bshes kyi 'du shes yid la byed pas khro ba'i sems skyes pa rnams bsal nas snying rje kho nas bzod par byed do zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'das pa'i dus nye bar bzung nas ji ltar 'os shing gsha' bar gnyen bshes kyi 'du shes yid la byed pas khro ba'i sems skyes pa rnams bsal nas snying rje kho nas bzod par byed do zhes bya ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: you should clear away any anger that has arisen by bringing to mind the idea that they are your friends and relatives, as appropriate.

original: thog ma med pa'i dus nas sems can gyi gnas skabs la yang nges pa med pas rnyed par dka'o zhes smras pa /
analyzed: thog ma med pa'i dus nas sems can gyi gnas skabs la yang nges pa med pas rnyed par dka'o zhes smras pa /
translated: With regard to the difficulty of finding beings, it is said that it is difficult to find beings because there is no certainty about their condition as sentient beings from beginningless time.

original: sems can gang bdag gi pha ma la sogs par ma gyur pa ni rnyed par dka'o zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gang bdag gi pha ma la sogs par ma gyur pa ni rnyed par dka'o zhes bya bar bsams pa'o //
translated: The meaning is that it is difficult to find beings who have not been your father, mother, and so on.

original: gnas skabs dang rjes su mthun par 'du shes yid la bya ba'i bye brag ni gang gi phyir gnod pa byed pa'i sems can bud med yin la rgan par gyur na ni ma'i 'du shes yid la bya'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs dang rjes su mthun par 'du shes yid la bya ba'i bye brag ni gang gi phyir gnod pa byed pa'i sems can bud med yin la rgan par gyur na ni ma'i 'du shes yid la bya'o //
translated: The specific mental attentions to the perception of what is suitable to the occasion are as follows: When a woman is the one who harms you, you should attend to the perception of her as your mother if she is old.

original: 'on te skyes pa yin la rgan na ni pha'i 'du shes yid la bya'o //🔽na tshod mnyam pa'i skyes pa la ni spun zla'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: 'on te skyes pa yin la rgan na ni pha'i 'du shes yid la bya'o // na tshod mnyam pa'i skyes pa la ni spun zla'i 'du shes so //
translated: If a man is the one who harms you, you should attend to the perception of him as your father if he is old.🔽If a man of the same age harms you, you should attend to the perception of him as your brother.

original: bud med la ni sring mo'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: bud med la ni sring mo'i 'du shes so //
translated: If a woman of the same age harms you, you should attend to the perception of her as your sister.

original: de lta bu ni khyim pa'i phyogs kyi 'du shes yid la bya ba'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni khyim pa'i phyogs kyi 'du shes yid la bya ba'o //
translated: This is the mental attention to the perception of what is suitable to the occasion in the case of householders.

original: gal te rab tu byung ba gnod par byed par gyur na ni slob dpon la sogs pa'i 'du shes ji ltar rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gal te rab tu byung ba gnod par byed par gyur na ni slob dpon la sogs pa'i 'du shes ji ltar rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: If an ordained person harms you, you should attend to the perception of him as your preceptor and so on, as is appropriate.

original: chos tsam du rjes su 'brang ba'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni bdag med par mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chos tsam du rjes su 'brang ba'i 'du shes zhes bya ba ni bdag med par mthong ba'i rjes su 'brang ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The mental attention to the perception of the mere phenomenon means the perception that follows from seeing selflessness.

original: rkyen la rag las pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: rkyen la rag las pa dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The mental attention to the perception of dependence on conditions means that you should attend to the perception of the fact that the harm is caused by the coming together of many conditions.

original: srid pa brag ca lta bur yid la byed pa dang / gzugs brnyan lta bur yid la byed pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa brag ca lta bur yid la byed pa dang / gzugs brnyan lta bur yid la byed pa'o //
translated: He attends to existence as like an echo, and as like a reflection.

original: 'du byed tsam dang zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'du byed tsam dang zhes bya ba ni /
translated: He attends to mere conditioning.

original: bdag dang gzhan dag sems can med par yid la byed pa'o //🔽bdag nyid bdag med pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dag sems can med par yid la byed pa'o // bdag nyid bdag med pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: He attends to self and others as devoid of sentient beings.🔽He attends to the self as selfless.

original: gshe bar byed pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gshe bar byed pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: He says, “Those who scold me or act against me,

original: 'du shes skad cig gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas 'jug pas na /
analyzed: 'du shes skad cig gcig nas gcig tu brgyud pas 'jug pas na /
translated: because their perceptions pass from one moment to the next,

original: gang dag sdug bsngal skyed par byed cing bde ba 'gag par byed pa de dag ni zang cing 'gags la bral zhing yongs su gyur to //
analyzed: gang dag sdug bsngal skyed par byed cing bde ba 'gag par byed pa de dag ni zang cing 'gags la bral zhing yongs su gyur to //
translated: those who cause suffering and block happiness have ceased, departed, changed, and are gone.

original: da ltar byung ba ni gzhan dag ste /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba ni gzhan dag ste /
translated: The present ones are different.
