original: gnod pa mi byed pa de dag la bdag gnod pa byed pa ni bdag gi tshul dang mthun pa ma yin no zhes mi rtag ba nyid yid la byed pas gnas so zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin no //
analyzed: gnod pa mi byed pa de dag la bdag gnod pa byed pa ni bdag gi tshul dang mthun pa ma yin no zhes mi rtag ba nyid yid la byed pas gnas so zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin no //
translated: It is not right for me to harm those who do not harm me.” He remains in this way by attending to impermanence. This is the nature.

original: sems can thams cad ni don dam par na sdug bsngal du bying ba yin gyi /
analyzed: sems can thams cad ni don dam par na sdug bsngal du bying ba yin gyi /
translated: All sentient beings are, in the ultimate sense, immersed in suffering.

original: sems can gang yang gcig tu bde ba ni 'ga' yang med do //
analyzed: sems can gang yang gcig tu bde ba ni 'ga' yang med do //
translated: There is not a single sentient being who is happy.

original: @181b de lta bur rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal bar gyur pa'i sems can rnams la snying rje bskyed la bdag gis sdug bsngal bsal ba la 'bad par 'os pa yin gyi /
analyzed: @181b de lta bur rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal bar gyur pa'i sems can rnams la snying rje bskyed la bdag gis sdug bsngal bsal ba la 'bad par 'os pa yin gyi /
translated: Thus, one should generate compassion for those sentient beings who are suffering by nature, and one should think, “It is fitting for me to strive to remove their suffering.🔽It is not fitting for me to generate suffering for them.”

original: sdug bsngal bskyed par 'os pa ni ma yin no zhes yid la byed cing snga ma bzhin du bzod par byed do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bskyed par 'os pa ni ma yin no zhes yid la byed cing snga ma bzhin du bzod par byed do //
translated: One should practice patience as before.

original: bdag gis byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i smon lam btab pa'i rjes thogs la sems can thams cad chung ma'i tshul du yongs su bzung nas /
analyzed: bdag gis byang chub tu sems bskyed pa'i smon lam btab pa'i rjes thogs la sems can thams cad chung ma'i tshul du yongs su bzung nas /
translated: Immediately after one has made the aspiration prayer to generate the mind of awakening, one should take all sentient beings as one’s wives.

original: sdug bsngal las yongs su bskyab par 'dod pa'i sbyor bas /
analyzed: sdug bsngal las yongs su bskyab par 'dod pa'i sbyor bas /
translated: With the practice of desiring to protect them from suffering,

original: de ltar mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa la mgron du bos nas bdag nyid kyis 'jigs pa skyed par byed pa ni /
analyzed: de ltar mi 'jigs pa'i sbyin pa la mgron du bos nas bdag nyid kyis 'jigs pa skyed par byed pa ni /
translated: one should invite them to the giving of fearlessness.

original: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin no zhes yid la byed cing snga ma bzhin du bzod par byed de /
analyzed: tshul dang mthun pa ma yin no zhes yid la byed cing snga ma bzhin du bzod par byed de /
translated: He thinks: “This is not proper,” and he forgives as before.

original: de la bzod pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni bzod pa rnam pa gsum gyi bye brag las 'jug pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par bstan par 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: de la bzod pa gang zhe na zhes bya ba ni bzod pa rnam pa gsum gyi bye brag las 'jug pa'i rnam pa'i khyad par bstan par 'dod pa'o //
translated: What is forgiveness? He wishes to show the difference in the mode of activity of the three kinds of forgiveness.

original: bzod pa dang po'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: bzod pa dang po'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With reference to the first kind of forgiveness, he says:

original: mi 'khrugs pa dang zhes bya ba ni sems so //
analyzed: mi 'khrugs pa dang zhes bya ba ni sems so //
translated: “He is not disturbed” means that his mind is not disturbed.

original: phyir gnod pa mi byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gis so //
analyzed: phyir gnod pa mi byed pa dang zhes bya ba ni lus dang ngag gis so //
translated: “He does not return the injury” means that he does not injure with body or speech.

original: de bzhin du 'dir dge sbyong du byed pa'i chos bzhi yang ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dir dge sbyong du byed pa'i chos bzhi yang ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the four qualities that make one a śramaṇa should be applied here as appropriate.

original: sems la yang mi 'dzin zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pas byas pa'i phyi nas khon du 'dzin pa spong ba'o //
analyzed: sems la yang mi 'dzin zhes bya ba ni gnod pa byed pas byas pa'i phyi nas khon du 'dzin pa spong ba'o //
translated: “He does not hold it in his mind” means that he abandons the resentment that is held in the mind by the one who has been injured.

original: bdag sngon gyis byis pa'i gnas skabs na don med pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar byas so zhes dran par byas nas /
analyzed: bdag sngon gyis byis pa'i gnas skabs na don med pa'i sdug bsngal nyams su myong bar byas so zhes dran par byas nas /
translated: “Remembering that in the past, when he was a child, he experienced meaningless suffering,”

original: de ni sems bskyed nas sdug bsngal dang du len pa na ni don dang bcas pa yin no zhes bsam nas sdug bsngal dang du blang bar bya ba ni gcig tu legs pa yin par ston par byed do //
analyzed: de ni sems bskyed nas sdug bsngal dang du len pa na ni don dang bcas pa yin no zhes bsam nas sdug bsngal dang du blang bar bya ba ni gcig tu legs pa yin par ston par byed do //
translated: It is meaningful when one generates the thought of awakening and then accepts suffering.

original: 'dod pa spyod pa ni 'dod pa tshol pa dang / srung ba dang / longs spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa spyod pa ni 'dod pa tshol pa dang / srung ba dang / longs spyod pa'i dbang du byas nas lus dang ngag gis sbyor ba'o //
translated: The practice of desire is the application of body and speech in the pursuit of desire, the protection of desire, and the enjoyment of desire.

original: rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid can yin na 'dod pa zhes ci'i phyir bya zhe na som nyi bzlog pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid can yin na 'dod pa zhes ci'i phyir bya zhe na som nyi bzlog pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: If it is by nature the essence of suffering, why is it called desire? In order to remove doubt, he says:

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin par tshor bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin par tshor bzhin du zhes bya ba la /
translated: Although it is the cause of suffering, it is felt.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin gyi ngo bo nyid kyi sdug bsngal ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yin gyi ngo bo nyid kyi sdug bsngal ni ma yin no //
translated: It is suffering because it is the cause of suffering, not because it is suffering by its very nature.

original: des na slob dpon ku m'a ra la tas kyang /
analyzed: des na slob dpon ku m'a ra la tas kyang /
translated: Therefore, Kumāralāta also says:

original: sdug bsngal nyid kyi rgyu yi phyir //
analyzed: sdug bsngal nyid kyi rgyu yi phyir //
translated: Because it is the cause of suffering,

original: sdug bsngal mi nyung bas bsgrubs shing//🔽@182a * // sdug bsngal nyid la bder brtags pas //
analyzed: sdug bsngal mi nyung bas bsgrubs shing// @182a * // sdug bsngal nyid la bder brtags pas //
translated: and is achieved through much suffering.🔽Since suffering is imagined to be happiness,

original: sdug bsngal yin par de nyid 'dod //
analyzed: sdug bsngal yin par de nyid 'dod //
translated: it is held to be just suffering.

original: ces bstan pa yin no //🔽nyams su blangs pa ni sdug bsngal 'ong par shes bzhin du nyams su blangs shing brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: ces bstan pa yin no // nyams su blangs pa ni sdug bsngal 'ong par shes bzhin du nyams su blangs shing brtsams pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching.🔽Practice is the practice and undertaking of the experience of suffering.

original: dang du blangs pa ni myong ba'i tshe brnags pa'o //
analyzed: dang du blangs pa ni myong ba'i tshe brnags pa'o //
translated: Acceptance is the patience in the experience of suffering.

original: nyams su myong ba ni de la zhugs par gyur pa'i tshe bzod par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba ni de la zhugs par gyur pa'i tshe bzod par byed pa'o //
translated: Experience is the patience in the practice of suffering.

original: ci'i don du zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i don du zhe na /
translated: For what purpose?

original: de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir mi shes pa'i nyes pas zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir mi shes pa'i nyes pas zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to show the cause of that, he says, “through the fault of ignorance.”

original: de ltar 'dod pa skyon dang ldan pa yin yang mi shes pa'i dbang gis nyes dmigs mthong bar ma gyur to zhes bsams pa'o ;
analyzed: de ltar 'dod pa skyon dang ldan pa yin yang mi shes pa'i dbang gis nyes dmigs mthong bar ma gyur to zhes bsams pa'o ;
translated: Thus, although desire is faulty, it is thought that one does not see its disadvantage through the power of ignorance.

original: / bde bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi bde ba 'byung ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: / bde bsgrub pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan gyi bde ba 'byung ba'i gnas so //
translated: The establishment of happiness is the source of the happiness of self and other.

original: nyams su blang ba ni cha yin no zhes bya ba ni don dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyams su blang ba ni cha yin no zhes bya ba ni don dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The practice is the part that is meaningful.

original: gzhi thams cad las byung ba zhes bya ba ni thams cad las byung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhi thams cad las byung ba zhes bya ba ni thams cad las byung ba'o //
translated: The basis is the source of all, that is, the source of everything.

original: sdug bsngal la brten pa ni rnam pa brgyad du rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la brten pa ni rnam pa brgyad du rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The basis of suffering is to be understood in eight ways:

original: khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba'am /
analyzed: khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba'am /
translated: as the householder and the renunciate,

original: bdag gi don dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: bdag gi don dang ldan pa'am /
translated: as the one who is endowed with the aim of self and

original: gzhan gyi don dang ldan pa ji ltar rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi don dang ldan pa ji ltar rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: as the one who is endowed with the aim of others, as appropriate.

original: lus nye bar brtan par byed pa'i phyir chos gos la sogs pa bzhi ni /🔽'tsho ba'i yo byad de /
analyzed: lus nye bar brtan par byed pa'i phyir chos gos la sogs pa bzhi ni / 'tsho ba'i yo byad de /
translated: The four requisites of robes, etc. are the basis of the body because they stabilize the body.

original: rten ces brjod do //
analyzed: rten ces brjod do //
translated: They are called requisites of life because they are necessary for life.

original: ji skad du 'dul ba las zas kyi nang na bsod snyoms ni rung ba rnyed kyang sla ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du 'dul ba las zas kyi nang na bsod snyoms ni rung ba rnyed kyang sla ba'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgya cher bstan pa yin no //
translated: As it is said in the Vinaya: Of the foods, alms-food is the easiest to obtain and the easiest to use.

original: rab tu byung ba rnams ni chos gos la sogs par ngan nam med na sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba rnams ni chos gos la sogs par ngan nam med na sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: For the renunciate, suffering arises when robes, etc. are of poor quality or non-existent.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: He says:

original: de dag ngan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
analyzed: de dag ngan pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ;
translated: Because of that, they are not distressed, etc.

original: de dag ji ltar rigs par lus dang sems kyi sdug bsngal du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ji ltar rigs par lus dang sems kyi sdug bsngal du shes par bya'o //
translated: They should be understood as physical and mental suffering, as is appropriate.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, he says:

original: mi dga' bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mi dga' bar mi 'gyur zhes bya ba la /
translated: They are not distressed, etc.

original: mi dga' bar mi 'gyur ba ni mngon par dga' zhing mi dga' ba med pa'o //
analyzed: mi dga' bar mi 'gyur ba ni mngon par dga' zhing mi dga' ba med pa'o //
translated: They are not distressed means they are not averse and they are not dispirited.

original: yongs su yi chad par mi 'gyur ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i sems kyi gdung ba med pa'o //🔽gzhi des brtson 'grus kyang gtong bar mi byed ces bya ba ni le lo'i dngos po bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas nyams par mi byed pa'am /
analyzed: yongs su yi chad par mi 'gyur ba ni tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa'i sems kyi gdung ba med pa'o // gzhi des brtson 'grus kyang gtong bar mi byed ces bya ba ni le lo'i dngos po bstan pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas nyams par mi byed pa'am /
translated: They are not dispirited means they are not tormented by the mind that is inattentive.🔽They do not abandon effort on that account means they do not fall away from the state of laziness.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i dngos po'i sgo nas brtsams pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i dngos po'i sgo nas brtsams pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go//
translated: Or, it means they do not abandon the state of effort that has been undertaken.

original: @182b 'jig rten gyi chos ni rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: @182b 'jig rten gyi chos ni rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The mundane entities should be understood as being of two types:

original: rab tu grags pa'i nag po'i phyogs dang / dkar po'i phyogs kyis brgyad las de dag las nag po'i phyogs su gyur pa /
analyzed: rab tu grags pa'i nag po'i phyogs dang / dkar po'i phyogs kyis brgyad las de dag las nag po'i phyogs su gyur pa /
translated: The dark and bright fortnights are well known.

original: 'dir yongs su bzung bas sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dir yongs su bzung bas sdug bsngal gyi dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the dark fortnight is taken as the basis for suffering because it is included in the dark fortnight.

original: mtshan nyid kyis ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyis ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: By nature, it is fivefold:

original: rgas pa dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / 'jig pa dang / zad pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: rgas pa dang / na ba dang / 'chi ba dang / 'jig pa dang / zad pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: aging, sickness, death, destruction, and disappearance.

original: de la 'gal ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas pas dngos po myur du nyams par 'gyur ba ni 'jig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'gal ba'i rkyen nye bar gnas pas dngos po myur du nyams par 'gyur ba ni 'jig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Destruction is the rapid perishing of things due to the presence of opposing conditions.

original: rang nyid dus gzhan na ngang gis med par 'gyur pa ni zad pa zhes bya'o//
analyzed: rang nyid dus gzhan na ngang gis med par 'gyur pa ni zad pa zhes bya'o//
translated: Disappearance is the natural absence of things at another time.

original: yid du 'ong ba'i lang tsho nyams par 'gyur ba ni rga ba'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i lang tsho nyams par 'gyur ba ni rga ba'o //
translated: Aging is the deterioration of attractive youthfulness.

original: 'dod par bya ba'i nad med pa nyams par gyur pa ni nad do //
analyzed: 'dod par bya ba'i nad med pa nyams par gyur pa ni nad do //
translated: Sickness is the deterioration of the absence of disease, which is desirable.

original: yid du 'ong ba'i srog yongs su gtong ba ni 'chi ba'o //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i srog yongs su gtong ba ni 'chi ba'o //
translated: Death is the loss of attractive life.

original: spyod lam ni bzhi ste zhes bya ba la gang gis 'gro bar byed pa la sogs pa dang / gang 'gro bar byed pa de dag gnyi ga spyod lam nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya'o //🔽'gro ba la sogs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems ni skul bar byed pas spyod lam zhes bya ste /
analyzed: spyod lam ni bzhi ste zhes bya ba la gang gis 'gro bar byed pa la sogs pa dang / gang 'gro bar byed pa de dag gnyi ga spyod lam nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya'o // 'gro ba la sogs pa kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems ni skul bar byed pas spyod lam zhes bya ste /
translated: The four postures are standing, walking, sitting, and lying down.

original: 'dis 'byung ba rnams skul zhing 'debs pa dang yul gzhan du phyin par byed pas so //
analyzed: 'dis 'byung ba rnams skul zhing 'debs pa dang yul gzhan du phyin par byed pas so //
translated: The mind that instigates going and so on is called the instigator of the four postures because it instigates the primary elements that are the basis of the four postures and it instigates the four postures.

original: de'i lam ni 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i lam ni 'gro ba la sogs pa'i bya ba ste /
translated: The path of the four postures is the action of going and so on.

original: 'gro ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas de la 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba la sogs pa'i sgo nas de la 'jug pa'o //
translated: The four postures are engaged through the action of going and so on.

original: nyin mo dang mtshan mo dus ring du sems kyi sgrib pa sbyong bar byed pa na spyod lam gcig gis gnas par byed pa ni sdug bsngal skyed par byed pas /
analyzed: nyin mo dang mtshan mo dus ring du sems kyi sgrib pa sbyong bar byed pa na spyod lam gcig gis gnas par byed pa ni sdug bsngal skyed par byed pas /
translated: When one is purifying the mind of obscurations during the day and night for a long time, one should remain in one posture because remaining in one posture generates suffering.

original: de la btang snyoms su yid la byed cing de bsal ba'i thabs kyang mi byed par dge ba'i phyogs la rab tu sbyor ba ni sdug bsngal byung ba dang du len pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de la btang snyoms su yid la byed cing de bsal ba'i thabs kyang mi byed par dge ba'i phyogs la rab tu sbyor ba ni sdug bsngal byung ba dang du len pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He does not make an effort to remove it, but applies himself to virtue. This is called “endurance of the occurrence of suffering.”

original: de bsal ba'i thabs mi byed pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir /🔽dus ma yin par khri'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de bsal ba'i thabs mi byed pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir / dus ma yin par khri'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In order to demonstrate that he does not make an effort to remove it, he says:🔽“He does not get up from his seat, whether it is a high couch or a bench, or from spreading grass or leaves, even if he is being pricked by stumps or thorns.”

original: khri'am khri'u zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang du gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: khri'am khri'u zhes bya ba ni gtsug lag khang du gtogs pa yin no //
translated: A high couch or bench is used in a monastery.

original: rtsva bting ba'am lo ma bting ba ni dgon par gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rtsva bting ba'am lo ma bting ba ni dgon par gtogs pa'o //
translated: Spreading grass or leaves is used in the forest.

original: chos yongs su 'dzin pa rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa bdun te /
analyzed: chos yongs su 'dzin pa rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam pa bdun te /
translated: The classification of the retention of the Dharma is sevenfold:

original: rab tu byung ba ni dman pa dang / 'bring dang / mchog ste /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni dman pa dang / 'bring dang / mchog ste /
translated: Ordination is inferior, middling, and superior.

original: dge slong gi dbang du byas nas dman pa ni zhal ta bya ba'o //🔽de yang rnams pa @183a * //
analyzed: dge slong gi dbang du byas nas dman pa ni zhal ta bya ba'o // de yang rnams pa @183a * //
translated: From the perspective of a monk, the inferior is service.🔽That is twofold:

original: gnyis te / gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gnyis te / gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: For what reason is it said?

original: dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa dang / rim gro bya ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa dang / rim gro bya ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: Worship of the Three Jewels and service to them.

original: ji ltar rigs par lus la sogs pas sangs rgyas la mchod pa nas dge 'dun la mchod pa'i bar du byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par lus la sogs pas sangs rgyas la mchod pa nas dge 'dun la mchod pa'i bar du byed do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Worship of the Buddha, etc. is service to them, by means of body, speech, and mind, as is fitting.

original: bla ma mchod pa ni slob dpon dang / mkhan po la yongs su bsnyen bkur byed pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma mchod pa ni slob dpon dang / mkhan po la yongs su bsnyen bkur byed pa'o //
translated: Worship of the guru is service to the preceptor and master.

original: mdo la sogs pa gzhan gyis bstan pa 'dzin pa ni chos rnams bzung ba'o //
analyzed: mdo la sogs pa gzhan gyis bstan pa 'dzin pa ni chos rnams bzung ba'o //
translated: Retention of the Dharma is the retention of the scriptures, such as the Sutras, etc.

original: bzung ba'i don dang gzhung rnams gzhan dag la ston pa ni rgya cher ston pa'o //
analyzed: bzung ba'i don dang gzhung rnams gzhan dag la ston pa ni rgya cher ston pa'o //
translated: Extensive teaching is the teaching of the meaning and the text to others.

original: de dag nyid tshig gis yang dang yang du zlos pa ni kha ton du bya'o //🔽thos pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas dben par 'jal ba ni sems pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid tshig gis yang dang yang du zlos pa ni kha ton du bya'o // thos pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas dben par 'jal ba ni sems pa'o //
translated: Recitation is the repeated recitation of the scriptures.🔽Reflection is the investigation of the meaning of what one has heard, in solitude.

original: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong goms par byed pa ni sgom pa'o //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang lhag mthong goms par byed pa ni sgom pa'o //
translated: Cultivation is the cultivation of serenity and insight.

original: tshe dang ldan pa dag slong mo pa rnams kyis slong mo'i gnas nyi shu rtsa gnyis la brtag par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i mdo de las gnas dang po bdun bzung nas 'di ltar bstan te /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa dag slong mo pa rnams kyis slong mo'i gnas nyi shu rtsa gnyis la brtag par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i mdo de las gnas dang po bdun bzung nas 'di ltar bstan te /
translated: Venerable ones, the twenty-two fields of begging should be examined by beggars.

original: de dag ni sdug bsngal gyi gnas kyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni sdug bsngal gyi gnas kyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first seven are taught in the Sūtra on Teaching, because they are distinguished by being the basis of suffering.

original: bdag ni khyim pa'i rtags spangs pas gzugs mi sdug pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam pas gzugs mi sdug pa la blangs pa yang khyim pa'i mtshan ma spangs pas mtshon to//🔽khyim pa'i mtshan ma spangs pa'i phyir skra dang kha spu la sogs pa bregs pa'o //
analyzed: bdag ni khyim pa'i rtags spangs pas gzugs mi sdug pa'o zhes bya ba ni rnam pas gzugs mi sdug pa la blangs pa yang khyim pa'i mtshan ma spangs pas mtshon to// khyim pa'i mtshan ma spangs pa'i phyir skra dang kha spu la sogs pa bregs pa'o //
translated: The first is “I have abandoned the marks of a householder, so I am ugly.”

original: bdag gis kha dog ngan pa nyams su blang ngo zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o //🔽gos dras pa dang / gos kha dog ngan pa 'chang ba ni kha dog ngan pa 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gis kha dog ngan pa nyams su blang ngo zhes bya ba ni gnyis pa'o // gos dras pa dang / gos kha dog ngan pa 'chang ba ni kha dog ngan pa 'chang ba'o //
translated: The second is “I will practice having an ugly color.”

original: gos kha dog dmar ser 'chang ba ni gos /
analyzed: gos kha dog dmar ser 'chang ba ni gos /
translated: Wearing torn clothes and wearing ugly-colored clothes is having an ugly color.🔽Wearing clothes that are reddish-yellow is having an ugly color.

original: kha dog na pa 'chang ba'o //
analyzed: kha dog na pa 'chang ba'o //
translated: He is a renunciate who wears the robes of the Dharma.

original: bdag gis tshul gzhan bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gis tshul gzhan bya'o zhes bya ba ni gsum pa ste /
translated: The third is the thought: I will practice in a different way.

original: 'gro ba la sogs pa la 'jig rten pa'i spyod pa dang spyod du yul thams cad las bsdams nas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba la sogs pa la 'jig rten pa'i spyod pa dang spyod du yul thams cad las bsdams nas gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: He lives in solitude, having withdrawn from all worldly activities such as walking about and so on.

original: bdag gzhan la rag las pas 'tsho bar bya'o snyam pa ni bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gzhan la rag las pas 'tsho bar bya'o snyam pa ni bzhi pa ste /
translated: The fourth is the thought: I will live depending on others.

original: las kyi mtha' thams cad yongs su spangs nas gzhan gyis byin pas nye bar 'tsho zhing gzhan dag las rnyed pas srog 'dzin par byed cing dus 'da' bar byed de /
analyzed: las kyi mtha' thams cad yongs su spangs nas gzhan gyis byin pas nye bar 'tsho zhing gzhan dag las rnyed pas srog 'dzin par byed cing dus 'da' bar byed de /
translated: Having abandoned all worldly activities, he lives depending on the gifts of others, and he passes his time subsisting on what he receives from others.

original: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du gzhan dag las bslangs shing 'tsho bar bya ba ste /
analyzed: ji srid 'tsho'i bar du gzhan dag las bslangs shing 'tsho bar bya ba ste /
translated: He lives by begging as long as he lives,

original: lan cig la mang po rnyed du zin kyang bsags @183b nas longs spyad par ma gnang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lan cig la mang po rnyed du zin kyang bsags @183b nas longs spyad par ma gnang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because he is not permitted to hoard what he receives, even if he receives much.

original: mi'i 'dod pa rnams ni 'khrig pa'i 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: mi'i 'dod pa rnams ni 'khrig pa'i 'dod pa'o //
translated: Human desires are sexual desires.

original: de las ldog pa ni 'khrig pa'i chos las ldog pa yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las ldog pa ni 'khrig pa'i chos las ldog pa yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The opposite of that is the vow to abstain from sexual activity.

original: mi'i dga' ba dang / rtsed mo dang / gar la sogs pa mthong na de dag las ldog pa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs pas spangs pa'o //
analyzed: mi'i dga' ba dang / rtsed mo dang / gar la sogs pa mthong na de dag las ldog pa'i sdom pa yang dag par blangs pas spangs pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is the vow to abstain from seeing shows of men and women, dancing, and so on.

original: mdza' bo ni mi phan pa spong du 'jug cing phan pa la yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: mdza' bo ni mi phan pa spong du 'jug cing phan pa la yang dag par sbyor ba'o //
translated: A friend is one who causes you to abandon what is harmful and engages you in what is beneficial.

original: snying du sdug pa ni phongs pa'i dus na yang mi 'dor ba'o //
analyzed: snying du sdug pa ni phongs pa'i dus na yang mi 'dor ba'o //
translated: A dear friend is one who does not abandon you even in times of misfortune.

original: chung po grogs ni byis pa'i dus nas yun ring du 'grogs ba'o //
analyzed: chung po grogs ni byis pa'i dus nas yun ring du 'grogs ba'o //
translated: A childhood friend is one with whom you have been acquainted for a long time.

original: bgad pa ni 'dod chags kyis kun nas bslang ba'i ngag gi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bgad pa ni 'dod chags kyis kun nas bslang ba'i ngag gi sbyor ba'o //
translated: Laughter is the expression of desire that arises from speech.

original: rtse ba ni de bzhin du lus kyi sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rtse ba ni de bzhin du lus kyi sbyor ba'o //
translated: Play is the expression of desire that arises from the body.

original: dga' ba ni de bzhin du yid kyi kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: dga' ba ni de bzhin du yid kyi kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: Joy is the expression of desire that arises from the mind.

original: dga' mgur spyod pa ni phan tshun nyon mongs pas kun nas bslang ba'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod pa ni phan tshun nyon mongs pas kun nas bslang ba'i dga' ba'o //
translated: Sexual intercourse is the mutual expression of desire that arises from the afflictions.

original: de lta bu las ldog par bya ste /
analyzed: de lta bu las ldog par bya ste /
translated: One should turn away from such things.

original: de lta bu'i sdug bsngal ba rnams ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i sdug bsngal ba rnams ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should apply these sufferings in the appropriate manner.

original: lus kyi dub pa ni shin tu brtson 'grus brtsams pas lus ngal ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi dub pa ni shin tu brtson 'grus brtsams pas lus ngal ba'o //
translated: Physical exhaustion is the fatigue of the body due to the practice of excessive striving.

original: sems kyi 'khrugs pa ni dran pa brjed ngas pa dang / sems rnam par nyams pa'o //
analyzed: sems kyi 'khrugs pa ni dran pa brjed ngas pa dang / sems rnam par nyams pa'o //
translated: Mental exhaustion is the forgetfulness and distraction of the mind.

original: rnam par bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar bya ba rnams te /
analyzed: rnam par bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar bya ba rnams te /
translated: It should be understood as being of eleven kinds.🔽The duties of the bodhisattva are to be known as being of eleven kinds.

original: rab tu byung ba rnams kyi ni chos sgrub pa'i yo byad rnams gzung ba'i bya ba'o //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba rnams kyi ni chos sgrub pa'i yo byad rnams gzung ba'i bya ba'o //
translated: The duties of the ordained bodhisattva are to receive the requisites for practicing the Dharma.

original: khyim pa rnams kyi ni yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' nyams su len pa'o //
analyzed: khyim pa rnams kyi ni yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' nyams su len pa'o //
translated: The duties of the lay bodhisattva are to practice right livelihood.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dzud pa kho nar byed kyi zhes bya ba ni nges par byang chub kyi tshogs la yang dag par 'dzud par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la 'dzud pa kho nar byed kyi zhes bya ba ni nges par byang chub kyi tshogs la yang dag par 'dzud par byed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He should only engage in the quest for perfect enlightenment.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams su zin kyang bar du ldog pa yang srid pas zhugs nas kyang ldog par mi byed cing zhes bya ba'o //🔽de la mi dga' ba med pas yid mi dga' ba med pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams su zin kyang bar du ldog pa yang srid pas zhugs nas kyang ldog par mi byed cing zhes bya ba'o // de la mi dga' ba med pas yid mi dga' ba med pa'o //
translated: Even if one has begun to practice, one does not turn back, because it is possible that one might turn back in the middle, even though one has begun to practice.🔽Since one has no displeasure, one has no mental unhappiness.

original: yongs su gdung ba med pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su gdung ba med pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: Since one has no remorse, one is not defiled.

original: yang dag pa'i lam la so sor rtog pa ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lam la so sor rtog pa ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: Correct discernment is thorough analysis.

original: yang dag pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa zhes bya ba ni phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam pa'o //
translated: Correct means non-erroneous.

original: chos ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos ni zag pa dang bcas pa dang zag pa med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Dharmas are those with and without impurity, etc.

original: so sor 'byed pas na rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
analyzed: so sor 'byed pas na rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'o //
translated: Thorough analysis is the discernment of each one.

original: rigs pa dang bcas pa yin na yang phyin ci ma log par rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid tshul bzhin yid la byed @184a * //
analyzed: rigs pa dang bcas pa yin na yang phyin ci ma log par rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid tshul bzhin yid la byed @184a * //
translated: Even if one has a reason, one thoroughly analyzes in the correct manner the general and specific characteristics of non-erroneous mental attention.

original: pa ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
analyzed: pa ni rab tu rnam par 'byed pa ste /
translated: Thorough analysis is the discernment of each one.

original: de la rigs pa rnam pa bzhi la brten nas rnam par 'byed pa ni shin tu brtags pa'o //
analyzed: de la rigs pa rnam pa bzhi la brten nas rnam par 'byed pa ni shin tu brtags pa'o //
translated: It is well investigated when it is investigated on the basis of four kinds of reason.

original: rgyu des mos pa ni shin tu brtags pa'i blos mos pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu des mos pa ni shin tu brtags pa'i blos mos pa'o //
translated: Interest that is due to that cause is the interest of the well investigated mind.

original: nges pa'i dngos po la de kho na bzhin du nges par 'dzin pa ni legs par gnas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nges pa'i dngos po la de kho na bzhin du nges par 'dzin pa ni legs par gnas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Firmly abiding in the object of conviction is called well established,

original: bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi thub pa'i phyir dang / stobs brtan po thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdud dang phas kyi rgol ba thams cad kyis mi thub pa'i phyir dang / stobs brtan po thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it cannot be overcome by any demons or adversaries and because it has attained firm strength.

original: dkon mchog gi yon tan zhes bya bya ba ni dkon mchog gi che ba'i bdag nyid do //
analyzed: dkon mchog gi yon tan zhes bya bya ba ni dkon mchog gi che ba'i bdag nyid do //
translated: The qualities of the Jewels are the greatness of the Jewels.

original: de kho na'i don ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na'i don ni gang zag dang chos la bdag med pa'o //
translated: The meaning of reality is the selflessness of persons and things.

original: mthu chen po ni sngar bstan pa'i rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: mthu chen po ni sngar bstan pa'i rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Great power is the three kinds previously mentioned.

original: gang gnas gsum bo 'di la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni zab mo la mos pa dang / rgya che ba la mos pa zhes bya'o /
analyzed: gang gnas gsum bo 'di la mos pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni zab mo la mos pa dang / rgya che ba la mos pa zhes bya'o /
translated: The bodhisattva who is interested in these three states is said to be interested in the profound and interested in the extensive.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu la mngon par yid ches pa ni mos pa ste /
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu la mngon par yid ches pa ni mos pa ste /
translated: Faith is the conviction that the cause and effect taught in the scriptures really exist.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta bu'o zhes nges pa'i stobs kyis len pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i mtshan nyid ni 'di lta bu'o zhes nges pa'i stobs kyis len pa'o //
translated: It is the acceptance of the characteristics of cause and effect by the power of certainty.

original: bdag gis thob par bya ba'i don 'di ni nges par yod de //
analyzed: bdag gis thob par bya ba'i don 'di ni nges par yod de //
translated: The meaning to be attained by me certainly exists.

original: de thob par bya'o zhes nges par thob pa'o //
analyzed: de thob par bya'o zhes nges par thob pa'o //
translated: It is the attainment of certainty.🔽This is the path that causes its attainment.🔽It is the attainment of certainty.

original: de thob par byed pa'i lam ni 'di yin no zhes nges par thob pa ni de thob pa'i thabs zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de thob par byed pa'i lam ni 'di yin no zhes nges par thob pa ni de thob pa'i thabs zhes bya ste /
translated: The method for attaining it is called the method for attaining it.

original: 'di dag ni mngon par mos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ni mngon par mos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the certainties of faith.

original: shes bya'i spyod yul zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa la 'di ni 'di lta bu yin gyi /
analyzed: shes bya'i spyod yul zhes bya ba ni mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa la 'di ni 'di lta bu yin gyi /
translated: The domain of the knowable refers to the aspects of impermanence, etc.

original: gzhan du ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan du ma yin no zhes nges par gzung ba thob pa'o //
translated: It is the attainment of the certainty that this is just so and not otherwise.

original: bskal pa grangs med pa chen po gcig tu yongs su bsgoms pa nyid kyi phyir mos pas spyod pa'i sa la yun ring du sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bskal pa grangs med pa chen po gcig tu yongs su bsgoms pa nyid kyi phyir mos pas spyod pa'i sa la yun ring du sbyor ba'o //
translated: It is the long cultivation of the stage of faithful practice for one incalculable great eon.

original: sa bcu la legs par zhugs par gyur pa'i rtogs pa'i khyad par thob par gyur pa'i chos bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid can shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa bcu la legs par zhugs par gyur pa'i rtogs pa'i khyad par thob par gyur pa'i chos bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid can shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One attains the gnosis of the extremely pure realitylessness of things, which is the special realization of one who has entered well into the ten stages.

original: bzod pa thams cad du dka' ba'i bzod pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: bzod pa thams cad du dka' ba'i bzod pa la sogs pa rnam par gzhag pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to teach the presentation of the patience of difficulty in all patience, he says:

original: de la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de la brten nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Based on that, etc.

original: de ni rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ni rnam pa gsum du blta bar bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: That should be seen as threefold, etc.

original: dka' ba'i bzod pa yang rnam pa gsum du rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: dka' ba'i bzod pa yang rnam pa gsum du rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The patience of difficulty should be presented as threefold.

original: bzod par bya ba'i khyad par dang / bzod par byed pa'i khyad par dang / gnod pa'i dngos po'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: bzod par bya ba'i khyad par dang / bzod par byed pa'i khyad par dang / gnod pa'i dngos po'i khyad par ro //
translated: The patience of difficulty is threefold: the special object of patience, the special agent of patience, and the special entity of harm.

original: bzod par bya ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: bzod par bya ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With regard to the object of patience, he says:

original: nyam chung ba rnams kyi zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: nyam chung ba rnams kyi zhes bya ba la /
translated: The weak, etc.

original: dman pa de dag ni byams pa'i yul yin @184b zhing ;
analyzed: dman pa de dag ni byams pa'i yul yin @184b zhing ;
translated: Those inferior ones are the objects of love.

original: snying rje'i rten yin pas bzod par bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: snying rje'i rten yin pas bzod par bya ba yin gyi /
translated: It is patience that is difficult to carry out because it is the basis of compassion.

original: gzhan pa'i bya ba med pas bzod pa ni dka' ba'i bzod pa'o //🔽bzod par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: gzhan pa'i bya ba med pas bzod pa ni dka' ba'i bzod pa'o // bzod par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: Patience is patience that is difficult to carry out because it is not the practice of others.

original: bzod par byed pa ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bzod par byed pa ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: Patience that is difficult to carry out is described from the perspective of the one who practices patience.🔽Patience that is difficult to carry out is patience toward those who are able to harm you in every way.

original: rje dpon ni nus pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: rje dpon ni nus pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: A master is someone who is powerful and able to harm you in every way.

original: rnam pa thams cad du gnod pa byed par nus pa de lta bu la bzod pa 'di ni dka' ba'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //🔽dman pa'i gnas na gnas pa dag gis srog la thug pa'i gnod pa byas la bdag nyid ni chen por gyur pa cig yin na yang bzod pa dang / de bzhin du nyam chung ba rnams kyis gnod pa byas pa la bzod pa dang / mtshungs pa rnams kyis gnod pa byas pa yang bzod pa dang /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du gnod pa byed par nus pa de lta bu la bzod pa 'di ni dka' ba'i bzod pa zhes bya'o // dman pa'i gnas na gnas pa dag gis srog la thug pa'i gnod pa byas la bdag nyid ni chen por gyur pa cig yin na yang bzod pa dang / de bzhin du nyam chung ba rnams kyis gnod pa byas pa la bzod pa dang / mtshungs pa rnams kyis gnod pa byas pa yang bzod pa dang /
translated: Patience toward such a person is called patience that is difficult to carry out.

original: dma' ba rnams kyis ba rnag par dka' ba'i gnod pa byas pa yang bzod pa ni dka' ba'i bzod pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dma' ba rnams kyis ba rnag par dka' ba'i gnod pa byas pa yang bzod pa ni dka' ba'i bzod pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Patience that is difficult to carry out is also said to be patience toward those who harm you when you are in a lowly state, even though you are great; patience toward those who harm you when you are weak; patience toward those who harm you when you are equal in strength; and patience toward those who harm you when you are superior.

original: mdza' bo rnams la ni phan pa'i sems kyis bzod par byed do //
analyzed: mdza' bo rnams la ni phan pa'i sems kyis bzod par byed do //
translated: One is patient with friends through a mind of benefit.

original: mi mdza' ba rnams la ni byams pa'i sems kyis so //
analyzed: mi mdza' ba rnams la ni byams pa'i sems kyis so //
translated: One is patient with enemies through a mind of love.

original: tha mal pa rnams la ni so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms kyis so //
analyzed: tha mal pa rnams la ni so sor ma brtags pa'i btang snyoms kyis so //
translated: One is patient with neutrals through a non-investigating equanimity.

original: de ltar sgo gsum nas so //
analyzed: de ltar sgo gsum nas so //
translated: Thus, there are three doors.

original: gsum char la yang mnyam pa'i rnam pas bzod par byed pa ni sgo bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: gsum char la yang mnyam pa'i rnam pas bzod par byed pa ni sgo bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth door is that one is patient with all three through an attitude of equality.

original: mi bzod pa'i sgo nas bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa mi byed pa ni skyes bu dam pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi bzod pa'i sgo nas bdag dang gzhan la gnod pa mi byed pa ni skyes bu dam pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One who does not harm oneself or others through impatience is called a holy person.

original: de'i bzod pa ni skyes bu dam pa'i bzod pa'o //🔽mi bzod pa'i nyes pa rnam pa lnga mthong zhing /
analyzed: de'i bzod pa ni skyes bu dam pa'i bzod pa'o // mi bzod pa'i nyes pa rnam pa lnga mthong zhing /
translated: His patience is the patience of a holy person.🔽One sees the five faults of impatience and

original: de las ldog pa'i bzod pa'i phan yon rnam pa lnga mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las ldog pa'i bzod pa'i phan yon rnam pa lnga mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one sees the five benefits of patience that are the opposite of those.

original: phan yon bstan pa'i phyir phyi ma la dgra mang bar mi 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di dag gi phan yon gyi don bstan pa ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: phan yon bstan pa'i phyir phyi ma la dgra mang bar mi 'gyur ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la 'di dag gi phan yon gyi don bstan pa ni snga ma bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: In order to demonstrate the benefits, he says, in future lives, one will have few enemies, etc. The meaning of the benefits should be understood as above.

original: 'di lta ste thos pa las byung ba'i sa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di lta ste thos pa las byung ba'i sa las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like the arising of the stage of learning.

original: de ltar bzod pa'i phan yon mthong ba ni de la mang du gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar bzod pa'i phan yon mthong ba ni de la mang du gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, one who sees the benefits of patience will abide in it frequently.

original: sems can rnams la yang rjes su brtse ba'i phyir gzhan dag kyang bzod pa la yang dag par 'gong par byed do //🔽bzod pa'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: sems can rnams la yang rjes su brtse ba'i phyir gzhan dag kyang bzod pa la yang dag par 'gong par byed do // bzod pa'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: And, out of compassion for sentient beings, one will also establish others in patience.

original: sems can rnam pa gsum yang dag par 'god par byed pa la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnam pa gsum yang dag par 'god par byed pa la sogs pa snga ma bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: In this way, one should understand the establishment of the three types of sentient beings in patience, etc., as above.

original: mi sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni dpyas shing 'jigs su rung ba la bzod pa zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi sdug pa'i rnam par smin pa zhes bya ba ni dpyas shing 'jigs su rung ba la bzod pa zhes bya bar bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The ripening of patience is said to be the ripening of the patience that is directed toward the repulsive and the patience that is directed toward the fearsome.

original: snying brtse ba'i sems ni sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa nyid do//
analyzed: snying brtse ba'i sems ni sems can rnams la phan pa dang bde ba'i bsam pa nyid do//
translated: The mind of love is the intention to bring about the welfare and happiness of sentient beings.

original: @185a * // snying rje'i sems ni sdug bsngal bar 'dod pa nyid do //
analyzed: @185a * // snying rje'i sems ni sdug bsngal bar 'dod pa nyid do //
translated: The mind of compassion is the desire to relieve the suffering of sentient beings.

original: mnyen pa'i sems ni sems can rnams mi gtong ba nyid do //
analyzed: mnyen pa'i sems ni sems can rnams mi gtong ba nyid do //
translated: The mind of gentleness is the non-abandonment of sentient beings.

original: de lta na sems can rnam pa gsum la ltos nas bzod par byed do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na sems can rnam pa gsum la ltos nas bzod par byed do zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, it is shown that one should practice patience in relation to three types of sentient beings.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la lhag par mos pa'i bsam pa drag po dang ldan pas byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bzod pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la lhag par mos pa'i bsam pa drag po dang ldan pas byang chub kyi tshogs yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir bzod pa'o //
translated: Patience is the practice of patience by one who possesses a strong aspiration for perfect enlightenment, in order to complete the accumulations for enlightenment.

original: bzod pa'i stobs can zhes bya ba ni dka' thub can thams cad kyi nang na bzod pa'i dka' thub ni mchog yin pa'i phyir dang / de'i stobs kyis dka' thub dang tshul khrims yang dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir bzod pa'i stobs can zhes brjod do //
analyzed: bzod pa'i stobs can zhes bya ba ni dka' thub can thams cad kyi nang na bzod pa'i dka' thub ni mchog yin pa'i phyir dang / de'i stobs kyis dka' thub dang tshul khrims yang dag par 'gyur ba'i phyir bzod pa'i stobs can zhes brjod do //
translated: The expression one who possesses the power of patience is used because the austerity of patience is the highest of all austerities, and because the power of patience purifies the austerities and morality.

original: de ltar na bdag nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par la ltos pa dang bcas pas bzod par byed do //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag nyid kyi gnas skabs kyi khyad par la ltos pa dang bcas pas bzod par byed do //
translated: Thus, he is patient with regard to the special state of his own self.

original: rigs phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi rtogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: rigs phun sum tshogs pa zhes bya ba ni rigs kyi rtogs pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The phrase endowed with the excellence of spiritual lineage means that he is endowed with the realization of the spiritual lineage.

original: sngon zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: sngon zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The phrase previously, refers to the stage of action out of faith.

original: gnas shing zhes bya ba bstan pa ni 'dug pas zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnas shing zhes bya ba bstan pa ni 'dug pas zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The phrase while abiding indicates that he is patient while sitting.

original: kha cig nas gnas pa la zhes 'don pa der ni don 'di yin te /
analyzed: kha cig nas gnas pa la zhes 'don pa der ni don 'di yin te /
translated: Some editions have the phrase while abiding in patience, but the meaning is the same.

original: bzod pa goms par byas pas mngon du phyogs par gyur pas 'dug pa ni gnas pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa goms par byas pas mngon du phyogs par gyur pas 'dug pa ni gnas pa'o //
translated: The phrase while abiding means that he is patient while sitting, because he is engaged in the practice of patience.

original: rang bzhin gyis kyang bzod pa dang // zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i stobs can yin gyi /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis kyang bzod pa dang // zhes bya ba ni rgyu'i stobs can yin gyi /
translated: The phrase naturally patient refers to one who is strong by nature,

original: sbyor ba'i stobs can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i stobs can ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: but not strong by application.

original: sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: The phrase the bodhisattva who has entered the stages refers to the bodhisattva who has entered the stages.

original: gang zag la bdag med pa so sor rig pas 'di la bzod par bya ba bdag gis bzod par bya'o zhes rlom sems med pa ni bzod pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag la bdag med pa so sor rig pas 'di la bzod par bya ba bdag gis bzod par bya'o zhes rlom sems med pa ni bzod pa'o //
translated: Patience is the absence of conceit, “I will be patient,” in the patience that comes from the individual knowledge of the selflessness of persons.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: Why is that?

original: sems can med par rig nas zhes bya ba ni chos la bdag med par rab tu rtogs nas gnod pa byed pa thams cad la ji mi snyam pa'o //
analyzed: sems can med par rig nas zhes bya ba ni chos la bdag med par rab tu rtogs nas gnod pa byed pa thams cad la ji mi snyam pa'o //
translated: It is said, “Having known that there are no sentient beings,” that is, having realized the selflessness of phenomena, one is indifferent to all harms.

original: de ltar na de kho na nyid kyi rnam par shes pa'i stobs kyis bzod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na de kho na nyid kyi rnam par shes pa'i stobs kyis bzod par 'gyur ro zhes bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, it is taught that patience comes from the power of knowing suchness.

original: de ltar na rnam pa drug go //
analyzed: de ltar na rnam pa drug go //
translated: Thus, there are six aspects.

original: rnam pa bdun gyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: rnam pa bdun gyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: In terms of seven aspects, it is said:🔽Patience with regard to all,

original: thams cad kyis bzod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyis bzod pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and so on.

original: de ltar na dngos po'i bye brag dang / yul gyi bye brag dang / ngus kyi bye brag dang / gnas skabs kyi bye brag dang / rnam pa gsum la bye brag med par bzod pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bdun yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po'i bye brag dang / yul gyi bye brag dang / ngus kyi bye brag dang / gnas skabs kyi bye brag dang / rnam pa gsum la bye brag med par bzod pa zhes bya ba ni rnam pa bdun yin no //
translated: Thus, there are seven kinds of patience: patience with regard to the variety of things, patience with regard to the variety of objects, patience with regard to the variety of people, patience with regard to the variety of situations, and patience with regard to the three aspects.🔽The eight kinds of patience that are practiced in order to help others are, in brief, of two kinds:🔽patience in enduring harm done by others and patience in accepting hardships.

original: phongs shing 'dod pa'i bzod pa rnam pa brgyad ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rnam par @185b gzhag par bya ste /🔽gang gis sems can la gnod par 'gyur ba de bzod par byas nas spong bar byed pa dang / gang dag don du gnyer ba de dag la nye bar sgrub par byed par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: phongs shing 'dod pa'i bzod pa rnam pa brgyad ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su rnam par @185b gzhag par bya ste / gang gis sems can la gnod par 'gyur ba de bzod par byas nas spong bar byed pa dang / gang dag don du gnyer ba de dag la nye bar sgrub par byed par rig par bya'o //
translated: The first is to be understood as twofold: patience in enduring harm done by others and patience in accepting hardships.🔽The first is to be understood as twofold: patience in enduring harm done by others and patience in accepting hardships.🔽The first is to be understood as twofold: patience in enduring harm done by others and patience in accepting hardships.🔽The first is to be understood as twofold: patience in enduring harm done by others and patience in accepting hardships.

original: slong ba'i gnod pa bzod pa zhes bya ba ni slong ba po rnams kyi 'khrul pa sna tshogs la mi 'byed pa'i bzod pa ste //🔽de lta bu'i bya bas 'dod pa rnams kyi bsam pa sgrub pas phongs shing 'dod pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: slong ba'i gnod pa bzod pa zhes bya ba ni slong ba po rnams kyi 'khrul pa sna tshogs la mi 'byed pa'i bzod pa ste //🔽de lta bu'i bya bas 'dod pa rnams kyi bsam pa sgrub pas phongs shing 'dod pa'i bzod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The first is to be understood as twofold: patience in enduring harm done by others and patience in accepting hardships.🔽The first is to be understood as twofold: patience in enduring harm done by others and patience in accepting hardships.🔽The first is to be understood as twofold: patience in enduring harm done by others and patience in accepting hardships.🔽The first is to be understood as twofold: patience in enduring harm done by others and patience in accepting hardships.🔽The first is to be understood as twofold: patience in enduring harm done by others and patience in accepting hardships.

original: ma rungs pa sdig pa chen po'i las kyi nyes par spyod pa chen po la spyod pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la zhugs pa snying rje chen po'i dbang du byas nas gnod sems mi skyed cing nyes par spyod pa la gnas pa rnams la mnar sems med pa
analyzed: ma rungs pa sdig pa chen po'i las kyi nyes par spyod pa chen po la spyod pa sdug bsngal gyi rgyu la zhugs pa snying rje chen po'i dbang du byas nas gnod sems mi skyed cing nyes par spyod pa la gnas pa rnams la mnar sems med pa
translated: He does not generate malice, and he is without hostility toward those who are engaged in the cause of suffering, who are engaged in the great misdeeds of evil, grave misdeeds, and who are engaged in misconduct, on the strength of his great compassion.

original: ni bzod pa ste /
analyzed: ni bzod pa ste /
translated: This is patience.

original: de lta bu ni khyim pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni khyim pa'i phyogs kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: This is from the point of view of the householder.

original: rab tu byung ba log par zhugs pa rnams la bzod par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba log par zhugs pa rnams la bzod par bya ba bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate patience toward those who are ordained but have gone astray, he says:

original: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: “toward those who have transgressed in morality,” and so on.

original: brtsal ba mi mjed pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba ni de'i sgo nas skyes pa'i sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa'o //🔽gang gis phongs par 'gyur ba de ni zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brtsal ba mi mjed pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba ni de'i sgo nas skyes pa'i sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa'o // gang gis phongs par 'gyur ba de ni zhes bya ba la /
translated: Patience that is not sought after is the patience that is the acceptance of suffering that arises from that.

original: mi 'dod pa dang mi 'phrod pa ni phongs par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa dang mi 'phrod pa ni phongs par gyur pa'o //
translated: “That which is a lack” is a lack of what is not desired and what is not suitable.

original: bzod pas yongs su spong bar byed la zhes bya ba ni bzod pa la brten nas lus la sogs pas lan du gnod pa mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pas yongs su spong bar byed la zhes bya ba ni bzod pa la brten nas lus la sogs pas lan du gnod pa mi byed pa'o //
translated: By means of patience, one avoids i.e. one does not retaliate in kind with the body, etc. by relying on patience.

original: gang 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni zang zing dang chos la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang 'dod pa zhes bya ba ni zang zing dang chos la sogs pa'o //
translated: The desired refers to material things, the Dharma, etc.

original: de'i sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos de dag nyid gzhan dag la rgya cher bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i sgrub par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni chos de dag nyid gzhan dag la rgya cher bstan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa rig par bya'o //
translated: Because of the accomplishment of those, one should understand that those very dharmas are taught extensively to others, etc.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad po dang du blangs nas dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba dang ldan pas mthong ba'i chos la sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa ni 'jig rten 'dir bde ba'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad po dang du blangs nas dge ba'i phyogs la sbyor ba dang ldan pas mthong ba'i chos la sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams dang ma 'dres pa'i phyir sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa ni 'jig rten 'dir bde ba'o //
translated: The patience of accepting suffering is happiness in this world because one is endowed with the application to virtue by accepting the eightfold suffering and because one is not mixed up with sinful, nonvirtuous dharmas in this very life.

original: de'i sgo nas bdag nyid kyi dge ba'i chos rnams nye bar bsags pas 'jig rten gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas bdag nyid kyi dge ba'i chos rnams nye bar bsags pas 'jig rten gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: It is happiness in the next world because one is endowed with the accumulation of one's own virtuous dharmas by means of that.

original: ji skad bstan pa'i sdug bsngal khyad du bsad nas gzhan dag 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba la rab tu bkod pa ni gzhan dag 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i bzod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji skad bstan pa'i sdug bsngal khyad du bsad nas gzhan dag 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba la rab tu bkod pa ni gzhan dag 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i bzod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The patience of being established in the happiness of this life and the next is the patience of one who, disregarding the sufferings described above, establishes others in the happiness of this life and the next.

original: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad ni dus tshigs gzhan du gyur pa las byung ba ni gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal rnam pa brgyad ni dus tshigs gzhan du gyur pa las byung ba ni gang yang smras pa /
translated: The eight kinds of suffering are those that arise from changes in the seasons,

original: grang ba dang / tsha ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: grang ba dang / tsha ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: such as cold and heat.

original: lhan cig skyes pa gang yin pa ni bkres pa dang / skom pa zhes @186a * //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes pa gang yin pa ni bkres pa dang / skom pa zhes @186a * //
translated: Those that arise from birth are hunger and thirst.

original: bya ba'o // rtsub pa'i reg pa las byung ba'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis su byas pa ni gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: bya ba'o // rtsub pa'i reg pa las byung ba'i sgo nas rnam pa gnyis su byas pa ni gang yang smras pa /
translated: Those that arise from contact with rough objects are of two kinds:

original: sbrang bus zin pa dang / sha sbrang gis zin pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sbrang bus zin pa dang / sha sbrang gis zin pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: being bitten by insects and being bitten by leeches.🔽Those that arise from the torment of the body are wind,

original: lus gdungs pa las skyes pa ni rlung dang / nyi tshan dang zhes bya ba la gdung ba dang / skam par byed pa'o //
analyzed: lus gdungs pa las skyes pa ni rlung dang / nyi tshan dang zhes bya ba la gdung ba dang / skam par byed pa'o //
translated: sun, and so on, which torment and dry out the body.

original: sos reg ba las skyes pa ni brang 'gro la sogs pa ste /🔽gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: sos reg ba las skyes pa ni brang 'gro la sogs pa ste / gang yang smras pa /
translated: That arising from contact with the season is, for example, the heat of summer and the cold of winter.🔽That arising from contact with the elements is, for example, being burned by fire, or scalded by hot water, or pricked by sharp kusa grass.

original: sdig sbrul gyis zin pa rnams zhes bya ba'o //🔽rtsal drags pa las byung ba ni gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: sdig sbrul gyis zin pa rnams zhes bya ba'o // rtsal drags pa las byung ba ni gang yang smras pa /
translated: That arising from contact with non-human beings is, for example, being bitten by a snake, or stung by a mosquito.

original: ngal ba las byung ba'i lus dang / sems dub pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ngal ba las byung ba'i lus dang / sems dub pa dang zhes bya ba'o //
translated: That arising from excess of energy is, for example, the fatigue of body and the exhaustion of mind that arise from overexertion.

original: skye ba la sogs pa 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: skye ba la sogs pa 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: The suffering of birth, etc., in the life-cycle is referred to by the words:

original: 'khor ba na yod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba na yod pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “the suffering of being in the life-cycle.”

original: de dag thams cad dang du blangs nas ji ltar rigs par bdag la phan pa dang gzhan la phan pa la yang dag par sbyor bar byed pa ni dang du len pa'i bzod pa ste /
analyzed: de dag thams cad dang du blangs nas ji ltar rigs par bdag la phan pa dang gzhan la phan pa la yang dag par sbyor bar byed pa ni dang du len pa'i bzod pa ste /
translated: Having accepted all of these, one applies oneself to the benefit of self and others in whatever way is appropriate. This is the patience of accepting suffering.

original: bdag dang gzhan dag 'di dang gzhan du bde ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan dag 'di dang gzhan du bde ba'o //
translated: This is the happiness of self and others in this life and in the next.

original: gnod pa byas par gyur pa la lan du gnod pa mi byed pa ni sbyor ba dag pas ni rnam par dag pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: gnod pa byas par gyur pa la lan du gnod pa mi byed pa ni sbyor ba dag pas ni rnam par dag pa'i bzod pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The patience of not returning harm for harm is the patience of purification, because it is pure in its application.

original: da ltar gzhan gyis gnod pa byed par gyur pa la sems 'khrugs par mi byed pa nyid dang / 'das pa'i dus su byas par shes kyang zhe la mi 'dzin pa nyid dang / de dag la slar phan gdags par 'dod pa nye bar bzung nas bsam pa dag pa yin pas rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: da ltar gzhan gyis gnod pa byed par gyur pa la sems 'khrugs par mi byed pa nyid dang / 'das pa'i dus su byas par shes kyang zhe la mi 'dzin pa nyid dang / de dag la slar phan gdags par 'dod pa nye bar bzung nas bsam pa dag pa yin pas rnam par dag pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: One does not become upset when others do harm now; one does not hold it against them when one knows they have done it in the past; and one is intent on helping them, with a pure intention.

original: sems can gnod pa byed pa rnams la rang nyid song nas mthun par smra zhing kho na med par ston pa dang / gzhan gnod par byed pa dag 'ongs nas bzod pa gsol na de bzhin du dang du len par byed pa nyid ni phyir bcos pas rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gnod pa byed pa rnams la rang nyid song nas mthun par smra zhing kho na med par ston pa dang / gzhan gnod par byed pa dag 'ongs nas bzod pa gsol na de bzhin du dang du len par byed pa nyid ni phyir bcos pas rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: One goes to those who do harm to sentient beings, speaks agreeably to them, and shows them to be without hostility. And when others who do harm come and ask for forgiveness, one readily forgives them.

original: mi bzod pa las brtsams te shas cher ngo tsha shes pa ni bzod pa'i sgo nas ston pa la gus par bya ba'i bsam pa nyid dang / rnam par tho ma'i tshams pa las brtsams te /
analyzed: mi bzod pa las brtsams te shas cher ngo tsha shes pa ni bzod pa'i sgo nas ston pa la gus par bya ba'i bsam pa nyid dang / rnam par tho ma'i tshams pa las brtsams te /
translated: One is ashamed of impatience, and one is intent on respecting the teacher through patience.

original: snying rje ba'i bsam pa nyid dang / dngos po'i khyad par gyi sgo nas bsam pa'i khyad par rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje ba'i bsam pa nyid dang / dngos po'i khyad par gyi sgo nas bsam pa'i khyad par rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The superiority of attitude is due to the attitude of compassion and the purity of the attitude is due to the excellence of the object.

original: mi bzod pa'i chos kyi grogs ni khong khro la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
analyzed: mi bzod pa'i chos kyi grogs ni khong khro la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams so //
translated: The conditions for the Dharma of patience are the afflictions such as anger.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi bzod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rab tu spangs pas rnam par dag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi bzod pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs rab tu spangs pas rnam par dag pa yin no //
translated: The purity of patience is due to the abandonment of the resistance to patience, i.e.

original: de ltar na mdor bsdu na sbyor pa rnam par dag pa dang / bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / sbyor ba'i @186b khyad par rnam par dag pa dang / bsam pa'i khyad par rnam par dag pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba rnam par dag pas bzod pa gsol bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mdor bsdu na sbyor pa rnam par dag pa dang / bsam pa rnam par dag pa dang / sbyor ba'i @186b khyad par rnam par dag pa dang / bsam pa'i khyad par rnam par dag pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba rnam par dag pas bzod pa gsol bar byas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, in brief, patience is praised due to the purity of application, the purity of attitude, the purity of the excellence of application, the purity of the excellence of attitude, and the purity of freedom from attachment.

original: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u ste bcu gcig pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u ste bcu gcig pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the eleventh chapter, on the perfection of patience, in the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras.

analyzed: sems mngon par spro ba zhes bya ba dang / sems mngon par 'du byed pa zhes bya ba la khyad par ci yod ce na sems mngon par 'du byed pa ni dge ba dang / mi dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa la yang 'jug pas zhes bya ba nas spyi'i rnam pa ste /
