translated: The nature of effort is established as having

original: yang mngon par spro ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i bya ba sgrub pa'i bdag nyid can te /
analyzed: yang mngon par spro ba zhes bya ba ni 'dod pa'i bya ba sgrub pa'i bdag nyid can te /
translated: Again, “exertion” is the nature of accomplishing desired activities.

original: yang dag pa'i gtso bos bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i gtso bos bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is included in right effort.

original: spro ba ni brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: spro ba ni brtson 'grus te /
translated: Exertion is vigor,

original: sems las byung ba dge ba rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sems las byung ba dge ba rnams kyi rgyur gyur pa'o //
translated: which is the cause of the virtuous mental factors.

original: de bzhin du bya ba la mngon par phyogs pa ni spro ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bya ba la mngon par phyogs pa ni spro ba ste /
translated: Similarly, “exertion” is the inclination towards activity,

original: mngon par spro ba zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mngon par spro ba zhes brjod do //
translated: and is called “exertion”.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa ni yongs su g-yo ba tsam 'ba' zhig nyid do //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa ni yongs su g-yo ba tsam 'ba' zhig nyid do //
translated: “Exertion” is merely the movement of the mind.

original: dmigs pa nyid ni gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid ni gang yang smras pa /
translated: The object itself is not mentioned.

original: dpag tu med pa bsdu ba dang // zhes bya ba la dge ba'i chos dpag tu med pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa bsdu ba dang // zhes bya ba la dge ba'i chos dpag tu med pa dang / sems can gyi don bya ba la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: “Involving immeasurable collections” means that immeasurable virtuous dharmas and the benefit of sentient beings are engaged.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: dge ba'i chos dpag tu med pa bsdu ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos dpag tu med pa bsdu ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Involving immeasurable collections of virtuous dharmas” and so on.

original: gang yang sbyor ba nyid smras pa //
analyzed: gang yang sbyor ba nyid smras pa //
translated: Again, “application” is mentioned.

original: sbyangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: sbyangs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In “purification” and so on,

original: gus par bya ba'i sbyor bas yongs su bzung ba ni sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gus par bya ba'i sbyor bas yongs su bzung ba ni sbyangs pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The embrace of the practice of respect is called “purification”

original: mngon par 'dus byas pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽rgyun mi 'chad par rtag tu 'jug pa nye bar bzung nas rtag tu sbyor bas yongs su bsdus pa ni bar chad med pa'o //
analyzed: mngon par 'dus byas pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro // rgyun mi 'chad par rtag tu 'jug pa nye bar bzung nas rtag tu sbyor bas yongs su bsdus pa ni bar chad med pa'o //
translated: because it is the aspect of the composition of the perfections.🔽The embrace of the practice of constant engagement is called “uninterrupted”🔽because it is the practice of the perfections without interruption.🔽The embrace of the practice of skill in means is called “non-erroneous”

original: thabs kyi sbyor bas yongs su bzung ba ni phyin ca mi log pa ste /🔽brtson 'grus tshul bzhin brtsams pa la //🔽dka' ba cung zad yod ma yin //
analyzed: thabs kyi sbyor bas yongs su bzung ba ni phyin ca mi log pa ste / brtson 'grus tshul bzhin brtsams pa la // dka' ba cung zad yod ma yin //
translated: because it is the practice of the perfections without error.🔽The verse says,

original: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tshigs su bcad pas so //
translated: “There is no difficulty at all in the proper practice of effort.”🔽The embrace of the practice of natural outcome is called “natural outcome”

original: rgyu mthun pa nyid @187a * //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa nyid @187a * //
translated: because it is the natural outcome of the perfections.

original: ni gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: ni gang yang smras pa /
translated: The verse says,🔽“The perfections are the natural outcome of the perfections.”

original: de las byung ba'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de las byung ba'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: The embrace of the practice of universal benefit is called “universal benefit”🔽because it is the practice of the perfections for the sake of all beings.🔽The verse says,

original: de ltar na lus dang ngag dang yid kyi dge ba'i chos rnams ni brtson 'grus kyis kun nas slong ba'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis te /
analyzed: de ltar na lus dang ngag dang yid kyi dge ba'i chos rnams ni brtson 'grus kyis kun nas slong ba'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gis te /
translated: “The perfections are practiced for the sake of all beings.”

original: mngon par spro ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyis mngon par 'du byed pa'i zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mngon par spro ba dang ldan pa'i sems kyis mngon par 'du byed pa'i zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “with a mind that is fully engaged” shows that it is fully engaged.

original: sdom pa pa'i tshul khrims kyi yul ni brtson 'grus 'di la ma smos te /
analyzed: sdom pa pa'i tshul khrims kyi yul ni brtson 'grus 'di la ma smos te /
translated: The object of the morality of restraint is not mentioned here in the verse,

original: de ni ldog pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de ni ldog pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: because it is of the nature of a cessation,

original: brtson 'grus ni spro ba'i bdag nyid can yin pas 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: brtson 'grus ni spro ba'i bdag nyid can yin pas 'jug pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: whereas effort is of the nature of an engagement, because it is characterized by exertion.

original: 'jug pa'i tshul khrims nyid ni spro ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ldog pa'i tshul khrims nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa'i tshul khrims nyid ni spro ba nyid du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ldog pa'i tshul khrims nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: The morality of engagement is established as exertion, but the morality of restraint is not.

original: tshul khrims zhes bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyis bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang yongs su g-yo ba tsam zhes bya ba'i tshig nyid kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshul khrims zhes bya ba ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyis bsdus pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de yang yongs su g-yo ba tsam zhes bya ba'i tshig nyid kyis bsdus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The term “morality” is included in the phrase “merely a movement,” because it is included in the activities of body, speech, and mind that are free from evil.

original: khyim pa'am rab tu byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la rab tu sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba smras pa /
analyzed: khyim pa'am rab tu byung ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang sems can yongs su smin par bya ba la rab tu sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva who is a householder or a monk is engaged in the full maturation of the qualities of the Buddha and the full maturation of sentient beings.🔽It is said that

original: rnam pa gnyis su zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis su zhes bya ba la /
translated: there are two kinds of full maturation.

original: de yang gnyi ga'i phyogs la brten pas so sor rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang gnyi ga'i phyogs la brten pas so sor rnam pa gsum du 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, since each of these two kinds is based on both sides, there are three kinds of full maturation.

original: brtson 'grus thams cad ni rnam pa gnyis su bsdu ste /
analyzed: brtson 'grus thams cad ni rnam pa gnyis su bsdu ste /
translated: All effort is included in two kinds:

original: go cha'i btson 'grus dang sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: go cha'i btson 'grus dang sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: armor-like effort and the effort of application.

original: sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus la rdzas kyi rnam pa dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su byas nas rnam pa gsum du smras te /
analyzed: sbyor ba'i brtson 'grus la rdzas kyi rnam pa dbye bas rnam pa gnyis su byas nas rnam pa gsum du smras te /
translated: The effort of application is divided into two kinds according to its substance and is said to be threefold.

original: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i mdor bstan pa dang chos mtshungs pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims la sogs pa'i mdor bstan pa dang chos mtshungs pa'o //
translated: It is similar to the brief presentation of morality, etc.

original: rtsom pa'i brtson 'grus dang / rdzogs par byed pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya ba ni 'di dag gi rnam grangs so //
analyzed: rtsom pa'i brtson 'grus dang / rdzogs par byed pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya ba ni 'di dag gi rnam grangs so //
translated: The effort of undertaking and the effort of completing are synonyms for these.

original: go cha zhes brjod pa ni dang por rnam par brtags nas yongs su len pa'o //
analyzed: go cha zhes brjod pa ni dang por rnam par brtags nas yongs su len pa'o //
translated: The word “armor” indicates that one first dons it by way of imagination.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: sbyor ba'i snga rol nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi go cha'i brtson 'grus ni tshad med pa bzhis bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i snga rol nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi go cha'i brtson 'grus ni tshad med pa bzhis bsdus pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that the bodhisattvas’ armor-like effort is included in the four immeasurables.

original: de'i phyir bstod pa /🔽tshad med pa ni bzhi po yis //
analyzed: de'i phyir bstod pa / tshad med pa ni bzhi po yis //
translated: Therefore it is praised:🔽By taking up the four immeasurables,

original: yongs su bzung bas 'jigs pa med //🔽ces bya ba yin no //
analyzed: yongs su bzung bas 'jigs pa med // ces bya ba yin no //
translated: one is fearless.

original: tshad med pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: tshad med pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four immeasurables?

original: dus tshad med pa ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis sangs rgyas nyid thob par thos nas de bzhin du dam bcas nas brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa ni dus de snyed grangs med pa'i skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal so sor @187b rab tu myong ba nyams su len pa nyid do //
analyzed: dus tshad med pa ni bskal pa grangs med pa gsum gyis sangs rgyas nyid thob par thos nas de bzhin du dam bcas nas brtson 'grus rtsom pa dang / sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa ni dus de snyed grangs med pa'i skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal so sor @187b rab tu myong ba nyams su len pa nyid do //
translated: The immeasurable time is the attainment of buddhahood in three incalculable eons. Having heard that, one makes a vow and begins effort. The immeasurable suffering is the experience of the suffering of birth and so on for that number of incalculable eons.

original: bsod nams tshad med pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang 'jig rten pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i bsod nams nye bar sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsod nams tshad med pa ni nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang 'jig rten pa thams cad las yang dag par 'das pa'i bsod nams nye bar sogs pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The immeasurable merit is the possession of merit that transcends all the disciples, the Solitary Buddhas, and the world.

original: sems can tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir yongs su 'dzin pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems can tshad med pa zhes bya ba ni sems can gyi khams dpag tu med pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i phyir yongs su 'dzin pa nyid do //
translated: The immeasurable sentient beings are the possession of the sentient beings who attain Nirvana.

original: de dag nyid kyi don gyi rnam grangs rim gyis 'dir bstan pa'i phyir gal te sangs rgyas nyid las brtsams te /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi don gyi rnam grangs rim gyis 'dir bstan pa'i phyir gal te sangs rgyas nyid las brtsams te /
translated: In order to teach the synonyms of those very two, he says: If one begins with Buddhahood,

original: sbyor ba byas ba las dgos pa chung du tsam du gyur la ngal ba ni chen por gyur kyang /
analyzed: sbyor ba byas ba las dgos pa chung du tsam du gyur la ngal ba ni chen por gyur kyang /
translated: even if the purpose is small and the exertion is great,🔽nevertheless, one should apply oneself to the attainment of Buddhahood.

original: de lta na yang sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir sbyor bar byed pa nyid ces bya ba ni go cha chen po nyid bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de lta na yang sangs rgyas nyid thob par bya ba'i phyir sbyor bar byed pa nyid ces bya ba ni go cha chen po nyid bstan pa'o //
translated: This is the teaching of the great armor.

original: dgos pa chung ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dgos pa chung ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the smallness of the purpose, he says:

original: gal te sems can gcig ces bya ba la /
analyzed: gal te sems can gcig ces bya ba la /
translated: If one can cause a single sentient being to attain nirvana through such great effort, then it is worthwhile to make such an effort, not to mention many sentient beings.

original: de lta bu'i rtsom pa chen po brtsams pa las sems can gcig cig mya ngan las 'das par byed nus na yang de lta na yang sbyor ba nyid du byed na mang po dag gis lta ci smos zhes bstan pa'i phyir dang / dus dang sdug bsngal chen pos yongs su ngal ba chen po bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i rtsom pa chen po brtsams pa las sems can gcig cig mya ngan las 'das par byed nus na yang de lta na yang sbyor ba nyid du byed na mang po dag gis lta ci smos zhes bstan pa'i phyir dang / dus dang sdug bsngal chen pos yongs su ngal ba chen po bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: This is taught in order to demonstrate the great hardship of great exhaustion through great suffering for a long time,🔽for as long as one lives in hell for as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges,🔽counting them as one day and night,🔽for as many hundreds of thousands of eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges,

original: yongs su bgrang ba bzung na bskal pa stong phrag grangs med pa'i nyin dang mtshan mo'i rnam par gzhag pa dang mnyam pa grangs med pa brgya stong yongs su bgrang ba bzung ba snyed du ji srid 'tsho'i bar du dmyal bar gnas pas bdag gis bla na med
analyzed: yongs su bgrang ba bzung na bskal pa stong phrag grangs med pa'i nyin dang mtshan mo'i rnam par gzhag pa dang mnyam pa grangs med pa brgya stong yongs su bgrang ba bzung ba snyed du ji srid 'tsho'i bar du dmyal bar gnas pas bdag gis bla na med
translated: in order to attain the unsurpassed bliss of nirvana for a single sentient being.

original: pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub par 'gyur na yang de lta na yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la sbyor bar bya'o zhes go bgos na mthar thug par ma gyur gyi bar du bar ma dor 'dor bar mi bya ba
analyzed: pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub par 'gyur na yang de lta na yang bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub la sbyor bar bya'o zhes go bgos na mthar thug par ma gyur gyi bar du bar ma dor 'dor bar mi bya ba
translated: Even if it were to take that long to attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, still, having taken up the armor, one should not cast it aside in the meantime until one has reached the ultimate.

original: dang / gal te de bas yun thung ba dang / sdug bsngal chung bas thob par 'gyur na lta shin tu yang 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dang / gal te de bas yun thung ba dang / sdug bsngal chung bas thob par 'gyur na lta shin tu yang 'jug par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If it were to be attained in less time and with less suffering, then one should engage in it.

original: 'di dag gis ni dus ring po dang / dus rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pas sdug bsngal shin tu drag cing che ba'i sgo nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ba de lta na yang de'i don du sbyor ba'i dor bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis🔽mi khyab pa'i go cha yongs su gsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni dus ring po dang / dus rgyun mi 'chad par 'jug pas sdug bsngal shin tu drag cing che ba'i sgo nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub 'thob par 'gyur ba de lta na yang de'i don du sbyor ba'i dor bar mi bya'o zhes bya ba ni bsam gyis🔽mi khyab pa'i go cha yongs su gsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: By these, one should understand the inconceivable armor, which is the statement that even though one will attain unsurpassed perfect enlightenment through suffering that is very intense and great due to engaging in it for a long time and continuously, one should not cast aside the application for that purpose.

original: de lta bu la mos pa tsam dang zhes bya ba ni 'di lta bu thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o zhes de bzhin du bzung nas de lta bu'i mos pa tsam gyis de dang 'dra ba'i go cha la dad pa skye @188a * //
analyzed: de lta bu la mos pa tsam dang zhes bya ba ni 'di lta bu thams cad ni byang chub sems dpa'i go cha'o zhes de bzhin du bzung nas de lta bu'i mos pa tsam gyis de dang 'dra ba'i go cha la dad pa skye @188a * //
translated: The mere faith in such a conception is called the mere faith in the conception of the armor. Having conceived of all this as the Bodhisattva's armor, one generates the faith in the conception of the armor that is similar to that conception.

original: bar 'gyur ba ni dad pa tsam skyed pa'o //
analyzed: bar 'gyur ba ni dad pa tsam skyed pa'o //
translated: The mere generation of faith is called the mere generation of faith.

original: de yang brtan po yin te zhes bya ba ni phyir mi ldog cing brtan por 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: de yang brtan po yin te zhes bya ba ni phyir mi ldog cing brtan por 'gyur ba ste /
translated: And that is firm, means that it is irreversible and firm,

original: phyir ni ldog pa'i sa bon dang yang dag par 'gyur bar ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyir ni ldog pa'i sa bon dang yang dag par 'gyur bar ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is endowed with the seed of irreversibility.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: rgyu yongs su rtas par byed pa yin na zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rgyu yongs su rtas par byed pa yin na zhes bya ba la /
translated: If it is the development of the cause,

original: byang chub kyi don du brtson 'grus brtsams pas sa bon bskrun pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: byang chub kyi don du brtson 'grus brtsams pas sa bon bskrun pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: means that the seed is planted by the exertion of effort for the sake of enlightenment.

original: go cha de dang yang dag par ldan par gyur pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i dbang du byas nas dka' ba'i spyod pa'i bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: go cha de dang yang dag par ldan par gyur pa ni sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i dbang du byas nas dka' ba'i spyod pa'i bya ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: One who is endowed with that armor does not have to perform difficult practices, taking into account the full development of the qualities of the Buddha and the full development of living beings.

original: de las khyad par du 'phags par 'jug pa'i dka' ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las khyad par du 'phags par 'jug pa'i dka' ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has entered the path that is superior to that, and is without difficulty.

original: sems zhum pa ni rtsom pa'i dus su yi bsad pa'o //
analyzed: sems zhum pa ni rtsom pa'i dus su yi bsad pa'o //
translated: Depression of mind is discouragement at the time of undertaking.

original: dka' ba spyad dgos pa ni sbyor ba'i dus na mi nus nga med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dka' ba spyad dgos pa ni sbyor ba'i dus na mi nus nga med pa'i phyir te /
translated: The necessity of difficult practice is the inability to apply oneself at the time of application, because of the thought I cannot do this.

original: thams cad rim gyis bde bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad rim gyis bde bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because everything is done gradually, and with ease.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sbyor ba dang / mngon par sgrub pa dang / 'jug pa'i brtson 'grus ni dge ba sdud pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la sbyor ba dang / mngon par sgrub pa dang / 'jug pa'i brtson 'grus ni dge ba sdud pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The effort that is applied to the six perfections, the effort that is accomplished, and the effort that is engaged, are taught as the effort that gathers virtue.

original: re re yang rnam pa bdun bdun gyis bsdus par rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: re re yang rnam pa bdun bdun gyis bsdus par rig par bya ste zhes bya ba la /
translated: Each of these is to be understood as consisting of seven aspects.

original: rnam pa bdun po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na gsum du byas pas bsdu bar bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na gsum du byas pas bsdu bar bya'o //
translated: These seven aspects are to be included within three, when they are summarized.

original: stobs brtan pos bskyed pa dang / sbyor ba'i khyad par dang / gnas rnams dang ji ltar rigs par sbyar par bya'o //
analyzed: stobs brtan pos bskyed pa dang / sbyor ba'i khyad par dang / gnas rnams dang ji ltar rigs par sbyar par bya'o //
translated: They are to be applied to the stability of power, the distinction of application, and the stations, as is appropriate.

original: mi g-yos pa zhes bya ba ni brtan pa ste /
analyzed: mi g-yos pa zhes bya ba ni brtan pa ste /
translated: Immovable is steadfast.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad kyis zil gyis gnon par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad kyis zil gyis gnon par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not overcome by any adverse elements.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad kyang rnam pa gnyis su bsdu bar bya ste /
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs thams cad kyang rnam pa gnyis su bsdu bar bya ste /
translated: All adverse elements are to be included within two kinds:

original: rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa dang / gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa dang / gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa'o //
translated: those belonging to one’s own continuum and those belonging to the continua of others.

original: rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those belonging to one’s own continuum are of two kinds:

original: nyon mongs pa med pa dang / nyon yongs pa can no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa dang / nyon yongs pa can no //
translated: those that are unafflicted and those that are afflicted.

original: de la 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sems can gyi log par sgrub par tung ba yid pa byed pas ni brtson 'grus nyams par gyur ro zhes bya bas btson 'grus mi brtan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal dang / sems can gyi log par sgrub par tung ba yid pa byed pas ni brtson 'grus nyams par gyur ro zhes bya bas btson 'grus mi brtan par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva's steadfastness is unshakable by the suffering of cyclic existence and by the ingratitude of sentient beings.

original: de las bzlog pa ni brtan pa ste gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni brtan pa ste gnas pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is steadfastness.

original: gnas pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i phyir mi g-yo ba'o //
translated: Because of steadfastness, he is unshakable.

original: nyon mongs pa can ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ni nyon mongs pa dang / nye ba'i nyon mongs pa ste /
translated: He is unshakable by the afflictions, which are the root afflictions and the secondary afflictions.

original: de dag gis mi bskyod pas na brtan pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis mi bskyod pas na brtan pa'o //
translated: He is steadfast because he is unshakable by them.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud du gtogs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: He is unshakable by others, who are of two kinds.

original: bstan pa 'di la sdang zhing gnod par byed pa rnams kyis bzlog @188b tu zin kyang 'di nyid la brtson 'grus rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur pa ni brtan pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa 'di la sdang zhing gnod par byed pa rnams kyis bzlog @188b tu zin kyang 'di nyid la brtson 'grus rgyun mi 'chad par 'gyur pa ni brtan pa'o //
translated: He is steadfast because he is unshakable by those who are hostile to this teaching and who do harm, even though they may try to stop him.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor pa'i gzhi nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yang dag par myong zhing de dag gi gnod pa drag po myong yang brtson 'grus rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor pa'i gzhi nyid yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal yang dag par myong zhing de dag gi gnod pa drag po myong yang brtson 'grus rgyun mi 'chad pa'o //
translated: It is uninterrupted effort, because one experiences the suffering of the basis of the feeling of suffering, and because one experiences the intense harm of those, yet one's effort is uninterrupted.

original: brtan pa ni shin tu legs par zhugs pa'i brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: brtan pa ni shin tu legs par zhugs pa'i brtson 'grus te /
translated: It is firm effort, because one is well engaged.

original: gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba'o /
analyzed: gus par byed pa'i sbyor ba'o /
translated: It is respectful application.

original: 'di dag nyid rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa thob par byed pa'i phyir dang / mkhas pa'i sgor zhugs pa'i phyir dpag med pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag nyid rig pa'i gnas thams cad la mkhas pa thob par byed pa'i phyir dang / mkhas pa'i sgor zhugs pa'i phyir dpag med pa'o //
translated: It is immeasurable, because one attains skill in all the branches of learning and because one enters the door of skill.

original: thob par bya ba'i thams yang dag pa dang ldan pas thabs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: thob par bya ba'i thams yang dag pa dang ldan pas thabs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is skillful, because one possesses the means of attaining the goal.

original: mnyam pa nyid rab tu rtogs pas nyon mongs pa nyid dang bral ba'i phyir yang thabs dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid rab tu rtogs pas nyon mongs pa nyid dang bral ba'i phyir yang thabs dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is skillful, because one is free from afflictions through the realization of equality.

original: don chen po la sbyor ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //🔽dus rtag tu sbyor ba dang / rgyas par zhugs pas na /
analyzed: don chen po la sbyor ba'i phyir yang dag pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o // dus rtag tu sbyor ba dang / rgyas par zhugs pas na /
translated: It is called right effort because it is applied to the great goal.

original: rgyas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called extensive because it is always applied and because it is well engaged.

original: ngar sems pa'i skyon dang bral pa'i phyir dang rgyal med pa'o zhes bstan pa'i rnam pa bdun po 'di dag ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i tshul bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: ngar sems pa'i skyon dang bral pa'i phyir dang rgyal med pa'o zhes bstan pa'i rnam pa bdun po 'di dag ni brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i tshul bstan pa yin no //
translated: These seven aspects demonstrate the manner in which one undertakes striving.

original: brtson 'grus tshul bzhin du brtsams ba'i 'bras bu nyi bar bstan pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed do zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: brtson 'grus tshul bzhin du brtsams ba'i 'bras bu nyi bar bstan pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu yongs su rdzogs par gyur pa ni myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par byed do zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to demonstrate the result of properly undertaking striving, he says, “One who is endowed with the perfection of cause and effect quickly attains unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.”

original: byang chub kyi tshogs thams cad kyi tshogs thams cad kyi gtso bo ni brtson 'grus yin par bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: byang chub kyi tshogs thams cad kyi tshogs thams cad kyi gtso bo ni brtson 'grus yin par bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Striving is taught to be the foremost of all the accumulations for enlightenment,

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa de ni de'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa de ni de'i rgyu can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because generosity and so forth are caused by it.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, he says:

original: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Because of that, it is said:🔽“One who is endowed with the perfection of cause and effect quickly attains unsurpassed perfect complete enlightenment.”

original: bstan pas ston par mdzad do zhes bya ba ni kun dga' bo brtson 'grus ni byang chub kyi rgyu'i gtso bo'o zhes mdo sde nas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bstan pas ston par mdzad do zhes bya ba ni kun dga' bo brtson 'grus ni byang chub kyi rgyu'i gtso bo'o zhes mdo sde nas bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The statement he teaches by teaching is because it is taught in the sutras that effort is the principal cause of enlightenment.🔽The second is the difficulty of application that is due to the fact that one cannot apply oneself without regard for wealth, body, and life because one has not attained physical strength and ability.

original: lus kyi stobs dang / nus pa thob par gyur pas longs spyod dang lus dang srog la ltos pa med par sbyor bar byed par mi nus pa nyid dka' ba dang / rnam pa 'dra bas dus ring por rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor ba byed par dga' ba ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi stobs dang / nus pa thob par gyur pas longs spyod dang lus dang srog la ltos pa med par sbyor bar byed par mi nus pa nyid dka' ba dang / rnam pa 'dra bas dus ring por rgyun mi 'chad par sbyor ba byed par dga' ba ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: The third difficulty is the difficulty of engaging in effort that is due to the fact that one delights in applying oneself for a long time without interruption because one is of similar type.

original: btson 'grus kyi mnyam pa nyid rab tu rtogs par dga' ba nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa la 'jug par dka' ba nyid ni dka' ba gsum pa'o //🔽de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: btson 'grus kyi mnyam pa nyid rab tu rtogs par dga' ba nyid dang / phyin ci ma log pa la 'jug par dka' ba nyid ni dka' ba gsum pa'o // de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The difficulty of engaging in effort that is due to the fact that one delights in realizing the sameness of effort and the non-erroneous engagement is the third difficulty.🔽In order to demonstrate the cause of that, he says:

original: 'di sdud pa'i rgyu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: 'di sdud pa'i rgyu ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: The cause of its collection is the cause of its accumulation.

original: lus kyi mthu dang stobs thob par gyur pas lus dang srog la ltos pa med par sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang po'o //🔽sems can rnams la @189a * //
analyzed: lus kyi mthu dang stobs thob par gyur pas lus dang srog la ltos pa med par sbyor bar byed do zhes bya ba ni rgyu dang po'o // sems can rnams la @189a * //
translated: The first cause is: “He applies himself without regard for his body and life because he has attained physical strength and power.”

original: snying rje'i stobs brtan po thob par gyur pas sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ji srid 'tsho'i bar du sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: snying rje'i stobs brtan po thob par gyur pas sems can rnams kyi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya ba'i phyir ji srid 'tsho'i bar du sbyor ba zhes bya ba ni snying rje'i sbyor ba ste /
translated: The second cause is: “He applies himself as long as he lives in order to remove the suffering of sentient beings because he has attained the firm power of compassion for sentient beings.”

original: brtson 'grus kyi rgyu gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi rgyu gnyis pa'o //
translated: This is the application of compassion, the second cause of effort.

original: skyes shing skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams yongs su shes par rab tu sbyor bas kun nas nyon mongs pa med ba'i brtson 'grus zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: skyes shing skyes pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams yongs su shes par rab tu sbyor bas kun nas nyon mongs pa med ba'i brtson 'grus zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The third cause is: “He applies himself to the complete knowledge of the afflictions that arise, because he has attained the effort that is free from afflictions.”🔽The cause of the effort of sameness is wisdom.

original: mnyam pa nyid kyi btson 'grus kyi rgyu ni shes rab yin no //
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyi btson 'grus kyi rgyu ni shes rab yin no //
translated: The fourth cause is: “He applies himself to the accumulation of the requisites of merit and knowledge because he has attained the effort that is applied to the accumulation.”🔽The fifth cause is: “He applies himself to the purification of his sphere of action because he has attained the effort that is applied to purification.”🔽The sixth cause is: “He applies himself to the purification of his mental continuum because he has attained the effort that is applied to the purification of the mental continuum.”🔽The seventh cause is: “He applies himself to the purification of his superknowledges because he has attained the effort that is applied to the purification of the superknowledges.”🔽The eighth cause is: “He applies himself to the purification of his skill in liberative art because he has attained the effort that is applied to the purification of skill in liberative art.”🔽The ninth cause is: “He applies himself to the purification of his knowledge because he has attained the effort that is applied to the purification of knowledge.”🔽The tenth cause is: “He applies himself to the purification of his wisdom because he has attained the effort that is applied to the purification of wisdom.”

original: sdud par byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'dren par byed pa'i rgyu ste /
analyzed: sdud par byed pa'i rgyu zhes bya ba ni 'dren par byed pa'i rgyu ste /
translated: The eleventh cause is: “He applies himself to the purification of his means of attraction because he has attained the effort that is applied to the purification of the means of attraction.”🔽The twelfth cause is: “He applies himself to the purification of his knowledge of the world because he has attained the effort that is applied to the purification of knowledge of the world.”

original: sgrub par byed pa zhes byas nas rgyu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa zhes byas nas rgyu gsum pa'o //
translated: The thirteenth cause is: “He applies himself to the purification of his knowledge of the arts and crafts because he has attained the effort that is applied to the purification of knowledge of the arts and crafts.”🔽The fourteenth cause is: “He applies himself to the purification of his knowledge of the treatises because he has attained the effort that is applied to the purification of knowledge of the treatises.”🔽The

original: thams cad kyi sgo nas brtson 'grus ni yang dag par spong bas bsdus pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgo nas brtson 'grus ni yang dag par spong bas bsdus pa ste /
translated: Effort in all ways is included in the correct exertions.

original: de rdzogs par byed pa'i thabs kyis yongs su bsdus pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa ni gnyis dang gnyis kyis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de rdzogs par byed pa'i thabs kyis yongs su bsdus pa dang / rnam par gzhag pa ni gnyis dang gnyis kyis bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the method of perfecting it is included in the two, and that the establishment of it is included in the two.

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnam par spong par byed pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par spong ba snga ma dag gis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi chos rnam par spong par byed pa zhes bya ba ni yang dag par spong ba snga ma dag gis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: The phrase “the elimination of defiled things” is included in the former correct exertions.

original: dge ba'i chos rnams skyed par byed pa ni phyi ma dag gis bsdus pa yin no ;
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams skyed par byed pa ni phyi ma dag gis bsdus pa yin no ;
translated: The phrase “the production of virtuous things” is included in the latter correct exertions.

original: yongs su dag pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi kun du spyod pas ni yang dag par spong ba dang po gnyis kyis sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i zhes bya ba las yongs su dag par byed pa dag gi thabs kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi kun du spyod pas ni yang dag par spong ba dang po gnyis kyis sgom pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i zhes bya ba las yongs su dag par byed pa dag gi thabs kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: The phrase “the cultivation of the method of purifying one’s conduct of body, speech, and mind” is included in the first two correct exertions. The phrase “the perfection of cultivation” is included in the latter two correct exertions.

original: ye shes kyi khyad par thob par gyur pa dang / dge ba'i chos la yang dag par sbyor bas ye shes rnam par 'phel bar byed pa ni phyi ma gnyis rnam par dag par byed pa'i thabs kyi rgyu yin no //
analyzed: ye shes kyi khyad par thob par gyur pa dang / dge ba'i chos la yang dag par sbyor bas ye shes rnam par 'phel bar byed pa ni phyi ma gnyis rnam par dag par byed pa'i thabs kyi rgyu yin no //
translated: The cause of the means of purification is the increase of wisdom through the attainment of the distinctive wisdom and through the correct application to virtuous qualities.

original: rnam par dag par byed pa zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa'i las kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag par byed pa zhes bya ba ni lus la sogs pa'i las kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ste /
translated: Purification is the non-defiled activity of body, etc.🔽because it is exclusively virtuous.

original: gcig tu dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig tu dge ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the collection because it collects virtuous qualities.🔽The establishment of the virtues of the bodhisattvas is the cause of the means of purification.🔽The cause of the means of original: dge ba'i chos rnams nye bar sogs pa'i phyir sdud par byed pa'o ;🔽/ ma skyes pa las skye pa ni yang dag par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos rnams nye bar sogs pa'i phyir sdud par byed pa'o ; / ma skyes pa las skye pa ni yang dag par sgrub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The cause of the means of purification is the increase of wisdom through the attainment of the distinctive wisdom and through the correct application to virtuous qualities.

original: skyes pa rnams khyad par du 'gro ba ni rnam par 'phel bar byed pa'o //🔽skyes bu dman pa rnams kyi btson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa ni skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi brtson 'grus rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes pa rnams khyad par du 'gro ba ni rnam par 'phel bar byed pa'o //🔽skyes bu dman pa rnams kyi btson 'grus kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa ni skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi brtson 'grus rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The cause of the means of purification is the increase of wisdom through the attainment of the distinctive wisdom and through the correct application

original: dman pa rnams ni 'dun pa dang mos skyes pa rnams kyang 'dor bar byed do //
analyzed: dman pa rnams ni 'dun pa dang mos skyes pa rnams kyang 'dor bar byed do //
translated: The inferior person abandons the aspiration and the interest that have arisen.

original: de las bzlog pa ni skyes bu dam ba ste /
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni skyes bu dam ba ste /
translated: The opposite is the case for the excellent person.

original: 'dun pa skyed par byed do zhes byas nas so //🔽dman pa rnams ni brtsams nas kyang 'dor bar byed de /
analyzed: 'dun pa skyed par byed do zhes byas nas so // dman pa rnams ni brtsams nas kyang 'dor bar byed de /
translated: He generates the aspiration and interest that have not arisen.

original: sbyor ba mi brtan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyor ba mi brtan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The inferior person abandons the undertaking, because his application is unstable.🔽The opposite is the case for the excellent person.

original: de las bzlog pa rnams ni phyir zhing rtsom pa khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa'i @189b phyir 'phel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa rnams ni phyir zhing rtsom pa khyad par du 'phags pa dang ldan pa'i @189b phyir 'phel bar byed pa'o //
translated: He increases the undertaking, because his application is stable.

original: brtson 'grus rtsom pa la zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ges ni rtag tu byed pa dang gus par byed pa'i sbyor bas brtson 'grus brtsams pa'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rtsom pa la zhes bya ba'i mdo'i tshig ges ni rtag tu byed pa dang gus par byed pa'i sbyor bas brtson 'grus brtsams pa'o //
translated: The phrase “he undertakes with vigour” in the verse refers to the undertaking of vigour by means of constant and reverential application.

original: sems mi 'gong zhing sgyid lug pa med pa ni rab tu spro ba nyid do //
analyzed: sems mi 'gong zhing sgyid lug pa med pa ni rab tu spro ba nyid do //
translated: He does not become fainthearted or discouraged, because he is full of joy.

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i sgrub pas 'bras bu nye bar byed pa'i phyir dang yang dag par spong bas phyin ci ma log par spangs pa bstan pa'i phyir mgo'am gos la me 'bar ba gsod pa la brtson pa lta bu'i sbyor bas myur du brtson 'grus rtsom pa
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i sgrub pas 'bras bu nye bar byed pa'i phyir dang yang dag par spong bas phyin ci ma log par spangs pa bstan pa'i phyir mgo'am gos la me 'bar ba gsod pa la brtson pa lta bu'i sbyor bas myur du brtson 'grus rtsom pa
translated: Since it brings about the result through unerring practice and since it is taught that right effort is unerring abandonment, he practices with the application of one who strives to extinguish a fire on his head or clothes.

original: ni brtun te sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: ni brtun te sbyor ba'o //
translated: This is the practice of one who is diligent.

original: yon tan rnam pa thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad de bsdus pa dang so so'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan rnam pa thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i phyir rnam pa thams cad de bsdus pa dang so so'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is of all types because it is adorned with all the virtues, since it is taught as a collection and as individual types.

original: dus rtag tu 'jug pa'i phyir rtag pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus rtag tu 'jug pa'i phyir rtag pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: It is constant effort because it is applied at all times.

original: 'dun pa drag po'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas gus pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dun pa drag po'i sbyor ba dang ldan pas gus pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: It is respectful effort because it is applied with intense aspiration.

original: mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i gnas skabs kyi rgyu'i stobs las kun du 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa'i sa'i gnas skabs kyi rgyu'i stobs las kun du 'byung ba'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: It is natural effort because it arises from the power of the cause, the stage of action out of faith.

original: skyes shing 'byung ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir sbyor ba la byung ba'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: skyes shing 'byung ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyis zil gyis mi non pa'i phyir sbyor ba la byung ba'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the “diligence of application” because it is not overcome by adverse conditions that arise and occur.

original: sdug bsngal drag cing rtsub pa'i reg pa thams cad kyis mi ldog cing skyo ba med pa ni 'khrugs pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sdug bsngal drag cing rtsub pa'i reg pa thams cad kyis mi ldog cing skyo ba med pa ni 'khrugs pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the “diligence of agitation” because it is not turned back by any painful, harsh contact, and it is not discouraged.

original: brtson 'grus brtsams nas 'bras bu mthar thug pa'i bar du 'gro ba nyid ni chog mi shes pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus brtsams nas 'bras bu mthar thug pa'i bar du 'gro ba nyid ni chog mi shes pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the “insatiable diligence” because, having begun the diligence, one proceeds to the ultimate fruit.

original: brtson 'grus rnam pa drug po 'di ni mdo'i tshig drug dang yang dag par sbyar bar byas te /🔽brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid ni rtag pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus rnam pa drug po 'di ni mdo'i tshig drug dang yang dag par sbyar bar byas te / brtson 'grus brtsams pa nyid ni rtag pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: This sixfold diligence should be applied to the six statements of the sūtra.🔽It is called the “diligence of constancy” because one is diligent in the practice.

original: brtson 'grus kyi mthu dang stobs thob pa'i phyir gus pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi mthu dang stobs thob pa'i phyir gus pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the “diligence of respect” because one obtains the power and strength of diligence.

original: khyad par can gyi brtson 'grus kyi sbyor ba'i rgyu mthun pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi brtson 'grus kyi sbyor ba'i rgyu mthun pa'i brtson 'grus dang ldan pa'i phyir rgyu mthun pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the effort of natural outcome because it is endowed with the effort of natural outcome that is the cause of the application of special effort.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs kyi stobs kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis mnan nas spro ba dang ldan pa'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs kyi stobs kyis mi mthun pa'i phyogs zil gyis mnan nas spro ba dang ldan pa'i phyir sbyor ba las byung ba'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the effort of application because it is endowed with enthusiasm that overwhelms the counteragent by the power of the side of the counteragent.

original: brtun pa brten pa'i phyir mi 'khrus pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: brtun pa brten pa'i phyir mi 'khrus pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the effort of non-defilement because it is endowed with the support of effort.

original: ngan don tsam gyis chog mi shes pa'i phyir brtson pa mi gtong ba zhes bya'o /
analyzed: ngan don tsam gyis chog mi shes pa'i phyir brtson pa mi gtong ba zhes bya'o /
translated: It is called the effort of non-abandonment because it is not satisfied with just a little.

original: brtson 'grus gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'dun pa drag po dang ldan bar gyur pa dang / smon lam mang du 'debs pa ni 'dun pa dang ldan pa'i go cha'i brtson 'grus zhes @190a * //
analyzed: brtson 'grus gang gis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'dun pa drag po dang ldan bar gyur pa dang / smon lam mang du 'debs pa ni 'dun pa dang ldan pa'i go cha'i brtson 'grus zhes @190a * //
translated: The effort by which one becomes endowed with intense aspiration for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and makes many aspirations is called the armor effort of aspiration.

original: bya'o // dge ba'i sems ma skyes pa'i mi mthun pa nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs dang mthun zhing zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bya'o // dge ba'i sems ma skyes pa'i mi mthun pa nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs dang mthun zhing zhes bya'o //
translated: One should not be confused about the wholesome dharmas that have arisen, because they are not lost due to the possession of the concordance with the side of the antidote to the affliction that is the opposite of the wholesome mind that has not yet arisen.🔽One should increase and expand them.🔽One should not abide together with the arisen afflictions, because one should abandon them.🔽One should possess the special antidote, because it is the antidote itself.🔽One should seek the wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen, because one should generate them.🔽One should not be confused about the wholesome dharmas that have arisen, because one should not lose them.🔽One should increase and expand them, because one should expand them.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa gnyis rnam par spangs pas mthun pa dang ldan pas dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams mi 'phrogs pa la gnas pas mi rmongs pa'i phyir rnal du gnas pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa gnyis rnam par spangs pas mthun pa dang ldan pas dge ba'i chos skyes pa rnams mi 'phrogs pa la gnas pas mi rmongs pa'i phyir rnal du gnas pa ste /
translated: One should abandon the arisen afflictions, because one should not abide together with them.🔽One should possess the special antidote, because it is the antidote itself.🔽One should seek the wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen, because one should generate them.🔽One should not be confused about the wholesome dharmas that have arisen, because one should not lose them.

original: 'phel zhing spangs par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phel zhing spangs par 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: One should increase and expand them, because one should expand them.🔽One should abandon the arisen afflictions, because one should not abide together with them.🔽One should possess the special antidote, because it is the antidote itself.🔽One should seek the wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen, because one should generate them.🔽One should not be confused about the wholesome dharmas that have arisen, because one should not lose them.🔽One should increase and expand them, because one should expand them.🔽One should abandon the arisen afflictions, because one should not abide together with them.

original: nyon mongs pa skyes pa rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas pas spong bar byed pas gnyen po'i phyogs nyid yin pa'i phyir khyad par can dang ldan pa'i phyir khyad par can zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa skyes pa rnams dang lhan cig mi gnas pas spong bar byed pas gnyen po'i phyogs nyid yin pa'i phyir khyad par can dang ldan pa'i phyir khyad par can zhes bya'o //
translated: One should possess the special antidote, because it is the antidote itself.🔽One should seek the wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen, because one should generate them.🔽One should not be confused about the wholesome dharmas that have arisen, because one should not lose them.

original: rig pa'i gnas mngon par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i phyir dang / de thob par byed pa'i lam nas zhugs pa nye bar bzung nas tshol ba pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas mngon par rtogs pa'i sbyor ba'i sgo nas zhugs pa'i phyir dang / de thob par byed pa'i lam nas zhugs pa nye bar bzung nas tshol ba pa zhes bya'o //
translated: One should increase and expand them, because one should expand them.🔽One should abandon the arisen afflictions, because one should not abide together with them.🔽One should possess the special antidote, because it is the antidote itself.🔽One should seek the wholesome dharmas that have not yet arisen, because one should generate them.🔽One should not be confused about the wholesome dharmas that have arisen, because one should not lose them

original: khong du chud pa'i rig pa'i gnas rnams la sgom zhing nan tan byed pas slob pa ni slob pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: khong du chud pa'i rig pa'i gnas rnams la sgom zhing nan tan byed pas slob pa ni slob pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: The effort of learning is the effort of study and practice in the sciences that are to be understood.

original: sems can thams cad kyi don gyi bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir pha rol gyi don byed pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi don gyi bya ba dang ldan pa'i phyir pha rol gyi don byed pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: The effort of accomplishing the aims of others is the effort to accomplish the aims of all sentient beings.

original: nyes pa byas pa las slar gso ba'i sbyor ba ni kun nas srung ba'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyes pa byas pa las slar gso ba'i sbyor ba ni kun nas srung ba'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: The effort of protection is the effort to restore from faults that have been committed.🔽The effort of faith is the effort that is preceded by faith and aspiration.🔽The effort of the side of the antidote is the effort to obtain the side of the antidote and to abandon the side of the counteragent.🔽The effort of practice is the effort to practice the Dharma of transmission and realization.

original: mngon par mos pa dang / 'dun pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / gnyen po'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'thob pa dang spong ba'i brtson 'grus dang / lung dang rtogs pa'i chos la nan tan byed pa'i brtson 'grus dang / sems can gyi don la nan tan byed pa'i brtson 'grus dang /
analyzed: mngon par mos pa dang / 'dun pa sngon du 'gro ba dang / gnyen po'i phyogs dang / mi mthun pa'i phyogs 'thob pa dang spong ba'i brtson 'grus dang / lung dang rtogs pa'i chos la nan tan byed pa'i brtson 'grus dang / sems can gyi don la nan tan byed pa'i brtson 'grus dang /
translated: The effort of accomplishing the aims of sentient beings is the effort to accomplish the aims of sentient beings.

original: bslab pa rjes su srung ba'i brtson 'grus te /
analyzed: bslab pa rjes su srung ba'i brtson 'grus te /
translated: The effort of guarding the training is the effort to guard the training.

original: bdun po 'di dag gi dbang du byas nas ji ltar rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bdun po 'di dag gi dbang du byas nas ji ltar rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: These seven should be understood as appropriate.

original: bzod pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rnam pa brgyad du'o //
analyzed: bzod pa bzhin du zhes bya ba ni rnam pa brgyad du'o //
translated: Like patience, means in eight aspects.

original: slong mo'i don du sdug bsngal ba'i sems can rnams 'ongs pa la bzod pa zhes bya ba de 'dir brtson 'grus zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
analyzed: slong mo'i don du sdug bsngal ba'i sems can rnams 'ongs pa la bzod pa zhes bya ba de 'dir brtson 'grus zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan te /
translated: Patience toward those who come for alms, who are suffering sentient beings, is taught here by means of effort, etc.

original: sems can gzhan dag la yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can gzhan dag la yang de bzhin no //
translated: And so it is for other sentient beings.

original: spyod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod pa dang rjes su mthun pa'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is applied in accordance with the practice.

original: 'tsham pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir gang dang gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'tsham pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir gang dang gang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: In order to demonstrate the appropriateness, he says, whatever, etc.

original: dus ring por yongs su 'dris pa'i dngos po la sbyor ba'i phyir goms pa dang zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dus ring por yongs su 'dris pa'i dngos po la sbyor ba'i phyir goms pa dang zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called cultivation because it is applied to things that are well known for a long time.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su yang rgyun mi 'chad par gus par sbyor ba'i phyir mi g-yel ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus su yang rgyun mi 'chad par gus par sbyor ba'i phyir mi g-yel ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called assiduous because it is applied respectfully without interruption in the future.

original: bdag nyid kyang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen par mi byed pa'i dus sam /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang lta ba mchog tu 'dzin pa la mngon par zhen par mi byed pa'i dus sam /
translated: One should not cling to the view that one's own view is the best.

original: gzhan dag las gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa bzung nas sgrub par byed pa'i dus su yang rung phyin ni ma log pa'i lta ba'i dbang gis yang dag par @190b mtshon pa'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir legs par zin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag las gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa bzung nas sgrub par byed pa'i dus su yang rung phyin ni ma log pa'i lta ba'i dbang gis yang dag par @190b mtshon pa'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir legs par zin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Or, at the time of receiving instruction and counsel from others, and at the time of practice, it is called 'well-taken' because it is the application of correct understanding through the power of the unmistaken view.

original: mtshan ma bsgom pa'i dus su sbyor ba'i phyir dus su goms par brtson pa zhes bstan te //
analyzed: mtshan ma bsgom pa'i dus su sbyor ba'i phyir dus su goms par brtson pa zhes bstan te //
translated: Because it is applied at the time of cultivating the signs, it is called striving in familiarization at the proper time.

original: mtshan ma rnam pa drug la mkhas pa ni mtshan ma rtog pa dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma rnam pa drug la mkhas pa ni mtshan ma rtog pa dang ldan pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: Skill in the six signs is called effort endowed with the imagination of signs.

original: mtshan ma nyid kyang dang po nyid du ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pas nye bar mtshon nas mtshan ma rnams yang dag par bzung nas mi brjed par mtshon pa'i dus su yongs su shes shing rab tu rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma nyid kyang dang po nyid du ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pas nye bar mtshon nas mtshan ma rnams yang dag par bzung nas mi brjed par mtshon pa'i dus su yongs su shes shing rab tu rtogs pa'o //
translated: Having first correctly understood the signs, one should correctly apprehend the signs and not forget them. At the time of understanding and realizing them, one should not be satisfied with just a little understanding and realization, but should strive for complete understanding and realization.

original: zab pa ni de kho na'i don khong du chud pa'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: zab pa ni de kho na'i don khong du chud pa'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: Profound is the effort of one who has understood the meaning of reality.

original: mthu rnams khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i brtson 'grus so //
analyzed: mthu rnams khong du chud par bya ba'i phyir sbyor ba ni bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i brtson 'grus so //
translated: Inconceivable is the effort of one who is engaged in the realization of the powers.

original: bdag nyid la khyad du mi gsod pa ni de dag kyang mir gyur pas 'di lta bu'i brtson 'grus brtsams kyis bdag kyang mir gyur pa yin pas rim gyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes go cha ba go bar byed cing /
analyzed: bdag nyid la khyad du mi gsod pa ni de dag kyang mir gyur pas 'di lta bu'i brtson 'grus brtsams kyis bdag kyang mir gyur pa yin pas rim gyis bsgrub par bya'o zhes go cha ba go bar byed cing /
translated: One does not despise oneself, thinking, “They have become human beings and have begun such effort, and I have become a human being and will gradually accomplish it.”

original: go cha chen po'i sbyor ba mi 'dor zhing bdag gis mi nus so zhes bya ba'i 'du shes yid la mi byed pa'i phyir zhum par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: go cha chen po'i sbyor ba mi 'dor zhing bdag gis mi nus so zhes bya ba'i 'du shes yid la mi byed pa'i phyir zhum par mi byed pa'o //
translated: One does not become discouraged, thinking, “I cannot do it,” and one does not abandon the practice of the great armor.

original: bar mdor ldog par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir chog pa med pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bar mdor ldog par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir chog pa med pa'i brtson 'grus zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called insatiable effort because one does not turn back in the middle.

original: bcu po 'di dag ni rnam par dag pa'i brtson 'grus kyi rnam pa yin no //
analyzed: bcu po 'di dag ni rnam par dag pa'i brtson 'grus kyi rnam pa yin no //
translated: These ten are the aspects of pure effort.

original: mdor bsdu na sbyor ba rnam pa lngas rnam par dag par rig par bya ste /🔽ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba rnam par dag pa dang rjes su skrag pa dang / yang dag par dga' ba dang bral ba'i sgrub pa rnam par dag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs kyi sbyor ba rnam par dag pa dang / zhi gnas kyi sbyor ba rnam par dag pa dang /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na sbyor ba rnam pa lngas rnam par dag par rig par bya ste / ting nge 'dzin gyi sbyor ba rnam par dag pa dang rjes su skrag pa dang / yang dag par dga' ba dang bral ba'i sgrub pa rnam par dag pa dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi tshogs kyi sbyor ba rnam par dag pa dang / zhi gnas kyi sbyor ba rnam par dag pa dang /
translated: In brief, it should be understood as pure through five kinds of application.

original: bras bu'i khyad par la sbyor ba rnam par dag pa ste /
analyzed: bras bu'i khyad par la sbyor ba rnam par dag pa ste /
translated: The application to concentration is pure, the application to the absence of fear and joy is pure, the application to the requisites of concentration is pure, the application to serenity is pure, and the application to the distinctive result is pure.

original: ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: They should be applied as appropriate.

original: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u'i 'grel pa ste bcu gnyis pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u'i 'grel pa ste bcu gnyis pa rdzogs so /
translated: This was the commentary to the twelfth chapter on the perfection of effort.

original: // / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa ni bzhir rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: // / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi bsam gtan gyi ngo bo nyid kyi rnam pa ni bzhir rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The nature of the bodhisattvas' concentration should be posited in four ways.

original: 'gang yang dmigs pa nyid smras pa /
analyzed: 'gang yang dmigs pa nyid smras pa /
translated: The object of concentration is the same as the object of wisdom.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thos pa dang bsam pa sngon du 'gro ba'i zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i mdo sde shin tu rgyas pa thos pa dang / de'i don bsam pa sngon du 'gro bar byas nas bsgom pa dang ldan pas bskyed pa'i sems rtse gcig pa gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thos pa dang bsam pa sngon du 'gro ba'i zhes bya ba ni theg pa chen po'i mdo sde shin tu rgyas pa thos pa dang / de'i don bsam pa sngon du 'gro bar byas nas bsgom pa dang ldan pas bskyed pa'i sems rtse gcig pa gang yin pa de ni dmigs pa zhes bya bar rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: Why is it called the meditative concentration of the bodhisattvas?🔽Because it is the meditative development of the factors of enlightenment, which are based upon the meditative concentrations.🔽Why is it called the meditative concentration of the bodhisattvas?🔽Because it is the meditative development of the factors of enlightenment, which are based upon the meditative concentrations.🔽Why is it called the meditative concentration of the bodhisattvas?🔽Because it is the meditative development of the factors of enlightenment, which are based upon the meditative concentrations.🔽Why is it called the meditative concentration of the bodhisattvas?🔽Because it is the meditative development of the factors of enlightenment, which are based upon the meditative concentrations.🔽Why is it called the meditative concentration of the bodhisattvas?

original: bsam gtan gyi dbang du byas pa'i chos rnams de las skyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi dbang du byas pa'i chos rnams de las skyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the meditative development of the factors of enlightenment, which are based upon the meditative concentrations.

original: gang gi phyir rnam pa smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir rnam pa smras pa /
translated: Why is it called the meditative concentration of the bodhisattvas?🔽Because it is the meditative development of the factors of enlightenment, which are based upon the meditative concentrations.

original: 'jig rten pa dang / @191a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / @191a * //
translated: Why is it called the meditative concentration of the bodhisattvas?🔽Because it is the meditative development of the factors of enlightenment, which are based upon the meditative concentrations.🔽Why is it called the meditative concentration of the bodhisattvas?🔽Because it is the meditative development of the factors of enlightenment, which are based upon the meditative concentrations.🔽Why is it called the meditative concentration of the bodhisattvas?

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i rnam pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pa'i rnam pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because it is the meditative development of the factors of enlightenment, which are based upon the meditative concentrations.

original: ngo bo nyid gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: Why is it called the meditative concentration of the bodhisattvas?🔽Because it is the meditative development of the factors of enlightenment, which are based upon the meditative concentrations.🔽Why is it called the meditative concentration of the bodhisattvas?🔽Because it is the meditative development of the factors of enlightenment, which are based upon the meditative concentrations.🔽Why is it called

original: sems rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba la dmigs pa gcig la sems rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i rgyun gyis 'jug pa ni sems rtse gcig pa zhes bya ste ;
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa zhes bya ba la dmigs pa gcig la sems rnam par mi g-yeng ba'i rgyun gyis 'jug pa ni sems rtse gcig pa zhes bya ste ;
translated: One-pointedness of mind means that the mind is engaged in a continuous, undistracted manner with respect to a single object.

original: dmigs pa la gtad pas zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: dmigs pa la gtad pas zhes byas nas so //
translated: This is called one-pointedness of mind.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: sems gnas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sems gnas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the stability of mind.

original: rab tu dbye ba ni gang gi phyir smras pa /🔽zhi gnas kyi phyogs sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba ni gang gi phyir smras pa / zhi gnas kyi phyogs sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The analysis is as follows:

original: bsam gtan gyi rtsa ba ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs yin la /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi rtsa ba ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs yin la /
translated: It is said that the root of meditative concentration is the side of serenity,

original: nye bar gyur pa ni lhag mthong gi phyogs yin no //
analyzed: nye bar gyur pa ni lhag mthong gi phyogs yin no //
translated: the proximate state is the side of insight,

original: gzhi la brten nas 'phags pa'i lam skye bas gnyis ka'i phyogs so //
analyzed: gzhi la brten nas 'phags pa'i lam skye bas gnyis ka'i phyogs so //
translated: and the basis is the side of both.

original: yang na sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs so //
analyzed: yang na sems gnas pa rnam pa dgu ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs so //
translated: Or else, the nine mental states are the side of serenity,

original: sems gnas pa rnam pa bzhi ni lhag mthong gi phyogs so //
analyzed: sems gnas pa rnam pa bzhi ni lhag mthong gi phyogs so //
translated: the four mental states are the side of insight,

original: 'phags pa'i lam ni gnyi ga'i phyogs so //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam ni gnyi ga'i phyogs so //
translated: and the noble path is the side of both.

original: bdag nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad dang / bdag nyid kyi bya ba thams cad kyi dbang du byas nas bsam gtan thams cad rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi rnam pa thams cad dang / bdag nyid kyi bya ba thams cad kyi dbang du byas nas bsam gtan thams cad rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: All meditative concentrations are to be established in terms of all the aspects of the self and all the activities of the self.

original: bsam gtan thams cad kyi rnam pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bsam gtan thams cad kyi rnam pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: All meditative concentrations have two aspects:

original: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'o //
translated: mundane and transcendental.

original: bya ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: bya ba ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: They have three activities:

original: tshe 'di la bde bar reg par bya ba'i phyir gnas pa ni bde bar gnas par bya ba'i bsam gtan zhes bya ste /
analyzed: tshe 'di la bde bar reg par bya ba'i phyir gnas pa ni bde bar gnas par bya ba'i bsam gtan zhes bya ste /
translated: The meditative concentration that is a means of attaining happiness in this life is called the meditative concentration of happiness in this life.

original: rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud du gtogs pa yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because it causes the ripening of one's own continuum.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan sgrub pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan sgrub pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya ba ni sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meditative concentration that is the accomplishment of the virtues of meditative concentration is called the meditative concentration of the accomplishment of virtues. It is because it causes the ripening of the qualities of a Buddha.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan ni sems can yongs su smin par byed pa nyid do //
translated: The meditative concentration that is the performance of the aims of sentient beings is called the meditative concentration of the performance of the aims of sentient beings. It is because it causes the ripening of sentient beings.

original: re zhig byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba ni 'di tsam ste /
analyzed: re zhig byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba ni 'di tsam ste /
translated: This is the extent of the bodhisattva's activities.

original: gang yang bdag gi rgyud snod du rung bar bya ba dang snod du rung bar gyur nas sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang yang bdag gi rgyud snod du rung bar bya ba dang snod du rung bar gyur nas sangs rgyas kyi chos dang / sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
translated: The first is the meditative concentration of one who is a beginner, who has newly undertaken the bodhisattva vow.

original: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ci rigs par zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The second is the meditative concentration of one who has entered the stages, who has attained the stages.🔽The third is the meditative concentration of one who has not attained the stages, who has not attained the stages.🔽The fourth is the meditative concentration of one who has a purified attitude, who has attained the stages.🔽The first is the meditative concentration of one who is not free of conceptualization, who has not attained the stages.🔽The second is the meditative concentration of one who is free of conceptualization, who has attained the stages.🔽The third is the meditative concentration of one who is free of conceptualization, who has not attained the stages.🔽The fourth is the meditative concentration of one who is free of conceptualization, who has attained the stages.🔽The first is the meditative concentration of one who is not free of conceptualization, who has not attained the stages.🔽The second is the meditative concentration of one who is free of conceptualization, who has attained the stages.🔽The third is the meditative concentration of one who is free of conceptualization, who has not attained the stages.

original: sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan rnam par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi don bya ba'i bsam gtan rnam par spangs pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the meditative concentration of one who is free of conceptualization, who has attained the stages.🔽The first is the meditative concentration of one who is not free of conceptualization, who has not attained the stages.🔽The second is the meditative concentration of one who is free of conceptualization, who has attained the stages.

original: 'jig rten pa'i ni rnam pa gsum yang yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i ni rnam pa gsum yang yin no //
translated: The third is the meditative concentration of one who is free of conceptualization, who has not attained the stages.🔽The fourth is the meditative concentration of one who is free of conceptualization, who has attained the stages.🔽The first is the meditative concentration of one who is not free of conceptualization, who has not attained the stages.🔽The second is the meditative concentration of one who is free of conceptualization, who has attained the stages.🔽The third is the meditative concentration of one who is free of conceptualization, who has not attained the stages.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi spangs pa'i bsam gtan ni tshe 'di nyid la bde bar gnas pa yang dag par sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i rab tu rgyu ba dang bral ba ni gang gi phyir smras @191b
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa bzhi spangs pa'i bsam gtan ni tshe 'di nyid la bde bar gnas pa yang dag par sgrub par byed pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i rab tu rgyu ba dang bral ba ni gang gi phyir smras @191b
translated: The fourth is the meditative concentration of one who is free of conceptualization, who has attained the stages.

original: pa ; rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: pa ; rnam par rtog pa thams cad dang bral ba zhes bya ba la /
translated: The first is the meditative concentration of one who is not free of conceptualization, who has not attained the stages.🔽The second is the meditative concentration

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa rnams so //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni ngo bo nyid kyi rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa sngar bstan pa rnams so //
translated: All conceptual thoughts are those previously mentioned, such as conceptual thoughts of essential natures.

original: de khyad par can du gyur pa las shin tu sbyangs pas bskyed pas mchog tu rab tu zhi ba zhes bya ba la /🔽rten la phan 'dogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pas shin tu sbyangs pas bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: de khyad par can du gyur pa las shin tu sbyangs pas bskyed pas mchog tu rab tu zhi ba zhes bya ba la / rten la phan 'dogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pas shin tu sbyangs pas bskyed pa'o //
translated: It is called “supremely peaceful” because it is generated by pliancy, which is a special benefit to the basis.

original: rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir mchog tu zhi ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa'i phyir mchog tu zhi ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is called “supremely peaceful” because it functions naturally.

original: lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir rlom sems dang bral ba zhes bya'o /
analyzed: lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir rlom sems dang bral ba zhes bya'o /
translated: It is called “free of conceit” because it is free of the defilement of views.

original: sred pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro myong ba med pa'o //
analyzed: sred pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro myong ba med pa'o //
translated: It is called “free of experience” because it is free of the defilement of craving.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i longs spyod thams cad spangs pa'i phyir mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i longs spyod thams cad spangs pa'i phyir mtshan ma thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is called “free of all signs” because it abandons all enjoyments such as form.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin tha dad pa ni mang bas na sna tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin tha dad pa ni mang bas na sna tshogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The concentrations of the bodhisattvas are various because they are manifold and distinct.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid ni de dag gi ming yang spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab pa nyid ni de dag gi ming yang spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are inconceivable because their names are not within the range of those who are not bodhisattvas.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: ming yang mi shes na zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ming yang mi shes na zhes bya ba'o //
translated: If one does not even know their names, how much less could one know their concentrations?

original: ngo bo yang spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir tshad med pa nyid do //
analyzed: ngo bo yang spyod yul ma yin pa'i phyir tshad med pa nyid do //
translated: They are immeasurable because their essence is not within the range of those who are not bodhisattvas.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: snyoms par 'jug par ltag la 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug par ltag la 'gyur zhes bya ba'o //
translated: How could one enter into their concentrations?

original: yon tan sgrub pa'i bsam gtan bstan pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan rnams nges par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan sgrub pa'i bsam gtan bstan pas khyad par du 'phags pa'i yon tan rnams nges par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The concentrations of the bodhisattvas are superior to those of the disciples because they are taught as the meditative development of the perfections.

original: nyan thos dang thun mong ba rnams zhes bya ba ni ming nyid kyis yin gyi rgya che ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos dang thun mong ba rnams zhes bya ba ni ming nyid kyis yin gyi rgya che ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Those that are common to the disciples are so called by name, not by their extent.
