original: bsam gtan la brten nas de'i stobs kyis sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don bdag gi lus sprul pa dus gcig tu spros pas sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal sel ba dang / phan pa byas pa rnams la lan du phan 'dogs pa'i phyir du byed pa dang /
analyzed: bsam gtan la brten nas de'i stobs kyis sems can dpag tu med pa rnams kyi don bdag gi lus sprul pa dus gcig tu spros pas sdug bsngal ba rnams kyi sdug bsngal sel ba dang / phan pa byas pa rnams la lan du phan 'dogs pa'i phyir du byed pa dang /
translated: On the basis of meditative concentration, through its power, one emanates many bodies for the sake of countless sentient beings, simultaneously, in order to dispel the sufferings of those who suffer, to repay the benefits that have been conferred on oneself,

original: 'jigs pa rnams las srung ba dang / sdug bsngal bar gnas pa rnams kyi mya ngan sel ba dang / skrag par byed pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa rnams las srung ba dang / sdug bsngal bar gnas pa rnams kyi mya ngan sel ba dang / skrag par byed pa'i bar du'o //
translated: to protect those who are afraid, to dispel the sorrow of those who are miserable, and even to frighten the overbearing.

original: de lta bu'i bsam gtan gyi sems can rnams kyi bya ba sgrub par byed pa ni sems can gyi don byed pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o /
analyzed: de lta bu'i bsam gtan gyi sems can rnams kyi bya ba sgrub par byed pa ni sems can gyi don byed pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o /
translated: Meditative concentration that accomplishes the aims of sentient beings in this way is called the meditative concentration that accomplishes the aims of sentient beings.

original: bya ba sgrub pa nyid la de dag las gzhan pa'i bsam gtan ni med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: bya ba sgrub pa nyid la de dag las gzhan pa'i bsam gtan ni med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to show that there is no meditative concentration other than that which accomplishes the aims of sentient beings, he says:

original: 'di las gong na yang med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di las gong na yang med ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: There is no higher than this.

original: bsam gtan las yongs su ma nyams pa'i rnam par smin pa'i skye ba gzhan dag gis bzlog par dka' ba gang yin pa bzlog pa ni dka' ba'i bsam gtan yin no //🔽byang chub sems dpa' bsam @192a * //
analyzed: bsam gtan las yongs su ma nyams pa'i rnam par smin pa'i skye ba gzhan dag gis bzlog par dka' ba gang yin pa bzlog pa ni dka' ba'i bsam gtan yin no // byang chub sems dpa' bsam @192a * //
translated: The concentration that is difficult to do is the one that is difficult to overcome, because it is the one that is not overcome by other rebirths that are the results of concentration that has not degenerated.

original: gtan la brten nas bsam gtan dpag tu med pa grangs med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa gzhan dag gis mi nus pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa la med pa gang yin pa de ni dka' ba'i bsam gtan gnyis pa dang gsum pa'o //
analyzed: gtan la brten nas bsam gtan dpag tu med pa grangs med pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa gzhan dag gis mi nus pa dang / nyan thos la sogs pa la med pa gang yin pa de ni dka' ba'i bsam gtan gnyis pa dang gsum pa'o //
translated: The second and third concentrations that are difficult to do are those that are not done by other bodhisattvas on the basis of immeasurable, innumerable, inconceivable concentrations, and those that are not done by sravakas and so on.

original: dang po ni rtog dpyod dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: dang po ni rtog dpyod dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The first is associated with investigation and analysis.

original: gnyis pa ni yid bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni yid bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The second is associated with the faculty of mental pleasure.

original: gsum pa ni bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni bde ba'i dbang po dang ldan pa'o //
translated: The third is associated with the faculty of pleasure.

original: bzhi pa ni btang snyoms dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: bzhi pa ni btang snyoms dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The fourth is associated with equanimity.

original: phyin ci log gi mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: phyin ci log gi mdo'i rjes su 'brangs nas shes par bya'o //
translated: This should be understood according to the Sutra on the Errors.

original: rang gi rgyud kyi bde ba la 'jug pa nye bar gzung nas zag pa med pa'i dge ba ni ro myang ba med pa'i phyir skyes bu dam pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya ste sred pas ro ma myangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi rgyud kyi bde ba la 'jug pa nye bar gzung nas zag pa med pa'i dge ba ni ro myang ba med pa'i phyir skyes bu dam pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya ste sred pas ro ma myangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The concentration of the holy person is that which is undertaken by one who is engaged in his own happiness, because it is not relished, since it is not relished by craving.

original: sems can gzhan la bstan nas gnod sems la sogs pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs tshad med pa bzhi ni skyes bu dam pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o //🔽rnam pa drug ni yang rab tu dbye ba nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: sems can gzhan la bstan nas gnod sems la sogs pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs tshad med pa bzhi ni skyes bu dam pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o // rnam pa drug ni yang rab tu dbye ba nyid kyang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The concentration of the holy person is that which is undertaken by one who is engaged in the welfare of others, because it is the four immeasurables, such as friendliness, which are the counteragents to malice, etc.🔽The concentration of the bodhisattvas is sixfold:

original: phyogs kyi dbye ba yang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: phyogs kyi dbye ba yang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: 1. concentration of the Great Vehicle, 2. concentration of the perfections, 3. concentration of the stages, 4. concentration of retention, 5. concentration of the bodhisattvas, and 6. concentration of the Tathagata.🔽The first is the concentration of the bodhisattvas, the second is the concentration of the disciples and hermit buddhas, and the third is the concentration of the bodhisattvas, disciples, and hermit buddhas.

original: bya ba'i bye brag kyang rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: bya ba'i bye brag kyang rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattvas is twofold:🔽1. that which is common to the disciples and hermit buddhas, and 2. that which is uncommon to them.🔽The concentration of the bodhisattvas is sixfold:

original: rab tu dbye ba nyid ni byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan thams cad ni dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa ste /🔽nyon mongs pa can med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba nyid ni byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan thams cad ni dge ba dang / lung du ma bstan pa ste / nyon mongs pa can med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: 1. concentration of the Great Vehicle, 2. concentration of the perfections, 3. concentration of the stages, 4. concentration of retention, 5. concentration of the bodhisattvas, and 6. concentration of the Tathagata.

original: phyogs nyid kyi dbye ba ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs te /
analyzed: phyogs nyid kyi dbye ba ni zhi gnas kyi phyogs dang / lhag mthong gi phyogs te /
translated: The first is the concentration of the bodhisattvas, the second is the concentration of the disciples and hermit buddhas, and the third is the concentration of the bodhisattvas, disciples, and hermit buddhas.🔽The concentration of the bodhisattvas is twofold:🔽1. that which is common to the disciples and hermit buddhas, and 2. that which is uncommon to them.

original: ma 'dres pa'i dbye ba'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i dbye ba'o //
translated: The classification of the absorptions is finished.

original: de'i phyir gnyi ga'i phyogs ma smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyi ga'i phyogs ma smos so //
translated: Therefore, neither side is mentioned.

original: bya ba'i bye brag nyid ni gang yang bsam gtan la brten nas phyin ci ma log pa'i rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don la legs par sems pa ni don legs par nges par bsams pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba'i bye brag nyid ni gang yang bsam gtan la brten nas phyin ci ma log pa'i rang gi don dang gzhan gyi don la legs par sems pa ni don legs par nges par bsams pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
translated: The specific activity is that, based on the absorptions, one properly reflects on one's own and others' aims without error. This is called the absorption of properly determining the meaning.

original: mngon par bsgrub pa'i bsam gtan ni khyad par can gyi yon tan gyi rten du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par bsgrub pa'i bsam gtan ni khyad par can gyi yon tan gyi rten du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The absorption of accomplishment is the basis for special qualities.

original: rnam pa bdun ni mdor bsdus na dmigs pa nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa bdun ni mdor bsdus na dmigs pa nyid do //
translated: The seven aspects are summarized as the object.

original: bya ba nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba nyid du rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: It should be established as the activity.

original: dmigs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dmigs pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The object is also twofold:

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa dang / mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'o //
translated: the level of equipoise and the level of nonequipoise.

original: ming la dmigs pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bstan pa mnyan pa dang / gzung ba dang / bcang ba dang / bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis sems can mos pa sna tshogs pa rnams la yi ge sna tshogs kyis chos ston pa ste /
analyzed: ming la dmigs pa ni bsam gtan la brten nas byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas thams cad kyis bstan pa mnyan pa dang / gzung ba dang / bcang ba dang / bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis sems can mos pa sna tshogs pa rnams la yi ge sna tshogs kyis chos ston pa ste /
translated: The bodhisattva who is focused on names listens to the teachings of all the buddhas in dependence on meditative concentration, and he retains and holds them. And by the power of meditative concentration, he teaches the Dharma to various sentient beings with various letters.

original: bsam gtan de ni ming la dmigs pa zhes @192b bya'o ;
analyzed: bsam gtan de ni ming la dmigs pa zhes @192b bya'o ;
translated: This meditative concentration is called “focused on names.”

original: / don la dmigs pa ni bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis bstan pa'i don rnams rtogs nas gzhan la ston pa nyid do //🔽mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: / don la dmigs pa ni bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis bstan pa'i don rnams rtogs nas gzhan la ston pa nyid do // mnyam par gzhag pa'i sa pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: The bodhisattva who is focused on meanings realizes the meanings of the teachings by the power of meditative concentration and then teaches them to others.🔽The bodhisattva who is focused on gnosis is focused on the gnosis of meditative equipoise.🔽The bodhisattva who is focused on activity is focused on the signs of meditative equipoise.

original: zhig nas kyi mtshan ma la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la dmigs pa ni mtshan ma sgom pa'i dus so //
analyzed: zhig nas kyi mtshan ma la dmigs pa zhes bya ba la dmigs pa ni mtshan ma sgom pa'i dus so //
translated: The bodhisattva who is focused on signs is focused on the time of cultivating signs.

original: bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: bya ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Activity is also of two kinds:

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbye ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi rgyud kyi dbye ba'o //
translated: that which is done in one’s own continuum and that which is done in the continuum of another.

original: phongs shing 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams phongs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i bsam gtan ni phongs shing 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phongs shing 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i sems can rnams phongs pa bsal bar bya ba'i phyir dang / 'dod pa yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i bsam gtan ni phongs shing 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The concentration that removes the poverty of sentient beings who are poor and who have desires, and that fulfills their desires, is called the concentration that removes the poverty of sentient beings who are poor and who have desires.

original: 'byung po dang gdon la sogs pa nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i sgrub pa'i gsang sngags rnams byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan la brten nas bsam gtan gyi stobs dang / gsang sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pas sems can rnams kyi 'byung po dang gdon gyi gnod pa 'byung ba rnams rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir de dang rjes su mthun pa'i sngags kyi tshig rnams bstan pas nye bar 'che ba la sogs pa de dag rab tu🔽zhi par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byung po dang gdon la sogs pa nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i sgrub pa'i gsang sngags rnams byang chub sems dpa'i bsam gtan la brten nas bsam gtan gyi stobs dang / gsang sngags kyis byin gyis brlabs pas sems can rnams kyi 'byung po dang gdon gyi gnod pa 'byung ba rnams rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir de dang rjes su mthun pa'i sngags kyi tshig rnams bstan pas nye bar 'che ba la sogs pa de dag rab tu🔽zhi par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mantras that are spells for pacifying bhutas, grahas, and so on, are based on the bodhisattva’s concentration. By the power of concentration and the blessing of mantras, in order to pacify the harm of bhutas and grahas that afflict sentient beings, the bodhisattvas teach the words of the appropriate spells. By this, the harm of those bhutas and so on is completely pacified.

original: dang por ba rtags nas gnod pa byung ba rnams rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis dngos po rnams kyi ro dang nus pa yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par shes nas byin gyis rlob par byed pa'i bsam gtan de yang de'i ming du rnam par gzhag pa 'thob po //🔽mu ge'i ngu 'bod chen po dag byung ba'i tshe zhes bya ba ni lo mang por shin tu drag pa'i mu ge byung zhing char mi 'bab pa'i tshe char 'bebs par byed do //
analyzed: dang por ba rtags nas gnod pa byung ba rnams rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir dang / bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis dngos po rnams kyi ro dang nus pa yongs su gyur pa'i khyad par shes nas byin gyis rlob par byed pa'i bsam gtan de yang de'i ming du rnam par gzhag pa 'thob po // mu ge'i ngu 'bod chen po dag byung ba'i tshe zhes bya ba ni lo mang por shin tu drag pa'i mu ge byung zhing char mi 'bab pa'i tshe char 'bebs par byed do //
translated: The third is called the concentration of the sphere of excellent wisdom, because it is the basis for the knowledge of the specific transformation of the potency of things through the power of concentration, and for the blessing of things.🔽The fourth is called the concentration of the sphere of the end of contamination, because it is the basis for the knowledge of the specific transformation of the potency of things through the power of concentration, and for the blessing of things.🔽The first is called the concentration of the sphere of sovereignty, because it is the basis for the knowledge of the specific transformation of the potency of things through the power of concentration, and for the blessing of things.🔽The second is called the concentration of the sphere of the absence of conflict, because it is the basis for the knowledge of the specific transformation of the potency of things through the power of concentration, and for the blessing of things.

original: bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis sems can rnams 'jigs pa las yongs su skyob par yang byed do //🔽'brog dgon pa la sogs par zhugs shing lam stor ba rnams la lam ston cing bzhon pa la sogs pa yang sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi stobs kyis sems can rnams 'jigs pa las yongs su skyob par yang byed do //🔽'brog dgon pa la sogs par zhugs shing lam stor ba rnams la lam ston cing bzhon pa la sogs pa yang sgrub par byed do //
translated: The third is called the concentration of the sphere of excellent wisdom, because it is the basis for the knowledge of the specific transformation of the potency of things through the power of concentration, and for the blessing of things.🔽The fourth is called the concentration of the sphere of the end of contamination, because it is the basis for the knowledge of the specific transformation of the potency of things through the power of concentration, and for the blessing of things.

original: longs spyod sbyin pas 'dul ba rnams la longs spyod nye bar sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: longs spyod sbyin pas 'dul ba rnams la longs spyod nye bar sgrub par byed de /
translated: For those to be disciplined by enjoyment, he accomplishes enjoyment for them.

original: de dag gdul ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de dag gdul ba'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of disciplining them.

original: dus gcig tu phyogs thams cad du bag med pa la skul bar yang byed do //
analyzed: dus gcig tu phyogs thams cad du bag med pa la skul bar yang byed do //
translated: He also admonishes the heedless in all directions at one time.

original: de bzhin du sems can gyi don byed pa la 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can gyi don byed pa la 'jug par byed de /
translated: Similarly, he engages in the benefit of sentient beings.

original: de dag ni phongs shing 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag ni phongs shing 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called the concentrations of the desire realm, which are associated with the thought of wanting and lacking.

original: dang por rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis ma zhugs pa rnams 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: dang por rdzu 'phrul gyi cho 'phrul gyis ma zhugs pa rnams 'jug par byed do //
translated: First, by the miracle of psychic power, he causes those who have not entered to enter.

original: gnyis pas ni zhugs pa rnams @193a * //
analyzed: gnyis pas ni zhugs pa rnams @193a * //
translated: By the second, he causes those who have entered

original: yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: to mature.

original: gsum pa rjes su bstan pas ni yongs su smin pa rnams grol bar byed do //
analyzed: gsum pa rjes su bstan pas ni yongs su smin pa rnams grol bar byed do //
translated: By the third, he causes those who have matured to be liberated by teaching.

original: sems can nyes par spyod pa rnams 'gyod pa bskyed pa'i phyir nyes par spyod pa'i rnam par smin pa'i sa ston par byed do //
analyzed: sems can nyes par spyod pa rnams 'gyod pa bskyed pa'i phyir nyes par spyod pa'i rnam par smin pa'i sa ston par byed do //
translated: He displays the ripening of misdeeds in order to generate regret in sentient beings who have engaged in misdeeds.

original: snga ma gsum ni tshe 'di la bde ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: snga ma gsum ni tshe 'di la bde ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The first three are called the happiness of this life.

original: ngan 'gro'i sa rnam par ston par byed pa ni tshe phyi ma la bde ba'o //
analyzed: ngan 'gro'i sa rnam par ston par byed pa ni tshe phyi ma la bde ba'o //
translated: The teaching of the stages of the miserable realms is the happiness of the next world.

original: gzhan dag rtsod pa byed pa'i dus dang / don ston pa'i dus su ni spobs pa nye bar sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: gzhan dag rtsod pa byed pa'i dus dang / don ston pa'i dus su ni spobs pa nye bar sgrub par byed do //
translated: The establishment of eloquence is for the time of debate and for the time of teaching the meaning.

original: dran pa nye bar sgrub par byed pa ni chos ston pa dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan brjod pa'i dus su'o //
analyzed: dran pa nye bar sgrub par byed pa ni chos ston pa dang / dkon mchog gsum gyi yon tan brjod pa'i dus su'o //
translated: The establishment of mindfulness is for the time of teaching the Dharma and for the time of proclaiming the virtues of the Three Jewels.

original: phyin ci ma log pa ni yang dag pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid nye bar ston pa nyid ni bstan bcos te /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa ni yang dag pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid nye bar ston pa nyid ni bstan bcos te /
translated: The treatise is the teaching of the characteristics of the true Dharma.

original: gzhan la mi ltos par don gsal bar ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la mi ltos par don gsal bar ston par byed pa'o //
translated: It is the clear teaching of the meaning without dependence on others.

original: snyan ngag ni tshigs su bcad par sbyar ba'o //
analyzed: snyan ngag ni tshigs su bcad par sbyar ba'o //
translated: Poetry is the composition in verse.

original: ma mo zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i man ngag ston par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ma mo zhes bya ba ni mdo sde'i man ngag ston par byed pa'o //
translated: The mother is that which teaches the instructions of the sutras.

original: sbyor ba rnam par gzhag pa ston par byed cing ston pa ni dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: sbyor ba rnam par gzhag pa ston par byed cing ston pa ni dam pa'i chos yun ring du gnas par bya ba'i phyir zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The establishment of the application and the teaching is for the sake of the long duration of the true Dharma.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bzo'i gnas la sogs pa la sngon goms par byas pas zhes bya ba de lta bu yang 'di la bde ba'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i bzo'i gnas la sogs pa la sngon goms par byas pas zhes bya ba de lta bu yang 'di la bde ba'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o /
translated: The bodhisattva is happy in the creative arts, etc., which are not reprehensible, because he has previously cultivated them.

original: 'od zer spros pas 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa yang 'di la bde ba'o //
analyzed: 'od zer spros pas 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal sel bar byed pa yang 'di la bde ba'o //
translated: He is happy in the elimination of the suffering of beings by the emission of light.

original: de bzhin du mdor bsdu rnam par dag pa rnam pa lngas rnam par dag pa rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa bcur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mdor bsdu rnam par dag pa rnam pa lngas rnam par dag pa rnam par gzhag pa rnam pa bcur 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, in brief, the tenfold establishment of purity is due to five kinds of purity.

original: 'jig rten pa'i dag pa ni mdor bsdu na dag par byed par rig par bya ste /🔽khyad par du 'gro ba'i cha dang mthun pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i dag pa ni mdor bsdu na dag par byed par rig par bya ste / khyad par du 'gro ba'i cha dang mthun pa'am /
translated: The mundane purity is to be known in brief as that which purifies.🔽It is favorable to the special,

original: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
analyzed: nges par 'byed pa'i cha dang mthun pa'o //
translated: or it is favorable to the penetrating.

original: gnas pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag ni rang gis pa dang / sa 'og ma pa dag gi nyon mongs pa skye ba dang mthun pa'i phyir ma dag pa'o //
analyzed: gnas pa'i cha dang mthun pa dang / nyams pa'i cha dang mthun pa dag ni rang gis pa dang / sa 'og ma pa dag gi nyon mongs pa skye ba dang mthun pa'i phyir ma dag pa'o //
translated: The stage that is favorable to stability and the stage that is favorable to decline are impure because they are favorable to the arising of the passions of their own stage and of lower stages.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: ro myong ba med pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ro myong ba med pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
translated: The meditative stabilization that is free from relishing is called “pure.”

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dag pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i dag pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: The supramundane purity is free from all conceptual elaborations.

original: de dag gnyis ka yang rnam par dag pas dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gnyis ka yang rnam par dag pas dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Both of those are called “pure” because they are purified.

original: sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dag gi dag pa ni thob pa'i dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dag gi dag pa ni thob pa'i dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The purity of the preparatory and actual stages is called “purity of attainment.”

original: gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: gang yang smras pa /
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: sbyor ba'i dag pas dag pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i dag pas dag pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The purity of the preparatory stage is called “purity.”

original: dngos gzhi las khyad @193b par gong ma rnam par dag pas zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan khyad par can thob pa ste /
analyzed: dngos gzhi las khyad @193b par gong ma rnam par dag pas zhes bya ba ni bsam gtan khyad par can thob pa ste /
translated: The purity of the higher special meditative stabilization is called “purity of attainment.”

original: de yang thob ba'i dag pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang thob ba'i dag pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is also called “purity of attainment.”

original: ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa dang / gnas pa la sogs pa la dbang ba'i sbyor pa nyid dang / bsam gtan las zlog pa la dbang ba nyid kyi sbyor pa dang / yon tan yang dag par sgrub pa la dbang ba nyid kyi sbyor ba gang dag yin pa ni dbang ba dag pas rnam par dag pa'i bsam gtan no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la 'jug pa dang / gnas pa la sogs pa la dbang ba'i sbyor pa nyid dang / bsam gtan las zlog pa la dbang ba nyid kyi sbyor pa dang / yon tan yang dag par sgrub pa la dbang ba nyid kyi sbyor ba gang dag yin pa ni dbang ba dag pas rnam par dag pa'i bsam gtan no //
translated: The concentration of the bodhisattva is pure in terms of mastery, because it is applied to the mastery of entering and abiding in concentration, etc., to the mastery of turning away from concentration, and to the mastery of accomplishing good qualities.

original: lta bar gyur pa'i skyon thams cad dang bral bas ni rten rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa'i skyon thams cad dang bral bas ni rten rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: It is pure in terms of basis, because it is free from all the faults of false views.🔽It is pure in terms of elimination, because it eliminates the obscurations of passion and the knowable that exist in the life-stream.

original: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rgyud la yod pa rnams rab tu spong ba ni sgrib pa rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa rgyud la yod pa rnams rab tu spong ba ni sgrib pa rnam par dag pas rnam par dag pa'i bsam gtan zhes bya'o //
translated: This is the purity of the concentration of the bodhisattva.

original: bsam gtan gyi le'u ste bcu gsum pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi le'u ste bcu gsum pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: The chapter on concentration is completed.

original: // / byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi ngo bo ni rnam pa gsum du gzhag par bya ste /🔽gnas skabs nyid ni gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: // / byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab kyi ngo bo ni rnam pa gsum du gzhag par bya ste /🔽gnas skabs nyid ni gang yang smras pa /
translated: The perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva should be understood as threefold:🔽in terms of its nature, in terms of its categories, and in terms of its basis.

original: shes bya thams cad la 'jug pa dang zhugs pa zhes bya ba la mos pas spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab ni shes bya la rjes su 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la 'jug pa dang zhugs pa zhes bya ba la mos pas spyod pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi shes rab ni shes bya la rjes su 'jug pa yin te /
translated: The wisdom of bodhisattvas on the stage of action in faith is engaged in objects of knowledge,

original: chos bdag med pa rab tu rtogs pa la sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa rab tu rtogs pa la sbyor bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is applied to the realization of the selflessness of phenomena.

original: sa la zhugs pa rnams kyi shes rab ni shes bya'i rjes su zhugs pa yin te //
analyzed: sa la zhugs pa rnams kyi shes rab ni shes bya'i rjes su zhugs pa yin te //
translated: The wisdom of those who have entered the stages is engaged in objects of knowledge,

original: mngon par rtogs pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pas rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is distinguished by direct realization.

original: ngo bo nyid ni gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ni gang yang smras pa /
translated: The essence has been stated.

original: chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: chos rnams rab tu rnam par 'byed pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The analysis of objects of knowledge is stated.

original: shes rab ni rab tu rtog pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: shes rab ni rab tu rtog pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: Wisdom has the characteristic of thorough analysis,

original: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i rnam pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the aspect of thorough differentiation.

original: dmigs pa nyid ni gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid ni gang yang smras pa /
translated: The object has been stated.

original: rig pa'i gnas lnga po zhes bya ba la rig pa'i gnas lnga po dag la mkhas pa thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i shes rab kyang de dag la dmigs pa zhes bya bar brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas lnga po zhes bya ba la rig pa'i gnas lnga po dag la mkhas pa thob par bya ba'i phyir zhugs pa'i shes rab kyang de dag la dmigs pa zhes bya bar brjod par bya'o //
translated: The five branches of learning are the five branches of learning. The wisdom that is engaged in those in order to attain expertise in the five branches of learning is also called “that which has those as its object.”

original: shes rab thams cad ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su bstan to //
analyzed: shes rab thams cad ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su bstan to //
translated: All wisdom is summarized as being of two types.

original: de la bsdus pa nyid ni gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: de la bsdus pa nyid ni gang yang smras pa /
translated: Among them, the summary is stated:

original: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i zhes bya ba ste /
translated: mundane and supramundane.

original: shes rab thams cad ni 'jig rten pa'i dang / 'jig rten las 'das pas bsdus par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: shes rab thams cad ni 'jig rten pa'i dang / 'jig rten las 'das pas bsdus par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: All wisdom is included in the mundane and supramundane.

original: rnam pa de dag gnyi ga yang ci rigs par gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa de dag gnyi ga yang ci rigs par gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: Those two types should be understood as threefold, as appropriate.

original: de kho na'i rjes su zhugs pa dang / mkhas pa'i rjes su zhugs pa dang / bya ba'i rjes su zhugs pa ste /
analyzed: de kho na'i rjes su zhugs pa dang / mkhas pa'i rjes su zhugs pa dang / bya ba'i rjes su zhugs pa ste /
translated: They are: engaged in reality, engaged in expertise, and engaged in activity.

original: dbye ba ni de dag go /
analyzed: dbye ba ni de dag go /
translated: Those are the divisions.

original: de kho na'i rjes su zhugs pa yang rnam pa bzhir @194a * //
analyzed: de kho na'i rjes su zhugs pa yang rnam pa bzhir @194a * //
translated: Engaged in reality is fourfold:

original: rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: should be set forth.

original: dmigs pa nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba nyid dang / rnam pa nyid dang / zhugs pa'i lam rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa nyid dang / rab tu dbye ba nyid dang / rnam pa nyid dang / zhugs pa'i lam rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: It is set forth as the object, the divisions, the aspects, and the path of entry.

original: de la dmigs pa rnam par gzhag pa ni bden pa'i tshul gyi dbang du byas nas de bzhin nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'i bden pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: de la dmigs pa rnam par gzhag pa ni bden pa'i tshul gyi dbang du byas nas de bzhin nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'i bden pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: The setting forth of the object is the four noble truths distinguished by suchness, from the viewpoint of the mode of the truths.

original: de'i phyir smras pa ;
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa ;
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: chos bdag med pa brjod du med pa las brtsams te zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: chos bdag med pa brjod du med pa las brtsams te zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Beginning with the inexpressible selflessness of dharmas.

original: bden pa rtogs par bya ba'am zhes bya ba la sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang / mjug gi dbye bas rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: bden pa rtogs par bya ba'am zhes bya ba la sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang / mjug gi dbye bas rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: For the realization of the truths is threefold, from the viewpoint of the preparation, the actual basis, and the conclusion.

original: de la mngon par rtogs pa la sbyor ba'i shes rab kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: de la mngon par rtogs pa la sbyor ba'i shes rab kyi dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With regard to that, from the viewpoint of the wisdom of the preparation for realization, it is said:

original: bden pa rtogs par bya ba'am zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bden pa rtogs par bya ba'am zhes bya ba la /
translated: For the realization of the truths.

original: de ni mos pas spyod pa'i sar gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de ni mos pas spyod pa'i sar gtogs pa'o //
translated: That is included in the stage of action in faith.

original: mngon par rtogs pas rab tu phye ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: mngon par rtogs pas rab tu phye ba'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: From the viewpoint of that distinguished by realization, it is said:🔽For the realization of the truths.

original: bden pa rtogs pa'i dus sam zhes bya bas ni sa dang po la zhugs pa'i dus su'o //🔽de'i rjes la thob pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: bden pa rtogs pa'i dus sam zhes bya bas ni sa dang po la zhugs pa'i dus su'o // de'i rjes la thob pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: The phrase at the time of realizing the truth refers to the time of entering the first stage.

original: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa yan chad ces bya ba ste /
analyzed: bden pa mngon par rtogs pa yan chad ces bya ba ste /
translated: From the perspective of the post-equipoise state, it says, After realizing the truth.

original: de ni sa gzhan la rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni sa gzhan la rig par bya'o //
translated: This refers to the other stages.

original: de lta bu ni rab tu dbye ba nyid do //🔽rnam pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: de lta bu ni rab tu dbye ba nyid do // rnam pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: This is the classification.

original: mchog tu rab tu zhi bar nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /🔽rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu rab tu zhi bar nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu ba thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir rnam par mi rtog pa'o //
translated: From the perspective of its aspects, it says, It is the supreme pacification, and so on.🔽It is nonconceptual because it is free from all conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir dang / tshig gis brjod pa'i gnas dang bral pa'i phyir spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i spyod yul las shin tu 'das pa'i phyir dang / tshig gis brjod pa'i gnas dang bral pa'i phyir spros pa thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: It is free from all elaborations because it transcends the domain of conceptualization and is free from the basis of verbal expression.

original: dag gi spyod yul thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid kyi rjes su song ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dag gi spyod yul thams cad las 'das pa'i phyir chos thams cad la mnyam pa nyid kyi rjes su song ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it transcends all the spheres of the pure and impure, it is called “the subsequent attainment of the sameness of all things.

original: de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi rjes su song ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir spyi'i mtshan nyid chen po la zhugs pa zhes bya ba la de bzhin nyid kun du 'gro ba la zhugs pa'i phyir spyi'i mtshan nyid chen po la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid du ro gcig pa rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir dang / mnyam pa nyid kyi rjes su song ba nyid du bstan pa'i phyir spyi'i mtshan nyid chen po la zhugs pa zhes bya ba la de bzhin nyid kun du 'gro ba la zhugs pa'i phyir spyi'i mtshan nyid chen po la zhugs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Because it is realized as having a single taste in suchness and because it is taught as the subsequent attainment of sameness, it is called “the entry into the great universal characteristic. ” Because it enters into the all-pervading suchness, it is called “the entry into the great universal characteristic.

original: mchog la sogs pa'i rnam pa rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir shes bya'i mthar phyin pa'o //
analyzed: mchog la sogs pa'i rnam pa rab tu rtogs pa'i phyir shes bya'i mthar phyin pa'o //
translated: Because it is realized in the form of the supreme, etc., it is the culmination of the knowable.

original: gnyis su med pas rab tu phye bas mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis su med pas rab tu phye bas mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'o //
translated: Because it is distinguished by nonduality, it is the abandonment of the two extremes.

original: mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i phyir dbu ma'i lam du 'gro ba'o zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mtha' gnyis rnam par spangs pa'i phyir dbu ma'i lam du 'gro ba'o zhes bya ste /
translated: Because it abandons the two extremes, it is called “the path of the middle way. ”

original: ji skad du mdo sde las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo sde las /
translated: As it is said in the sutra:

original: 'od srungs yod ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gcig go //
analyzed: 'od srungs yod ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gcig go //
translated: “KaSyapa, existence is one extreme, nonexistence is a second extreme.

original: med ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: med ces bya ba 'di ni mtha' gnyis pa'o //
translated: The statement it is not non-existent is the second extreme.🔽The middle way between these two is the non-existence of the non-existence of form, etc.🔽The statement it is not existent and non-existent is the third extreme.🔽The middle way between these two is the non-existence of the existence and non-existence of form, etc.🔽The statement it is not non-existent and not non-existent is the fourth extreme.

original: 'di gnyis kyi dbus gang yin pa @194b de ni gzugs med pa /
analyzed: 'di gnyis kyi dbus gang yin pa @194b de ni gzugs med pa /
translated: The middle way between these two is the non-existence of the non-existence and non-non-existence of form, etc.

original: bstan du med pa /
analyzed: bstan du med pa /
translated: The statement it is not existent is the fifth extreme.🔽The middle way between these two is the non-existence of the existence and non-existence of the existence and non-existence of form, etc.

original: thogs pa med pa /🔽mi gnas pa /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa / mi gnas pa /
translated: The statement it is not non-existent is the sixth extreme.🔽The middle way between these two is the non-existence of the existence and non-existence of the existence and non-existence of the existence and non-existence of form, etc.

original: snang ba med pa /🔽rnam par shes par byar med pa gang yin pa de ni 'od srungs dbu ma'i lam chos rnams kyi yang dag pa la rtogs pa zhes brjod do zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: snang ba med pa / rnam par shes par byar med pa gang yin pa de ni 'od srungs dbu ma'i lam chos rnams kyi yang dag pa la rtogs pa zhes brjod do zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The statement it is not existent and non-existent is the seventh extreme.🔽The middle way between these two is the non-existence of the existence and non-existence of the existence and non-existence of the existence and non-existence of the existence and non-existence of form, etc.

original: gnas brgyad la mkhas pa ni rnam par gzhag pa'i rab tu nges pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas brgyad la mkhas pa ni rnam par gzhag pa'i rab tu nges pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The statement it is not non-existent and not non-existent is the eighth extreme.🔽The middle way between these two is the non-existence of the existence and non-existence of the existence and non-existence of the existence and non-existence of the existence and non-existence of the existence and non-existence of form, etc.

original: rgyas par ni rigs kyi le'u'i rjes su 'brangs nas so //🔽don dang ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi tshogs ni dang po dge ba'i chos kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: rgyas par ni rigs kyi le'u'i rjes su 'brangs nas so // don dang ldan pa'i chos rnams kyi tshogs ni dang po dge ba'i chos kyi tshogs so //
translated: The statement it is not existent is the ninth extreme.

original: gnyis pa ni mi dge ba'i chos kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni mi dge ba'i chos kyi tshogs so //
translated: The middle way between these two is the non-existence of the existence and non-existence of the existence and non-existence of the existence and non-existence of the existence and non-existence of the existence and non-existence of the existence and non-existence of form, etc.

original: gsum pa ni lung du ma bstan pa'i chos kyi tshogs so //🔽de dag la de ni rnam pa yongs su shes pa la mkhas pa'o //
analyzed: gsum pa ni lung du ma bstan pa'i chos kyi tshogs so //🔽de dag la de ni rnam pa yongs su shes pa la mkhas pa'o //
translated: The statement it is not non

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang chos thams cad kyi don dam pa'i tshul gyi dbang du byas nas don dam par yod pa ni tshogs dang po'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang chos thams cad kyi don dam pa'i tshul gyi dbang du byas nas don dam par yod pa ni tshogs dang po'o //
translated: Another enumeration: the first collection is from the point of view of ultimate existence in the ultimate mode of being of all things.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas nas rdzas su yod pa'i dbang du byas pa ni tshogs gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi dbang du byas nas rdzas su yod pa'i dbang du byas pa ni tshogs gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second collection is from the point of view of substantial existence in terms of intrinsic identity.

original: kun rdzob kyi tshul gyis btags pa nyid du yod pa'i dbang du byas pa ni tshogs gsum pa'o //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tshul gyis btags pa nyid du yod pa'i dbang du byas pa ni tshogs gsum pa'o //
translated: The third collection is from the point of view of conventional existence as mere designation by the conventional mode.

original: gnas brgyad la mkhas pas bsdus pa'i shes rab ni byang chub chen po thob pa dang // rjes su mthun pa'i phyir dang / shin tu phan 'dogs par bstan pa'i phyir dang / mkhas pa yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas brgyad la mkhas pas bsdus pa'i shes rab ni byang chub chen po thob pa dang // rjes su mthun pa'i phyir dang / shin tu phan 'dogs par bstan pa'i phyir dang / mkhas pa yongs su 'dzin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The wisdom included in the eight bases of skill is taught to be very helpful because it is conducive to the attainment of great enlightenment and because it is the support of skill.

original: shes rab gsum pa ni rab tu dbye na bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste /
analyzed: shes rab gsum pa ni rab tu dbye na bcu gcig tu rig par bya ste /
translated: The third wisdom should be known as elevenfold when classified.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate just that, he says:

original: snga ma bzhin du rnam pa bcu gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snga ma bzhin du rnam pa bcu gcig ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: As before, it is of eleven kinds, and so on.

original: dka' ba'i shes rab ni rnam pa gsum du bstan te /
analyzed: dka' ba'i shes rab ni rnam pa gsum du bstan te /
translated: Difficult wisdom is taught as threefold:

original: de kho na'i don rtogs pa'i mthar thug pa nyid de /
analyzed: de kho na'i don rtogs pa'i mthar thug pa nyid de /
translated: the ultimate realization of the meaning of reality

original: chos bdag med pa rab tu rig pa'i rnam pas zhugs pa nyid dang / gdul ba'i thabs kyi mthar thug pa nyid de /
analyzed: chos bdag med pa rab tu rig pa'i rnam pas zhugs pa nyid dang / gdul ba'i thabs kyi mthar thug pa nyid de /
translated: because it is the entry into the realization of the selflessness of phenomena, and the ultimate method of conversion

original: sems can thams cad la rnam pa thams cad kyis gdul ba'i thabs yongs su shes pa'i phyir dang / shes bya thams cad kyi mthar thug pa la thogs pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la rnam pa thams cad kyis gdul ba'i thabs yongs su shes pa'i phyir dang / shes bya thams cad kyi mthar thug pa la thogs pa med par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the knowledge of the method of converting all sentient beings in every way, and because it is the unobstructed knowledge of the ultimate of all that is to be known.

original: shes rab de dag ni bdag dang gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa dang / gzhan la phan pa'i thabs sgrub pa dang / gzhan la phan pa'i nus pa sgrub pa'i dbang du byas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab de dag ni bdag dang gzhan la phan pa sgrub pa dang / gzhan la phan pa'i thabs sgrub pa dang / gzhan la phan pa'i nus pa sgrub pa'i dbang du byas pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These wisdoms should be understood as being in terms of the accomplishment of benefit for oneself and others, the accomplishment of the method of benefit for others, and the accomplishment of the ability to benefit others.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i sbyor ba'i dbye ba dang / mnyam par bzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa ba'i shes rab kyi stobs bskyed pa 'phel ba dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i @195a * //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa pa'i sbyor ba'i dbye ba dang / mnyam par bzhag pa dang mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sa ba'i shes rab kyi stobs bskyed pa 'phel ba dang / mnyam par bzhag pa'i @195a * //
translated: The classification of the level of preparation that is not equipoise, the increase of the power of wisdom on the level of equipoise and the level of nonequipoise and the increase of the power of wisdom on the level of nonequipoise.🔽

original: sa pa'i shes rab kyi dbang du byas nas sgo bzhir rnam par bya'o //
analyzed: sa pa'i shes rab kyi dbang du byas nas sgo bzhir rnam par bya'o //
translated: The fourfold analysis is made in terms of the wisdom of the stage of non-concentration, the wisdom of the stage of concentration, the increase of the power of wisdom of the stage of concentration, and the wisdom of the stage of concentration.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i shes rab kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sbyor ba las byung ba'i shes rab kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The wisdom of the stage of non-concentration is twofold:

original: dam pa'i chos thos pa'i rjes la thob pa'i sbyor ba las skyes pa thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang / de nyid la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pas rigs pas nges par brtags pa'i sbyor ba las skyes pa bsams pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos thos pa'i rjes la thob pa'i sbyor ba las skyes pa thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab dang / de nyid la tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pas rigs pas nges par brtags pa'i sbyor ba las skyes pa bsams pa las byung ba'o //
translated: the wisdom arisen from hearing, which is the wisdom arisen from the practice of the Dharma that is obtained after hearing the holy Dharma, and the wisdom arisen from thinking, which is the wisdom arisen from the practice of proper mental attention to that Dharma through logical investigation.🔽The wisdom of the stage of concentration is also twofold:

original: de nyid sbyor ba byed pa'i dus su lus kyi stobs dang / nus pa dang / brtan pa dang bcas pas gegs su gyur pa zil gyis mnan nas sgrub par byed pa ni so sor rtog pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid sbyor ba byed pa'i dus su lus kyi stobs dang / nus pa dang / brtan pa dang bcas pas gegs su gyur pa zil gyis mnan nas sgrub par byed pa ni so sor rtog pa'i stobs zhes bya'o //
translated: The power of analysis is the practice of the bodhisattva which, by means of the strength, ability and firmness of body, subdues the obstacles and accomplishes the task.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis su rig par bya ste /
translated: The activity of the bodhisattva should be understood as twofold:

original: bya ba la 'jug pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa las ldog pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba la 'jug pa dang / bya ba ma yin pa las ldog pa'o //
translated: the engagement in activity and the avoidance of inactivity.

original: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i shes rab kyi stobs kyis bsdus pa thob kyang rung ma thob kyang rung bsgoms pa'i stobs zhes brjod do //
analyzed: mnyam par bzhag pa'i sa pa'i shes rab kyi stobs kyis bsdus pa thob kyang rung ma thob kyang rung bsgoms pa'i stobs zhes brjod do //
translated: The power of meditation is the practice of the bodhisattva which, by means of the power of wisdom on the stage of meditative equipoise, is described as the power of meditation, whether or not one has attained the state of being free from error.

original: de'i rab tu dbye ba dpag tu med pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i rab tu dbye ba dpag tu med pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Since its differentiation is infinite, he says:

original: tshad med pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshad med pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: It is immeasurable.

original: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa'i shes rab las bzlog pa ni skyes bu dam pa'i shes rab tu rnam par gzhag par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa'i shes rab las bzlog pa ni skyes bu dam pa'i shes rab tu rnam par gzhag par shes par bya'o //
translated: The wisdom of the holy person is to be understood as the opposite of the wisdom of the non-holy person.

original: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa'i rim gyis 'jug pa'i shes rab ni rnam pa lngar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa'i rim gyis 'jug pa'i shes rab ni rnam pa lngar 'gyur ro //
translated: The wisdom that is entered gradually by those who are not holy has five aspects.

original: de la dang por skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa dang bstan pa las dam pa ma yin pa'i chos thos pas phyin ci log gi thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab thob pa'o //
analyzed: de la dang por skyes bu dam pa ma yin pa dang bstan pa las dam pa ma yin pa'i chos thos pas phyin ci log gi thos pa las byung ba'i shes rab thob pa'o //
translated: First, from listening to the teachings of those who are not holy, one acquires the wisdom that arises from listening, which is erroneous because it is erroneous with regard to the teachings of those who are not holy.

original: de'i rjes la tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa dang ldan pas phyin ci log gi bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa dang ldan pas phyin ci log gi bsams pa las byung ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: Next, from the erroneous thought that is associated with improper mental attention, one acquires the wisdom that arises from reflection, which is erroneous because it is erroneous with regard to the meaning of the teachings.

original: de las bdag dang gzhan gyi don phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa las thabs ma yin pa dang bcas pa'i bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: de las bdag dang gzhan gyi don phyin ci log tu bsgrub pa las thabs ma yin pa dang bcas pa'i bsgoms pa las byung ba'o //
translated: From that, one acquires the wisdom that arises from meditation, which is erroneous because it is erroneous with regard to the practice of the aims of oneself and others.🔽From that, one acquires the wisdom that arises from meditation, which is erroneous because it is erroneous with regard to the practice of the aims of oneself and others.🔽From that, one acquires the wisdom that arises from meditation, which is erroneous because it is erroneous with regard to the practice of the aims of oneself and others.🔽From that, one acquires the wisdom that arises from meditation, which is erroneous because it is erroneous with regard to the practice of the aims of oneself and others.🔽From that, one acquires the wisdom that arises from meditation, which is erroneous because it is erroneous with regard to the practice of the aims of oneself and others.🔽From that, one acquires the wisdom that arises from meditation, which is erroneous because it is erroneous with regard to the practice of the aims of oneself and others.🔽From that, one acquires the wisdom that arises from meditation, which is erroneous because it is erroneous with regard to the practice of the aims of oneself and others.🔽From that, one acquires the wisdom that arises from meditation, which is erroneous because it is erroneous with regard to the practice of the aims of oneself and others.🔽From that, one acquires the wisdom that arises from meditation, which is erroneous because it is erroneous with regard to the practice of the aims of oneself and others.🔽From that, one acquires the wisdom that arises from meditation, which is erroneous because it is erroneous with regard to the practice of the aims of oneself and others.🔽From that, one acquires the wisdom that arises from meditation, which is erroneous because it is erroneous with regard to the practice of the aims of oneself and others.

original: de ltar rab tu zhugs pa las phyin ci log gi chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'jog pa las phyin ci log gi chos la gnas pa'i shes pa 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de ltar rab tu zhugs pa las phyin ci log gi chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam par 'jog pa las phyin ci log gi chos la gnas pa'i shes pa 'byung ngo //
translated: From that, one acquires the wisdom that arises from meditation, which is erroneous because it is erroneous with regard to the practice of the aims of oneself and others.🔽From that, one acquires the wisdom that arises from meditation, which is erroneous because

original: de lta bu'i lam nas de ltar rim gyis zhugs pa las nyon mongs pa zlog pa thob par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i lam nas de ltar rim gyis zhugs pa las nyon mongs pa zlog pa thob par mi 'gyur te /
translated: One does not attain the cessation of the defilements through such a path and such a process.

original: shes rab des kun nas nyon mongs pa spong bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes rab des kun nas nyon mongs pa spong bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: That wisdom does not eliminate the afflictions.

original: de dag las bzlog pas ni skyes bu dam pa'i shes rab la rim gyis 'jug par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las bzlog pas ni skyes bu dam pa'i shes rab la rim gyis 'jug par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that the opposite of those is the gradual entry into the wisdom of the holy beings.

original: rnam grangs gnyis pa ni de kho na nyid kyi don la nan tan bya ba'i dbye ba dang / rgyu rab tu dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gnyis pa ni de kho na nyid kyi don la nan tan bya ba'i dbye ba dang / rgyu rab tu dbye ba'i dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The second enumeration should be understood as being established from the point of view of the classification of the practice of the meaning of reality and the classification of the cause.

original: de kho @195b na'i don yang ngo bo nyid dang / grangs su yongs su bcad pas cha phra ba dang / mkhas par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de kho @195b na'i don yang ngo bo nyid dang / grangs su yongs su bcad pas cha phra ba dang / mkhas par shes par bya'o //
translated: The meaning of reality should be understood as subtle and as expertise through the determination of its nature and number.

original: sngon gyi las las nges par byung ba'i shes rab ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
analyzed: sngon gyi las las nges par byung ba'i shes rab ni lhan cig skyes pa'o //
translated: The wisdom that arises from previous karma is innate.

original: de nyid ni skye bas thob pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid ni skye bas thob pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That itself is called “obtained at birth.”

original: rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the cause, it is said:

original: ye shes kyi tshogs sngar yang dag par thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ye shes kyi tshogs sngar yang dag par thob pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Because the accumulation of wisdom has been attained previously.

original: sngon gyi skye bas ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par bsags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sngon gyi skye bas ye shes kyi tshogs yang dag par bsags pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is: because the accumulation of wisdom has been properly collected in previous lives.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thos pa la sogs pa las skyes pa ni lung dang ldan pa'i shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sde snod thos pa la sogs pa las skyes pa ni lung dang ldan pa'i shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that arises from listening to the Bodhisattva Canon and so on is called wisdom endowed with scripture.

original: sa bcu rnams su so sor rig pa ni rtogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sa bcu rnams su so sor rig pa ni rtogs pa dang ldan pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The wisdom that arises from reflection is called wisdom endowed with reasoning.🔽The wisdom that arises from meditation is called wisdom endowed with practice.

original: dmigs pa dang / rnam pa'i dbye bas dang / bya ba gnyis byas pa'i lam gyi shes rab ni rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya ste /
analyzed: dmigs pa dang / rnam pa'i dbye bas dang / bya ba gnyis byas pa'i lam gyi shes rab ni rnam pa drug tu blta bar bya ste /
translated: The wisdom of the path that is endowed with practice is to be seen as sixfold, according to the classification of objective supports and aspects.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i dbye bas ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi shes pa'i dbye bas ni rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: It is fourfold according to the classification of the knowledge of the four noble truths.

original: 'di nyid la nyon mongs pa zad pa shes pa dang / ma 'ongs pa na phung po mi skye ba shes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid la nyon mongs pa zad pa shes pa dang / ma 'ongs pa na phung po mi skye ba shes pa'o //
translated: It is twofold, the knowledge of the extinction of the contaminants and the knowledge that the aggregates will not arise again in the future.

original: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang du byas nas zad pa shes pa dang/ mi skyes ba shes pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: phung po lhag ma dang bcas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbang du byas nas zad pa shes pa dang/ mi skyes ba shes pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The knowledge of elimination and the knowledge of non-arising are established from the perspective of nirvāṇa with remainder.

original: gnyen po'i phyogs shes rab kyi khyad par dang / rnam pa'i khyad par dang / mthu'i rab tu dbye ba dang / rgyu'i dngos po'i khyad par dang / sbyor ba'i khyad par dang / rten gyi khyad par gyi dbang du byas nas rnam pa bdun du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gnyen po'i phyogs shes rab kyi khyad par dang / rnam pa'i khyad par dang / mthu'i rab tu dbye ba dang / rgyu'i dngos po'i khyad par dang / sbyor ba'i khyad par dang / rten gyi khyad par gyi dbang du byas nas rnam pa bdun du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: They are established as seven types from the perspective of the distinction of the antidote, the distinction of mode, the distinction of power, the distinction of causal entity, the distinction of application, and the distinction of basis.

original: de la zag pa med pa'i shes pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa ni chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
analyzed: de la zag pa med pa'i shes pa 'dod pa'i khams kyi gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa ni chos shes pa'i bzod pa'o //
translated: Among them, the knowledge of dharmas that is the antidote to the desire realm is the receptivity to the knowledge of dharmas.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa'i rjes su rtog pa shes pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa'i rjes su rtog pa shes pa ste /
translated: The subsequent knowledge that is the antidote to the form and formless realms is the subsequent knowledge.

original: de ltar gnyen po'i phyogs so //
analyzed: de ltar gnyen po'i phyogs so //
translated: Thus there are two antidotes.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad ni kun rdzob kyi rnam pa yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa thams cad ni kun rdzob kyi rnam pa yin pa'i phyir kun rdzob shes pa zhes brjod do //
translated: All that is impure is relative form, and so it is called the knowledge of the relative.

original: mthu rnam pa drug dang ldan pa ni yang mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mthu rnam pa drug dang ldan pa ni yang mngon par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the superknowledges is the knowledge of the six superknowledges.

original: mtshan rnams nges par sgrub par byed pa shes pa ni mtshan rnams kyi rgyu yongs su shes pa'i phyir mtshan nyid shes pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan rnams nges par sgrub par byed pa shes pa ni mtshan rnams kyi rgyu yongs su shes pa'i phyir mtshan nyid shes pa'i shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the characteristics is the knowledge of the causes of the characteristics, because it is the knowledge of the causes of the characteristics.

original: stobs bcu'i sbyor bar gyur pa'i ye shes ni stobs bcu sngon du 'gro ba'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: stobs bcu'i sbyor bar gyur pa'i ye shes ni stobs bcu sngon du 'gro ba'i shes pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the ten powers is the knowledge that is preceded by the ten powers.

original: yang gzhan dag ni stobs bcu'i sgo nas 'jug pa yin no zhes smra bar byed do //
analyzed: yang gzhan dag ni stobs bcu'i sgo nas 'jug pa yin no zhes smra bar byed do //
translated: Others say that it is the knowledge that is preceded by the ten powers.

original: rigs pa rnam pa bzhi la brten nas de dang de las rigs pas yongs su brtags pa'i rnam pa ni rigs pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rigs pa rnam pa bzhi la brten nas de dang de las rigs pas yongs su brtags pa'i rnam pa ni rigs pa shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge of the reasonings is the knowledge that is investigated by the four reasonings.

original: rnam pa thams cad du gzhan gyi don ston pa la mkhas @196a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du gzhan gyi don ston pa la mkhas @196a * //
translated: The knowledge of the teaching is the knowledge of the means of teaching the Dharma to others in all its modes.

original: pa dang / bstan pa rjes su srung ba la nus pa dang ldan pa dang / khyim rgyud legs par bskyang ba la mkhas pa dang / rgyal po'i tshul dang / 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la mkhas pa'i dbang du byas nas phongs shing 'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams la chos nye bar sgrub par byed pa nyid dang /
analyzed: pa dang / bstan pa rjes su srung ba la nus pa dang ldan pa dang / khyim rgyud legs par bskyang ba la mkhas pa dang / rgyal po'i tshul dang / 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la mkhas pa'i dbang du byas nas phongs shing 'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams la chos nye bar sgrub par byed pa nyid dang /
translated: and the ability to protect the teaching, and skill in properly maintaining the family, and skill in the king's way of life and worldly conventions, he establishes the Dharma for those who are poor and desirous.

original: khong du chud par bya ba la sogs pa nye bar bsgrub pa ni phongs shing 'dod pa'i shes rab ces bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: khong du chud par bya ba la sogs pa nye bar bsgrub pa ni phongs shing 'dod pa'i shes rab ces bya bar rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The establishment of understanding, etc. is called the wisdom of the poor and desirous.

original: rnam pa thams cad du gzhan gyi don ston pa la mkhas pa ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du gzhan gyi don ston pa la mkhas pa ni so so yang dag par rig pa bzhir rig par bya ste /
translated: Skill in teaching the import for others in every way is to be known as the four analytical knowledges.

original: shes pa gang gis chos rnams kyi rnam grangs nges par ston pa la thogs pa med pa'i rnam pas rab tu mkhyen pa de ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: shes pa gang gis chos rnams kyi rnam grangs nges par ston pa la thogs pa med pa'i rnam pas rab tu mkhyen pa de ni chos so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The knowledge by which one knows without obstruction the categories of things to be taught is called the analytical knowledge of the teaching.

original: mtshan nyid las brtsams nas de bzhin du shes pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o //🔽nges pa'i tshig brjod pa las brtsams nas ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid las brtsams nas de bzhin du shes pa ni don so so yang dag par rig pa zhes bya'o // nges pa'i tshig brjod pa las brtsams nas ni nges pa'i tshig so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The knowledge of the object is called the correct discrimination of the object.🔽The correct discrimination of language is the knowledge of the expression of the teaching.

original: rab tu dbye ba las brtsams nas spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba las brtsams nas spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'o //
translated: The correct discrimination of eloquence is the knowledge of the classification of the teaching.

original: shes rab gang gis mu stegs can gyi nyes pa brjod par nus pas phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod pa gang yin pa de ni tshar gcod pa'i shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab gang gis mu stegs can gyi nyes pa brjod par nus pas phas kyi rgol ba tshar gcod pa gang yin pa de ni tshar gcod pa'i shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: The knowledge by which one can refute the objections of the tirthikas is called the knowledge of refutation.

original: gang yang rang gi phyogs kyi yon tan rjod par byed pa nyid ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' thob pa ston par byed pa ni yang dag par rnam par 'jog pa'i shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang yang rang gi phyogs kyi yon tan rjod par byed pa nyid ni rang gi grub pa'i mtha' thob pa ston par byed pa ni yang dag par rnam par 'jog pa'i shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: The knowledge by which one can teach the doctrine of one's own school is called the knowledge of establishment.

original: khyim rgyud legs par bskyang ba la mkhas pas ni khyim gyi 'byor pa 'phel bar byed do //
analyzed: khyim rgyud legs par bskyang ba la mkhas pas ni khyim gyi 'byor pa 'phel bar byed do //
translated: The knowledge by which one can increase the wealth of the household is called the knowledge of the household.🔽 The knowledge by which one can increase the wealth of the king is called the knowledge of the king.

original: rgyal po'i bya ba la mkhas pa dang / 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la mkhas pas rgyal po bsrung pa dang / 'jig rten shes pa'i shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: rgyal po'i bya ba la mkhas pa dang / 'jig rten gyi tha snyad la mkhas pas rgyal po bsrung pa dang / 'jig rten shes pa'i shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: The wisdom of protecting the king through skill in the king's duties and through skill in worldly conventions is called the wisdom of knowing the world.

original: nges pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu nges pa ste /
analyzed: nges pa zhes bya ba ni shin tu nges pa ste /
translated: Ascertainment means complete ascertainment.

original: mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: mkhas pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It means skill.

original: shes rab kyi gnas nyid dang / shes rab kyi bya ba de nyid kyis 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i shes rab rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: shes rab kyi gnas nyid dang / shes rab kyi bya ba de nyid kyis 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i shes rab rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Wisdom should be understood as being established in terms of the basis of wisdom, the activity of wisdom, and the wisdom that leads to happiness in this life and the next through that very basis and activity of wisdom.

original: rig pa'i gnas rnam pa lnga la shin tu rnam par byang zhing shin tu rnam par byang ba ste /
analyzed: rig pa'i gnas rnam pa lnga la shin tu rnam par byang zhing shin tu rnam par byang ba ste /
translated: It is complete purification in the five branches of learning and complete purification in the four noble truths.

original: rnam par gnas pa'i dbang du byas nas chos dang chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i rjes su 'gro bas so //
analyzed: rnam par gnas pa'i dbang du byas nas chos dang chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i rjes su 'gro bas so //
translated: In terms of abiding, it is the practice of Dharma and the practice in accordance with Dharma through following the Dharma.

original: rab tu gnas pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i gnas bzhi la chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pas gnas par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu gnas pa ni ma yin zhes bya ba ni rig pa'i gnas bzhi la chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pas gnas par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It does not abide means that it does not abide in the four branches of learning through practicing the Dharma and in accordance with the Dharma.

original: shes rab gang dang gang gis de dang de la rmongs pa rnams la bstan pa nas /
analyzed: shes rab gang dang gang gis de dang de la rmongs pa rnams la bstan pa nas /
translated: The wisdom by which one teaches the deluded, from the beginning,

original: yang @196b dag par dga' bar byed pa'i bar ni bya ba byas pa'i shes rab ces bya'o //
analyzed: yang @196b dag par dga' bar byed pa'i bar ni bya ba byas pa'i shes rab ces bya'o //
translated: and causes them to rejoice in the truth, is the wisdom of the performance of action.

original: dbye ba gnyis kyis tha dad du byas pas don rnam pa lnga nyid la brten nas de la dmigs pa'i shes rab ni phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam par dag pa bcur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dbye ba gnyis kyis tha dad du byas pas don rnam pa lnga nyid la brten nas de la dmigs pa'i shes rab ni phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam par dag pa bcur rig par bya'o //
translated: The wisdom which has that as its object, based on the five kinds of objects, should be known as the ten kinds of unerring purity, distinguished by the two divisions.

original: don rnam pa lnga ni de kho na'i don dang / 'jug pa'i don dang / nye bar len pa'i don dang / thabs kyi don dang / mthar thug pa'i don to //
analyzed: don rnam pa lnga ni de kho na'i don dang / 'jug pa'i don dang / nye bar len pa'i don dang / thabs kyi don dang / mthar thug pa'i don to //
translated: The five kinds of objects are the object of reality, the object of engagement, the object of appropriation, the object of means, and the object of culmination.

original: de kho na'i don yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de kho na'i don yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The object of reality is twofold:

original: de kho na'i don yang dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad yongs su gcod pa'o //
analyzed: de kho na'i don yang dag pa dang / rnam pa thams cad yongs su gcod pa'o //
translated: the object of reality as it is, and the object of reality in all its aspects.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i don ni 'jug pa'i don dang zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i don ni 'jug pa'i don dang zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The object of cause and effect is the object of engagement,

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi rgyun 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu dag gi rgyun 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because cause and effect are engaged in a continuum.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, it is twofold:

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam pas rgyur 'dzin pa dang / 'bras bur 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i rnam pas rgyur 'dzin pa dang / 'bras bur 'dzin pa'o //
translated: the cause is grasped by way of non-error and the result is grasped.

original: nye bar len pa'i don rnam pa gnyis ni phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa ste /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i don rnam pa gnyis ni phyin ci log dang phyin ci ma log pa ste /
translated: The two kinds of objects of appropriation are non-erroneous and erroneous,

original: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i phyogs nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i phyogs nye bar len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they appropriate the side of engagement and the side of disengagement.

original: 'dis nye bar len pa'i phyir zhes bya bas de dag gnyis ka yang yongs su shes pas de ltar rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: 'dis nye bar len pa'i phyir zhes bya bas de dag gnyis ka yang yongs su shes pas de ltar rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Because of this, they are both fully known, and thus there are two kinds.

original: thabs ni 'jug pa'i tshul khrims dang ldog pa'i tshul khrims so //
analyzed: thabs ni 'jug pa'i tshul khrims dang ldog pa'i tshul khrims so //
translated: The means is the morality of engagement and the morality of disengagement.

original: de lta na yang bya ba dang / bya ba ma yin pa thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas las rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de lta na yang bya ba dang / bya ba ma yin pa thams cad yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pas las rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Even so, there are two kinds of action because all that should and should not be done is known just as it is.

original: mthar thug pa'i don ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rab tu spangs pa dang / rnam par byang ba yang dag par bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i don ni kun nas nyon mongs pa rab tu spangs pa dang / rnam par byang ba yang dag par bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: The ultimate object is the complete abandonment of affliction and the complete establishment of purification.

original: de gnyi ga yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa ni de bzhin du shes rab rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: de gnyi ga yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes pa ni de bzhin du shes rab rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The two kinds of wisdom are the knowledge of the two kinds of reality, as it is.

original: shes rab shin tu rnam par nges shing ste /
analyzed: shes rab shin tu rnam par nges shing ste /
translated: Wisdom is very certain and

original: rnam par byang ba sbyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba sbyin par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: purifies, because it gives the gift of purification.

original: dpag tu med pa ni rdzas kyi rnam pa'i 'bye bas so //
analyzed: dpag tu med pa ni rdzas kyi rnam pa'i 'bye bas so //
translated: It is immeasurable, because of the variety of substances.🔽The six perfections are taught in the sutras.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di rnams ni mdo nas bstan pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di rnams ni mdo nas bstan pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: 'di ni mdo sde gzhan de dang de dag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di ni mdo sde gzhan de dang de dag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In other sutras, here and there,

original: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo la sogs pa'i mdo rnams so //
analyzed: 'phags pa blo gros mi zad pa'i mdo la sogs pa'i mdo rnams so //
translated: in the sutras such as the noble Aksayamatinirdesa,🔽in small groups,

original: thor bu thor bus zhes bya ba ni nyung shas nyung shas kyis bstan pa rnams so //🔽mdor bsdus te bstan pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid bsdus nas bstan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: thor bu thor bus zhes bya ba ni nyung shas nyung shas kyis bstan pa rnams so //🔽mdor bsdus te bstan pa zhes bya ba ni mtshan nyid bsdus nas bstan pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: in brief,🔽the six perfections are taught.

original: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa zhes bya ba ni mdor bsdus te bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching is the brief teaching.

original: nges par bshad pa ni rgyas par bstan pa'o //
analyzed: nges par bshad pa ni rgyas par bstan pa'o //
translated: The explanation is the extensive teaching.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid 'dir bstan pa'i don nges par gzung ba mdo @197a * //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid 'dir bstan pa'i don nges par gzung ba mdo @197a * //
translated: The meaning of the characteristics of the nature, etc. of generosity, etc. which is taught here is ascertained in the sutras.

original: gzhan dag nas bstan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dag la yang ngo bo nyid la sogs pa nges par sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag nas bstan pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dag la yang ngo bo nyid la sogs pa nges par sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The nature, etc. should also be applied to the perfections taught in other sutras.

original: 'dir bshad pa'i lugs 'di yang gzhan dag tu grangs la sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya bar smras pa /
analyzed: 'dir bshad pa'i lugs 'di yang gzhan dag tu grangs la sbyar bar bya'o zhes bya bar smras pa /
translated: And this system of explanation here should be applied to the enumeration in other sutras.

original: bsdu ba yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba yang ci rigs par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary should be understood as appropriate.

original: mdo sde 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi skyes pa'i rabs la sogs pa rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: mdo sde 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi skyes pa'i rabs la sogs pa rnams la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to show that this is not only in the sutras, but also in the Jataka tales, etc., it is said:

original: skyes pa'i rabs dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In the countless Jataka tales, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i skyes pa'i rabs thams cad ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang yang dag par ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i skyes pa'i rabs thams cad ni pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang yang dag par ldan pa yin te /
translated: All the Jataka Tales of the Bodhisattva are perfectly endowed with the six perfections,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa thams cad ni bsod nams dang ye shes kyis rab tu phye ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the Bodhisattva practices are distinguished by merit and knowledge.🔽And from those Jataka Tales, etc., some of the nature of the perfections such as giving, etc., are also taught.
