original: skyes pa'i rabs la sogs pa de dag las kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa 'ga' zhig kyang ston to zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: skyes pa'i rabs la sogs pa de dag las kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid la sogs pa 'ga' zhig kyang ston to zhes bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says:

original: kha cig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: kha cig ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Some are of the nature of giving, etc.

original: da dag ji ltar rigs par dpyad nas sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: da dag ji ltar rigs par dpyad nas sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: They should be applied as appropriate.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang yang dag par ldan pa'i bsod nams kyis yang dag par bsdus pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa dang / dge ba'i chos 'das pa nye bar bzung nas chen po nyid de dang ldan pas dkar po'i chos kyi chu chen po ste /🔽bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po bsags pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang yang dag par ldan pa'i bsod nams kyis yang dag par bsdus pa'i bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs bsags pa dang / dge ba'i chos 'das pa nye bar bzung nas chen po nyid de dang ldan pas dkar po'i chos kyi chu chen po ste / bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po bsags pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The great river of the bright qualities is the great accumulation of the bright qualities of merit and knowledge, which is gathered by the merit that is endowed with the six perfections.🔽The great ocean of the bright qualities is the great accumulation of the bright qualities of merit and knowledge, which is gathered by the merit that is endowed with the great accumulation of the bright qualities of merit and knowledge.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i dus nye bar bzung nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po bsags pa dang ldan pas dkar po'i chos chen po'i rgya mtsho chen po zhes bya ba ste //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i dus nye bar bzung nas bsod nams dang ye shes kyi tshogs chen po bsags pa dang ldan pas dkar po'i chos chen po'i rgya mtsho chen po zhes bya ba ste //
translated: The great ocean of the bright qualities is the great accumulation of the bright qualities of merit and knowledge, which is gathered by the merit that is endowed with the great accumulation of the bright qualities of merit and knowledge.

original: ji ltar rgya mtshor gnas pa'i chu chen po nyid yin pas chu chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rgya mtshor gnas pa'i chu chen po nyid yin pas chu chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Just as the great river is called great because it is the great water that remains in the ocean,

original: bya ba sna tshogs 'bab che ba'i phyir rgya mtsho chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bya ba sna tshogs 'bab che ba'i phyir rgya mtsho chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: and the ocean is called great because it is the great descent of the various actions,

original: tshul 'di yang de dang 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: tshul 'di yang de dang 'dra ba yin no //
translated: this method is also like that.

original: rgya mtsho chen po dang chos mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar rgya mtsho chen po rin po che thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can thams cad kyi don gyi rnam pa thams cad kyi rin po che chen🔽po'i 'byung gnas yin te /
analyzed: rgya mtsho chen po dang chos mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir ji ltar rgya mtsho chen po rin po che thams cad kyi 'byung gnas yin pa de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' yang sems can thams cad kyi don gyi rnam pa thams cad kyi rin po che chen po'i 'byung gnas yin te /
translated: In order to show that it is similar to the great ocean, it is said: Just as the great ocean is the source of all jewels, so the bodhisattva is the source of all the jewels of the great welfare of all beings.

original: de ni sems can thams cad kyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pas rin po che'i 'byung gnas yin te /🔽rab tu skyed par byed pas zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: de ni sems can thams cad kyi phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pas rin po che'i 'byung gnas yin te / rab tu skyed par byed pas zhes bya bas so //
translated: The great jewels are the great welfare of all beings, because they are the cause of all the perfections of all beings.🔽The source of jewels is the cause of the jewels.

original: de'i phyir de la rin po che chen po rab tu sbyin pa yin no zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de la rin po che chen po rab tu sbyin pa yin no zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that he is the giver of the great jewels.

original: 'di dag gis ni bsod nams dang ye shes ni byang chub chen @197b po dang rgyu dang 'bras bu mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir de'i rgyu 'di ni 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gis ni bsod nams dang ye shes ni byang chub chen @197b po dang rgyu dang 'bras bu mtshungs par bstan pa'i phyir de'i rgyu 'di ni 'bras bu dang rjes su mthun pa'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: By these, it is shown that merit and intuition are the cause and result of great enlightenment, which is similar to the jewel, and so it is said that this cause is in accord with the result.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u ste bcu bzhi pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa'i le'u ste bcu bzhi pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /
translated: This concludes the commentary on the fourteenth chapter, the chapter on the perfection of wisdom.

original: // / sdom ni snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba'i 'grel ba ni sngar bstan pa'i gang la bslab pa dang / ji ltar slob pa zhes bstan pa de la pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi sbyor bas mngon par bsgrub pas bslab par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: // / sdom ni snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba'i 'grel ba ni sngar bstan pa'i gang la bslab pa dang / ji ltar slob pa zhes bstan pa de la pha rol tu phyin pa drug gi sbyor bas mngon par bsgrub pas bslab par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The summary is as before. The commentary on as before teaches that one should train in what was previously taught as the training and how to train by accomplishing it through the application of the six perfections.

original: da ni bsdu ba'i dngos po rnam pa bzhi'i sbyor bas kyang bslab par bya'o zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang mthun par bstan par bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: da ni bsdu ba'i dngos po rnam pa bzhi'i sbyor bas kyang bslab par bya'o zhes rab tu bstan pa'i phyir bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi po yang pha rol tu phyin pa drug dang mthun par bstan par bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that one should also train through the application of the four principles of gathering, and in order to demonstrate that the four principles of gathering are also in harmony with the six perfections, it is said:

original: sdom ni snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: sdom ni snga ma bzhin du zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The summary is as before.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po dang po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de bstan pa nyid kyis de yang bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bsams nas de bzhag nas snyan par smra ba nyid bstan pa ni thog ma dang / bar dang /
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po dang po ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pas de bstan pa nyid kyis de yang bstan par 'gyur ro zhes bsams nas de bzhag nas snyan par smra ba nyid bstan pa ni thog ma dang / bar dang /
translated: The first of the means of gathering disciples is the essence of the perfection of generosity, so by teaching that, the other means of gathering disciples are also taught.

original: tha mar dge ba nyid kyi tshig ni snyan par smra ba nyid kyi ngo bo zhes brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: tha mar dge ba nyid kyi tshig ni snyan par smra ba nyid kyi ngo bo zhes brjod pa yin te /
translated: The words that are virtuous in the beginning, middle, and end are said to be the essence of pleasant speech.

original: de la rna ba'i dbang pos thos pa'i dus na dbang po 'phrog cing dga' bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir thog mar dge ba'o //
analyzed: de la rna ba'i dbang pos thos pa'i dus na dbang po 'phrog cing dga' bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir thog mar dge ba'o //
translated: They are virtuous in the beginning because they captivate the sense faculty of the ear and delight it.

original: yid 'phrog par byed cing bya ba nyams dga' ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / yongs su brtags pa bzod pa'i phyir bar du dge ba'o //
analyzed: yid 'phrog par byed cing bya ba nyams dga' ba dang ldan pa'i phyir dang / yongs su brtags pa bzod pa'i phyir bar du dge ba'o //
translated: They are virtuous in the middle because they captivate the mind and are delightful to do, and because they are acceptable when examined.

original: sgrub pa nyams su len pa'i dus su yongs su gyur pa'i bde ba yin pa'i phyir tha mar dge ba'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa nyams su len pa'i dus su yongs su gyur pa'i bde ba yin pa'i phyir tha mar dge ba'o //
translated: They are virtuous in the end because they are happiness that has been transformed at the time of putting the practice into effect.

original: de la yid du 'ong ba'i tshig ni thog mar dge ba'o //
analyzed: de la yid du 'ong ba'i tshig ni thog mar dge ba'o //
translated: Pleasant words are virtuous in the beginning.

original: bden pa ni slu ba med pa yin pa'i phyir dang / yongs su brtag bzod pa'i phyir bar du dge ba'o //
analyzed: bden pa ni slu ba med pa yin pa'i phyir dang / yongs su brtag bzod pa'i phyir bar du dge ba'o //
translated: It is virtuous in the middle because it is not deceptive and because it is able to withstand thorough investigation.

original: bde bar yongs su 'gyur ba dang / phan par yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / phan pa dang bde ba'i 'bras bu chos kyi don dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir des na tha mar dge ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: bde bar yongs su 'gyur ba dang / phan par yongs su 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / phan pa dang bde ba'i 'bras bu chos kyi don dang ldan pa yin pa'i phyir des na tha mar dge ba zhes bya'o //
translated: It is virtuous in the end because it is conducive to happiness and conducive to benefit, and because it has the meaning of the Dharma, which is the result of benefit and happiness.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang thog ma dang bar dang tha ma rnams su de'i tshig bzhin du byas na bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin du 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang thog ma dang bar dang tha ma rnams su de'i tshig bzhin du byas na bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin du 'gyur zhing /
translated: Another explanation is that it is like nectar at the beginning, in the middle, and at the end, because it is like nectar if one acts in accordance with its teaching at the beginning, in the middle, and at the end.

original: yan lag gsum dang ldan pa'i legs par bshad pa ni snyan par smra ba'i ngo bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yan lag gsum dang ldan pa'i legs par bshad pa ni snyan par smra ba'i ngo bo nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that eloquent speech has three branches.

original: yan lag gsum ni snyan pa dang / bde ba dang / phan par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yan lag gsum ni snyan pa dang / bde ba dang / phan par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The three branches are pleasant, beneficial, and truthful speech.

original: snyan pa'i phyir rnar bde ba'o //
analyzed: snyan pa'i phyir rnar bde ba'o //
translated: It is pleasant to the ear because it is pleasant.

original: bde ba ni yid bde bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: bde ba ni yid bde bar byed pa ste /
translated: It is beneficial because it brings about happiness.🔽It is truthful because it is not deceptive.

original: sgrub par byed pa'i dus su dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i dus su mngon @198a * //
analyzed: sgrub par byed pa'i dus su dga' ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro // chos dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i dus su mngon @198a * //
translated: because it gives rise to joy at the time of practice.

original: par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba'i phyir phan pa dang bde ba 'dren par byed pa ste /
analyzed: par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i 'bras bu 'byung ba'i phyir phan pa dang bde ba 'dren par byed pa ste /
translated: It is beneficial and pleasant because it brings about the result of high status and certain goodness at the time of practice in accord with the Dharma.

original: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i snyan par smra ba'i ngo bo nyid de //
analyzed: 'di dag ni byang chub sems dpa'i snyan par smra ba'i ngo bo nyid de //
translated: These are the characteristics of a bodhisattva's agreeable speech.

original: mdor bsdu na rnam pa thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na rnam pa thams cad du kha na ma tho ba med pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: In brief, it should be understood as being irreproachable in every way.

original: mdor bsdu na snyan par smra ba thams cad ni rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na snyan par smra ba thams cad ni rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, all agreeable speech should be understood as being comprised of two types:

original: 'jig rten gyi gtam gyi ngo bo nyid dang / chos ston pa'i gtam gyi ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi gtam gyi ngo bo nyid dang / chos ston pa'i gtam gyi ngo bo nyid do //
translated: that which is in the nature of worldly conversation and that which is in the nature of instructive teaching.

original: de la 'jig rten gyi gtam gyi ngo bo yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten gyi gtam gyi ngo bo yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The first, that which is in the nature of worldly conversation, is also of two types:

original: dus thams cad du rab tu 'jug par bya ba yin pa'i phyir rtag tu ba dang / yang dag par 'byor pa dang ldan pa'i dus su 'jug par bya ba yin pa'i phyir res 'ga' ba'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad du rab tu 'jug par bya ba yin pa'i phyir rtag tu ba dang / yang dag par 'byor pa dang ldan pa'i dus su 'jug par bya ba yin pa'i phyir res 'ga' ba'o //
translated: It is constant because it is to be engaged in at all times, and it is occasional because it is to be engaged in at the time of the attainment of perfect mastery.

original: de yang snga ma ni yang dag par dga' bar byed pa'o //🔽gnyis pa ni kun du dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de yang snga ma ni yang dag par dga' bar byed pa'o // gnyis pa ni kun du dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: Moreover, the former is the one that delights,🔽and the latter is the one that delights others.

original: yang dag par dga' bar byed pa'i dag gang yin pa de yang rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag par dga' bar byed pa'i dag gang yin pa de yang rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The one that delights should be understood as twofold:

original: lus dang ngag gi nyes pa rnam par spong bar byed pa nyid dang ; dngos po rnam pa bzhi yongs su 'dri bar byed pa'i rnam pa nyid do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gi nyes pa rnam par spong bar byed pa nyid dang ; dngos po rnam pa bzhi yongs su 'dri bar byed pa'i rnam pa nyid do //
translated: the one that delights by means of the body and speech, and the one that delights by means of the mind.

original: de la lus kyi skyon ni gnod sems dang khong khro ba dang / mnar sems dang / phrag dog gi kun nas ldang ba dang bcas pa'i bzhin gyi 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de la lus kyi skyon ni gnod sems dang khong khro ba dang / mnar sems dang / phrag dog gi kun nas ldang ba dang bcas pa'i bzhin gyi 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The fault of the body is the change in facial expression that is accompanied by the motivating factors of malice, hostility, and violence, as well as envy.

original: de med pa'i ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de med pa'i ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the nature of the absence of that, it is said:

original: khro gnyer med la zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: khro gnyer med la zhes bya ba'o //
translated: He is without a frown.

original: dag gi skyon ni rigs mthon po la sogs pa'i nga rgyal gyis khengs pas yid kyis mi 'dud pa dang / drung du 'ongs ba rnams la mtshor ba ltar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dag gi skyon ni rigs mthon po la sogs pa'i nga rgyal gyis khengs pas yid kyis mi 'dud pa dang / drung du 'ongs ba rnams la mtshor ba ltar gnas pa'o //
translated: The fault of the mind is not bowing down due to pride in high birth, etc. and remaining like a wall for those who have approached.

original: de med pa'i ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir gsong por smra zhing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de med pa'i ngo bo bstan pa'i phyir gsong por smra zhing zhes bya ba la /
translated: In order to teach the nature of the absence of those, it says, he is a greeter.

original: rang nyid mngon du phyogs par bstan pa'i phyir 'ongs pa rnams la bde bar 'ongs sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa rang nyid sngon du smra ba'o //
analyzed: rang nyid mngon du phyogs par bstan pa'i phyir 'ongs pa rnams la bde bar 'ongs sam zhes bya ba la sogs pa rang nyid sngon du smra ba'o //
translated: In order to teach the nature of one's own orientation, it says, he is a first speaker to those who have approached, saying, 'Welcome!' and so on.

original: tshig gnyis po 'di dag tshig gzhan gnyis kyis bstan pa nyid de /
analyzed: tshig gnyis po 'di dag tshig gzhan gnyis kyis bstan pa nyid de /
translated: These two phrases are taught by two other phrases.

original: tshig gnyis kyis bstan ces bya ba yang go rims la brten nas bzhin gyi mdangs 'byin la zhes bya bas ni khro gnyer med la zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: tshig gnyis kyis bstan ces bya ba yang go rims la brten nas bzhin gyi mdangs 'byin la zhes bya bas ni khro gnyer med la zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: The phrase taught by two phrases is also based on the order. He is a face-to-face teacher teaches he is without a frown.

original: 'dzum pa sngon du gtong zhing tshig gang gi zhe bya bas ni gsong por smra zhing zhes bya ba bstan to //
analyzed: 'dzum pa sngon du gtong zhing tshig gang gi zhe bya bas ni gsong por smra zhing zhes bya ba bstan to //
translated: The phrase with a smile on his face indicates the meaning of the expression he speaks pleasantly.

original: de ltar lus dang ngag gi skyon spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar lus dang ngag gi skyon spangs pa yin no //
translated: Thus, he avoids the faults of body and speech.

original: dngos po yongs su 'dri ba'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po yongs su 'dri ba'i rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the form of his inquiry about others' welfare,

original: bde ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: bde ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: he says, Are you happy?, etc.

original: bde ba dang bde legs nyid ni gnod pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: bde ba dang bde legs nyid ni gnod pa med pa nyid de /
translated: Happy and well mean being free from injury.

original: gdon dang mi ma yin pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa med pa'i phyir @198b gnod pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gdon dang mi ma yin pa la sogs pa'i gnod pa med pa'i phyir @198b gnod pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Free from injury means that there is no injury from demons, spirits, etc.

original: nad kyi gnod pa med pa nyid ni khams snyoms pa'o //
analyzed: nad kyi gnod pa med pa nyid ni khams snyoms pa'o //
translated: Are your constituents balanced? means that there is no injury from illness.

original: gzhan dag gi lus dang sems la gnod pa med pa ni mtshan mo dang nyin mo bde ba yongs su 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag gi lus dang sems la gnod pa med pa ni mtshan mo dang nyin mo bde ba yongs su 'dri ba'o //
translated: Are you happy by day and by night? means that there is no injury to the bodies and minds of others.

original: ci zhig 'dri zhe na bde'am /
analyzed: ci zhig 'dri zhe na bde'am /
translated: What does he ask about? He asks about happiness,

original: khams snyoms sam /🔽mtshan mo bde'am /
analyzed: khams snyoms sam / mtshan mo bde'am /
translated: the balance of the constituents,🔽happiness by day,

original: nyin mo bde'am zhes 'dri bar byed do //
analyzed: nyin mo bde'am zhes 'dri bar byed do //
translated: and happiness by night.

original: tshur shog legs par 'ongs so zhes smra zhing stan 'dings pa ni yongs su 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: tshur shog legs par 'ongs so zhes smra zhing stan 'dings pa ni yongs su 'dri ba'o //
translated: Come, welcome! and he spreads out a seat for him: this is fully questioning.

original: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad ni grong khyer ba'i skye bo rnams so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad ni grong khyer ba'i skye bo rnams so //
translated: The worldly is the people of the city.

original: de dag ni dngos po'i dbang du bya ba'o //
analyzed: de dag ni dngos po'i dbang du bya ba'o //
translated: They are in the power of things,

original: 'byor pa 'phel ba'i dus su dang por snyan pa'i ngag smra ba ni yang dag par dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'byor pa 'phel ba'i dus su dang por snyan pa'i ngag smra ba ni yang dag par dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: When there is an increase of prosperity, first he speaks pleasant words: this is pleasing.

original: mdor bsdu na 'phel ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na 'phel ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In brief, there are two kinds of increase:

original: 'jig rten 'di'i 'byor pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'byor pa'i dbang du bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di'i 'byor pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'byor pa'i dbang du bya ba'o //
translated: the increase of prosperity in this world and the increase of prosperity in the next world.

original: 'jig rten 'di'i 'byor pa ni sems can dang sems can ma yin par bgrang ba'i mthar thug pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di'i 'byor pa ni sems can dang sems can ma yin par bgrang ba'i mthar thug pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: The increase of prosperity in this world is the distinction of the final limit of what is counted as sentient beings and non-sentient beings.

original: de la sems can du bgrang ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /🔽rigs rgyud nges par 'dzin pa ni gang smras pa ;🔽bu 'byor pa'am zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: de la sems can du bgrang ba yang rnam pa gnyis te / rigs rgyud nges par 'dzin pa ni gang smras pa ; bu 'byor pa'am zhes bya ba ste /
translated: Therein, counted as sentient beings is also of two kinds:🔽 holding the family lineage firmly is what is called son.🔽 Or, prosperity of son is what is called son.

original: bu rnyed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bu rnyed pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means obtaining a son.

original: rtsed mo dga' ba'i dngos po ni gang smras pa /
analyzed: rtsed mo dga' ba'i dngos po ni gang smras pa /
translated: The things that are the basis for the delight in play are as stated:

original: chung ma 'byor pa'am zhes bya ba ni rigs la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa thog pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: chung ma 'byor pa'am zhes bya ba ni rigs la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa thog pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “the acquisition of a wife” means the acquisition of a wife who is superior in terms of family and so on.

original: ma dang pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i dngos po ni gang smras pa /
analyzed: ma dang pa'i phyogs su gtogs pa'i dngos po ni gang smras pa /
translated: The things that are the basis for the delight in sexual intercourse are as stated:

original: nye du 'byor pa'am zhes bya ba ni nye du'i phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par thob par 'gyur ba ni 'byor pa'o //🔽sems can ma yin par bgrang ba'i dngos po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: nye du 'byor pa'am zhes bya ba ni nye du'i phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par thob par 'gyur ba ni 'byor pa'o // sems can ma yin par bgrang ba'i dngos po yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: “the acquisition of relatives” means the acquisition of the excellence of relatives.

original: nyo tshong 'du ba'i sgor gyur pa'i 'bras bu ni gang smras pa /
analyzed: nyo tshong 'du ba'i sgor gyur pa'i 'bras bu ni gang smras pa /
translated: The things that are the basis for the delight in the acquisition of wealth are as stated:

original: nor 'byor pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: nor 'byor pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “the acquisition of wealth” means the acquisition of the excellence of wealth.

original: zhing gis 'du ba'i sgor gyur pa ni gang yang smras pa /🔽'bru 'byor pa zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: zhing gis 'du ba'i sgor gyur pa ni gang yang smras pa / 'bru 'byor pa zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The things that are the basis for the delight in the acquisition of grain are as stated:🔽“the acquisition of grain” means the acquisition of the excellence of grain.🔽The things that are the basis for the delight in the acquisition of goods are as stated:🔽“the acquisition of goods” means the acquisition of the excellence of goods.

original: 'byor pa ni phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'byor pa ni phun sum tshogs pa'i khyad par thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: “Acquisition” means the acquisition of excellence.

original: bdag 'byor pa dang ldan par ma rtogs shing ma shes pa la 'byor pa mthong na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'byor pa dang ldan par bdag nyid kyis sngar ma shes pa la dang por de brjod pa las de thob pas rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba'i🔽phyir gang smras pa /
analyzed: bdag 'byor pa dang ldan par ma rtogs shing ma shes pa la 'byor pa mthong na zhes bya ba ni ji ltar 'byor pa dang ldan par bdag nyid kyis sngar ma shes pa la dang por de brjod pa las de thob pas rab tu dga' bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gang smras pa /
translated: When one does not understand or know that one has the means, and one sees that one has the means, one is delighted because one has obtained what one did not have before.🔽This is what is meant by the expression:

original: bsnyad cing kun du dga' bar byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsnyad cing kun du dga' bar byed pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: “one speaks and one rejoices.”

original: 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'byor pa ni mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i lam 'jug pa dang bcas pa thob pa yin par rig par bya'o //🔽de la dad pa dang / @199a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten pha rol gyi 'byor pa ni mngon par mtho ba dang / nges par legs pa'i lam 'jug pa dang bcas pa thob pa yin par rig par bya'o // de la dad pa dang / @199a * //
translated: One should understand that the means for the next world is the acquisition of the path of the high and the happy destinies, together with the entry to that path.🔽Therein, one enters by means of faith,

original: tshul khrims dang / gtong bas ni 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang / gtong bas ni 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: morality, and generosity.

original: de dag gis lus dang longs spyod khyad par du 'phags pa rjes su thob par byed pa yin pas de ltar na mngon par ma thob 'byor pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis lus dang longs spyod khyad par du 'phags pa rjes su thob par byed pa yin pas de ltar na mngon par ma thob 'byor pa yin no //
translated: Since one acquires a special body and resources through them, one has the means for the not yet acquired.

original: dad pas thos pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dad pas thos pa la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through faith, one enters into learning.

original: de las shes rab rnam pa gsum 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las shes rab rnam pa gsum 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From that, the three kinds of wisdom arise.

original: shes rab rnam pa gsum gyis ci rigs par mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas nges par legs pa yang dag par 'thob bo //
analyzed: shes rab rnam pa gsum gyis ci rigs par mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas nges par legs pa yang dag par 'thob bo //
translated: By means of the three kinds of wisdom, one abandons the addictions which are to be abandoned by the paths of seeing and cultivation, and thus one attains the highest good.

original: de ltar na nges par legs pa 'byor bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na nges par legs pa 'byor bar 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the highest good is achieved.

original: pha rol gyi 'byor pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: pha rol gyi 'byor pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the achievement of the other shore.

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi yon tan dang ldan pa ni rnam pa nyi shur rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi yon tan dang ldan pa ni rnam pa nyi shur rig par bya ste /
translated: The possession of all the qualities is to be known as twentyfold.

original: phan pa mchog gis phan 'dogs par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni snyan par smra ba gsum gyi nang nas phyi ma mchog nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: phan pa mchog gis phan 'dogs par gyur pa zhes bya ba ni snyan par smra ba gsum gyi nang nas phyi ma mchog nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: The highest benefit is the benefit of the last of the three kinds of pleasing speech.

original: de ltar na snyan par smra ba nyid kyang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na snyan par smra ba nyid kyang rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, pleasing speech is to be known as threefold:

original: dman pa dang bar ma dang / mchog tu gyur pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: dman pa dang bar ma dang / mchog tu gyur pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: inferior, middling, and superior.

original: rab tu dbye bas zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa nyid do //
analyzed: rab tu dbye bas zhes bya ba ni rgyas pa nyid do //
translated: By way of analysis means by way of extension.

original: mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mdor bsdu na zhes bya ba ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: In brief is the summary.

original: 'jig rten gyi tshul dang ldan pa ni 'jig rten pa'i lugs kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tshul dang ldan pa ni 'jig rten pa'i lugs kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: Possessing worldly ways is included in the worldly system.

original: chos bstan pa dang ldan pa ni de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: chos bstan pa dang ldan pa ni de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Possessing the teaching of Dharma means having its nature, that is the meaning.

original: dka' ba'i snyan par smra ba ni rnam pa gsum du rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: dka' ba'i snyan par smra ba ni rnam pa gsum du rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: Difficult agreeable speech is to be established in three ways.

original: gnod pa drag po byed pa'i sems can rnams la yang lan du gnod pa byed par 'dod pa byams pa'i sems bskyed pa nyid kyis zil gyis mnan pa nyid dang / shin tu rmongs shing dbang po rtul po rnams la snying rje'i sems nye bar bzhag nas yid skyo ba zil gyis mnan te phan pa dang bde ba ston pa dang /
analyzed: gnod pa drag po byed pa'i sems can rnams la yang lan du gnod pa byed par 'dod pa byams pa'i sems bskyed pa nyid kyis zil gyis mnan pa nyid dang / shin tu rmongs shing dbang po rtul po rnams la snying rje'i sems nye bar bzhag nas yid skyo ba zil gyis mnan te phan pa dang bde ba ston pa dang /
translated: Even for sentient beings who do great harm, by the mere generation of a loving mind, one is to be overcome with the desire to repay harm; and for those who are very confused and have dull faculties, having placed compassion in the mind, one is to be overcome with mental weariness, and one should teach benefit and happiness.

original: yon gnas rnams la sgyu dang g-yos rnam par gnas shing log par sgrub pa chen po byed pa rnams la yang gnod sems mi skyed pa ste /
analyzed: yon gnas rnams la sgyu dang g-yos rnam par gnas shing log par sgrub pa chen po byed pa rnams la yang gnod sems mi skyed pa ste /
translated: Even for those who are established in deceit and fraud with regard to those who are worthy of gifts, and who do great wrong practice, one should not generate malice.

original: tshig rnam pa gsum ni ji ltar rigs par dka' ba yin no //
analyzed: tshig rnam pa gsum ni ji ltar rigs par dka' ba yin no //
translated: The three types of words are difficult to understand as appropriate.🔽To demonstrate the great harm, he says:🔽murder,🔽robbery,

original: gnod pa che thang du byed pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir gsod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gnod pa che thang du byed pa nyid bstan pa'i phyir gsod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and enmity.

original: gsod pa ni srog gi bar chad byed pa'o //
analyzed: gsod pa ni srog gi bar chad byed pa'o //
translated: Murder is the obstruction of life.

original: phyir rgol ba ni longs spyod kyi bar chad byed pa'o //
analyzed: phyir rgol ba ni longs spyod kyi bar chad byed pa'o //
translated: Robbery is the obstruction of wealth.

original: dgra ni chung ma 'phrog par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dgra ni chung ma 'phrog par byed pa'o //
translated: Enmity is the stealing of a wife.

original: rnam grangs gzhan yang dge ba'i bar chad byed pa ni phyir rgol ba'o //
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan yang dge ba'i bar chad byed pa ni phyir rgol ba'o //
translated: Another explanation: murder is the obstruction of virtue;

original: phan pa ma yin pa dang / don @199b ma yin pa 'dod pa ni dgra zhes bya'o //
analyzed: phan pa ma yin pa dang / don @199b ma yin pa 'dod pa ni dgra zhes bya'o //
translated: robbery is the desire for what is not beneficial and not meaningful; and enmity is the desire for what is not beneficial and not meaningful.

original: sgo bzhi nas 'jug pa'i snyan par smra ba ni mdor bsdus na gang zag gsum gyi bya bas rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: sgo bzhi nas 'jug pa'i snyan par smra ba ni mdor bsdus na gang zag gsum gyi bya bas rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: Pleasant speech that enters through the four doors is to be established in brief by the activity of three persons.

original: gang zag gsum yang sgrub pa la mngon du phyogs pa dang / sgrub pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa dang sgrub par 'dod pa thabs mi shes pa'o //
analyzed: gang zag gsum yang sgrub pa la mngon du phyogs pa dang / sgrub pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa dang sgrub par 'dod pa thabs mi shes pa'o //
translated: The three persons are: one who is inclined to practice, one who is averse to practice, and one who desires to practice but does not know the means.

original: de la sgrub pa la mngon du phyogs pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la sgrub pa la mngon du phyogs pa la yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The person who is about to practice is also of two kinds:

original: rgyud yongs su ma smin pa dang / rgyud yongs su smin pa'o //🔽rgyud yongs su ma smin pa'i lam bskyed pa la gegs dang bcas par kun du spyod pa la dga' ba dang spro ba'i sems thob nas rgyud snod du bya ba'i phyir snga rol du bya ba'i chos bstan pa rnam pa dgu po sbyin pa'i gtam la sogs pa
analyzed: rgyud yongs su ma smin pa dang / rgyud yongs su smin pa'o // rgyud yongs su ma smin pa'i lam bskyed pa la gegs dang bcas par kun du spyod pa la dga' ba dang spro ba'i sems thob nas rgyud snod du bya ba'i phyir snga rol du bya ba'i chos bstan pa rnam pa dgu po sbyin pa'i gtam la sogs pa
translated: one whose stream of being is not yet ripe and one whose stream of being is ripe.🔽For the one whose stream of being is not yet ripe, the teacher first teaches the nine topics, such as generosity, in order to make the stream of being a fit vessel.

original: ston par byed do //
analyzed: ston par byed do //
translated: The teacher teaches these topics to the one who is not yet practicing the path, who is not yet a fit vessel, who is not yet free of obstacles, and who is not yet happy and enthusiastic about practice.

original: rgyud yongs su smin pa ni sems dga' zhing sgrib pa med la spro ba dang bcas pa ste /
analyzed: rgyud yongs su smin pa ni sems dga' zhing sgrib pa med la spro ba dang bcas pa ste /
translated: The one whose stream of being is ripe is happy, free of obscurations, and enthusiastic.

original: de'i 'phags pa'i lam bskyed pa'i phyir dang / dar 'gro las gdon pa'i phyir dang / yang dag pa'i 'don par byed pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ston par byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'phags pa'i lam bskyed pa'i phyir dang / dar 'gro las gdon pa'i phyir dang / yang dag pa'i 'don par byed pa'i 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi ston par byed do //
translated: For the one whose stream of being is ripe, the teacher teaches the four noble truths, which are the correct view, in order to generate the noble path in that person, in order to free that person from the life-cycle, and in order to make that person a fit vessel for the noble path.

original: sgrub pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa la yang khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: sgrub pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa la yang khyim pa dang / rab tu byung ba'i phyogs kyi dbye bas rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: Those who turn their backs on spiritual practice are of two types: householders and monastics.

original: de la khyim pa ni 'dod pa la zhen pa dang ldan pas pag med pa'i phyir dge ba'i chos rnams sgom par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de la khyim pa ni 'dod pa la zhen pa dang ldan pas pag med pa'i phyir dge ba'i chos rnams sgom par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Among them, householders do not cultivate wholesome dharmas because they are careless due to attachment to desires.

original: rab tu byung ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la chags pa dang ldan pas so //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti la chags pa dang ldan pas so //
translated: Monastics do so because they are attached to gain and honor.

original: yang khyim pa ni mi dge ba'i chos la spyod pas so //
analyzed: yang khyim pa ni mi dge ba'i chos la spyod pas so //
translated: Moreover, householders engage in unwholesome dharmas.

original: rab tu byung ba ni lung du ma bstan pa'i chos la spyod pas so //
analyzed: rab tu byung ba ni lung du ma bstan pa'i chos la spyod pas so //
translated: Monastics engage in indeterminate dharmas.

original: bag med pa gnyi ga la yang dge ba'i chos bsgom pa med pa'i phyir de dag la yang dag par bskul ba ni dus dang mthun par don 'dod pas byams pa'i sems nyid kyis tshig snyan pas 'di ltar mi nyid dang / 'phags pa'i rigs kyi yul du skyes pa dang /
analyzed: bag med pa gnyi ga la yang dge ba'i chos bsgom pa med pa'i phyir de dag la yang dag par bskul ba ni dus dang mthun par don 'dod pas byams pa'i sems nyid kyis tshig snyan pas 'di ltar mi nyid dang / 'phags pa'i rigs kyi yul du skyes pa dang /
translated: Since neither of them cultivate wholesome dharmas, one should exhort them with loving thoughts, speaking pleasantly in a timely manner, desiring their welfare, saying: You have been born as a human, in a country where the noble ones are found,

original: dbang po mtshang ba med pa dang / las kyi mtha' phyin ci ma log pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la dad pa thob par gyur nas khyod lta bu 'di ltar phyin ci log tu zhugs nas don ma yin pa la ci'i phyir spyod ces dra na par byed cing yang dag par skul bar byed do //
analyzed: dbang po mtshang ba med pa dang / las kyi mtha' phyin ci ma log pa dang / de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la dad pa thob par gyur nas khyod lta bu 'di ltar phyin ci log tu zhugs nas don ma yin pa la ci'i phyir spyod ces dra na par byed cing yang dag par skul bar byed do //
translated: When they have obtained the faculties that are not defective, the unerring culmination of action, and the attainment of faith in the teachings of the Tathagata, they will ask you, Why do you engage in this meaningless conduct that is so contrary to the Dharma?

original: thabs mi shes pa rnams kyi the tshom byung ngo cog ste chos som nyi dang ldan pa de dag gi skyes shing skyes pa'i the tshom gcod pa ni bstan pa dang / nye bar bstan pas ston pa ste /
analyzed: thabs mi shes pa rnams kyi the tshom byung ngo cog ste chos som nyi dang ldan pa de dag gi skyes shing skyes pa'i the tshom gcod pa ni bstan pa dang / nye bar bstan pas ston pa ste /
translated: For those who do not know the means, the Exalted One cuts through every doubt that arises, and through teaching and demonstrating, he cuts through the doubts that arise again and again for those who have doubts about the Dharma.

original: chos bstan pa dang / 'bel ba'i gtam rnam par nges par bya'i zhes bya @200a * //
analyzed: chos bstan pa dang / 'bel ba'i gtam rnam par nges par bya'i zhes bya @200a * //
translated: He teaches the Dharma and resolves doubts about the scriptures.

original: ba'o ; / skyes bu mchog gi snyan par smra ba ni skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi snyan par smra ba zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: ba'o ; / skyes bu mchog gi snyan par smra ba ni skyes bu dam pa rnams kyi snyan par smra ba zhes bya ba ste /
translated: The Exalted One's pleasant speech to the best of beings is called pleasant speech to the holy ones.

original: skyes bu dam pa nyid kyi thun mong ma yin pas ston te /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa nyid kyi thun mong ma yin pas ston te /
translated: It is taught as being unique to the holy ones.

original: chos ston pa ni rnam pa lngar yongs su bstan pa ste /
analyzed: chos ston pa ni rnam pa lngar yongs su bstan pa ste /
translated: Teaching the Dharma is shown in five aspects.

original: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpar gyur pa dang zhes bya bas ni sa chen po la zhugs pa rang gi ngo bo lus la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' byang chub sems dpar gyur pa dang zhes bya bas ni sa chen po la zhugs pa rang gi ngo bo lus la gnas pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva as a bodhisattva is the essence of the bodhisattva who has entered the great stages.

original: de bzhin gshegs par gyur pa zhes bya bas ni de nyid sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku'i tshul gyis gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs par gyur pa zhes bya bas ni de nyid sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa'i sku'i tshul gyis gnas pa'o //
translated: The Tathagata is the same one in the form of the emanation body of the Buddha.

original: thun mong ma yin pa ston pa ni 'dul ba las bcas pa dang / mdo sde las bcas pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam pa lngar shes par bya'o //
analyzed: thun mong ma yin pa ston pa ni 'dul ba las bcas pa dang / mdo sde las bcas pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam pa lngar shes par bya'o //
translated: The teaching of the uncommon is to be understood in five aspects from the point of view of the rules of the Vinaya and the rules of the Sutras.

original: 'dul ba las bcas pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /🔽gleng gzhi dang bcas pa dang / nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: 'dul ba las bcas pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa / gleng gzhi dang bcas pa dang / nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: From the point of view of the rules of the Vinaya, it is said:🔽With its nidana and with its renunciation.

original: ltung ba byung ba la mkhas pa dang / de las nges par 'byung ba la mkhas pa la brten nas go rims bzhin te /
analyzed: ltung ba byung ba la mkhas pa dang / de las nges par 'byung ba la mkhas pa la brten nas go rims bzhin te /
translated: In dependence on the expertise in the occurrence of downfalls and the expertise in the renunciation of them, respectively.

original: ltung ba 'byung ba la mkhas pa la brten nas /
analyzed: ltung ba 'byung ba la mkhas pa la brten nas /
translated: Relying on expertise in the occurrence of downfalls,🔽disciples who have committed faults that accord with the things that should not be done are established in the basis of training.

original: gdul bya rnams kyis bya ba ma yin pa spyod pa'i dngos po dang mthun pa'i nyes pa byas pa las bslab pa'i gzhi gnas te dus su 'cha' ba gang yin pa de ni gleng gzhi dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyis bya ba ma yin pa spyod pa'i dngos po dang mthun pa'i nyes pa byas pa las bslab pa'i gzhi gnas te dus su 'cha' ba gang yin pa de ni gleng gzhi dang bcas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is established at the proper time is said to have a basis.

original: ji skad du 'dul ba las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'dul ba las /
translated: As the Vinaya states:

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis gleng gzhi 'di dang / rab tu dbye ba 'di dang / dngos po 'di las zhes rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis gleng gzhi 'di dang / rab tu dbye ba 'di dang / dngos po 'di las zhes rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The Bhagavat taught in detail the basis, the classification, and the thing from which this arises.

original: nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa ni de bzhin du bslab pa'i gzhi'i gnas su bcas pa'i chos ston pa dang / nges par 'byung ba la mkhas pa la brten nas dus dang / yul dang / gang zag dang / gnas skabs la ltos nas ltung ba med pa yang gsungs te /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa ni de bzhin du bslab pa'i gzhi'i gnas su bcas pa'i chos ston pa dang / nges par 'byung ba la mkhas pa la brten nas dus dang / yul dang / gang zag dang / gnas skabs la ltos nas ltung ba med pa yang gsungs te /
translated: That which has an escape is the teaching of the Dharma that is established as a basis of training in that way, and relying on expertise in escape, the Vinaya states that there is no downfall in consideration of time, place, person, and situation.

original: las dang po pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: las dang po pa la nyes pa med do zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par bstan pa yin no //
translated: It is taught in detail that there is no fault for a beginner and so on.

original: de lta bu'i 'dul ba'i bslab pa rnam pa gnyis po bcas pa ltung ba byung ba dang / nges par 'byung ba la mkhas pa 'di ni sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams ma yin pa gzhan nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'dul ba'i bslab pa rnam pa gnyis po bcas pa ltung ba byung ba dang / nges par 'byung ba la mkhas pa 'di ni sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams ma yin pa gzhan nyan thos la sogs pa rnams kyi ma yin pa'o //
translated: Such is the twofold training in the precepts of the Vinaya. The Buddha and the great bodhisattvas are skilled in the downfalls and in the certain deliverance from them, but not the śrāvakas and others who are not like them.

original: de'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir thun mong ma yin pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be “uncommon.”

original: mdo sde las bcas pa'i dbang du byas nas ni rnam pa gsum bstan to //
analyzed: mdo sde las bcas pa'i dbang du byas nas ni rnam pa gsum bstan to //
translated: From the perspective of the sūtras and the precepts, it is taught as threefold.

original: rton pa dang bcas par bstan pa ni dngos po rnam pa bzhi la rton pa rnam pa bzhi bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rton pa dang bcas par bstan pa ni dngos po rnam pa bzhi la rton pa rnam pa bzhi bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching of reliance is the teaching of the four kinds of reliance on the four kinds of things.

original: rtul ba dang bcas pa bstan pa ni sdug @200b bsngal thams cad las nges par 'byung ba'i lam bstan pa'o //
analyzed: rtul ba dang bcas pa bstan pa ni sdug @200b bsngal thams cad las nges par 'byung ba'i lam bstan pa'o //
translated: The teaching of practice is the teaching of the path that definitely delivers from all suffering.

original: cho 'phrul dang bcas pa ston pa ni cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum la brten nas ji ltar rigs par sems can rnams gzhug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: cho 'phrul dang bcas pa ston pa ni cho 'phrul rnam pa gsum la brten nas ji ltar rigs par sems can rnams gzhug par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The teaching of miracles is the teaching of the three kinds of miracles, in order to engage sentient beings in the practice of the path in whatever way is appropriate.

original: dngos po rnam pa bzhi las dang po gnyis ni 'di gnyis te /
analyzed: dngos po rnam pa bzhi las dang po gnyis ni 'di gnyis te /
translated: The four kinds of things are:

original: chos dang / gang zag go //
analyzed: chos dang / gang zag go //
translated: the Dharma and the person.

original: de las chos la brtan par bya'i gang zag la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de las chos la brtan par bya'i gang zag la ni ma yin te /
translated: Among them, one should rely on the Dharma, not the person,

original: gang gi tshe de nyid las rnam par gyur nas gzhan du 'gyur ba yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de nyid las rnam par gyur nas gzhan du 'gyur ba yang srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible that the person may change and become someone else.

original: chos kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: chos kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The Dharma is also of two kinds:

original: don dang yi ge'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: don dang yi ge'i dbye bas so //
translated: that which is in the form of words and that which is in the form of knowledge.

original: de dag las kyang don la brtan par bya'i yi ge la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag las kyang don la brtan par bya'i yi ge la ni ma yin te /
translated: Among them, one should rely on the Dharma in the form of knowledge, not that in the form of words,

original: yi ge ni rnam grangs dang / yongs su 'gyur ba'i sgo nas yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / yang dag pa'i don rab tu ston pas so //
analyzed: yi ge ni rnam grangs dang / yongs su 'gyur ba'i sgo nas yang dag pa ma yin pa dang / yang dag pa'i don rab tu ston pas so //
translated: because the latter is not the true meaning, since it is subject to change and to mispronunciation, but the former is the true meaning.

original: don yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: don yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The Dharma in the form of knowledge is also of two kinds:

original: drang ba'i don dang / nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: drang ba'i don dang / nges pa'i don to //
translated: that of provisional meaning and that of definitive meaning.

original: de la nges pa'i don la brtan par bya ste /
analyzed: de la nges pa'i don la brtan par bya ste /
translated: Among them, one should rely on the Dharma of definitive meaning,

original: tshig gi don so sor rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshig gi don so sor rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the meaning that is to be realized.

original: drang ba'i don la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: drang ba'i don la ni ma yin te /
translated: One should not rely on the Dharma of provisional meaning,🔽because it is the meaning that is to be interpreted.

original: don gzhan ston pas na tshig gi don rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gzhan ston pas na tshig gi don rtogs par dka' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the meaning of the words is difficult to understand when it is taught by another.

original: don nye bar thob pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: don nye bar thob pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The attainment of the object is also twofold:

original: rang gi mtshan nyid nye bar thob ba ni snang ba tsam gyi dngos po 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid nye bar thob ba ni snang ba tsam gyi dngos po 'dzin pa'i rnam par shes pa'o //
translated: the attainment of the own-characteristic is the consciousness that apprehends the entity of mere appearance;

original: phyin ci ma log pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid thob pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rjes su mthun pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs rnam par byang ba dang mthun pa'i rnam pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: phyin ci ma log pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid thob pa ni 'dod chags dang bral ba dang rjes su mthun pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs rnam par byang ba dang mthun pa'i rnam pa yongs su 'dzin pa'i ye shes so //
translated: the attainment of the undistorted universal characteristic is the intuition that apprehends the aspects that are conducive to freedom from attachment and that are conducive to purification, which is the counteragent to the defilement family.

original: de las dang po la bstan par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de las dang po la bstan par mi bya ste /
translated: The first of these should not be taught,

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba la rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba la rjes su mthun pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is not conducive to freedom from attachment.

original: gnyis pa de las bzlog pa ye shes kyi bdag nyid can la ni bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa de las bzlog pa ye shes kyi bdag nyid can la ni bstan par bya'o //
translated: The second, which is the opposite of that, which has the nature of intuition, should be taught.

original: de ltar na rton pa dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rton pa dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is endowed with reliance.

original: rtul ba ni lam gyi nus pa'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: rtul ba ni lam gyi nus pa'i khyad par ro //
translated: Steadfastness is a special ability of the path.

original: de ni sdug bsngal thams cad las nges par 'byung bar byed pa nyid du khong du chud par byed do //
analyzed: de ni sdug bsngal thams cad las nges par 'byung bar byed pa nyid du khong du chud par byed do //
translated: It is understood that it causes the definite emergence from all suffering.

original: phyir mi ldog par zhes bya ba ni shin tu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par zhes bya ba ni shin tu zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The term irreversible means very.

original: bstan pa don dang bcas pa ni cho 'phrul dang bcas pa'i chos ston pa'o //
analyzed: bstan pa don dang bcas pa ni cho 'phrul dang bcas pa'i chos ston pa'o //
translated: The teaching is meaningful because it is a teaching of the Dharma with miracles.

original: snyan par smra ba rnam pa drug ni rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag par bya ste /🔽'dul ba'i bslab pa'i gnas la rjes su gnang ba dang / dgag par bstan pa dang / mdo sde las rnam pa thams cad kyi tshig gi don nges par bstan pa'i bstan pa'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba rnam pa drug ni rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag par bya ste / 'dul ba'i bslab pa'i gnas la rjes su gnang ba dang / dgag par bstan pa dang / mdo sde las rnam pa thams cad kyi tshig gi don nges par bstan pa'i bstan pa'o //
translated: The six kinds of pleasant speech are to be understood as being of two kinds:

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi tshig gi don nges par bstan pa ni so @201a * //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi tshig gi don nges par bstan pa ni so @201a * //
translated: the teaching of permission and prohibition with regard to the bases of training in the precepts of the disciples, and the teaching of the demonstration of the meaning of the words of all the aspects in the sūtras.🔽The demonstration of the meaning of the words of all the aspects is based on the four analytical knowledges.

original: so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la brten pa'i rnam grangs dang / mtshan nyid dang nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'i dbye bas so //
analyzed: so yang dag par rig pa bzhi la brten pa'i rnam grangs dang / mtshan nyid dang nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so so yang dag par rig pa'i dbye bas so //
translated: It is a division of the analytical knowledges of synonyms, meanings, languages, and eloquence.

original: rnam pa bdun du rnam par gzhag pa ni 'jig rten gyi tshul gyi gtam dang / dman pa dang / bar ma dang / mchog rnams ji ltar rigs par yang dag par zhugs pa la ji ltar 'dod pa'i don sbyin pa dang / 'jigs pa rnams la dbugs dbyung ba'i gtam dang /
analyzed: rnam pa bdun du rnam par gzhag pa ni 'jig rten gyi tshul gyi gtam dang / dman pa dang / bar ma dang / mchog rnams ji ltar rigs par yang dag par zhugs pa la ji ltar 'dod pa'i don sbyin pa dang / 'jigs pa rnams la dbugs dbyung ba'i gtam dang /
translated: The sevenfold classification is from the point of view of conversation that is worldly, inferior, middling, and superior, as appropriate, and that gives the desired object, conversation that gives relief to those who are afraid,

original: rmongs pa rnams la rigs pas nye bar ston pa dang / phyin ci log la zhugs pa rnams yang dag pa'i dngos por skul ba dang / rang nyid la nus pa med na yang gzhan dag la skul bar byed pa'i gtam gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa rnams la rigs pas nye bar ston pa dang / phyin ci log la zhugs pa rnams yang dag pa'i dngos por skul ba dang / rang nyid la nus pa med na yang gzhan dag la skul bar byed pa'i gtam gyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: conversation that teaches with reasoning to those who are confused, conversation that encourages those who are engaged in error to take up the real thing, and conversation that encourages others even if one is not able to do it oneself.

original: 'jig rten gyi tshul gyi gtam ni yang dag par dga' bar byed pa dang / kun du dga' bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi tshul gyi gtam ni yang dag par dga' bar byed pa dang / kun du dga' bar byed pa'o //
translated: Conversation that is worldly is that which delights and pleases.

original: ji ltar 'dod pa'i don sbyin pa ni rnam pa gnyis te yo byad thams cad kyis snying las chung bar bya ba dang / bya ba thams cad la snying las chung bar bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid kyis de dag yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dod pa'i don sbyin pa ni rnam pa gnyis te yo byad thams cad kyis snying las chung bar bya ba dang / bya ba thams cad la snying las chung bar bya ba'i phyir bdag nyid kyis de dag yang dag par sgrub par byed pa'o //
translated: The giving of desired objects is twofold: in order to be of service in all activities, one accomplishes them oneself.

original: slu zhing rnam par nyams pa'i bdag nyid can gyi ngag ni de lta bu'i tha snyad kyis sems can rnams sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: slu zhing rnam par nyams pa'i bdag nyid can gyi ngag ni de lta bu'i tha snyad kyis sems can rnams sdug bsngal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Speech which is deceptive and of a nature to fail is a cause of suffering for sentient beings because of such conventions.

original: de las bzlog pa'i 'dod pa rnams la mi slu ba'i rnam pa ni ngag gi tha snyad rnam pa brgyad do //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i 'dod pa rnams la mi slu ba'i rnam pa ni ngag gi tha snyad rnam pa brgyad do //
translated: The opposite of that is the eightfold conventional usage of speech which is not deceptive with regard to desired objects.

original: yongs su dag pa'i ngag gi kun du spyod pa ni phongs shing 'dod pa'i snyan par smra ba'o //
analyzed: yongs su dag pa'i ngag gi kun du spyod pa ni phongs shing 'dod pa'i snyan par smra ba'o //
translated: The completely pure conventional usage of speech is the pleasant speech of one who is poor and desirous.

original: ngag rnam par dag pa rnam pa bzhi la brten nas zhes bya bas ni 'phags pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bstan to //
analyzed: ngag rnam par dag pa rnam pa bzhi la brten nas zhes bya bas ni 'phags pa'i tha snyad kyi rgyu gsal bar bya ba'i phyir bstan to //
translated: The phrase based upon the fourfold purity of speech indicates the cause of the usage of the noble ones.

original: rnam pa bzhis yongs su dag pa'i ngag gi kun du spyod pa nyid la 'phags pa'i tha snyad brgyad gzhag par bya'o//
analyzed: rnam pa bzhis yongs su dag pa'i ngag gi kun du spyod pa nyid la 'phags pa'i tha snyad brgyad gzhag par bya'o//
translated: The eight noble expressions should be posited in relation to the completely pure conduct of speech in four ways.

original: gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma yin no zhes bsams pa'o //
translated: not in relation to others.

original: 'di dang gzhan du bde ba'i snyan par smra ba ni phongs pa spong ba dang / phun sum tshogs pa nye bar sgrub par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dang gzhan du bde ba'i snyan par smra ba ni phongs pa spong ba dang / phun sum tshogs pa nye bar sgrub par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: Pleasant speech is established in relation to the abandonment of poverty and the accomplishment of prosperity in this life and the next.

original: phongs pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: phongs pa yang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Poverty is twofold in brief:

original: 'jig rten 'dir thob pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol du thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dir thob pa dang / 'jig rten pha rol du thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: poverty in this life and poverty in the next life.

original: yang rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i dbye bas rgyus phongs pa dang / 'bras bus phongs pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yang rgyu dang / 'bras bu'i dbye bas rgyus phongs pa dang / 'bras bus phongs pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Moreover, it is poverty in terms of cause and poverty in terms of effect.

original: dang po ni rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dang po ni rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The first is threefold:

original: nye du srog dang bral ba'am sdug pa dang bral ba'i phongs pa dang / de lta bu la gnas pa la 'chi ba dang / mi rtag pa bstan @201b pas mya ngan sel bar byed pa'i snyan par smra ba nyid dang / yid du 'ong ba'i longs spyod dang nye bar spyod pa rnam par nyams pa ni me la sogs pas longs spyod rlag pa'i mya ngan sel ba ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: nye du srog dang bral ba'am sdug pa dang bral ba'i phongs pa dang / de lta bu la gnas pa la 'chi ba dang / mi rtag pa bstan @201b pas mya ngan sel bar byed pa'i snyan par smra ba nyid dang / yid du 'ong ba'i longs spyod dang nye bar spyod pa rnam par nyams pa ni me la sogs pas longs spyod rlag pa'i mya ngan sel ba ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: The pleasant speech of the bodhisattva is the consolation of those who are in distress due to the loss of relatives, or the loss of wealth. The consolation of those who are in distress due to the loss of life is the teaching of impermanence and death. The consolation of those who are in distress due to the loss of pleasant enjoyments and enjoyments is the teaching of impermanence and death, as before.

original: nad mngon du gyur pas nad med pas phongs par gyur pa la so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa bstan pas so //
analyzed: nad mngon du gyur pas nad med pas phongs par gyur pa la so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang / sdug bsngal dang du len pa'i bzod pa bstan pas so //
translated: The consolation of those who are in distress due to the loss of health is the teaching of the power of discernment and the patience of accepting suffering.

original: phongs pa gnyis pa ni rnam pa gnyis te //
analyzed: phongs pa gnyis pa ni rnam pa gnyis te //
translated: The second kind of distress is twofold.

original: tshul khrims nyams pa las kun du spyod pa dang / phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: tshul khrims nyams pa las kun du spyod pa dang / phyin ci log tu mngon par zhen pa'o //
translated: The distress of those who are in distress due to the loss of morality is the teaching of the practice and the teaching of the non-inversion of the nature of morality.

original: de dag gnyi ga spang ba'i phyir tshul khrims kyi yang dag pa'i gtam dang / shes rab kyi yang dag pa'i gtam byed pa ni snyan par smra ba'o /
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga spang ba'i phyir tshul khrims kyi yang dag pa'i gtam dang / shes rab kyi yang dag pa'i gtam byed pa ni snyan par smra ba'o /
translated: Pleasant speech is the correct teaching of morality and wisdom in order to abandon both of those.

original: phun sum tshogs pa nye bar sgrub par byed pa ni 'dul ba'i bslab pa dang yang dag par ldan pa ni dge slong rnams rigs bzhi'i bslab pa'i gnas la yongs su dag par slob par ston pa'o //
analyzed: phun sum tshogs pa nye bar sgrub par byed pa ni 'dul ba'i bslab pa dang yang dag par ldan pa ni dge slong rnams rigs bzhi'i bslab pa'i gnas la yongs su dag par slob par ston pa'o //
translated: Correct practice is the teaching of the training in the precepts of the Vinaya, which is the training in the four types of training for monks.

original: rigs kyi le'u las zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi le'u las zhes bya ba ni rjes su mthun par zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The chapter on family is the chapter on in accordance with that and so on.

original: snyan par smra ba gang yin pa de ni don spyod pa yang yin te /
analyzed: snyan par smra ba gang yin pa de ni don spyod pa yang yin te /
translated: Pleasant speech is also beneficial conduct,

original: snyan par smra ba de dang der nye bar bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'i don spyod pa yang yin pas don spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba de dang der nye bar bsgrub par bya ba gang yin pa de ni 'dod pa'i don spyod pa yang yin pas don spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: because that pleasant speech is also beneficial conduct in that it accomplishes the desired aim.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: don spyod pa ni zhes bya ba la tshig 'khyal pa rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
analyzed: don spyod pa ni zhes bya ba la tshig 'khyal pa rnam par gzhag pa yin te /
translated: Beneficial conduct is the correct teaching of the Dharma.🔽The correct teaching of the Dharma is the correct teaching of the Dharma that is beneficial, which is the correct teaching of the Dharma that is not meaningless speech.

original: ji ltar brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams ni ngag 'khyal pa yang yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa'i tshig rnams ni ngag 'khyal pa yang yin te /
translated: For example, speech that is lying, etc. is also idle chatter,

original: nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is afflicted.

original: nyon mongs can rnams ni ngag 'khyal pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: nyon mongs can rnams ni ngag 'khyal pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: The words “afflicted speech is idle chatter” are stated.🔽In order to eliminate the fault that is stated, namely, that it would follow that the four verbal misdeeds would not exist if the meaning were so,

original: gang don de lta na ni ngag gi nyes par spyod pa bzhi char ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i skyon spang ba'i phyir brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa lam gzhan du gyur pa'i ngag 'khyal ba yang yod pas rnam par 'jog pa bzhin
analyzed: gang don de lta na ni ngag gi nyes par spyod pa bzhi char ma yin par thal bar 'gyur ro zhes zer ba'i skyon spang ba'i phyir brdzun du smra ba la sogs pa lam gzhan du gyur pa'i ngag 'khyal ba yang yod pas rnam par 'jog pa bzhin
translated: idle chatter that is a different path from lying, etc. is also posited here.

original: du / 'dir yang snyan par smra ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid don spyod pa yin na yang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi tha dad du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: du / 'dir yang snyan par smra ba nyid kyi mtshan nyid don spyod pa yin na yang bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi tha dad du rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In the same way, even though the definition of pleasant speech is meaningful speech, it is stated in order to present the four principles for attracting disciples as distinct.

original: de las bye brag tu gyur pa'i don spyod pa gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de las bye brag tu gyur pa'i don spyod pa gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Meaningful speech that is different from that is also stated, beginning with “another.”

original: de dag gnyi ga bshad pa'i phyir 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga bshad pa'i phyir 'di ltar byang chub sems dpa' ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In order to explain both of these, it says: thus, the bodhisattva...

original: snyan par smra pa dang ldan pa de ni snyan par smra bar rigs pas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: snyan par smra pa dang ldan pa de ni snyan par smra bar rigs pas zhes bya ste /
translated: The one who is endowed with pleasant speech is the one who is fit to speak pleasantly,

original: sems can sdud pa'i thabs su gyur pa'i phyir ro //🔽yang dag par bstan pa ni rjes su gzung bas khas @202a * //
analyzed: sems can sdud pa'i thabs su gyur pa'i phyir ro // yang dag par bstan pa ni rjes su gzung bas khas @202a * //
translated: because he is the means of attracting sentient beings.

original: blangs shing bdag gir byas pa'o //
analyzed: blangs shing bdag gir byas pa'o //
translated: Correct teaching is the acceptance and ownership of the latter through the process of being taken into the following.

original: de ltar na go rims bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na go rims bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the order is demonstrated.

original: snyan par smra ba'i rjes thogs su don mthun pa la 'jug par byed do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: snyan par smra ba'i rjes thogs su don mthun pa la 'jug par byed do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Immediately after pleasant speech, one should engage in the same purpose.

original: bslab pa rnams zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la sogs pa bslab pa rnam pa gsum yin la /
analyzed: bslab pa rnams zhes bya ba ni lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bslab pa la sogs pa bslab pa rnam pa gsum yin la /
translated: The trainings are the three trainings in superior morality, etc.

original: de dag kyang don spyod pa rnam pa bcus rab tu phye ba yin par rgyu bcus rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang don spyod pa rnam pa bcus rab tu phye ba yin par rgyu bcus rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: And they are distinguished by ten kinds of altruistic activity, and are established by ten causes.

original: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad kyis don yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam pa thams cad kyis don yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said from the point of view of the fulfillment of the meaning in all aspects.

original: don spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: don spyod pa'i ngo bo nyid rnam par gzhag par rig par bya ste /
translated: The nature of the practice of the meaning should be understood as being established.

original: don gyi gtso bo yongs su 'dzin pa'i dbang du byas nas so //
analyzed: don gyi gtso bo yongs su 'dzin pa'i dbang du byas nas so //
translated: It is from the point of view of the possession of the principal meaning.

original: rgyu bcu po gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: rgyu bcu po gang yin zhe na /
translated: What are the ten causes?

original: sdom pa gsum gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdom pa gsum gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is the cause of the three vows.

original: sdom pa gsum ni tshul khrims nyams pa las sdom pa dang / yul las sdom pa dang / nyon mongs pa las sdom pa'o //
analyzed: sdom pa gsum ni tshul khrims nyams pa las sdom pa dang / yul las sdom pa dang / nyon mongs pa las sdom pa'o //
translated: The three vows are the vow of morality, the vow of the object, and the vow of the afflictions.

original: tshangs par spyod pa gsum gyi rgyu yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa gsum gyi rgyu yin pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: It is also because it is the cause of the three pure practices.

original: tshangs par spyod pa rnam pa gsum ni log pa'i sdom pa blangs pa dang / gtan du ma spangs pa dang / gtan du spangs pa'o //
analyzed: tshangs par spyod pa rnam pa gsum ni log pa'i sdom pa blangs pa dang / gtan du ma spangs pa dang / gtan du spangs pa'o //
translated: The three pure practices are the vow of the non-erroneous, the vow of the non-abandoned, and the vow of the abandoned.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen po'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa rnam pa gsum gyi gnyen po'i yang phyir te /
translated: It is also because it is the antidote to the three kinds of afflictions.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum ni nyes par spyod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni sdig pa byed pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa gsum ni nyes par spyod pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni sdig pa byed pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The three kinds of defilement are: the defilement of bad conduct, for those who commit sins;

original: srad pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni de las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa can rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: srad pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni de las gzhan pa'i 'dod pa can rnams kyi'o //
translated: the defilement of craving, for those who are in the realm of desire, other than the former;

original: lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni mu stegs can rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: lta ba'i kun nas nyon mongs pa ni mu stegs can rnams kyi'o //
translated: and the defilement of views, for the heterodox.

original: ngan 'gro dang / gnod pa dang bcas pa'i bde 'gro dang / gnod pa med pa'i bde 'gro'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: ngan 'gro dang / gnod pa dang bcas pa'i bde 'gro dang / gnod pa med pa'i bde 'gro'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa'i yang phyir te /
translated: It is also because it is the counteragent to the three kinds of life: life in the unfortunate planes of existence, life in the fortunate planes of existence which is subject to harm, and life in the fortunate planes of existence which is not subject to harm.

original: ngan 'gro ni ngan song rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: ngan 'gro ni ngan song rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: Life in the unfortunate planes of existence refers to the three unfortunate planes of existence.

original: gnod pa dang bcas pa'i bde 'gro ni ngan 'gro rnams ma gtogs pa 'dod pa'i khams pa ste /
analyzed: gnod pa dang bcas pa'i bde 'gro ni ngan 'gro rnams ma gtogs pa 'dod pa'i khams pa ste /
translated: Life in the fortunate planes of existence which is subject to harm refers to the realm of desire, with the exception of the unfortunate planes of existence.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is the feeling of suffering.

original: gnod pa med pa'i bde 'gro ni gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa med pa'i bde 'gro ni gzugs dang / gzugs med pa'o //
translated: Life in the fortunate planes of existence which is not subject to harm refers to the realms of form and the formless.

original: nag po'i las dang / las 'dren ma dang / dkar po'i las rnams kyi gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: nag po'i las dang / las 'dren ma dang / dkar po'i las rnams kyi gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa'i yang phyir te /
translated: because they are the counteragents to black karma, mixed karma, and white karma.

original: nag po ni mi dge ba'o //
analyzed: nag po ni mi dge ba'o //
translated: Black karma is nonvirtuous.

original: 'dren ma ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'o //
analyzed: 'dren ma ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'o //
translated: Mixed karma is virtuous karma in the desire realm.

original: dkar po ni gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'o //
analyzed: dkar po ni gzugs dang / gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i dge ba'o //
translated: White karma is virtuous karma in the form and formless realms.

original: gnas skabs gsum gyi nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa'i yang @202b phyir te //
analyzed: gnas skabs gsum gyi nyon mongs pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur pa'i yang @202b phyir te //
translated: They are also counteragents to the afflictions in three states:

original: gnas skabs gsum gyi nyon mongs pa ni mngon par zil gyis gnon pa'i gnas skabs dang / kun du spyod pa'i gnas skabs dang / bag la nyal gyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: gnas skabs gsum gyi nyon mongs pa ni mngon par zil gyis gnon pa'i gnas skabs dang / kun du spyod pa'i gnas skabs dang / bag la nyal gyi gnas skabs so //
translated: the state of manifest afflictions, the state of conduct, and the state of latent tendencies.

original: yang sdig pa'i spyod pa dang / 'dod pa'i spyod pa dang / dka' ba'i spyod pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur ba'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: yang sdig pa'i spyod pa dang / 'dod pa'i spyod pa dang / dka' ba'i spyod pa'i gnyen po'i phyogs su gyur ba'i yang phyir te /
translated: They are also counteragents to the conduct of evil, the conduct of desire, and the conduct of hardship.

original: sdig pa'i spyod pa ni las ngan pa byed pa rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sdig pa'i spyod pa ni las ngan pa byed pa rnams kyi'o //
translated: The conduct of evil is that of those who do bad actions.

original: 'dod pa'i spyod pa ni 'dod pa'i bde ba la mngon par zhen pa rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i spyod pa ni 'dod pa'i bde ba la mngon par zhen pa rnams so //
translated: The conduct of desire is for those who are attached to the pleasures of desire.

original: dka' ba'i spyod pa ni bdag nyid ngal zhing dub par byed pa'o //
analyzed: dka' ba'i spyod pa ni bdag nyid ngal zhing dub par byed pa'o //
translated: The conduct of austerity is for those who torment themselves.

original: rab tu byung bas ni mtha' de gnyi ga spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //🔽yang bde 'gro dang // 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i yang phyir ro //🔽yang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i yang phyir dang / gnyis kyis skal ba dang ldan pa rnams mnyam par gzhag pa dang rnam par grol ba'i rgyu yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu byung bas ni mtha' de gnyi ga spang bar bya'o zhes bya ba yin no // yang bde 'gro dang // 'jig rten pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i rnam par dag pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i yang phyir ro // yang ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab dang / rnam par grol ba'i rgyur gyur pa'i yang phyir dang / gnyis kyis skal ba dang ldan pa rnams mnyam par gzhag pa dang rnam par grol ba'i rgyu yang yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one who has gone forth should avoid both extremes.🔽Moreover, it is the cause of happy rebirth, of mundane purity, and of supramundane purity.🔽Moreover, it is the cause of meditative concentration, wisdom, and liberation, and it is the cause of the meditative concentration and liberation of those who are fortunate.

original: bslab pa'i don rjes su spyod pa ni don spyod pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bslab pa bcas pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas sbyor ba byed pa ni sgrub pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: bslab pa'i don rjes su spyod pa ni don spyod pa zhes bya ba ni ji ltar bslab pa bcas pa'i rjes su 'brangs nas sbyor ba byed pa ni sgrub pa zhes bya ba'o //
