original: de nyid bshad pa ni chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid bshad pa ni chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa'i spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The explanation of that is called “the practice of accomplishing the Dharma that accords with the Dharma.”

original: rgyu med par ngo bo nyid kyis snying brtse ba'i bdag nyid can de la yang dag par dgod pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rgyu med par ngo bo nyid kyis snying brtse ba'i bdag nyid can de la yang dag par dgod pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: For one who is naturally compassionate without any cause, in order to establish him in reality, it is said:

original: snying rje'i sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: snying rje'i sems zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The mind of compassion,” and so on.🔽The essence is taught in brief.

original: ngo bo nyid mdor bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid mdor bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The essence is taught in brief.🔽The essence is taught in brief.

original: ngo bo nyid mdor bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba la de dag gis dge sbyong gi bya ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid mdor bstan pa yin no zhes bya ba la de dag gis dge sbyong gi bya ba thams cad yongs su rdzogs pa yin no //
translated: All the activities of a spiritual practitioner are complete in those.

original: de la don spyod pa thams cad ni sems can thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad kyi don sdud pa nye bar bzung nas rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: de la don spyod pa thams cad ni sems can thams cad kyi rnam pa thams cad kyi don sdud pa nye bar bzung nas rnam pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: Therein, all the activities of benefiting others, having taken up the collection of all the aspects of the aims of all sentient beings, should be posited in two aspects:

original: ma smin pa rnams smin par bya ba dang / smin pa rnams grol bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma smin pa rnams smin par bya ba dang / smin pa rnams grol bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: for the sake of ripening those who are not ripe, and for the sake of liberating those who are ripe.

original: yang de'i don gyi bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can rnams kyi 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yongs su smin pa dang / rnam par grol bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang de'i don gyi bya ba ni yongs su mya ngan las mi 'da' ba'i chos can dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos can rnams kyi 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i yongs su smin pa dang / rnam par grol bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, its activity is to be known as the complete maturation and liberation of those who are not destined for complete nirvana and those who are destined for complete nirvana, in the mundane and supramundane paths.

original: yang de ni dngos po yongs su spong ba'i sgo gsum du 'jug pa'o zhas bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: yang de ni dngos po yongs su spong ba'i sgo gsum du 'jug pa'o zhas bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Moreover, it is the entrance into the three doors of liberation through the relinquishment of things.🔽The meaning of this is stated in the verse:

original: tshe 'di'i don zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten 'di'o //
analyzed: tshe 'di'i don zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten 'di'o //
translated: The meaning of this life refers to this world.

original: tshe phyi ma'i don zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi'o //🔽tshe @203a * //
analyzed: tshe phyi ma'i don zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten pha rol gyi'o // tshe @203a * //
translated: The meaning of the next life refers to the next world.

original: 'di dang phyi ma'i don zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gnyi ga'i don to //
analyzed: 'di dang phyi ma'i don zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten gnyi ga'i don to //
translated: The meaning of both this life and the next refers to the meaning of both worlds.

original: longs spyod kyi bde ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i bde ba dang / nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba'i dbang du byas nas sgo gsum du rig par bya ste //
analyzed: longs spyod kyi bde ba dang / nges par 'byung ba'i bde ba dang / nye bar zhi ba'i bde ba'i dbang du byas nas sgo gsum du rig par bya ste //
translated: The three doors of liberation should be understood in terms of the happiness of wealth, the happiness of emancipation, and the happiness of tranquility.

original: chos dang mthun pa ni nyes par spyod pa rnams rnam par spang pa'o //
analyzed: chos dang mthun pa ni nyes par spyod pa rnams rnam par spang pa'o //
translated: In accordance with the Dharma means to avoid evil conduct.

original: yon tan dang ldan pa ni slu ba dang / 'dring  pa dang / bcos pa'i g-yo dang / sgyu rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa ni slu ba dang / 'dring  pa dang / bcos pa'i g-yo dang / sgyu rnam par spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Endowed with good qualities means to avoid the deceptions, the deceits, and the frauds of the world.

original: sgrub pa ni ma thob pa thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa ni ma thob pa thob par byed pa'o //
translated: Accomplishment means to attain what has not been attained.

original: thob pa rnam par mi nyams pa ni bsrung ba'o //
analyzed: thob pa rnam par mi nyams pa ni bsrung ba'o //
translated: Non-degeneration of what has been attained means to guard it.

original: bsrungs pa rnam par 'phel ba ni spel ba nyid de /
analyzed: bsrungs pa rnam par 'phel ba ni spel ba nyid de /
translated: Increase of what has been guarded means to expand it.

original: las kyi yon tan 'di dag gis 'jig rten 'dir yang kha na ma tho ba med pa'i snyan pa dang bde ba thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: las kyi yon tan 'di dag gis 'jig rten 'dir yang kha na ma tho ba med pa'i snyan pa dang bde ba thob par 'gyur te /
translated: By these good qualities of action, one attains in this world the fame and happiness that are free from reproach.

original: de lta bu ni 'jig rten 'di pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de lta bu ni 'jig rten 'di pa zhes brjod do //
translated: This is called the worldly.

original: 'di lta ste gzhan gyis kyang dmad par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di lta ste gzhan gyis kyang dmad par mi 'gyur la /
translated: It is like this: one is not despised by others.

original: rang nyid kyang dga' ba dang mgu ba'i gnas 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang nyid kyang dga' ba dang mgu ba'i gnas 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One increases the basis of one's own joy and satisfaction.

original: longs spyod spangs nas gzhan la rag las pa'i 'tsho ba dang rab tu 'brel pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod spangs nas gzhan la rag las pa'i 'tsho ba dang rab tu 'brel pa'o //
translated: Having abandoned wealth, one is dependent on others for one's livelihood.

original: rab tu byung ba'i tshul la yang dag par sbyor ba ni gcig tu phyi ma'i don yin te /
analyzed: rab tu byung ba'i tshul la yang dag par sbyor ba ni gcig tu phyi ma'i don yin te /
translated: The correct practice of the life of renunciation is solely for the sake of the future,

original: nges par phyi ma la rab tu bsngags pa'i 'gro ba rnams su 'gro bar 'gyur zhing bde bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par phyi ma la rab tu bsngags pa'i 'gro ba rnams su 'gro bar 'gyur zhing bde bar 'gyur ro //
translated: because one will certainly go to the happy realms praised in the future and one will be happy.

original: 'jig rten 'di la ni gcig tu bde ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di la ni gcig tu bde ba ma yin te /
translated: But the life of this world is not solely for happiness,

original: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: nges pa med pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because it is uncertain.

original: rim gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba zhes bya pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyis 'dod pa'i khams kyi ngan 'gro'i 'gro ba las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa'i khams ma lus pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: rim gyis 'dod chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba zhes bya pa ni mthong ba'i lam gyis 'dod pa'i khams kyi ngan 'gro'i 'gro ba las 'dod chags dang bral ba dang / bsgom pa'i lam gyis 'dod pa'i khams ma lus pa las 'dod chags dang bral ba ste /
translated: One becomes free from attachment in stages means that one becomes free from attachment to the lower realms of the desire realm through the path of seeing and one becomes free from attachment to the entire desire realm through the path of meditation.

original: de lta bur ji srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar las 'dod chags dang bral bas bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bur ji srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar las 'dod chags dang bral bas bstan par bya'o //
translated: One should understand that one becomes free from attachment to the summit of existence in the same way.

original: des tshe 'di'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: des tshe 'di'i don bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the purpose of this life,

original: lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs ba dang zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: lus shin tu sbyangs pa dang / sems shin tu sbyangs ba dang zhes bya ba la /
translated: the root text says, “physical pliancy and mental pliancy.”

original: lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa ste /
translated: It is endowed with the special qualities of physical and mental pliancy.

original: lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba rab tu myong bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir smras pa //
analyzed: lus dang sems shin tu sbyangs pa'i bde ba rab tu myong bar 'gyur bas de'i phyir smras pa //
translated: Because one experiences the bliss of physical and mental pliancy, therefore it is said:

original: bde ba la reg pas gnas par 'gyur la zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: bde ba la reg pas gnas par 'gyur la zhes bya ba la /
translated: “One dwells in contact with bliss.”

original: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bas rnam par dag pa'i lhar skye bar 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mthar thug pa thob pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams su yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral bas rnam par dag pa'i lhar skye bar 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i mthar thug pa thob pas mya ngan las 'das pa'i khams su yongs su mya ngan las 'das par 'gyur ro //
translated: One is reborn as a pure god through freedom from worldly attachment, and one attains final nirvāṇa in the element of nirvāṇa through attaining the supramundane.

original: gang zag rnam pa gsum la go rims bzhin @203b du dge ba yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i spyod pa dang / rab tu byung ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'i spyod pa dang / lta ba ngan pa 'dor du bcug nas bstan pa la 'dzud par byed pa'i spyod pa ni nus pa dka' ba'i phyir dka' ba'i don spyod pa zhes bya'o //🔽gang zag gsum las rgyu las nyams pa ni sngon gyi dus nye bar bzung nas dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad du ma spyad cing dge ba la goms par ma byas pa nyid la byang chub sems dpa' 'bad pa chen pos so sor brtags nas skye ba 'di
analyzed: gang zag rnam pa gsum la go rims bzhin @203b du dge ba yang dag par 'dzin du gzhug pa'i spyod pa dang / rab tu byung ba yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa'i spyod pa dang / lta ba ngan pa 'dor du bcug nas bstan pa la 'dzud par byed pa'i spyod pa ni nus pa dka' ba'i phyir dka' ba'i don spyod pa zhes bya'o // gang zag gsum las rgyu las nyams pa ni sngon gyi dus nye bar bzung nas dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad du ma spyad cing dge ba la goms par ma byas pa nyid la byang chub sems dpa' 'bad pa chen pos so sor brtags nas skye ba 'di
translated: The practice of engaging in the difficult is the practice of engaging in virtue, the practice of engaging in going forth, and the practice of engaging in the teaching after having abandoned bad views, for three kinds of persons, respectively. It is called the practice of engaging in the difficult because it is difficult to be able to do it.

original: nyid la mi byed pa gang yin pa de phyis kyang byed par mi 'gyur ba nyid du rig nas dge ba la yang dag par 'dzud par byed pa'o //
analyzed: nyid la mi byed pa gang yin pa de phyis kyang byed par mi 'gyur ba nyid du rig nas dge ba la yang dag par 'dzud par byed pa'o //
translated: Of the three kinds of persons, the one who has fallen away from the cause is one who, in a former time, did not practice any wholesome actions at all and did not cultivate virtue. The bodhisattva, after great effort and careful consideration, does not do in this very life what he knows will not be done later on.🔽He engages in virtue.

original: da ltar gyi dus su longs spyod chen po dang ldan pas bag med pa la mang du gnas shing 'dod pa la gcig tu zhen pa de dag gi rab tu byung bar skul ba ni shin tu dka' ba yin pa las de bzhin du yang dag par skul
analyzed: da ltar gyi dus su longs spyod chen po dang ldan pas bag med pa la mang du gnas shing 'dod pa la gcig tu zhen pa de dag gi rab tu byung bar skul ba ni shin tu dka' ba yin pa las de bzhin du yang dag par skul
translated: It is very difficult to encourage those who are presently living in great wealth to go forth, because they are very attached to their desires.

original: bar byed pa'o //🔽skye ba gzhan dag tu mu stegs can gyi lta ba la mos pa brtan zhing sbags pa de dag lta ba ngan pa dang phral nas bstan pa 'di la gzhug par dka' ba las lta ba ngan pa de dang phral nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la
analyzed: bar byed pa'o // skye ba gzhan dag tu mu stegs can gyi lta ba la mos pa brtan zhing sbags pa de dag lta ba ngan pa dang phral nas bstan pa 'di la gzhug par dka' ba las lta ba ngan pa de dang phral nas de bzhin gshegs pa'i bstan pa la
translated: But they are encouraged to do so.🔽It is difficult to separate those who are attached to the views of non-Buddhists in other lives and to introduce them to this teaching.

original: 'god par byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'god par byed pa'o //
translated: But they are separated from their bad views and introduced to the teaching of the Tathagata.

original: bdag nyid kyis blun pa ni phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i blo can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyis blun pa ni phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i blo can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They are fools because they have erroneous ideas.

original: mngon par zhen pa ni 'di kho na bden gyi /
analyzed: mngon par zhen pa ni 'di kho na bden gyi /
translated: They are attached to their views because they think, “This alone is the truth.

original: gzhan ni rmongs pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni rmongs pa'o zhes bya ba ste /
translated: All else is folly.”

original: log par lta ba mang po dang ldan pa'i phyir rigs pa dang rigs pa ma yin pa ston pa'i tshig gi sgo nas bstan cing bsgrubs kyang khas len par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba mang po dang ldan pa'i phyir rigs pa dang rigs pa ma yin pa ston pa'i tshig gi sgo nas bstan cing bsgrubs kyang khas len par mi byed pa'o //
translated: Because of the abundance of wrong views, they do not accept the teaching and practice of the words of the one who teaches what is correct and incorrect.

original: mngon par mtho ba'i lam gnyis 'jug pa dang bcas pa dang nges par legs pa'i lam gyi ngo bo ni gcig go //
analyzed: mngon par mtho ba'i lam gnyis 'jug pa dang bcas pa dang nges par legs pa'i lam gyi ngo bo ni gcig go //
translated: The path of the higher realms and the path of definite goodness have the same nature.

original: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas yang dag par skul bar byed pas sgo bzhi nas 'jug pa ni thams cad kyi sgo nas don spyod pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'i dbang du byas nas yang dag par skul bar byed pas sgo bzhi nas 'jug pa ni thams cad kyi sgo nas don spyod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The one who engages in the four doors of activity is said to be one who practices the meaning in all ways, in terms of the mundane and supramundane perfections.

original: de la dad pas ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la dad pas ni sbyin pa dang tshul khrims la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through faith, one engages in generosity and discipline.

original: de dag gis ni ma 'das pa na lus dang longs spyod khyad par du 'phags pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag gis ni ma 'das pa na lus dang longs spyod khyad par du 'phags pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: Through those, one attains an excellent body and resources in the future.

original: khams gsum du ji ltar rigs pa ste /
analyzed: khams gsum du ji ltar rigs pa ste /
translated: In the three realms, as is appropriate.

original: 'jig rten pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the cause of mundane perfection.

original: dad pas ni shes rab la yang 'jug par 'gyur la /
analyzed: dad pas ni shes rab la yang 'jug par 'gyur la /
translated: Faith also leads to wisdom.

original: shes rab kyis sgom pa rab kyi mthar @204a * //
analyzed: shes rab kyis sgom pa rab kyi mthar @204a * //
translated: By wisdom, when meditation reaches its culmination,

original: thug par gyur pa na nyon mongs pa rab tu spangs nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thug par gyur pa na nyon mongs pa rab tu spangs nas 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: afflictions are completely abandoned and one attains the excellence of transcending the world.

original: yang na rim gyis nan tan du bya ba yin pa'i dbang du byas nas dad pa la sogs pa bzhi rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: yang na rim gyis nan tan du bya ba yin pa'i dbang du byas nas dad pa la sogs pa bzhi rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Or, in terms of the necessity of practice in stages, the four beginning with faith are presented.

original: 'di ni rigs kyi bu'am /
analyzed: 'di ni rigs kyi bu'am /
translated: This is for a son or daughter of good lineage

original: rigs kyi bu mo gang zhig gis byang chub sems dpa' las chos thos pa na las dang 'bras bu dang / dkon mchog dang / bden pa rnam pa gsum la dad pa thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu mo gang zhig gis byang chub sems dpa' las chos thos pa na las dang 'bras bu dang / dkon mchog dang / bden pa rnam pa gsum la dad pa thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: who, when hearing the Dharma from a bodhisattva, attains faith in the three types of karma and its effects, the three jewels, and the three truths.

original: de dad pa thob pa de dang ldan pas khyim na gnas pa'i nyes dmigs dang / rab tu byung ba'i phan yon mthong ba na lus kyi sdom pa dang / dag gi sdom pa dang / 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go //
analyzed: de dad pa thob pa de dang ldan pas khyim na gnas pa'i nyes dmigs dang / rab tu byung ba'i phan yon mthong ba na lus kyi sdom pa dang / dag gi sdom pa dang / 'tsho ba yongs su dag pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go //
translated: Endowed with that faith, he causes them to take up the restraint of body, speech, and livelihood, seeing the disadvantages of the household life and the benefits of the renunciate life.

original: yang de lta bu'i tshul gyis tshul khrims kyi phung po dang ldan par shes snas 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab la 'god par byed do //
analyzed: yang de lta bu'i tshul gyis tshul khrims kyi phung po dang ldan par shes snas 'jig rten dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i shes rab la 'god par byed do //
translated: And in that way, knowing that they are endowed with the aggregate of morality, he causes them to take up the wisdom that is mundane and supramundane.

original: des don ngan pa gtong bar byed do zhes bya bas gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go zhes brjod de /
analyzed: des don ngan pa gtong bar byed do zhes bya bas gtong ba phun sum tshogs pa yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug go zhes brjod de /
translated: He causes them to take up the perfection of giving, saying, “Give up what is bad.”

original: 'dus byas zag pa dang bcas pa rnams la 'dzin pa ni ser sna can no zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: 'dus byas zag pa dang bcas pa rnams la 'dzin pa ni ser sna can no zhes bya bas so //
translated: Because “those who cling to conditioned, contaminated things are stingy.”

original: tshig rnam pa lnga'i dbang du byas nas /
analyzed: tshig rnam pa lnga'i dbang du byas nas /
translated: With reference to five kinds of words,

original: skyes bu dam pa'i don spyod pa ni rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa'i don spyod pa ni rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: the bodhisattva’s practice of the altruistic practice is fivefold.

original: yang tshig gi don rnam pa lnga ni skul ba dang / rjes su ston pa dang / chos ston pa rnams su rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang tshig gi don rnam pa lnga ni skul ba dang / rjes su ston pa dang / chos ston pa rnams su rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, the five topics of the verses should be understood as exhortation, instruction, and teaching the Dharma.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /🔽yang dag pa'i don yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa / yang dag pa'i don yang dag par 'dzin du 'jug pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽“The five topics are the correct meaning, the correct teaching, the correct practice, the correct attainment, and the correct result.”

original: tshig gi lam lnga ni yang dag pa'i don la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tshig gi lam lnga ni yang dag pa'i don la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five paths of speech are the correct meaning and so forth.

original: rnam pa gnyis ni rang gi 'khor du gtogs pa yang dag pa dang / log par zhugs pa rnams yongs su bzung ba dang / tshar bcad pa'i dbang du byas pa dang / gzhan dag bstan pa la sdang ba dang / bar ma dang zhugs pa dang yongs su smin pa'i sems can rnams la drang ba dang gzhug pa dang yongs su smin par bya ba dang rnam par grol ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis ni rang gi 'khor du gtogs pa yang dag pa dang / log par zhugs pa rnams yongs su bzung ba dang / tshar bcad pa'i dbang du byas pa dang / gzhan dag bstan pa la sdang ba dang / bar ma dang zhugs pa dang yongs su smin pa'i sems can rnams la drang ba dang gzhug pa dang yongs su smin par bya ba dang rnam par grol ba'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The two aspects are in terms of those who are included in one’s retinue, who are engaged in the correct and incorrect, and in terms of those who are to be accepted and defeated, and in terms of others who are hostile to the teaching, and those sentient beings who are in the middle, who are engaged, and who are ripe for complete liberation, in terms of guiding, engaging, ripening, and liberating.

original: yongs su gzung ba'i bya ba ni gnyis te /
analyzed: yongs su gzung ba'i bya ba ni gnyis te /
translated: The action of acceptance is twofold:

original: zang zing gi bgo bsha' bya bas dang yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya bas so //
analyzed: zang zing gi bgo bsha' bya bas dang yang dag par rab tu dga' bar bya bas so //
translated: by distributing material things and by gladdening them.🔽The act of subduing is threefold: by reprimanding, by punishment, and by banishment.

original: tshar gcad pa'i bya ba ni chung ngu la sogs pa'i rim gyis rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: tshar gcad pa'i bya ba ni chung ngu la sogs pa'i rim gyis rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: The act of banishment is of seven kinds:🔽by banishing from the village, from the country, from the region, from the district, from the continent, from the whole earth, and from the whole world.

original: spyo ba dang / chad pa'i las dang / bskrad par bya'o //
analyzed: spyo ba dang / chad pa'i las dang / bskrad par bya'o //
translated: The act of banishing is of seven kinds:🔽by banishing from the village, from the country, from the region, from the district, from the continent, from the whole earth, and from the whole world.🔽The act of banishing is of seven kinds:🔽by banishing from the village, from the country, from the region, from the district, from the continent, from the whole earth, and from the whole world.🔽The act of banishing is of seven kinds:🔽by banishing from the village, from the country, from the region, from the district, from the continent, from the whole earth, and from the whole world.

analyzed: rnam pa bdun du rnam par gzhag pa ni spyi'i rim gyis sgom @204b pa la sbyor ba'i nan tan la yang dag par sbyor bar byed pa'o //
translated: The act of banishing is of seven kinds:🔽by banishing from the village, from the country, from the region, from the district, from the continent, from the whole earth, and from the whole world.

original: rnam pa lnga sta /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga sta /
translated: The act of banishing is of seven kinds:🔽by banishing from the village, from the country, from the region, from the district, from the continent, from the whole earth, and from the whole world.🔽The act of banishing is of seven kinds:🔽by banishing from the village, from the country, from the region, from the district, from the continent, from the whole earth, and from the whole world.🔽The act of banishing is of seven kinds:🔽by banishing from the village, from the country, from the region, from the district, from the continent, from the whole earth, and from the whole world.

original: khyad par nyid ni theg pa gsum la rab tu dgod pa'i dbang du byas nas ni rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: khyad par nyid ni theg pa gsum la rab tu dgod pa'i dbang du byas nas ni rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: The act of banishing is of seven kinds:

original: spyi'i bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽theg pa dman pa las brtsams pa dang / theg pa chen po las brtsams pa zhes bya ba la //
analyzed: spyi'i bstan par bya ba'i phyir / theg pa dman pa las brtsams pa dang / theg pa chen po las brtsams pa zhes bya ba la //
translated: by banishing from the village, from the country, from the region, from the district, from the continent, from the whole earth, and from the whole world.

original: theg pa'i dbye ba'i dbang du byas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: theg pa'i dbye ba'i dbang du byas pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The act of banishing is of seven kinds:🔽by banishing from the village, from the country, from the region, from the district, from the continent, from the whole earth, and from the whole world.🔽The act of banishing is of seven kinds:

original: de la tshogs ni dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la tshogs ni dbang po'i sgo bsdams pa'i phyir ro //
translated: by banishing from the village

original: de dag srung ba ni nyams pa las srung ba'o //
analyzed: de dag srung ba ni nyams pa las srung ba'o //
translated: Protecting means protecting against degeneration.

original: bsags pa ni 'phel bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: bsags pa ni 'phel bar byed pa'o //
translated: Increasing means increasing what has been attained.

original: rab tu dben pa ni lus dang sems dben pa'o //
analyzed: rab tu dben pa ni lus dang sems dben pa'o //
translated: Isolation means isolation of body and mind.

original: sems rtse gcig tu bya ba ni de la dang por sems yang dag par gtod pa'o //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig tu bya ba ni de la dang por sems yang dag par gtod pa'o //
translated: One-pointedness of mind means first directing the mind to that.

original: sgrib pa rnam par dag par bya ba ni kun du spyod pa rnam par sbyong ba la sogs pa la dmigs pa yid la byed pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: sgrib pa rnam par dag par bya ba ni kun du spyod pa rnam par sbyong ba la sogs pa la dmigs pa yid la byed pa sgom pa'o //
translated: Purifying obscurations means cultivating the attention focused on purifying conduct and so on.

original: las dang po la skyo ba bskyed pa'i phyir mtshan ma lnga bzung la bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: las dang po la skyo ba bskyed pa'i phyir mtshan ma lnga bzung la bsgom par bya'o zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For the beginner, generating disenchantment means cultivating the five signs after apprehending them.

original: phongs shing 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i don spyod pa ni kun nas dkris pa rnam pa brgyad rab tu spong ba la 'dzud pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
analyzed: phongs shing 'dod pa dang ldan pa'i don spyod pa ni kun nas dkris pa rnam pa brgyad rab tu spong ba la 'dzud pa'i dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag par bya'o //
translated: The practice of generosity for the sake of those who are distressed and desirous should be understood in terms of engaging in the complete abandonment of the eight entanglements.

original: kun nas dkris pa rnam pa brgyad rnam par gzhag pa ni tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi phung po tshogs dang bcas pa'i gegs byed pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa yin no //
analyzed: kun nas dkris pa rnam pa brgyad rnam par gzhag pa ni tshul khrims dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / shes rab kyi phung po tshogs dang bcas pa'i gegs byed pa nyid kyi dbang du byas pa yin no //
translated: The eight entanglements are presented as hindrances to the aggregates of morality, samādhi, and wisdom, along with their collections.

original: de la ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa ni tshul khrims kyi phung po'i gegs su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: de la ngo tsha med pa dang / khrel med pa ni tshul khrims kyi phung po'i gegs su gyur pa ste /
translated: Shamelessness and lack of conscience are hindrances to the aggregate of morality,

original: bdag dang gzhan la ltos nas nyes par spyod pa spangs nas tshul khrims yang dag par len pa med pa'i phyir dang / blangs pa yang dag par mi srung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan la ltos nas nyes par spyod pa spangs nas tshul khrims yang dag par len pa med pa'i phyir dang / blangs pa yang dag par mi srung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not avoid misdeeds in relation to oneself and others, and because one does not take up morality or, having taken it up, does not guard it.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang rab tu ldan pa la bying ba dang rmugs pa'i 'jigs pa yod pas nang gi bdag nyid zhum par 'gyur te //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang rab tu ldan pa la bying ba dang rmugs pa'i 'jigs pa yod pas nang gi bdag nyid zhum par 'gyur te //
translated: Since there is the danger of laxity and sleepiness in one who is endowed with samādhi, there is internal contraction.

original: de dag gis ting 'dzin gyi phung po'i gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag gis ting 'dzin gyi phung po'i gegs byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are hindrances to the aggregate of samādhi.

original: lhag mthong dang rab tu ldan pa la ni rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa'i 'jigs pa yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: lhag mthong dang rab tu ldan pa la ni rgod pa dang / 'gyod pa'i 'jigs pa yod pa nyid do //
translated: For one who is endowed with insight, there is the fear of agitation and regret.

original: chags pa dang 'gyod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir shes bya'i gzugs brnyan mthong ba med pa nyid do //
analyzed: chags pa dang 'gyod pa dang bcas pa'i phyir shes bya'i gzugs brnyan mthong ba med pa nyid do //
translated: And because of attachment and regret, there is no seeing of the reflection of the object of knowledge.

original: de'i phyir de dag gnyi g-yang shes rab kyi phung po'i gegs su gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gnyi g-yang shes rab kyi phung po'i gegs su gyur pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, both of these are obstacles to the aggregate of wisdom.

original: de'i bar du gcod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bar du gcod par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they obstruct it.

original: lus dang sems nye bar brtan par gyur pa ni phung po gsum sgom par byed do //🔽de la lus @205a * //
analyzed: lus dang sems nye bar brtan par gyur pa ni phung po gsum sgom par byed do // de la lus @205a * //
translated: One whose body and mind are well-established cultivates the three aggregates.

original: nye bar brtan pa ni skye ba gzhan du byas pa'i sbyin pas tshe 'di la de dang rjes su mthun pa'i rkyen mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar brtan pa ni skye ba gzhan du byas pa'i sbyin pas tshe 'di la de dang rjes su mthun pa'i rkyen mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therein, the body is well-established through giving in other lives, and in this life the conditions that accord with that are accomplished.🔽The mind is well-established through morality, because one is free from regret.

original: sems nye bar brtan pa ni skye ba gzhan la byas pa'i chos kyi sbyin pas tshe 'di la de dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos thos pa dang / gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa rab tu thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems nye bar brtan pa ni skye ba gzhan la byas pa'i chos kyi sbyin pas tshe 'di la de dang rjes su mthun pa'i chos thos pa dang / gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa rab tu thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The mind becomes firm through the gift of Dharma in a previous life, and in this life one obtains the teachings that are in conformity with it, as well as instructions and further teachings.

original: sbyin pa rnam pa gnyi ga'i bar du gcod par byed pa ni gzhan gyi 'byor pa mi bzod pa dang / dngos por 'dzin pa chen po yin na sbyin pa la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bas so //🔽sel bar byed ces bya ba ni so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis skyes pa rnams spong ba'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa rnam pa gnyi ga'i bar du gcod par byed pa ni gzhan gyi 'byor pa mi bzod pa dang / dngos por 'dzin pa chen po yin na sbyin pa la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya bas so // sel bar byed ces bya ba ni so sor rtog pa'i stobs kyis skyes pa rnams spong ba'o //
translated: The obstacles to both kinds of generosity are the inability to bear the prosperity of others and great attachment to things.

original: spong bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis ma skyes pa rnams shin tu mi skyed pa'o //
analyzed: spong bar byed pa zhes bya ba ni bsgoms pa'i stobs kyis ma skyes pa rnams shin tu mi skyed pa'o //
translated: One removes them by the power of discernment, and one avoids them by the power of meditation.

original: rnam pa dgu ni lus dang ngag gi nyes par spyod pa'i rnam par dbye bas so sor rnam pa bzhir 'gyur la /
analyzed: rnam pa dgu ni lus dang ngag gi nyes par spyod pa'i rnam par dbye bas so sor rnam pa bzhir 'gyur la /
translated: The nine kinds of generosity are distinguished by the distinction of the physical and verbal misconduct of the bodhisattvas.

original: yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dbye ba rnams ni yang gcig tu byas pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi nyes par spyod pa dbye ba rnams ni yang gcig tu byas pa'o //
translated: The mental misdeeds are combined into one.

original: de la rigs pa gnyis kyis lus kyi nyes par sbyong pa rnam pa bzhir gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: de la rigs pa gnyis kyis lus kyi nyes par sbyong pa rnam pa bzhir gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The four types of physical misdeeds are established by two reasons.

original: las kyi lam rnam par gzhag pa dang / dge bsnyen gyi bslab pa'i gnas kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas pas so //
analyzed: las kyi lam rnam par gzhag pa dang / dge bsnyen gyi bslab pa'i gnas kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs rnam par gzhag pa'i dbang du byas pas so //
translated: They are established from the perspective of the presentation of the karmic paths and the presentation of the adverse factors of the precepts of a layperson.

original: las kyi lam rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul gyis ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: las kyi lam rnam par gzhag pa'i tshul gyis ni lus kyi nyes par spyod pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: From the perspective of the presentation of the karmic paths, there are three types of physical misdeeds.

original: tshul gzhan gyis ni bzhi pa myos par 'gyur ba'i btung ba gtogs par byas pa'o //
analyzed: tshul gzhan gyis ni bzhi pa myos par 'gyur ba'i btung ba gtogs par byas pa'o //
translated: From another perspective, there is a fourth, which includes drinking alcohol.

original: yid kyi nyes par spyod pa rnams gcig tu byas pa ni de dag la bya ba tha dad yod du zin kyang mngon du gyur pa tsam gyis las kyi lam du rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi nyes par spyod pa rnams gcig tu byas pa ni de dag la bya ba tha dad yod du zin kyang mngon du gyur pa tsam gyis las kyi lam du rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The mental misdeeds are combined into one because, although they have different functions, they are posited as karmic paths by the mere manifestation of the mental action.

original: rnam pa thams cad spangs pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang / mjug rnams su'o //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad spangs pa zhes bya ba ni sbyor ba dang / dngos gzhi dang / mjug rnams su'o //
translated: Abandonment of all aspects refers to the preparatory, the actual, and the subsequent stages.

original: rnam pa bcu mdor bsdu na sbyor ba rnam par dag pa dang / bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa bcu mdor bsdu na sbyor ba rnam par dag pa dang / bsam pa rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: In brief, it is summarized in ten aspects, in terms of the purity of preparation and the purity of attitude.

original: sbyor ba rnam par dag pa yang rnam pa lnga'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba rnam par dag pa yang rnam pa lnga'o //
translated: The purity of preparation is fivefold.

original: de bzhin du bsam pa rnam par dag pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam pa rnam par dag pa yang ngo //
translated: Likewise, the purity of attitude is fivefold.

original: yang 'di dag gi rnam par gzhag pa gzhan smras pa /
analyzed: yang 'di dag gi rnam par gzhag pa gzhan smras pa /

original: phyi rol dag pa dang / nang dag pa la brten te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyi rol dag pa dang / nang dag pa la brten te zhes bya ba la /
translated: Based on the purity of the external and the purity of the internal.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang ma 'dres pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs dang ma 'dres pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par blangs pa'i phyir kha na ma tho ba med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “without offense” because one has taken up the wholesome roots that are not mixed with adverse elements.

original: des na smras pa /🔽nyes par spyod pa dang 'dres shing zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: des na smras pa / nyes par spyod pa dang 'dres shing zhes bya ba la /
translated: Therefore, it is said:🔽“Mixed with misconduct” means that one is not mixed with misconduct.

original: par bar du nyes @205b par spyod pa la 'jug pa ni 'dres pa nyid do //
analyzed: par bar du nyes @205b par spyod pa la 'jug pa ni 'dres pa nyid do //
translated: One is not mixed with misconduct because one does not engage in misconduct.

original: nyes par spyod pa sngon du 'gro ba ni dge ba bya ba'i phyir sngon du nyes bar spyod pa byed pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nyes par spyod pa sngon du 'gro ba ni dge ba bya ba'i phyir sngon du nyes bar spyod pa byed pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The first is the one who, having previously engaged in misconduct, later engages in virtue, and is called “one who previously engaged in misconduct.”

analyzed: de'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa can nyid kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa nyid de / dper na chos ma yin pas longs spyod bsgrubs nas sam /

analyzed: pha rol las phrogs nas sbyin pa byed pa lta bu'o //

analyzed: gzugs med pas bsdus pa dang / gcig tu nges par rnam par dag pa ma yin par nga gis pa'i bag la nyal dang bcas la gcig tu rnam par dag pa'i thar pa yin no zhes yang dag par 'dzud par mi byed do //

analyzed: de lta bas na phyin ci ma log pa'i don gyi bya ba yin no //
translated: Thus, it is the activity of the unerring meaning.

original: rims su 'bab pa ni go rims bzhin du nan tan bya ba la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: rims su 'bab pa ni go rims bzhin du nan tan bya ba la sbyor ba'o //
translated: The order is the application to the practice in accordance with the order.

original: des na smras pa /
analyzed: des na smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: thog mar bslab pa'i chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: thog mar bslab pa'i chos zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: First, the training precepts, etc.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba dang / phyogs gcig pa ma yin pa nyid ni rigs la sogs pa'i nges pa med par 'jug par byed pa zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba dang / phyogs gcig pa ma yin pa nyid ni rigs la sogs pa'i nges pa med par 'jug par byed pa zhes byas nas so //
translated: The universality and non-partialness are the engagement without the determination of lineage, etc.

analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

analyzed: rigs bzhi dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: ci nus ci lcogs kyis sems can dang rjes su mthun pa'i don nye bar sgrub pa'o //
translated: The benefiting according to ability is the establishment of the meaning in accordance with the sentient beings.

original: mthun mthun du sbyor ba ni thams sna tshogs kyis nye bar sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: mthun mthun du sbyor ba ni thams sna tshogs kyis nye bar sgrub pa'o //

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore, it is said:

original: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag ces bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those, etc.

original: gang zag sdig pa'i las shin tu drag po dang ldan pas sdug che thang du myong ba'i rgyu la zhugs pa rnams la chos kyi snying rje chen po'i bsam pa na da dag pa dang po'o //

translated: The first is the attitude of great compassion for the Dharma toward those who are endowed with very strong sinful actions and who have entered into the cause of great suffering.

original: sems can cher rmongs pa rnams la sdug bsngal thams cad kyis yongs su ngal bar gyur kyang skyo ba bzod par byas nas rab tu dga' ba'i bsam pas spyod pa ni gnyis pa'o //

translated: The second is the attitude of delight in the practice, having endured the fatigue of all suffering for the sake of the very confused sentient beings.

original: shin tu dman zhing phongs pa'i gang zag la yang bdag nyid rigs dang 'byor pa la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa yin du zin kyang dman pa'i bsam pas spyod pa ni gsum la'o //
analyzed: shin tu dman zhing phongs pa'i gang zag la yang bdag nyid rigs dang 'byor pa la sogs pa khyad par du 'phags pa yin du zin kyang dman pa'i bsam pas spyod pa ni gsum la'o //
translated: The third is the attitude of humility in the practice, even though one is superior in caste, wealth, etc.

original: g-yo sgyu sa nye bar spyod pa rnams la bcos ma ma yin pa'i sems kyis spyod pa ni bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: g-yo sgyu sa nye bar spyod pa rnams la bcos ma ma yin pa'i sems kyis spyod pa ni bzhi pa'o //
translated: The fourth is the attitude of the practice with an uncontrived mind toward those who are deceitful.

original: gnod pa drag po drag po byed pa rnams la yang byams pa'i bsam @206a * //
analyzed: gnod pa drag po drag po byed pa rnams la yang byams pa'i bsam @206a * //
translated: The fifth is the attitude of love toward those who do great harm.

original: pas spyod pa ni rnam par dag pa lnga pa'o //🔽don spyod la bstan pa'i sgo nas don mthun pa yang yin pas ngo bo nyid la sogs pa yang bstan par mi bya ste /
analyzed: pas spyod pa ni rnam par dag pa lnga pa'o // don spyod la bstan pa'i sgo nas don mthun pa yang yin pas ngo bo nyid la sogs pa yang bstan par mi bya ste /
translated: The fifth purity is the purity of the practice.🔽And since the practice of the teaching is also the practice of the meaning, the practice of the meaning is included in the practice of the teaching.🔽Therefore, the practice of the meaning is not taught separately from the practice of the teaching.

original: grub zin ba'i phyir ro //🔽de'i phyir 'dir rnam pa gzhan gyis don mthun pa bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: grub zin ba'i phyir ro // de'i phyir 'dir rnam pa gzhan gyis don mthun pa bstan par bya'o //
translated: But the practice of the meaning is taught separately from the practice of the teaching, because the practice of the teaching is the practice of the teaching of the Dharma, and the practice of the meaning is the practice of the meaning of the Dharma.

original: dang por don mthun pa rnam pa gsum du rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: dang por don mthun pa rnam pa gsum du rnam par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The practice of the meaning is of three kinds:🔽The meaning itself is the object and the roots of virtue are the object.🔽The object is called the meaning because it is the object of those who desire the benefit and happiness of self and others.🔽The practice of the meaning is the practice of the meaning of the Dharma.

original: dngos po nyid ni don gang dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba gang la zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid don ces brjod do //🔽bdag dang gzhan gyi phan pa dang bde ba 'dod pa rnams kyis 'dod par bya ba yin pas zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: dngos po nyid ni don gang dang / dge ba'i rtsa ba gang la zhes bya ba ni dge ba'i rtsa ba nyid don ces brjod do // bdag dang gzhan gyi phan pa dang bde ba 'dod pa rnams kyis 'dod par bya ba yin pas zhes byas nas so //
translated: The practice of the teaching is the practice of the teaching of the Dharma.🔽The practice of the teaching is the practice of the teaching of the Dharma.

original: rang sgrub par byed pa nyid ni gang gi phyir smras pa /🔽bdag nyid dang yang dag par ston te zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: rang sgrub par byed pa nyid ni gang gi phyir smras pa / bdag nyid dang yang dag par ston te zhes bya ba la /
translated: The practice of the meaning is the practice of the meaning of the Dharma.🔽The practice of the teaching is the practice of the teaching of the Dharma.🔽The practice of the meaning is the practice of the meaning of the Dharma.🔽The practice of the teaching is the practice of the teaching of the Dharma.🔽The practice of the meaning is the practice of the meaning of the Dharma.🔽The practice of the teaching is the practice of the teaching of the Dharma.🔽The practice of the meaning is the practice of the meaning of the Dharma.🔽The practice of the teaching is the practice of the teaching of the Dharma.🔽The practice of the meaning is the practice of the meaning of the Dharma.🔽The practice of the teaching is the practice of the teaching of the Dharma.🔽The practice of the meaning is the practice of the meaning of the Dharma.🔽The practice of the teaching is the practice of the teaching of the Dharma.🔽The practice of the meaning is the practice of the meaning of the Dharma.🔽The practice of the teaching is the practice of the teaching of the Dharma.🔽The practice of the meaning is the practice of the meaning of the Dharma.🔽The practice of the teaching is the practice of the teaching of the Dharma.🔽The practice of the meaning is the practice of the meaning of the Dharma.🔽The practice of the teaching is the practice of the teaching of the Dharma.

original: don mthun pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang don mthun pa nyid de /
analyzed: don mthun pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan dang don mthun pa nyid de /
translated: The practice of the meaning is the practice of the meaning of the Dharma.

original: don 'dra ba nyid dang / sgrub pa 'dra ba nyid do //
analyzed: don 'dra ba nyid dang / sgrub pa 'dra ba nyid do //
translated: similarity of meaning and similarity of practice.

original: dgos pa nyid ni dgos pa rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dgos pa nyid ni dgos pa rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The purpose is twofold:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par blangs pa la gzhan dag gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / bdag nyid kyi tshig gzung bar 'os par bya ba dang skur pa 'debs pa'i skabs med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba yang dag par blangs pa la gzhan dag gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir dang / bdag nyid kyi tshig gzung bar 'os par bya ba dang skur pa 'debs pa'i skabs med par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: in order to generate respect for the undertaking of the roots of virtue in others and in order to make oneself worthy of being heeded and to eliminate slander.

original: dang po bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: dang po bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the first, he says:

original: de 'dul ba gzhan dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la brtan zhing nges te zhes bya ba ni gus par byas nas sgrub pa las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de 'dul ba gzhan dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la brtan zhing nges te zhes bya ba ni gus par byas nas sgrub pa las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: “Because of the other’s training,” etc. “ Steadfast and certain” means that one does not turn back from the practice after having undertaken it with respect.

original: des na smras pa //
analyzed: des na smras pa //
translated: Therefore, he says:

original: phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: phyir mi ldog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba la /
translated: “one becomes irreversible.”

original: brtan zhing nges pa'i sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtan zhing nges pa'i sbyor ba'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the cause of the application of steadfastness and certainty, he says:🔽“because of the other’s training,” etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'dis gang kho na bdag cag la bstan pa de nyid la bdag nyid kyang brtan zhing nges par kun du spyod par byed pa las na /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'dis gang kho na bdag cag la bstan pa de nyid la bdag nyid kyang brtan zhing nges par kun du spyod par byed pa las na /
translated: This bodhisattva teaches us just what we should do, and he himself is firm and certain in practicing just that.

original: nges par bdag cag la phan pa dang bde ba bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: nges par bdag cag la phan pa dang bde ba bstan pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, he is teaching us what is beneficial and pleasant.🔽Since he himself desires what is beneficial and pleasant, he does not practice what is not beneficial and unpleasant.

original: 'di nyid kyang phan pa dang bde ba 'dod pa bzhin du mi phan pa dang mi bde ba la spyod par mi byed do zhes bsams nas 'di la bsgrub par bya'o zhes sgrub par byed do //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyang phan pa dang bde ba 'dod pa bzhin du mi phan pa dang mi bde ba la spyod par mi byed do zhes bsams nas 'di la bsgrub par bya'o zhes sgrub par byed do //
translated: Having reflected in this way, we should practice what he teaches.

original: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: gnyis pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: With reference to the second, it is said:

original: bcos dgos so zhes mi zer ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bcos dgos so zhes mi zer ro zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: We do not say that it is not necessary to correct him.

original: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad gcig tu don mthun pa yang ma yin te rnam par dbye ba yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' thams cad gcig tu don mthun pa yang ma yin te rnam par dbye ba yod do zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The bodhisattvas are not all of one mind, but are divided.

original: mu bzhi dang ldan par ston par byed de /
analyzed: mu bzhi dang ldan par ston par byed de /
translated: The four alternatives are taught:

original: mu gsum ni dkar po'i phyogs su gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: mu gsum ni dkar po'i phyogs su gtogs pa yin no //
translated: Three alternatives belong to the bright side.

original: bzhi pa ni nag @206b po'i phyogs su gtogs pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhi pa ni nag @206b po'i phyogs su gtogs pa yin no //
translated: The fourth is included in the dark side.

original: de ni spang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: de ni spang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: It is to be abandoned

original: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i chos nyid las yang dag par 'das pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is in complete contradiction to the nature of the bodhisattva.

original: bdag nyid kyi rgyud bzang po rnams gzhan dag dang mnyam du zin kyang rab tu sbas nas gnas pa gtsor byas nas dman par ston pa ni kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mu dang po ste //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi rgyud bzang po rnams gzhan dag dang mnyam du zin kyang rab tu sbas nas gnas pa gtsor byas nas dman par ston pa ni kha na ma tho ba med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mu dang po ste //
translated: The first alternative is when the bodhisattva, although equal to others in his own good qualities, conceals his virtues and makes a show of his faults.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa gnyis kyis phan tshun mnyam pa nyid de /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni rnam pa gnyis kyis phan tshun mnyam pa nyid de /
translated: The bodhisattva is equal to others in two ways:

original: mnyam pa'i sa la gnas pa nyid dang / gang yang sa rnam par sbyong bar byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: mnyam pa'i sa la gnas pa nyid dang / gang yang sa rnam par sbyong bar byed pa nyid do //
translated: he is equal in the stage of abiding in equality, and he is equal in the purification of the stages.

original: yon tan mnyam pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / dge ba'i chos la sbyor ba nyid do //
analyzed: yon tan mnyam pa ni sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / dge ba'i chos la sbyor ba nyid do //
translated: Equality of virtues is the application to the transcendences such as generosity and to the virtuous qualities.

original: mthu mnyam pa ni mngon par shes pa'i mthu'o //
analyzed: mthu mnyam pa ni mngon par shes pa'i mthu'o //
translated: Equality of power is the power of the superknowledges.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i lam ni byang chub sems dpa'i sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i lam ni byang chub sems dpa'i sgrub pa'o //
translated: The Bodhisattva path is the practice of the Bodhisattva.

original: slob dpon ni 'jig rten thams cad kyis slob dpon du 'dod pa'o //
analyzed: slob dpon ni 'jig rten thams cad kyis slob dpon du 'dod pa'o //
translated: The teacher is the one who is considered a teacher by the whole world.

original: de dang mnyam pa nyid yin na yang mnyam pa nyid du mi ston te /
analyzed: de dang mnyam pa nyid yin na yang mnyam pa nyid du mi ston te /
translated: Even if he is equal to the Bodhisattva, he does not teach equality.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na //
translated: Why is that?

original: de nyid la 'jig rten thams cad kyis gus pa dang bsnyen bkur dang rim gro byed par 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyis slob dpon du 'dzin par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid la 'jig rten thams cad kyis gus pa dang bsnyen bkur dang rim gro byed par 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten thams cad kyis slob dpon du 'dzin par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the whole world would respect, honor, and serve him, and the whole world would consider him a teacher.

original: don mthun pa nyid du bstan na de la de ltar 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: don mthun pa nyid du bstan na de la de ltar 'dzin par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: If he were to teach by means of the same purpose, he would not be considered that way.

original: gus pa dang bsnyen bkur byed pa nyams par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gus pa dang bsnyen bkur byed pa nyams par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: He would lose respect and honor.

original: de lta bu mthong bas don mthun pa nyid du ston par mi byed do //
analyzed: de lta bu mthong bas don mthun pa nyid du ston par mi byed do //
translated: Seeing that this is so, he does not teach by means of the same purpose.

original: bdag nyid yon tan dang mthu khyad du 'phags pa dang ldan par gyur la dman pa la mos pa nyan thos la sogs pa chos thams cad brjod du med pa nyid thos pa dang / bsgrub par mi 'gyur zhing skrag pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid yon tan dang mthu khyad du 'phags pa dang ldan par gyur la dman pa la mos pa nyan thos la sogs pa chos thams cad brjod du med pa nyid thos pa dang / bsgrub par mi 'gyur zhing skrag pa rnams la'o //
translated: One who has become endowed with excellent qualities and power, and who is inferior in inclination means one who is a śrāvaka, etc.

original: so sor brtags nas zhes bya ba ni dgos pa'i dbang gis de'i rnam pas don mthun pa nyed du ston par byed do //
analyzed: so sor brtags nas zhes bya ba ni dgos pa'i dbang gis de'i rnam pas don mthun pa nyed du ston par byed do //
translated: One who having investigated means one who, by the power of necessity, demonstrates the same purpose as that one.

original: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa nyan thos la sogs pa dang bdag nyid don mthun par stan par mdzad do //
analyzed: dper na de bzhin gshegs pa nyan thos la sogs pa dang bdag nyid don mthun par stan par mdzad do //
translated: For example, the Tathāgata teaches the same purpose as the śrāvakas, etc.

original: des 'dul ba rnams kyi don byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: des 'dul ba rnams kyi don byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the one who is disciplined acting for the benefit of others.

original: sems can dman pa rnams kyi don yang byed par 'dod pas skye gnas dang / rigs dang / rus la sogs pa bdag nyid mnyam par ston par byed do //
analyzed: sems can dman pa rnams kyi don yang byed par 'dod pas skye gnas dang / rigs dang / rus la sogs pa bdag nyid mnyam par ston par byed do //
translated: One who wishes to act for the benefit of inferior sentient beings demonstrates the same self as birth, caste, family, etc.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: bsams bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsams bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: intentionally, etc.

original: mu gsum pa ni bskul bar bya ba gang @207a * //
analyzed: mu gsum pa ni bskul bar bya ba gang @207a * //
translated: The third alternative is that which is to be urged, and which is the teaching of the concordant meaning for the sake of stabilizing the one who has taken up the practice through intimacy and friendship.

original: zhig 'dris shing bshes pas 'jug par 'gyur ba de dag kyang yang dag par blangs pa la brtan par bya ba'i phyir de dang don mthun pa nyid du ston par byed pa 'di ni yang rab tu grags pa'i don mthun pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: zhig 'dris shing bshes pas 'jug par 'gyur ba de dag kyang yang dag par blangs pa la brtan par bya ba'i phyir de dang don mthun pa nyid du ston par byed pa 'di ni yang rab tu grags pa'i don mthun pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be known as the most famous concordant meaning.

original: bdag nyid kyi don dang / gzhan gyi don la yang 'jug pa ma yin pa zhes bya bas gzhan gyi don la yang bag med pa'i dbang gis btang snyoms su gnas pas don mthun pa bstan pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi don dang / gzhan gyi don la yang 'jug pa ma yin pa zhes bya bas gzhan gyi don la yang bag med pa'i dbang gis btang snyoms su gnas pas don mthun pa bstan pa'i sgo nas gzhan gyi don byed pa ma yin no //
translated: The phrase not engaged in one's own aim and not engaged in others' aim means that one does not accomplish the aim of others through the concordant meaning, because one remains indifferent through the power of heedlessness with regard to others' aims.

original: sa bcu pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde nas gsungs pa'i sa dang po la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par spyod par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: sa bcu pa la sogs pa'i mdo sde nas gsungs pa'i sa dang po la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa lhag par spyod par 'gyur zhing /
translated: In the sutra of the Ten Stages and so on, it is said that on the first stage one practices the perfection of giving to a high degree.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po yang sbyin pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po yang sbyin pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The means of gathering a following also arises from giving.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ngo //
translated: And so on for the others.

original: gnyi ga smos pa'i dgos pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gnyi ga smos pa'i dgos pa bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: To show the purpose of mentioning both, he says:

original: de la sbyin pa rnam pa du mar bstan pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
analyzed: de la sbyin pa rnam pa du mar bstan pa gang yin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa la //
translated: Among them, the generosity that has been taught in many ways, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i bya ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The bodhisattva's activity is twofold:

original: bdag gi rgyud kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag gi rgyud kyis sangs rgyas kyi chos yongs su smin par bya ba dang / phyi rol gyi sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'o //
translated: the maturation of the Buddha qualities in one's own continuum and the maturation of sentient beings externally.

original: de la pha rol tu phyin pas ni snga ma yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: de la pha rol tu phyin pas ni snga ma yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: Among them, the perfections bring about the former maturation.

original: bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyis ni gzhan no //
analyzed: bsdu ba'i dngos po rnams kyis ni gzhan no //
translated: The means of gathering disciples bring about the latter.

original: des na byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bya ba thams cad ni di dag gis bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: des na byang chub sems dpa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba'i bya ba thams cad ni di dag gis bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, all the bodhisattva's activities of roots of virtue are included in these.

original: da ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa de dag nyid byang chub thob pa la rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir dang / byang chub kyi phyogs rnams kyang kun du spyod pa dang / phul du byung ba nyid dang / rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas nas de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir smras pa gsum gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: da ni pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa de dag nyid byang chub thob pa la rjes su mthun pa yin pa'i phyir dang / byang chub kyi phyogs rnams kyang kun du spyod pa dang / phul du byung ba nyid dang / rnam par dag pa'i dbang du byas nas de'i rgyu bstan pa'i phyir smras pa gsum gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate the cause of those very perfections, etc., because they are suitable for attaining enlightenment, and in order to demonstrate the cause of the factors of enlightenment in terms of practice, excellence, and purification, he says, “By three, etc.”

original: rgyu zhes bya ba ni sgo zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: rgyu zhes bya ba ni sgo zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: “Cause” means “door.”

original: dge ba'i chos la legs par spyod pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: dge ba'i chos la legs par spyod pa zhes brjod do //
translated: It is called “the practice of wholesome dharmas.”

original: legs par spyod pa ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyis bsdus pa nyid de /
analyzed: legs par spyod pa ni kha na ma tho ba med pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyis bsdus pa nyid de /
translated: The practice is included in the wholesome actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams lus la sogs pa'i sgo gsum nas kun du spyod pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos rnams lus la sogs pa'i sgo gsum nas kun du spyod pa'o //
translated: The dharmas of generosity, etc. are practiced through the three doors of body, speech, and mind.

original: rgya che ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phul du byung ba'i rnam pa bstan to //
analyzed: rgya che ba'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phul du byung ba'i rnam pa bstan to //
translated: “Because of their vastness, etc.” indicates the excellence.

original: rgya che ba nyid ni chen por gyur bzhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rgya che ba nyid ni chen por gyur bzhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Magnificence is the meaning of “greatness”.

original: rgyu gsum gyis dbye ba med pa'i phyir ma lus pa la 'jug pas na des na rgya che ba nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis dbye ba med pa'i phyir ma lus pa la 'jug pas na des na rgya che ba nyid do //
translated: Because of three causes, there is no differentiation, and so it is engaged in totality.

original: sems @207b can la dbye ba med pa ni bdag dang / gzhan zhes dbye ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid do //🔽dngos po la dbye ba med pa ni 'di ni sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: sems @207b can la dbye ba med pa ni bdag dang / gzhan zhes dbye ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid do // dngos po la dbye ba med pa ni 'di ni sbyin par bya'o //
translated: There is no differentiation in sentient beings, because there is no conceptual thought of “self” and “other”.

original: 'di ni sbyin par mi bya'o zhas bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ni sbyin par mi bya'o zhas bya ba'i rnam par rtog pa med pa nyid do //
translated: There is no differentiation in things, because there is no conceptual thought of “this is to be given” and “this is not to be given”.

original: dus la dbye ba med pa nyid ni dus 'di la ni sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus la dbye ba med pa nyid ni dus 'di la ni sbyin pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no differentiation in time, because there is no conceptual thought of “this is the time to give” and so on.

original: de'i phyir sems can thams cad dang / dngos po thams cad dang / dus thams cad kyi sgo nas 'jug pa ni rgya che ba zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir sems can thams cad dang / dngos po thams cad dang / dus thams cad kyi sgo nas 'jug pa ni rgya che ba zhes bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that engagement in totality is magnificence, because of engagement in all sentient beings, all things, and all times.

original: yang dbye ba med pa'i phyir spyi'i chen po nyid do //
analyzed: yang dbye ba med pa'i phyir spyi'i chen po nyid do //
translated: Moreover, it is greatness in general because of non-differentiation.

original: spyi'i chen po yin pa'i phyir chen po nyid do //
analyzed: spyi'i chen po yin pa'i phyir chen po nyid do //
translated: It is greatness because it is great in general.

original: de ltar na rten dang dngos po dang / dus chen po nyid kyis chen po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na rten dang dngos po dang / dus chen po nyid kyis chen po zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, it is called great because of the greatness of its basis, substance, and time.

original: chen po yin pas na rgya che ba zhes yongs su gsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: chen po yin pas na rgya che ba zhes yongs su gsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: It is called extensive because it is great.

original: rgyu de nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: rgyu de nyid kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The same cause, etc.

original: skye ba gzhan gyi rgyu'i stobs kyi rab tu spyod pas de bzhin du kun du spyod pa bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba gzhan gyi rgyu'i stobs kyi rab tu spyod pas de bzhin du kun du spyod pa bstan pa yin no //
translated: The practice of the latter is taught as the practice of the former, by the power of the cause of birth.🔽In four ways: it is pure, because it is the application of a joyful attitude; it is not mixed, because it is the application of an unadulterated attitude; it is not unequal, because it is the application of an attitude free of discouragement; it is respectful, because it is the application of a reverential attitude.

original: rnam pa bzhir zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i bsam pa'i sbyor ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang ba'i rab tu dga' ba dang bcas pa nyid de //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhir zhes bya ba ni dga' ba'i bsam pa'i sbyor ba nyid yin pa'i phyir dang ba'i rab tu dga' ba dang bcas pa nyid de //
translated: It is pure, because it is the application of a joyful attitude.

original: de'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said to be without affliction.

original: ma 'dres pa'i sbyor ba nyid yin pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa'i sbyor ba nyid yin pa'i phyir mi mnyam pa med pa'o //
translated: It is not unequal, because it is the application of an unadulterated attitude.

original: gus pa dang bcas pa'i bsam pa'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir gus par bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: gus pa dang bcas pa'i bsam pa'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir gus par bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: It is respectful, because it is the application of a reverential attitude.

original: ltos pa med pa'i bsam pa'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir rten pa med pa'o //
analyzed: ltos pa med pa'i bsam pa'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir rten pa med pa'o //
translated: It is without support because it is the application of a thought that is independent.

original: de ltar na kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi bsam pa'i sbyor ba spangs pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi bsam pa'i sbyor ba spangs pa'i phyir kun nas nyon mongs pa med par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the absence of defilement is due to the abandonment of the application of a defiled thought.

original: yang de dag gi dag pa nyid kyis dag pa ni dri ma med cing 'od gsal bar rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang de dag gi dag pa nyid kyis dag pa ni dri ma med cing 'od gsal bar rig par bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it is pure in its purity because it is stainless and radiant.

original: 'dres par gyur pa'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir gzhan la gnod pa byed pa nyid dang // da yang lta ba sngon du 'gro ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'dres par gyur pa'i sbyor ba yin pa'i phyir gzhan la gnod pa byed pa nyid dang // da yang lta ba sngon du 'gro ba nyid do //
translated: It is not harmful to others because it is the application of one who is not mixed up with others and it is not preceded by a view.

original: de la rgyu dang po med par bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de la rgyu dang po med par bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: In this respect, the first cause is shown to be non-existent:

original: gzhan la gnod pa med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa med pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: because it is not harmful to others, etc.

original: gzhan dag la gnod pa mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan dag la gnod pa mi byed ces bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it does not harm others.

original: rgyu gnyis pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu gnyis pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The second cause is shown to be non-existent:

original: lta bar gyur pa rnams la mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: lta bar gyur pa rnams la mngon par zhen pa med pa zhes bya'o //
translated: because it is not attached to views.

original: de'i phyir smras pa //
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa //
translated: Hence it is said:

original: ma 'dres pa de dag kun du spyod do zhes bya'o //🔽gus par byed pa'i @208a * //
analyzed: ma 'dres pa de dag kun du spyod do zhes bya'o // gus par byed pa'i @208a * //
translated: He practices them without mixing them up.

original: sbyor ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The application of respect is twofold:

original: phan yon mthong ba nyid dang / de lo na nyid la rab tu nged pa nyid do //
analyzed: phan yon mthong ba nyid dang / de lo na nyid la rab tu nged pa nyid do //
translated: seeing the benefits and being afraid of the consequences.

original: sgo gsum nas phan yon bstan pa'i phyir yon tan du lta ba nyid ni gzhan rjes su gzung ba la rab tu zhugs pa'o //
analyzed: sgo gsum nas phan yon bstan pa'i phyir yon tan du lta ba nyid ni gzhan rjes su gzung ba la rab tu zhugs pa'o //
translated: The seeing of virtues is the entry into the care of others, because it shows the benefits in three ways.

original: 'bras bu khyad par chen po nyid mthong ba ni snying por lta ba'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu khyad par chen po nyid mthong ba ni snying por lta ba'o //
translated: The seeing of the essence is the seeing of the great special result.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po'i phyogs gang yin pa ni zhi bar lta ba'o //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi gnyen po'i phyogs gang yin pa ni zhi bar lta ba'o //
translated: The seeing of peace is the antidote to the opposing side.

original: rgyu gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir shin tu nges pa zhes bya ba la rgyu dang 'bras bu blo'i mngon sum du gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu gnyis pa bstan pa'i phyir shin tu nges pa zhes bya ba la rgyu dang 'bras bu blo'i mngon sum du gyur ba nyid do //
translated: The second cause is taught: “he is very certain.” The cause and result are directly perceived.

original: des na smras pa /🔽gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog cing zhes bya'o //
analyzed: des na smras pa / gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog cing zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore it is said:🔽“he is not dependent on others.”

original: gzhan gyi dad pa bskyed nas sgrub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dad pa bskyed nas sgrub pa ma yin te /
translated: He does not practice out of faith in others.

original: gzhan gyi gdong du lta bar byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzhan gyi gdong du lta bar byed pa ma yin zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that he does not look to the face of others.🔽 In order to show that he is not concerned with the most excellent and sublime evolutionary development in the three realms, he says, he is not concerned even with the sovereignty of a world-emperor among men,

original: khams gsum gyi shin tu rab tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i rnam par smin pa la ltos pa med par bstan pa ni mi rnams kyi 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid la yang ltos pa med pa nyid dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te //
analyzed: khams gsum gyi shin tu rab tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i rnam par smin pa la ltos pa med par bstan pa ni mi rnams kyi 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal srid la yang ltos pa med pa nyid dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha rnams ni rnam pa gnyis te //
translated: and also with the gods in the realm of desire, who are of two kinds:

original: sa la brten pa dang / gzhal yas khang la brten pa'o //
analyzed: sa la brten pa dang / gzhal yas khang la brten pa'o //
translated: those who live on the earth and those who live in the palace.

original: sa la brten pa'i lha rnams kyi rgyal po ni brgya byin nyid do //
analyzed: sa la brten pa'i lha rnams kyi rgyal po ni brgya byin nyid do //
translated: The king of the gods who live on the earth is Sakra.

original: gzhan rnams kyi lha'i rgyal po ni bdud nyid do //
analyzed: gzhan rnams kyi lha'i rgyal po ni bdud nyid do //
translated: The king of the other gods is Mara.

original: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i rnam par smin pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i rnam par smin pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: In order to show that he is not concerned with the evolutionary development of the form and formless realms, he says, he is not concerned even with the sovereignty of Brahma.

original: tshangs pa nyid ces bya'o //
analyzed: tshangs pa nyid ces bya'o //
translated: The meaning is that he is not concerned even with the sovereignty of Brahma.🔽 In order to show that he does not expect any reward even in this life, he says, he does not expect any reward, even in this life, for the help he has given.

original: tshe 'di la lan du phan 'dogs pa la yang re ba med par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: tshe 'di la lan du phan 'dogs pa la yang re ba med par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The meaning is that he does not expect any reward, even in this life, for the help he has given.🔽

original: phan 'dogs pa la yang re ba med ces bya'o //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa la yang re ba med ces bya'o //
translated: He is not concerned with gain, honor, or fame

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la ltos pa med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti la ltos pa med pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the absence of concern for gain and honor, he says,🔽gain, honor,

original: khe dang / rnyed pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: khe dang / rnyed pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: and fame.

original: bdag gi lus kyi khyad par la yang mi brten par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: bdag gi lus kyi khyad par la yang mi brten par bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that he does not rely on the special qualities of his own body, he says,

original: tha na lus dang srog la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: tha na lus dang srog la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: not even for the sake of his own body and life.🔽In order to include the four kinds of non-affliction, he says, pure,

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnam pa bzhi nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir dang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa rnam pa bzhi nye bar bsdu bar bya ba'i phyir dang ba dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: mchog tu dga' ba dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba ni dad ba dang rab tu dga' ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba dang ldan pa dang zhes bya ba ni dad ba dang rab tu dga' ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Possessing supreme joy means possessing faith and delight.

original: gzhan la gnod pa mi byed pas na mi mthun pa med pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan la gnod pa mi byed pas na mi mthun pa med pa'o //
translated: Since he does not harm others, he is free from hostility.

original: yon tan la sogs pa mthong bas yang dag par blangs la 'jug pa zhas bya ba ni gus par bya ba byed pa'o //
analyzed: yon tan la sogs pa mthong bas yang dag par blangs la 'jug pa zhas bya ba ni gus par bya ba byed pa'o //
translated: He engages in the precepts through seeing the virtues and so on means he acts with respect.

original: rnam par smin pa la sogs pa la mi @208b ltos pas na mi brten pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa la sogs pa la mi @208b ltos pas na mi brten pa'o //
translated: Since he does not rely on karmic maturation and so on, he is independent.

original: rnam par dag pa gsum gyi rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa gsum gyi rnam pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the three purities, he says:🔽purification, non-wavering, and complete purity.

original: sbyangs pa nyid dang / mi g-yo ba nyid dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid ces bya ba ni mthar thug pa'i sa ma thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: sbyangs pa nyid dang / mi g-yo ba nyid dang / shin tu rnam par dag pa nyid ces bya ba ni mthar thug pa'i sa ma thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi ni dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The roots of the wholesome of the bodhisattvas who have not attained the level of a buddha are purified in two ways;

original: mthar thug par gyur pa rnams kyi ni gsum char gyis kyang ngo //
analyzed: mthar thug par gyur pa rnams kyi ni gsum char gyis kyang ngo //
translated: but those who have attained the ultimate level are purified in all three ways.

original: sbyangs pa ni bsam pa'i khyad par thob pa dang / rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ngang 'bad pa med par 'jug pa nyid dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: sbyangs pa ni bsam pa'i khyad par thob pa dang / rang gi ngang gis 'jug pa ngang 'bad pa med par 'jug pa nyid dang / mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: Purification is the attainment of a special intention, the effortless engagement of natural engagement and the engagement without the manifestation of formative influence.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /🔽so sor ma brtags par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
