analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa / so sor ma brtags par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba la /
translated: Hence he says:🔽because they are not engaged in the performance of action after careful consideration.

original: so sor brtags nas byed pa nyid ni ma yin na'o //
analyzed: so sor brtags nas byed pa nyid ni ma yin na'o //
translated: They are not engaged in the performance of action after careful consideration.

original: gang gis 'bad pa med par kun du spyod par 'gyur ba de lta bur 'jug par 'gyur ba'i rten dang sems kyi rgyud thob par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis 'bad pa med par kun du spyod par 'gyur ba de lta bur 'jug par 'gyur ba'i rten dang sems kyi rgyud thob par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: The bodhisattva obtains a life and a mental continuum in which he practices the perfections effortlessly.

original: mi g-yo ba nyid ni brten pas so //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba nyid ni brten pas so //
translated: Stability is due to the support.

original: yang na gzhan du 'gyur pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: yang na gzhan du 'gyur pa med pa nyid de /
translated: Or else, it is the fact that he does not change his mind.

original: yongs su ma nyams pa'i sbyor bas so //
analyzed: yongs su ma nyams pa'i sbyor bas so //
translated: It is due to the application of non-regression.

original: dper na bden pa mthong ba'i nyan thos rnams dge ba'i chos rnams las kyang mi nyams te /
analyzed: dper na bden pa mthong ba'i nyan thos rnams dge ba'i chos rnams las kyang mi nyams te /
translated: For example, the Sravakas who have seen the Truths do not regress from the wholesome roots.

original: khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par du 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: They progress.

original: de bzhin du sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang khyad par du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du sa la zhugs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyang khyad par du 'gro ba yin pa'i phyir yongs su nyams par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattvas who have entered into the stages do not regress, because they progress.

original: 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: 'phel bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The cause of increase is twofold:

original: rgyu nye bar bsags pa dang ldan pa nyid dang / rnam par smin pa'i khyad par thob pa nyid do //
analyzed: rgyu nye bar bsags pa dang ldan pa nyid dang / rnam par smin pa'i khyad par thob pa nyid do //
translated: the accumulation of the cause and the acquisition of a special result.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: This is why it is said:

original: mtshan mo dang nyin mo dang de dang de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mtshan mo dang nyin mo dang de dang de dag ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Night and day, here and there, etc.

original: dus la ltos nas nges par 'phel bar 'gyur ba ni 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa'i dngos po dper byas pa'o //
analyzed: dus la ltos nas nges par 'phel bar 'gyur ba ni 'jig rten la rab tu grags pa'i dngos po dper byas pa'o //
translated: The example is a thing well known in the world, which increases in dependence on time.🔽Just so, etc.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dper na zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dper na zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: means just as, for example.

original: de ltar mig sman ri mo sna tshogs ltar //
analyzed: de ltar mig sman ri mo sna tshogs ltar //
translated: Just as a picture is various,

original: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: just so is the world.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa la gnas pa ni sa bcu pa la dbang bskur ba thob pa'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mthar thug par 'gro ba'i sa la gnas pa ni sa bcu pa la dbang bskur ba thob pa'o //
translated: The Bodhisattva who has reached the stage of ultimate arrival is one who has attained consecration on the tenth stage.

original: de'i don dam pa'i tshul dang / rab tu grags pa'i tshul rnam pa gnyis kyi dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag par bya'o //🔽don dam pa'i tshul gyi dbang du byas pa ni dbang phyug @209a * //
analyzed: de'i don dam pa'i tshul dang / rab tu grags pa'i tshul rnam pa gnyis kyi dbang du byas nas rnam par gzhag par bya'o // don dam pa'i tshul gyi dbang du byas pa ni dbang phyug @209a * //
translated: His should be established in terms of both the ultimate mode and the well known mode.

original: chen po'i gnas su skyes pa de dag la dbye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: chen po'i gnas su skyes pa de dag la dbye ba med pa'o //
translated: In terms of the ultimate mode, they are born in the abode of Maheśvara, and there is no distinction among them.

original: rab tu grags pa'i tshul gyi dbang du byas pa ni smras pa /
analyzed: rab tu grags pa'i tshul gyi dbang du byas pa ni smras pa /
translated: In terms of the well known mode, it is said:

original: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa dang / srid pa tha ma pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba gcig gis thogs pa dang / srid pa tha ma pa'o //
translated: He is one lifetime away, and he is in his final existence.

original: de la skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ni dga' ldan gyi pho brang du skyes par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: de la skye ba gcig gis thogs pa ni dga' ldan gyi pho brang du skyes par gyur pa'o //
translated: One lifetime away means he has been born in the palace of Tushita.

original: srid pa tha ma pa ni de nas shi 'phos nas mi'i rigs su skyes pa'o //
analyzed: srid pa tha ma pa ni de nas shi 'phos nas mi'i rigs su skyes pa'o //
translated: In his final existence means that after that he will be born in the human race.

original: de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba des byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i mthar thug pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: de'i dge ba'i rtsa ba des byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa'i mthar thug pa rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: By that root of merit, he will reach the end of the bodhisattva course and will be purified.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa la de dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa la de dag las zhes bya ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: On the bodhisattva stages, from them, etc.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag gi mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu la dbye ba med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i chos 'di dag gi mthar thug pa'i 'bras bu la dbye ba med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: The ultimate fruit of these dharmas beginning with generosity is taught without distinction.

original: gzhan du na sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis bsdus pa'i dngos po rnams kyis ni sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ji ltar rang gi rgyud rab tu khyad par du 'phags pa thob par 'gyur /
analyzed: gzhan du na sngar bstan pa'i tshul gyis bsdus pa'i dngos po rnams kyis ni sems can yongs su smin par byed do zhes bya ba'i tshig gis ji ltar rang gi rgyud rab tu khyad par du 'phags pa thob par 'gyur /
translated: Otherwise, how could the words “by means of the things included in the previously explained manner, one brings beings to maturity” indicate the attainment of a special excellence of one’s own continuum?

original: des na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kun gyi spyi'i 'bras bu gcig pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: des na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid kun gyi spyi'i 'bras bu gcig pa nyid du bstan pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the essence of all the factors of enlightenment is taught to be a single universal effect.

original: de ltar na sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa dgur ci'i phyir bstan zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na sbyin pa la sogs pa rnam pa dgur ci'i phyir bstan zhe na /
translated: Why are the perfections taught to be nine in number?

original: de dag gi 'bras bu rnam pa dgu nyid do zhes bstan pa'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag gi 'bras bu rnam pa dgu nyid do zhes bstan pa'i yon tan bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To teach the qualities of that teaching, it says:

original: de ltar na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi 'bras bu mthar thug pa dang mthar thug pa ma yin pas gcig dang du ma'i bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos rnams kyi 'bras bu mthar thug pa dang mthar thug pa ma yin pas gcig dang du ma'i bdag nyid kyi 'bras bu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the ultimate and non-ultimate fruits of the factors of enlightenment are taught to be a single fruit and a multiple fruit.

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi spangs pa rnam pa gnyis dang / ye shes rnam pa gnyis kyi dang po'i dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi spangs pa rnam pa gnyis dang / ye shes rnam pa gnyis kyi dang po'i dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: The first is from the point of view of the two kinds of abandonment and the two kinds of knowledge of the unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: rdo rje snying po'i sku nyid ni de'i rten du gyur pa mtshan gyis brgyan pa'i gzugs kyi sku ste /
analyzed: rdo rje snying po'i sku nyid ni de'i rten du gyur pa mtshan gyis brgyan pa'i gzugs kyi sku ste /
translated: The body of the essence of the vajra is the body of form adorned with the major and minor marks, which is the basis of the latter.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku gcad du med cing gzhig tu med pa'i phyir thams cad rdo rje'i rang bzhin yin gyi sku gdung 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyi sku gcad du med cing gzhig tu med pa'i phyir thams cad rdo rje'i rang bzhin yin gyi sku gdung 'ba' zhig tu ma zad pa'o //
translated: Since the body of form of the Tathagata is indivisible and indestructible, it is all vajra by nature, not just the relics.

original: dka' ba'i sbyin pa la sogs pa ngo mtshar rmad du gyur pa nyid kyi 'bras bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos rnams thob pa'o //
analyzed: dka' ba'i sbyin pa la sogs pa ngo mtshar rmad du gyur pa nyid kyi 'bras bu ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba'i chos rnams thob pa'o //
translated: The result of the generosity of difficulty, etc., is the attainment of the wonderful and marvelous dharmas of the Tathagata.

original: thams cad kyi sgo nas sbyin pa la sogs pa la zhugs pas ni lha dang mi rnams kyis thams cad kyi sgo nas mchod pa ni @209b 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: thams cad kyi sgo nas sbyin pa la sogs pa la zhugs pas ni lha dang mi rnams kyis thams cad kyi sgo nas mchod pa ni @209b 'bras bu'o //
translated: The result of the practice of generosity, etc., in all ways is the worship of all gods and men in all ways.

original: skyes bu dam pa la brten pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi dam par gyur pa nyid de /
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa la brten pa'i phyir sems can thams cad kyi dam par gyur pa nyid de /
translated: He is the best of all beings because he is the support of holy beings.

original: nges pa'i don gyi dbang du byas nas mdo'i tshig rnams bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i don gyi dbang du byas nas mdo'i tshig rnams bstan pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that the words of the sutra are taught from the point of view of the ultimate truth.

original: tshul bzhin na rkang pas 'gro bar byed ces bya ba'i tshig gis drang ba'i don to //
analyzed: tshul bzhin na rkang pas 'gro bar byed ces bya ba'i tshig gis drang ba'i don to //
translated: The words “he goes with his feet” have a provisional meaning.

original: phyin ci log bcu gnyis la rkang pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: phyin ci log bcu gnyis la rkang pa zhes brjod de /
translated: The feet are said to be the twelve inversions.

original: yang srid par 'gro bar byed pa'i phyir dang / 'dis 'gro zhing bskyod pas zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: yang srid par 'gro bar byed pa'i phyir dang / 'dis 'gro zhing bskyod pas zhes byas nas so //
translated: Because they cause one to go to rebirth, and because one goes and moves by means of them.

original: de dag lhag ma ma lus par spangs pas na dgra bcom pa ni rkang pa med pa'o //🔽phyir mi 'ong ba ni rkang pa gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: de dag lhag ma ma lus par spangs pas na dgra bcom pa ni rkang pa med pa'o // phyir mi 'ong ba ni rkang pa gnyis pa ste /
translated: The arhat is without feet because he has completely abandoned them.🔽The non-returner has two feet because he still has the two inversions of taking what is impermanent as permanent and what is non-self as self.

original: yang srid pa'i sdug bsngal la bde bar 'du shes pa'i phyir phyin ci log tu kun du spyod pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang srid pa'i sdug bsngal la bde bar 'du shes pa'i phyir phyin ci log tu kun du spyod pa nyid do //
translated: Because he takes the suffering of rebirth as pleasure.

original: gal te de la gcig tu sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes dang sems kyis kun du spyod par gyur na ni yang srid par skye ba thob par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de la gcig tu sdug bsngal gyi 'du shes dang sems kyis kun du spyod par gyur na ni yang srid par skye ba thob par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one were to experience them with the notion and thought of suffering, one would not obtain rebirth in existence.

original: de'i phyir de ni de dag kun du spyod pa'i phyir rkang gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni de dag kun du spyod pa'i phyir rkang gnyis pa'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called the two-footed one because it experiences them.

original: rkang bzhi pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i gang zag ste /
analyzed: rkang bzhi pa ni 'phags pa nyan thos 'dod chags dang ma bral ba'i gang zag ste /
translated: The four-footed one is the noble disciple who is not free from passion.

original: de dag ni mi gtsang ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'khrig pa'i 'dod pa la gtsang bar 'du shes pa dang / sems phyin ci log yod pa dang yang srid kyi sdug bsngal bde bar 'du sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni mi gtsang ba'i mtshan nyid can gyi 'khrig pa'i 'dod pa la gtsang bar 'du shes pa dang / sems phyin ci log yod pa dang yang srid kyi sdug bsngal bde bar 'du sems phyin ci log tu gyur pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They have the notion of purity with regard to sexual intercourse, which has the characteristic of impurity, and they have the perverted thought and notion that the suffering of rebirth is happiness.

original: rkang mongs ni so so'i skye bo ste /
analyzed: rkang mongs ni so so'i skye bo ste /
translated: The one with passion is the ordinary person.

original: thams cad ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad ma spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he has not abandoned all the defilements.

original: yang de ni khams dang / skye ba'i dbye bas gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: yang de ni khams dang / skye ba'i dbye bas gzugs can dang / gzugs can ma yin pa'o //
translated: Moreover, he is of two kinds: with form and without form, according to the distinction of realm and rebirth.

original: gzugs can las ming gi phung po bzhi la zhugs pa ni 'du shes can no /
analyzed: gzugs can las ming gi phung po bzhi la zhugs pa ni 'du shes can no /
translated: Those who enter the four name aggregates from the form aggregate are those with ideation.

original: de las bzlog pa ni 'du shes med pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni 'du shes med pa'o //
translated: Those who are the opposite of that are those without ideation.

original: de bzhin du mi gsal ba'i 'du shes kun du spyod pa'i gzugs med pa ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du mi gsal ba'i 'du shes kun du spyod pa'i gzugs med pa ni 'du shes med 'du shes med min yin no //
translated: Similarly, the formless realm is that of neither ideation nor non-ideation, because ideation that is not clear is active there.

original: de ltar na dgra bcom pa dang / slob pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mchog nyid du bstan par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na dgra bcom pa dang / slob pa dang / 'jig rten pa'i 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mchog nyid du bstan par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus, it is taught that the arhats, the trainees, and the worldly beings are the best of those who are free from attachment.

original: gzhan du ni nye bar dgod pa 'di mdzes shing rjes su mthun pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni nye bar dgod pa 'di mdzes shing rjes su mthun pa ma yin no //
translated: Otherwise, this summary would not be beautiful and would not be in accord with the sutra.

original: mtshan rnams ni dpag tu med pa'i bsod nams kyis yongs su gzung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: mtshan rnams ni dpag tu med pa'i bsod nams kyis yongs su gzung ba'i phyir te /
translated: The marks are the result of the possession of immeasurable merit,

original: re re yang bsod nams brgya yis bskyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs pa la bdud dang phyir rgol ba rnams @210a * //
analyzed: re re yang bsod nams brgya yis bskyod pa yin pa'i phyir ro // byang chub kyi snying po la bzhugs pa la bdud dang phyir rgol ba rnams @210a * //
translated: because each mark is produced by a hundred merits.🔽The thirty-two marks of a great being are the result of the absence of harm, etc.

original: kyis gnod pa la sogs pa med pa'i 'bras bu'o //
analyzed: kyis gnod pa la sogs pa med pa'i 'bras bu'o //
translated: for one who is seated at the site of enlightenment, by Mara and his army.

original: de la bar du gcod pa med pa ni gnod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: de la bar du gcod pa med pa ni gnod pa med pa'o //
translated: The absence of obstruction is the absence of harm.

original: sku la mi 'dod pa'i dngos po'i reg pa mi 'byung ba ni tho 'tshams pa med pa'o //
analyzed: sku la mi 'dod pa'i dngos po'i reg pa mi 'byung ba ni tho 'tshams pa med pa'o //
translated: The absence of violence is the absence of contact with undesirable things.

original: thugs la rnam par 'gyur ba med pa ni bskyod par mi nus pa'o //
analyzed: thugs la rnam par 'gyur ba med pa ni bskyod par mi nus pa'o //
translated: The absence of agitation is the absence of disturbance.

original: 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i sbyin pa la sogs pa ni 'di nyid dang gzhan nyid du mchog tu bde ba'i dngos po mi las shin tu 'das pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'o zhes bya bar smras pa /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'di dang gzhan du bde bar 'gyur ba'i sbyin pa la sogs pa ni 'di nyid dang gzhan nyid du mchog tu bde ba'i dngos po mi las shin tu 'das pa'i 'bras bu thob pa'o zhes bya bar smras pa / de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The result of giving, etc. is the attainment of the supreme bliss of this very life and the next, which is the attainment of the fruit that transcends the human condition.

original: bde ba'i mchog ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud kyis bsdus pa'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i mchog ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rgyud kyis bsdus pa'o //
translated: The supreme bliss is included in the stream of being of the Tathagata.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i 'bras bu ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa'i 'bras bu ni sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams kyi chos ma 'dres pa rnams rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: The result of the purification of giving, etc. is the purification of the special qualities of the Buddha.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi las bsdu ba'i dngos po'i le'u ste bco lnga pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so /🔽// / dkon mchog la mchod pa dang / mdza' ba bstan pa'i sdom gyi 'grel pa ni ji ltar bslab par bya ba'i dbang du byas shing rjes su 'brangs nas de dang mthun par bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'i sgo nas ji ltar bslab par bya ba'i sbyor ba bstan nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i sa'i gzhi las bsdu ba'i dngos po'i le'u ste bco lnga pa'i 'grel pa rdzogs so / // / dkon mchog la mchod pa dang / mdza' ba bstan pa'i sdom gyi 'grel pa ni ji ltar bslab par bya ba'i dbang du byas shing rjes su 'brangs nas de dang mthun par bsdu ba'i dngos po bzhi'i sgo nas ji ltar bslab par bya ba'i sbyor ba bstan nas /
translated: This completes the commentary on the fifteenth chapter of the Bodhisattva Section of the Yogācārabhūmi, the chapter on the means of gathering.🔽Having explained the practice of the four means of gathering through following and in accordance with the chapter on the summary of worship of the Three Jewels and the spiritual friend,

original: da ni dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa'i sgo nas dang // dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa'i sbyor ba dang / tshad med pa bzhi bsgom pa'i sbyor bas kyang bslab par bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir sdom tha ma smras pa yin no //
analyzed: da ni dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa'i sgo nas dang // dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa'i sbyor ba dang / tshad med pa bzhi bsgom pa'i sbyor bas kyang bslab par bya'o zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir sdom tha ma smras pa yin no //
translated: now, in order to teach that one should also practice through worship of the Three Jewels, through the practice of relying on the spiritual friend, and through the practice of cultivating the four immeasurables, the final summary is stated.

original: de las dang po kho nar sangs rgyas dkon mchog la mchod pa bstan par 'dod nas smras pa /
analyzed: de las dang po kho nar sangs rgyas dkon mchog la mchod pa bstan par 'dod nas smras pa /
translated: First, wishing to teach the worship of the Buddha Jewel, it is said:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa gang zhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la mchod pa gang zhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: What is worship of the Tathagata?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rten la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i rten la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The Tathagata is the support of the Tathagata-essence.

original: re re la yang rab tu dbye ba dpag tu med pa yod pas mdor bsdu na zhes smras so //
analyzed: re re la yang rab tu dbye ba dpag tu med pa yod pas mdor bsdu na zhes smras so //
translated: Since each of these has an immeasurable classification, it is said in brief.

original: rnam pa bcur zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa bcur zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod pa ni rnam pa bcur rig par bya'o zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: The ten aspects are taught in order to show that the worship of the Tathagata should be known as having ten aspects.

original: rnam pa bcu po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam pa bcu po de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rnam pa gsum du gzhag par bya ste /
translated: These ten aspects are also established in brief as having three aspects:

original: mchod bya'i dngos po khyad par nyid dang / mchod pa po'i khyad par nyid dang / mchod pa'i rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par nyid de /
analyzed: mchod bya'i dngos po khyad par nyid dang / mchod pa po'i khyad par nyid dang / mchod pa'i rab tu dbye ba'i khyad par nyid de /
translated: the particular entity of worship, the particular worshipper, and the particular classification of worship.

original: gang la mchod pa dang / gang gis mchod pa dang / gang dag gis mchod pa zhes bya ba gsum po @210b 'di dag gi dbang du byas nas rnam pa bzhi dang / gnyis dang tshig lhag mas so //
analyzed: gang la mchod pa dang / gang gis mchod pa dang / gang dag gis mchod pa zhes bya ba gsum po @210b 'di dag gi dbang du byas nas rnam pa bzhi dang / gnyis dang tshig lhag mas so //
translated: what is worshipped, by what one worships, and by whom one worships.

original: mdor bsdu na mchod bya'i dngos po yang gnyis te /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na mchod bya'i dngos po yang gnyis te /
translated: In brief, the object of worship is twofold:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs ye shes dang bcas pa ma gyur pa la mchod pa dang / gyur pa dang bcas pa ni gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs ye shes dang bcas pa ma gyur pa la mchod pa dang / gyur pa dang bcas pa ni gang yang smras pa /
translated: worship of the transformed body of the Tathagata together with the intuition, and worship of the transformed body without the intuition.

original: mchod rten la mchod pa zhes bya bas so //
analyzed: mchod rten la mchod pa zhes bya bas so //
translated: The former is worship of the stupa, the latter is worship of the image.

original: de dag gnyis ka la mchod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /🔽mngon du gyur pa la'am /
analyzed: de dag gnyis ka la mchod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te / mngon du gyur pa la'am /
translated: Worship of both is also twofold:

original: mngon du ma gyur pa la mchod pa rnam pa gnyis so //
analyzed: mngon du ma gyur pa la mchod pa rnam pa gnyis so //
translated: worship of the manifest, and worship of the unmanifest.🔽Worship of the manifest and worship of the unmanifest.

original: mngon du gyur pa la mchod pa dang / mngon du ma gyur pa la mchod pa zhes bya bas de ltar na mchod par bya ba'i dngos po yang rnam pa bzhir dbye bar bya'o //
analyzed: mngon du gyur pa la mchod pa dang / mngon du ma gyur pa la mchod pa zhes bya bas de ltar na mchod par bya ba'i dngos po yang rnam pa bzhir dbye bar bya'o //
translated: Thus the object of worship is also classified as fourfold.

original: zang zing gi mchod pa gang yin pa de yang sbyin pa dang 'dra bar rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: zang zing gi mchod pa gang yin pa de yang sbyin pa dang 'dra bar rnam pa gnyis kyis 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: The material offering is also twofold, like generosity.

original: lus kyi sgo nas mchod pa ni gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: lus kyi sgo nas mchod pa ni gang yang smras pa /
translated: The offering made by oneself is that which is said:

original: bdag gis byas pa'i mchod pa dang zhes bya ba'o /🔽ngag gi sgo nas byed du bcug pa ni gang yang smras pa /
analyzed: bdag gis byas pa'i mchod pa dang zhes bya ba'o / ngag gi sgo nas byed du bcug pa ni gang yang smras pa /
translated: “The offering that I have made.”

original: gzhan byed du bcug pa'i mchod pa dang zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: gzhan byed du bcug pa'i mchod pa dang zhes bya ba'o /
translated: The offering made by others is that which is said:🔽“The offering that I have caused others to make.”

original: gzhan byed du bcug pa'i mchod pa yang gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan byed du bcug pa'i mchod pa yang gnyis te /
translated: The offering made by others is also twofold.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi mchod pa ni skyon dang ldan pa'i sgo nas dgag par bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi mchod pa ni skyon dang ldan pa'i sgo nas dgag par bya'o //
translated: The defiled offering is to be rejected because of its faults.

original: 'bras bu chen po dang ldan pas yon tan dang ldan pa ni rjes su gnang ba yin pas yang 'dir rjes su gnang bar bstan par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu chen po dang ldan pas yon tan dang ldan pa ni rjes su gnang ba yin pas yang 'dir rjes su gnang bar bstan par rig par bya'o //
translated: The pure offering is to be accepted because of its great result.

original: mchod ba'i ngo bo yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mchod ba'i ngo bo yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The essence of offering is also twofold.

original: rdzas la brten cing gnas pas rab tu phye ba nyid ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas la brten cing gnas pas rab tu phye ba nyid ni rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i mchod pa'o //
translated: Worship that is distinguished by its dependence on and reliance on material things is the worship of offerings and honor.

original: rdzas la mi brten pa rang gi don la mngon par brtson pas rab tu phye ba ni sgrub pa'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas la mi brten pa rang gi don la mngon par brtson pas rab tu phye ba ni sgrub pa'i mchod pa'o //
translated: Worship that is distinguished by its devotion to one's own aim without reliance on material things is the worship of practice.

original: rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i mchod pa'i bye brag gi dbye ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i mchod pa'i bye brag gi dbye ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The classification of worship by way of the distinction between offerings and honor is twofold:

original: rgya chen po'i mchod pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: rgya chen po'i mchod pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mchod pa'o //
translated: worship that is extensive and worship that is not defiled.

original: chen po nyid dang ldan pas rgya chen po'o //
analyzed: chen po nyid dang ldan pas rgya chen po'o //
translated: It is extensive because it is endowed with greatness.

original: dag pa nyid dang ldan pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: dag pa nyid dang ldan pas kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'o //
translated: It is not defiled because it is endowed with purity.

original: de ltar na 'dir mchod pa rnam pa gnyis yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir mchod pa rnam pa gnyis yin no //
translated: Thus, worship here is twofold.

original: mngon sum du zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum du byas pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum du zhes bya ba ni de bzhin gshegs pa mngon sum du byas pa ste /
translated: In the presence of means in the presence of the Tathagata.

original: sha'i mig gis mthong nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sha'i mig gis mthong nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Having seen with the eye of flesh means having seen with the physical eye.

original: mchod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni bkur sti byas nas zhes bya ba'i don to //🔽gyur pas shes pa dang mi ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyang 'du shes rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam @211a * //
analyzed: mchod par byed pa zhes bya ba ni bkur sti byas nas zhes bya ba'i don to // gyur pas shes pa dang mi ldan pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs kyang 'du shes rnam pa gnyis kyis rnam @211a * //
translated: “One who worships” means one who honors.

original: par gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: par gzhag par bya ste /
translated: The form of the Tathāgata, which is not endowed with consciousness, is also established by means of two kinds of ideas.

original: tha mal ba dang / khyad par can no //
analyzed: tha mal ba dang / khyad par can no //
translated: The ordinary and the special.

original: tha mal ba ni bsod nams bsags pa'i sgor gyur pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gnas dang dbyibs kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha mal ba ni bsod nams bsags pa'i sgor gyur pa rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i gnas dang dbyibs kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The ordinary is distinguished by the various forms of the receptacle, by the various shapes of the receptacle, which is the door to the accumulation of merit.

original: khyad par can gyi ni dbyibs kyi dbye bas rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: khyad par can gyi ni dbyibs kyi dbye bas rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The special is threefold, distinguished by shape.

original: gang yang smras pa //
analyzed: gang yang smras pa //
translated: Moreover, it is said:

original: mchod rten nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: mchod rten nam zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “A caitya, etc.”

original: de la mchod rten ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gi snying po can 'bru'i phung po'i dbyibs lta bus rab tu phye ba'o //
analyzed: de la mchod rten ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku gdung gi snying po can 'bru'i phung po'i dbyibs lta bus rab tu phye ba'o //
translated: Therein, a caitya is distinguished by the shape of a heap of grain, which contains relics of the Tathāgata.

original: gtsang khang phyur bu ni nang na sku gzugs bzhugs pa'i gru bzhi'o //
analyzed: gtsang khang phyur bu ni nang na sku gzugs bzhugs pa'i gru bzhi'o //
translated: A temple is a square building in which an image is placed.

original: gtsang khang ni de gnyis ka'i snying po can gyi zlum po'o //
analyzed: gtsang khang ni de gnyis ka'i snying po can gyi zlum po'o //
translated: The shrine is the round part which is the heart of both of them.

original: gsum po 'di dag nyid so sor gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis ni rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag nyid so sor gnas skabs kyi bye brag gis ni rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: These three are each of two kinds, according to the difference of the occasion.

original: mchod rten rnying ngam mchod rten gsar //🔽zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: mchod rten rnying ngam mchod rten gsar // zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Old or new shrines.

original: de la rnying pa ni gang yang mi bzhugs pas mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur thams cad dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de la rnying pa ni gang yang mi bzhugs pas mchod pa dang bsnyen bkur thams cad dang bral ba'o //
translated: The old one is that which is without any resident, and is devoid of all worship and service.

original: de las bzlog pa ni gsar pa'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa ni gsar pa'o //
translated: The opposite of that is the new one.

original: yang de dag ni dbyibs nyams shing 'thor bar gyur pa ni rnying ba'o //
analyzed: yang de dag ni dbyibs nyams shing 'thor bar gyur pa ni rnying ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the old one is that which has lost its shape and is in ruins.

original: rnying pa las bzlog par gyur pa ni gsar pa'o //
analyzed: rnying pa las bzlog par gyur pa ni gsar pa'o //
translated: The opposite of the old one is the new one.

original: de dag gi dbye ba bstan pa yang mchod pa byas na bsod nams yongs su 'dzin pa mnyam par bstan pa'i phyir brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi dbye ba bstan pa yang mchod pa byas na bsod nams yongs su 'dzin pa mnyam par bstan pa'i phyir brjod pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of their classification is stated in order to show that the merit acquired from worship is the same.

original: mngon du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i yul du gyur pa'o //
analyzed: mngon du gyur pa zhes bya ba ni dbang po'i yul du gyur pa'o //
translated: The manifest is that which is the object of the sense faculties.

original: de'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phyir smras pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: mngon sum du zhes bya ba ste //
analyzed: mngon sum du zhes bya ba ste //
translated: The manifest is that which is directly perceived.

original: mig gi mdun na gnas pas zhes byas nas so //
analyzed: mig gi mdun na gnas pas zhes byas nas so //
translated: because it is present in the eye's presence.

original: mngon sum du mchod pa'i dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: mngon sum du mchod pa'i dbye ba bstan pa'i phyir smras pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the classification of direct worship, he says:

original: mngon sum du mchod pa byed pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: mngon sum du mchod pa byed pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: The one who is directly worshipping and so on.

original: mchod par gyur pa'i bsam pa rnam pa drug las gang yang rung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mchod par gyur pa'i bsam pa rnam pa drug las gang yang rung ba dang ldan pa'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with superior intention because he possesses any one of the six types of the intention to worship.

original: de'i sgo nas dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba dang ldan pa ni dga' ba dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de'i sgo nas dga' ba dang rab tu dga' ba dang ldan pa ni dga' ba dang ldan pa'o //
translated: He is endowed with joy because he possesses joy and delight through that.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi chos nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs gsum yongs su bsdus pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa gcig gi chos nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni gnas skabs gsum yongs su bsdus pa'i ngo bo nyid ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The reality of a single Tathagata means the essence that includes the three states.

original: tshogs dang chos kyi sku dag dang // 'gro ba'i don ni spyod pa yis //
analyzed: tshogs dang chos kyi sku dag dang // 'gro ba'i don ni spyod pa yis //
translated: By the accumulations, the Dharma body, and the performance of the benefit of beings,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam par bzhed //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mnyam par bzhed //
translated: all Buddhas are considered equal.

original: ces bya bas so //
analyzed: ces bya bas so //
translated: This is what it says.

original: mchod rten gcig gi chos nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: mchod rten gcig gi chos nyid gang yin pa zhes bya ba la /
translated: The reality of a single stupa means

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i sku gdung gi snying po can gyi chos @211b nyid mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad kyi de bzhin gshegs pa yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa'i sku gdung gi snying po can gyi chos @211b nyid mtshungs pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: because the reality of the relics of the Tathagatas who have entered Parinirvana in all the world systems is the same.

original: de ltar na mngon sum dang / mngon sum ma yin pa'i thun mong gi mchod pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na mngon sum dang / mngon sum ma yin pa'i thun mong gi mchod pa ste /
translated: Thus, the worship is common to both direct and indirect perception.

original: gcig mngon du byas nas mchod pa byed pa ni mngon sum gyi mchod pa'o //
analyzed: gcig mngon du byas nas mchod pa byed pa ni mngon sum gyi mchod pa'o //
translated: The worship of one who has attained direct perception is direct worship.

original: de las gzhan pa ni mngon sum ma yin pa'i mchod pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa ni mngon sum ma yin pa'i mchod pa'o //
translated: The worship of one who has not attained direct perception is indirect worship.

original: de dag gnyi ga thun mong gi rnam pa la zhugs pa'i phyir thun mong gi mchod pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gnyi ga thun mong gi rnam pa la zhugs pa'i phyir thun mong gi mchod pa'o //
translated: Both of these are common worship because they are engaged in the common aspect.

original: mngon sum du ma gyur pa la zhes bya ba ni rjes su thos pa dang / rjes su dran pa ste /
analyzed: mngon sum du ma gyur pa la zhes bya ba ni rjes su thos pa dang / rjes su dran pa ste /
translated: Indirect perception is the worship of one who has heard of or remembers the Tathagata.

original: gzhan dag na de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs su zin kyang mthong ba'i yul las 'das pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: gzhan dag na de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs su zin kyang mthong ba'i yul las 'das pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Others believe that even though the Tathagata is present, he is beyond the range of vision.

original: ma byung ba'am yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni mngon sum du ma gyur ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ma byung ba'am yongs su mya ngan las 'das pa ni mngon sum du ma gyur ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The non-manifest or the totally parinirvāṇaed is called the non-present.

original: mchod rten rnams kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mchod rten rnams kyang de bzhin no //
translated: The stūpas are also like that.

original: de bzhin du sems mngon par 'dus byas te zhes bya ba ni rmi lam bzhin du yid kyis brtags pa ni bsod nams chung ba'i phyir 'ba' zhig ces brjod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du sems mngon par 'dus byas te zhes bya ba ni rmi lam bzhin du yid kyis brtags pa ni bsod nams chung ba'i phyir 'ba' zhig ces brjod de /
translated: Likewise, having mentally created the offering, that is, having mentally imagined it like a dream, it is said to be “only” because of the small amount of merit.

original: mngon sum du ma yin pa'i mchod pa gnyis pa la rgya chen po zhes brjod pa'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: mngon sum du ma yin pa'i mchod pa gnyis pa la rgya chen po zhes brjod pa'i tshig gis so //
translated: The second kind of non-present offering is called “extensive” by the word “extensive.”

original: das ni thun mong ma yin pa la mi bya ste /
analyzed: das ni thun mong ma yin pa la mi bya ste /
translated: That is not done for the uncommon,

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i tshig gis so //
translated: because of the word “for all the Buddhas.”

original: mngon sum ma yin pa'i mchod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: mngon sum ma yin pa'i mchod pa yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: The non-present offering is also of two kinds.

original: dngos po nye bar stobs pa'i mchod pa ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: dngos po nye bar stobs pa'i mchod pa ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: The offering of the thing that is present is that for which it is said,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'am zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The Tathāgatas or their stūpas,” and so on.

original: dngos po nye bar bzhag pa'i mchod pa ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: dngos po nye bar bzhag pa'i mchod pa ni gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: The offering of the thing that is not present is that for which it is said,🔽“Having mentally created the offering,” and so on.

original: yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Having attained complete nirvana and so on.

original: ci nus zhes bya ba ni nus pa dang rjes su mthun par ro //
analyzed: ci nus zhes bya ba ni nus pa dang rjes su mthun par ro //
translated: As much as possible means according to one's ability.

original: de nyid kyi don bstan pa na ci lcogs kyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi don bstan pa na ci lcogs kyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The meaning of that is taught: as much as one can.

original: yang na bsam pa dang / 'byor pa ji lta bus tshig gnyis so //
analyzed: yang na bsam pa dang / 'byor pa ji lta bus tshig gnyis so //
translated: Or, the two phrases are according to one's intention and wealth.

original: rgya che ba nyid bstan pa ni tshad med pa'i 'bras bu nyid dang ldan par bstan pas tshangs pa du ma'i bsod nams kyis yongs su zin pa yin te zhes bya ba la mchod rten gcig cig rab tu bzhengs pa'i bsod nams yongs su gzung ba mang tshangs
analyzed: rgya che ba nyid bstan pa ni tshad med pa'i 'bras bu nyid dang ldan par bstan pas tshangs pa du ma'i bsod nams kyis yongs su zin pa yin te zhes bya ba la mchod rten gcig cig rab tu bzhengs pa'i bsod nams yongs su gzung ba mang tshangs
translated: The teaching on greatness is taught by the phrase possessed of the merit of many Brahmas, which shows it has immeasurable results.

original: pa'i bsod nams yongs su gzung bar 'gyur na du ma nyid kyi bzhengs pas ni tshangs pa du ma nyid kyi bsod nams yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i bsod nams yongs su gzung bar 'gyur na du ma nyid kyi bzhengs pas ni tshangs pa du ma nyid kyi bsod nams yongs su gzung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the merit of possessing one stupa is the merit of possessing many Brahmas, then by possessing many stupas, one possesses the merit of many Brahmas.

original: ji skad du mdo gzhan dag las /
analyzed: ji skad du mdo gzhan dag las /
translated: As it is said in other sutras:

original: sa phyogs gang dag na de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten mi bzhugs pa de dag tu @212a * //
analyzed: sa phyogs gang dag na de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten mi bzhugs pa de dag tu @212a * //
translated: In those places where there is no stupa of the Tathagata,

original: bzhengs par byed na tshangs pa'i bsod nams yongs su gzung ba yang tshangs pa'i bsod nams dang mnyam par thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bzhengs par byed na tshangs pa'i bsod nams yongs su gzung ba yang tshangs pa'i bsod nams dang mnyam par thob par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: if one erects one, one will obtain the merit of Brahma, which is equal to the merit of Brahma.

original: tshangs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshad ni bsod nams gang gis bskal pa gcig tu mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: tshangs pa'i bsod nams kyi tshad ni bsod nams gang gis bskal pa gcig tu mtho ris su 'gro bar 'gyur ba ste /
translated: The measure of the merit of Brahma is that merit by which one goes to heaven for one eon.

original: yang dang yang rgyun mi 'chad par rnam par smin pa 'jug par 'gyur ba'i bsod nams la tshangs pa'i bsod nams zhes brjod do //
analyzed: yang dang yang rgyun mi 'chad par rnam par smin pa 'jug par 'gyur ba'i bsod nams la tshangs pa'i bsod nams zhes brjod do //
translated: The merit that is the cause of uninterrupted evolution of the maturation of that merit is called the merit of Brahma.

original: bsam gtan dang po'i sems can gyi bsod nams dang mtshungs pa la bya'o /
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po'i sems can gyi bsod nams dang mtshungs pa la bya'o /
translated: It should be understood as being equal to the merit of the beings of the first dhyana.

original: de la mdo gcig las ni dge 'dun mthun par byas na tshangs pa dang mnyam pa'i bsod nams 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de la mdo gcig las ni dge 'dun mthun par byas na tshangs pa dang mnyam pa'i bsod nams 'thob par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: In one sutra it is said: “If one causes the harmonious Sangha to be established, one will obtain the merit of Brahma.”

original: tshigs su bcad pa gzhan dag las ni /
analyzed: tshigs su bcad pa gzhan dag las ni /
translated: In other verses it is said:

original: dge 'dun mthun par byas na ni //
analyzed: dge 'dun mthun par byas na ni //
translated: But if the Saṅgha is in harmony,

original: bskal par mtho ris bde ba 'thob //
analyzed: bskal par mtho ris bde ba 'thob //
translated: one obtains the happiness of the higher realms for an eon.

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: This is what is said.

original: log par ltung ba mi 'gyur la //
analyzed: log par ltung ba mi 'gyur la //
translated: One does not fall into error.

original: zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni mos pas spyod pa'i gnas skabs kyi dbang du byas pa'o //
translated: This is from the point of view of the stage of practice through devoted interest.

original: bde 'gror yang rgyun mi 'chad par rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: bde 'gror yang rgyun mi 'chad par rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'jug pa'o //
translated: And in the happy realms, the fruitional effect continues uninterrupted.🔽And one does not fail to complete the accumulations.

original: tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mi byed par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po nyid mtshon par byed do //
analyzed: tshogs yongs su rdzogs par mi byed par yang mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni mchod pa'i bsod nams kyi tshogs chen po nyid mtshon par byed do //
translated: This shows the greatness of the accumulation of merit from worship.

original: de dag gis ni ji ltar rigs pa'i rgyud dang 'bras bu'i che ba nyid yongs su gsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag gis ni ji ltar rigs pa'i rgyud dang 'bras bu'i che ba nyid yongs su gsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: These verses make clear the greatness of the cause and effect in the proper order.

original: 'ba' zhig gi sgra'i don ni thun mong ma yin pa'i don du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig gi sgra'i don ni thun mong ma yin pa'i don du blta bar bya'o //
translated: The word “only” should be understood to mean “exclusively.”

original: 'ba' zhig gi sgra gnyis pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten gcig bzhengs pa'i 'ba' zhig go //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig gi sgra gnyis pa ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mchod rten gcig bzhengs pa'i 'ba' zhig go //
translated: The second “only” means that the worship of the Tathāgata’s stūpa is exclusive.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchod rten du byin gyis brlabs pa ni shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i 'bras bu thun mong pa'o //
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa thams cad kyi mchod rten du byin gyis brlabs pa ni shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa'i 'bras bu thun mong pa'o //
translated: The consecration as a stupa of all the Tathagatas is the common result of the highest excellence.

original: bdag gis byas pa'i mchod pa bstan pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyi rang gi lag gis nye bar bzung nas te /
analyzed: bdag gis byas pa'i mchod pa bstan pa'i phyir bdag nyid kyi rang gi lag gis nye bar bzung nas te /
translated: In order to show the worship which he himself performs, he says: holding it with his own hands,

original: nyes pa'i dbang gis gzhan byed du bcug pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nyes pa'i dbang gis gzhan byed du bcug pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: not having it performed by others through the influence of faults.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir le lo la sogs pa la brten te zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir le lo la sogs pa la brten te zhes bya ba la sogs pa /
translated: In order to show just that, he says: not relying on laziness, etc.🔽Having made the fault of laziness, etc.

original: lus kyi le lo dang / sems kyi snyom las bdag por byas nas zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: lus kyi le lo dang / sems kyi snyom las bdag por byas nas zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: the lord of the body, and the fault of mental indolence,

original: bya ba ngan pa dang 'brel pa'i nyes pa dang / bag med pa'i nyes pa'i gnas kyis te /
analyzed: bya ba ngan pa dang 'brel pa'i nyes pa dang / bag med pa'i nyes pa'i gnas kyis te /
translated: he says: through the fault of being connected with bad actions, and through the fault of heedlessness.

original: de lta bus kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi mchod pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bus kyang kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi mchod pa yin no //
translated: In this way also, worship is defiled.

original: ma @212b dang pha la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bar byas nas byed du bcug pa dang / de bzhin du sems can thams cad yongs su gzung ba'i phyir dngos po sngon du 'gro bar byas pa yin gyi yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te //
analyzed: ma @212b dang pha la sogs pa sngon du 'gro bar byas nas byed du bcug pa dang / de bzhin du sems can thams cad yongs su gzung ba'i phyir dngos po sngon du 'gro bar byas pa yin gyi yongs su gzung ba'i dngos po 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te //
translated: And likewise, for the sake of taking care of all sentient beings, one should make the thing go first, not just for the sake of taking care of oneself.

original: 'on kyang de las gzhan pa'i sems can gyi dngos po sngon du 'gro bar byas nas zhes bstan pa'i phyir rgyal po rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: 'on kyang de las gzhan pa'i sems can gyi dngos po sngon du 'gro bar byas nas zhes bstan pa'i phyir rgyal po rnams dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: But in order to show that one should make the thing go first for the sake of other sentient beings as well, he says, kings, princes, and so on.

original: de ltar khyim pa gzhan byed du bcug pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar khyim pa gzhan byed du bcug pa'o //
translated: Thus, one should cause others, householders, to do it.

original: de lta bu'i 'byor ba dang longs spyod mang po yod pa'i tshul bstan nas /
analyzed: de lta bu'i 'byor ba dang longs spyod mang po yod pa'i tshul bstan nas /
translated: Having shown the way of having much wealth and property in that way,

original: chung ba rnams kyi lugs bstan pa'i phyir //
analyzed: chung ba rnams kyi lugs bstan pa'i phyir //
translated: in order to show the way of having little,

original: dngos po chung du yod pa zhes bya ba'o /
analyzed: dngos po chung du yod pa zhes bya ba'o /
translated: he says, having a small amount of property.

original: snying rje dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan pa'i zhes bya ba la /
translated: Having compassion means

original: sems can la brtse ba bdag por byas nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can la brtse ba bdag por byas nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: having made one's love for sentient beings one's master.

original: sngon bsod nams ma byas pas tshe 'di la sdug bsngal bar gyur la /
analyzed: sngon bsod nams ma byas pas tshe 'di la sdug bsngal bar gyur la /
translated: Since one did not make merit previously, one suffers in this life.🔽Since one does not make merit in this life, one will suffer in the same way in future lives.

original: tshe 'di la bsod nams ma byas pas phyi ma la de bzhin du sdug bsngal bar 'gyur gyi zhes bya bar shes nas snying rjes de mngon du gyur pa rnams la mchod pa byed du 'jug gi byang chub sems dpa' rang nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya
analyzed: tshe 'di la bsod nams ma byas pas phyi ma la de bzhin du sdug bsngal bar 'gyur gyi zhes bya bar shes nas snying rjes de mngon du gyur pa rnams la mchod pa byed du 'jug gi byang chub sems dpa' rang nyid ni ma yin no zhes bya
translated: Having understood this, the bodhisattva, through compassion, causes those who are suffering to make offerings, but the bodhisattva himself does not.

original: ba'o // de la bdag nyid kyis mchod pa gang yin pa de ni mchod bya'i dngos po'i che ba'i bdag nyid kyis 'bras bu chen po nyid do //
analyzed: ba'o // de la bdag nyid kyis mchod pa gang yin pa de ni mchod bya'i dngos po'i che ba'i bdag nyid kyis 'bras bu chen po nyid do //
translated: The offering that is made by oneself has a great result because of the greatness of the entity that is the object of offering.

original: gzhan gyis mchod pa gang yin pa de yang 'bras bu chen po nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mchod pa gang yin pa de yang 'bras bu chen po nyid de /
translated: The offering that is made by others also has a great result,

original: phyogs gcig tu lhung ba yin yang mchod bya'i dngos po dang / mchod pa po'i dngos po'i khyad par gyis so //
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu lhung ba yin yang mchod bya'i dngos po dang / mchod pa po'i dngos po'i khyad par gyis so //
translated: even though it falls into the category of partiality, because of the distinction of the entity that is the object of offering and the entity that is the offerer.

original: gnyi gas byas pa gang yin pa de ni gnyi ga'i phyogs su gyur pas bsod nams kyi 'bras bu chen po nyid du 'gyur pas sngar bstan pa'i mchod pa bas shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa yin pas gong na med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'o
analyzed: gnyi gas byas pa gang yin pa de ni gnyi ga'i phyogs su gyur pas bsod nams kyi 'bras bu chen po nyid du 'gyur pas sngar bstan pa'i mchod pa bas shin tu khyad par du 'phags pa yin pas gong na med par rig par bya'o zhes bya ba'o
translated: Whatever is done by both is on the side of both, and so is a great result of merit. Therefore, it is known to be unsurpassed, since it is far superior to the previously mentioned worship.

original: // rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i mchod pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: // rnyed pa dang bkur sti'i mchod pa'i dbang du byas nas smras pa /
translated: Having taken up the worship of gain and honor, he says:

original: na bza' dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: rnam pa bdun gyis yongs su bsdus pa'i rgya che ba'i mchod pa rnam pa bzhi bstan pa'i phyir dngos po chung du yang dus ring du mchod pa la zhugs pas rtag tu byed pa'i sbyor bas dus rgya che ba'i phyir rgya che ba nyid de /

translated: Because of the extensive duration, it is extensive.

original: gang gi phyir smras pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir smras pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: yun ring por mchod pa byed de zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: yun ring por mchod pa byed de zhes bya ba'o //
translated: and for a long time.

original: lan cig nyid yin na yang mchog tu gyur pa'i dngos po nye bar 'bul bas rab tu phye ba nyid de /
analyzed: lan cig nyid yin na yang mchog tu gyur pa'i dngos po nye bar 'bul bas rab tu phye ba nyid de /
translated: Even if it is only once, it is distinguished by the offering of the best things.

original: dngos po mang po'i sgo nas mchod pas dngos po rgya che ba'i phyir rgya che ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po mang po'i sgo nas mchod pas dngos po rgya che ba'i phyir rgya che ba'o //
translated: It is extensive because of the abundance of things, since it is worship with many things.

original: dngos po gcig cig gtong ba'i sgo la zhugs pa yin na yang yid du 'ong ba dang / rin che ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba la zhugs pa yang dngos po gong na med pa'i phyir rgya che ba zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po gcig cig gtong ba'i sgo la zhugs pa yin na yang yid du 'ong ba dang / rin che ba'i dngos po yongs su gtong ba la zhugs pa yang dngos po gong na med pa'i phyir rgya che ba zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Even if one only gives one thing, it is extensive because of the preeminence of the thing, since it is the giving of a desirable and valuable thing.

original: bya ba rgya che bas rgya che ba ni mngon du gyur pa la mchod pa nas gzhan byed du bcug pa'i bar dag la gcig tu der zhen pas byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bya ba rgya che bas rgya che ba ni mngon du gyur pa la mchod pa nas gzhan byed du bcug pa'i bar dag la gcig tu der zhen pas byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is extensive because of the abundance of action, since it is worship in person, and it is done by one who is devoted to it, even if he has others do it.

original: mos pa drag pos byas pa ni bsam pa rgya che bas rgya che ba nyid do //
analyzed: mos pa drag pos byas pa ni bsam pa rgya che bas rgya che ba nyid do //
translated: It is extensive because of the abundance of resolve, since it is done with intense resolve.

original: rgya che ba'i dngos po thams cad rgya che ba nyid du yongs su bsngo bar bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
analyzed: rgya che ba'i dngos po thams cad rgya che ba nyid du yongs su bsngo bar bya ba'i phyir smras pa /
translated: He says this in order to dedicate all vast things to vastness.
